</div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer622786574" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8676342408474364699">Review found at: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.awesomebooknut.com" rel="nofollow">www.awesomebooknut.com</a><br /><br />UH OH! UNPOPULAR OPINION RIGHT HERE!!!!<br /><br />Here it is after a year we FINALLY get the conclusion to this series. I have absolutely loved the original 3 books from this series. IU+2019m gonna be honest though as much as itU+2019s been fun rehashing another selection with swapped sides IU+2019ve also very much not enjoyed these last two books.<br /><br />First of all I think Cass is a great storyteller. I donU+2019t however feel like she is the best of writers. That isnU+2019t to say that IU+2019m going</span>  <span id="freeText8676342408474364699" style="display:none">Review found at: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.awesomebooknut.com" rel="nofollow">www.awesomebooknut.com</a><br /><br />UH OH! UNPOPULAR OPINION RIGHT HERE!!!!<br /><br />Here it is after a year we FINALLY get the conclusion to this series. I have absolutely loved the original 3 books from this series. IU+2019m gonna be honest though as much as itU+2019s been fun rehashing another selection with swapped sides IU+2019ve also very much not enjoyed these last two books.<br /><br />First of all I think Cass is a great storyteller. I donU+2019t however feel like she is the best of writers. That isnU+2019t to say that IU+2019m going to stop reading her books, on the contrary! Because sheU+2019s a great teller of tales I will pick up anything she writes!<br /><br />I really struggled liking the guys. The guys from this view of the selection wereU+2026.too soft? eh maybeU+2026not manly? noU+2026 too feminine? maybeU+2026 they all just didnU+2019t seem to act like guys! I am in no way, shape, or form suggesting that men cannot be soft or have a feminine side/touch. However I just feel like in these last two books of the series I had a really hard time connecting with any of the characters. I do feel like she did a great job with keep their personalities separate though!<br /><br />The character development for me was too fast. Things just changed in a matter of paragraphs. I have a hard time believing that Kile; who disliked Eadlyn for so long all of a sudden finds himself really enjoying myself with her and liking her and possibly even loving her! NO WAY it doesnU+2019t happen THAT FASTU+2026does it? Overall I had a hard time enjoying the characters and getting involved in their stories. I found them to be too unbelievable. HOWEVER, I will say that I had a hard time liking Eadlyn in The Heir. This one I will admit I liked her A LOT better.<br /><br />The pacing was super fast. Things just wrapped up so fast and too conveniently with a nice pretty bow on top that I felt lost some of itU+2019s magic. IU+2019d be happier even if there was yet another book just so the pacing, character development were more evenly spaced and flowed slower to enjoy the story and their struggles. ButU+2026whatever.<br /><br />The romance? well, it was okayU+2026again WAY TO FAST for me. I like to enjoy a slow burning romance. This happened way to fast for my liking. I did enjoy the turn of events in this regard though IU+2019m not going to lie I expected on way and was surprised it see it go another way.<br /><br />Overall, it was an okay book. IU+2019m very much interested in seeing what Kiera Cass has up her sleeve. IU+2019ve really enjoyed this series overall! But IU+2019m also happy to see it done.<br /><br />Sexual Content: mild<br />Language: mild<br />Violence: mild<br />Drugs/Alcohol: mild</span>  <a data-text-id="8676342408474364699" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_622786574" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 622786574, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/622786574?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=2">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_622786574' style='display: He shrugged. "I know. Some see a weed; some see a flower. elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1655313251" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1655313251" />    <a title="Amanda Minnock" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/48100672-amanda-minnock"><img alt="Amanda Minnock" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477315971p2/48100672.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1655313251?book_show_action=false">Jun 07, 2016</a>      <a title="Amanda Minnock" class="user" name="Amanda Minnock" href="/user/show/48100672-amanda-minnock">Amanda Minnock</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/48100672-amanda-minnock?shelf=read-series">read-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/48100672-amanda-minnock?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1655313251" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5716327126024374581"><b> <u>I would like to thank HarperCollins UK, Children's & Kiera Cass for sending me an actual copy of the book instead of the ARC via NetGalley.</u> </b><br /><br />I have serious whiplash from this book it is unbelievable, I'm still trying to get my head around why these last two books were a part of this series instead of a spin off but hey what do I know I'm only a reader with a serious case of mixed emotions!<br /><br />The book picks up straight after The Heir, after the unfortunate event which happened with America putti</span>  <span id="freeText5716327126024374581" style="display:none"><b>  <u>I would like to thank HarperCollins UK, Children's & Kiera Cass for sending me an actual copy of the book instead of the ARC via NetGalley.</u></b><br /><br />I have serious whiplash from this book it is unbelievable, I'm still trying to get my head around why these last two books were a part of this series instead of a spin off but hey what do I know I'm only a reader with a serious case of mixed emotions!<br /><br />The book picks up straight after The Heir, after the unfortunate event which happened with America putting everyone under stress after Ahrens departure, Eadlyn tries to keep it together for her families sake and cuts her Selection down to the six Elites. Maxon who is under a serious amount of stress makes a decision which throws Eadlyn into the deep end like she wanted but is it all too much? With an old ally trying to become a new suitor and with The Selection needing to come to an end who will Eadlyn choose?! Let the heartache begin!<br /><br />I honestly don't know what to make of this book, I hated it at first I found it slow and Princess Bitchlyn really got to me so much I wanted to scream every time she spoke down to someone or referred to herself in the third person... If I could have set the book on fire with eyes I would have... many times. Then I would start to enjoy the book, then I would hate it again then I would give up reading it and leave it for a few days and decide to go back to it, I was at war with myself.<br /><br />I wanted to hate Eadlyn I really did, and to be honest I hated her mostly through The Heir and at the start of The Crown but near the end of the last book she started to grow on me, I could see her emotions come out and I really liked it but I found it to be rushed and pushed on to get it finished which I found a complete shame because I really started to see a side of her I wanted to know.<br /><br />I loved our Elite boys they were amazing, they all loved Eadlyn so much yet she would let them in then all a sudden make out they were enemies... then act like normal again. It was weird! it was like Kiera had forgotten only two sentences ago she had said how could she trust these people they had lied to her made a fool of her then she's secretly making out with someone in a dark room... ok then! Henri & Kile were my favourites from the beginning I loved them more and more through the book, not only were they perfect gentleman they worshiped the ground Eadlyn walked on.<br /><br />***SPOILERS PLEASE DON'T READ THIS PART IF YOU HAVE NOT READ THE BOOK**<br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Ok so let's touch on Erik, I don't usually ever write to spoil a book but I have to make my feelings clear on this. He was there to be Henri's translator yet he acted like a snake the whole time even putting in about how Henri and Eadlyn would find it hard to communicate, his little passes, forgetting his place, snaking someone who trusted him, this made me hate the book. I stopped reading it for a nearly a week hoping that maybe I could bring myself to like him but I don't know I just feel he betrayed Henri in such a horrible way and I don't know if I can ever get passed that feeling! <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />Be warned the last half of the book is really fast paced and that is where everything happens, I hated people one minute, I loved them the next. I was breaking my heart with tears down my face and finding myself willing for Eadlyn to be happy (god what is happening?!). Do I think this should have been a part of The Selection? No, I believe Kiera should have stopped at The One and made this a spin-off, nonetheless it was an ok read.<br /><br /><u>Check out my blog! <a target="_blank" href="http://www.amandaminnockx.tumblr.com" rel="nofollow">www.amandaminnockx.tumblr.com</a> thanks :) ! </u><br /><br /><b>  <i>U+201CMaybe it's not the first kisses that are supposed to be special. Maybe it's the last ones.U+201D </i></b></span>  <a data-text-id="5716327126024374581" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1447692773" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1447692773" />    <a title="Maxi" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/23901024-maxi"><img alt="Maxi" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1472680231p2/23901024.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1447692773?book_show_action=false">Aug 23, 2016</a>      <a title="Maxi" class="user" name="Maxi" href="/user/show/23901024-maxi">Maxi</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780062458865" href="/book/show/26198897-the-crown">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/23901024-maxi?shelf=2016">2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/23901024-maxi?shelf=completed-series">completed-series</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1447692773" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8933585767357006075">There's only one word I can use to describe this book: absurd. If I had to use two words: <i>FUCKING</i> ABSURD. <br /><br />I really should have stopped at book three. <br />To be honest, I liked the first trilogy. It was fun to read, the writing was still enjoyable and I actually remember crying at some point while reading The One. I knew I wasn't reading high literature but sometimes you just need something light & fluffy to read. <br />I can only define Kiera Cass' move to create another duology as something a greedy</span>  <span id="freeText8933585767357006075" style="display:none">There's only one word I can use to describe this book: absurd. If I had to use two words: <i>FUCKING</i> ABSURD. <br /><br />I really should have stopped at book three. <br />To be honest, I liked the first trilogy. It was fun to read, the writing was still enjoyable and I actually remember crying at some point while reading The One. I knew I wasn't reading high literature but sometimes you just need something light & fluffy to read. <br />I can only define Kiera Cass' move to create another duology as something a greedy person would do. <br />"How can I make more money without the pain in the ass of creating another whole set of characters?"<br /><br />This last book was even more pointless than <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/22918050.The_Heir__The_Selection___4_" title="The Heir (The Selection, #4) by Kiera Cass">The Heir</a>. Extremely predictable and absurd. Kinda boring. <br />The male characters in this series had no personality at all and if they had one it changed drastically to fit our main character needs. <br /><br />Eadlyn, which was unbearable in The Heir, wasn't even the worst thing about this book. <b>I honestly think Kiera Cass was (and is) the worst thing about this book. </b><br />The only queer relationship is used as a plot device. The author succeeded at the hard job of portraying the only non-english speaking characters as someone mentally challenged. The entire world-building part is something we really don't see, because <i>who the fuck cares</i>? <br /><br />This book was written not with hands but with a foot (not even two feet, A FUCKING SINGLE FOOT) so it's not like she really wanted to write more. So, really, you're telling me that this wasn't a move to make more money? </span>  <a data-text-id="8933585767357006075" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1447692773">  <td colspan="2">    <div data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=31&rating[page]=2&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1447692773&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="section">      <div id="review_1397133982" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url"       <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3344244-laura?shelf=ya">ya</a>,         </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1397133982" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13816134714691154663">WOW. I cannot believe I've actually finished this series. I don't wanna have any spoilers, so just "wow" is all I can say.<br /><br />[EDIT May 4] This wow is a good wow and a bad wow, and you'll have to wait until I've re-read and thought some more to find out what I mean. There were parts I loved and was <s>SHOUTING AT</s> talking to the book and reacting strongly, there were other parts that felt like cop-outs. There were ups and downs, but overall, what you'd want from the final book in a beloved series.<br /><br />[EDIT</span>  <span id="freeText13816134714691154663" style="display:none">WOW. I cannot believe I've actually finished this series. I don't wanna have any spoilers, so just "wow" is all I can say.<br /><br />[EDIT May 4] This wow is a good wow and a bad wow, and you'll have to wait until I've re-read and thought some more to find out what I mean. There were parts I loved and was <s>SHOUTING AT</s> talking to the book and reacting strongly, there were other parts that felt like cop-outs. There were ups and downs, but overall, what you'd want from the final book in a beloved series.<br /><br />[EDIT May 20] Two reads under my belt. Now just 2 more and I'll know this book by heart!</span>  <a data-text-id="13816134714691154663" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> class="section">      <div id="review_1679771469" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1679771469" />    <a title="Beatriz" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4566505-beatriz"><img alt="Beatriz" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477315993p2/4566505.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1679771469?book_show_action=false">Jun 29, 2016</a>      <a title="Beatriz" class="user" name="Beatriz" href="/user/show/4566505-beatriz">Beatriz</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1679771469" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2837275125830948728"><a target="_blank" href="https://beahreads.blogspot.com" rel="nofollow">https://beahreads.blogspot.com</a><br /><br />Sabe quando vocU+00EA se engaja em uma sU+00E9rie e praticamente vira uma questU+00E3o de honra ler o U+00FAltimo livro dessa saga? Afinal vocU+00EA gastou seu tempo; sua energia e seu dinheiro nas obras anteriores, portanto torna-se impossU+00EDvel desistir e abandonar todo seu esforU+00E7o aos 45 minutos do 2U+00BA tempo (gostaram da minha analogia com futebol? estou assistindo aos jogos da Eurocopa, porque U+00E9 um europeu mais bonito que o outro #ficaadica)<br /> "A Coroa" de Kiera Cass foi um desses livros que</span>  <span id="freeText2837275125830948728" style="display:none"><a target="_blank" href="https://beahreads.blogspot.com" rel="nofollow">https://beahreads.blogspot.com</a><br /><br />Sabe quando vocU+00EA se engaja em uma sU+00E9rie e praticamente vira uma questU+00E3o de honra ler o U+00FAltimo livro dessa saga? Afinal vocU+00EA gastou seu tempo; sua energia e seu dinheiro nas obras anteriores, portanto torna-se impossU+00EDvel desistir e abandonar todo seu esforU+00E7o aos 45 minutos do 2U+00BA tempo (gostaram da minha analogia com futebol? estou assistindo aos jogos da Eurocopa, porque U+00E9 um europeu mais bonito que o outro #ficaadica)<br /> "A Coroa" de Kiera Cass foi um desses livros que li na obrigaU+00E7 U+00E3o, pois a minha neura ficava repetindo no meu cU+00E9rebro que eu deveria terminar essa sU+00E9rie, entU+00E3o o resultado negativo dessa leitura forU+00E7ada nU+00E3o foi nenhuma surpresa.<br /> Desde que "A Herdeira" foi lanU+00E7ada, eu ficava questionando o motivo pelo qual a autora resolveu alongar uma trilogia que jU+00E1 estava finalizada . Os trU+00EAs primeiros livros de "A SeleU+00E7 U+00E3o" nU+00E3o podem ser considerados as "8U+00AA Maravilhas do Mundo", mas eles foram legais e serviram de entretenimento para minhas fU+00E9rias hU+00E1 alguns anos atrU+00E1s, entU+00E3o relevava todos os problemas da sU+00E9rie e encarava essa trilogia como uma leitura despretensiosa.<br /> EntU+00E3o Kiera Cass quis mexer com quem estava quieto e inventou esse enredo repetitivo, envolvendo a filha da America com o Maxon e simplesmente a coisa toda nU+00E3o deu certo, pois a autora limitou-se a escrever mais do mesmo e ainda (creio eu visando o lucro das vendas) alongou um enredo vazio por dois desnecessU+00E1rios livros.<br /> NU+00E3o queria soltar spoilers, porU+00E9m eles serU+00E3o necessU+00E1rios. SU+00F3 continue nessa resenha se vocU+00EA jU+00E1 leu "A Coroa", caso contrU+00E1rio vocU+00EA descobrirU+00E1 coisas que estragarU+00E3o sua leitura, jU+00E1 que comentarei sobre o desfecho da obra.<br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Em "A Herdeira" a autora apresentou aos leitores a premissa que embasaria essas duas novas obras. Eadlyn, a filha do nosso querido casal, deveria protagonizar sua prU+00F3pria "SeleU+00E7 U+00E3o" com o intuito de distrair as massas ainda rebeldes e quem sabe conseguir um companheiro que a ajudaria na tarefa de reinar o paU+00EDs.<br /> EntU+00E3o, seguindo a mesma histU+00F3ria da trilogia principal, novos rapazes sU+00E3o trazidos para o castelo e nossa mocinha (mimada e egocU+00EAntrica) deveria escolher entre eles. PorU+00E9m, o livro "A Herdeira" comeU+00E7ou e terminou sem um protagonista masculino para arrancar suspiros de Eadlyn ou dos leitores,<br /> Esperava-se que em "A Coroa" um personagem principal masculino ganhasse destaque, mas infelizmente isso tambU+00E9m nU+00E3o aconteceu. O leitor foi obrigado a ler 200 pU+00E1ginas, para Eadlyn finalmente criar um instalove com Erik, que era o garoto intU+00E9rprete de Henri.<br /> Em um momento de honestidade, confesso que nem lembrava mais da existU+00EAncia de Erik quando comecei a ler esse livro, pois minha mente tinha 100% de certeza que Eadlyn se casaria com Kile, o filho de Marlee. <br /> Kile foi o U+00FAnico rapaz cuja a apariU+00E7 U+00E3o eu lembrava, pois a autora deu uma U+00EAnfase maior em seu personagem o que me levou a acreditar que ele seria nosso protagonista. Portanto, achei bem sem graU+00E7a quando nossa moU+00E7a escolheu Erik, que era um personagem secundU+00E1rio praticamente nulo.<br /> SU+00F3 apU+00F3s sua escolha estar definida, eu finalmente consegui entender o motivo pelo qual Erik foi "o escolhido": ele era o U+00FAnico rapaz cuja uniU+00E3o com Eadlyn seria, tecnicamente, proibida. Portanto, como a falta de assunto para preencher o enredo era enorme, a autora usou e abusou desse amor impossU+00EDvel para preencher as 100 pU+00E1ginas restantes do livro (igual aluno que aumenta a letra para preencher o nU+00FAmero de linhas estipulado em um redaU+00E7 U+00E3o escolar, sem importar-se com o conteU+00FAdo da mesma).<br /> O romance foi fraco e insuficiente; o enredo da obra era mais do mesmo; logo restava apenas trabalhar e melhorar a personalidade de princesa mimada de Eadlyn (jU+00E1 que isso era o U+00FAnico diferencial do livro). Para melhorar sua caracterU+00EDstica irritante, Kiera Cass joga outro clichU+00EA na cara do leitor ao mostrar o quanto as responsabilidades do dia-a-dia fizeram nossa protagonista ser uma pessoa melhor.<br /> Por mais que isso seja verdade, essa mudanU+00E7a de Eadlyn foi forU+00E7ada demais (tipo, corre que o livro estU+00E1 acabando e U+00E9 preciso mostrar a evoluU+00E7 U+00E3o da personagem) e ainda senti-me incomodada com as inU+00FAmeras "morais" e "frases de efeito" que a autora inseriu na narrativa (o que confirma o fato de eu nU+00E3o ser o pU+00FAblico alvo dessa obra).<br /> Toda essa evoluU+00E7 U+00E3o de carU+00E1ter, fez Maxon renunciar ao trono e Eadlyn ser a nova regente, o que foi uma pU+00E9ssima ideia, porque no final do livro deu a louca na garota e ela resolveu acabar com a monarquia sem consultar ninguU+00E9m antes (mas tudo bem, pois ela fez isso visando beneficiar toda a naU+00E7 U+00E3o jU+00E1 que agora ela nU+00E3o era mais uma pessoa egocU+00EAntrica e blU+00E1 blU+00E1 blU+00E1). <br /> Ainda tentando inovar alguma coisa, Kiera Cass resolveu colocar um pseudo vilU+00E3o no meio da narrativa. Marid entrou com a promessa de agitar as coisas e no final foi mais insignificante do que uma formiga (nota-se outra tentativa fracassada de alongar a narrativa para preencher espaU+00E7o).<br /> Antes de concluir esse texto, quero reclamar de uma coisa boba, mas que sempre me irritou nos livros de "A SeleU+00E7 U+00E3o": os nomes dos personagens. SU+00E9rio, o apresentador do Jornal chama-se Gavril, o que sempre me fazia lembrar de nome de remU+00E9dio estomacal; Marid nU+00E3o passava de um anagrama de Madri e atU+00E9 agora eu associo esse personagem com a capital da Espanha; Eadlyn ou Eady fazia-me recordar as matU+00E9rias onlines da faculdade cuja sigla era sempre "Ead - EducaU+00E7 U+00E3o a DistU+00E2ncia" e por assim vai. A cada nome novo, uma decepU+00E7 U+00E3o.<br /> NU+00E3o iria fazer resenha desse livro, pois escrever sobre ele U+00E9 a mesma coisa que tentar tirar leite de pedra, mas como ele marca o desfecho da sU+00E9rie resolvi deixar registrado a minha indignaU+00E7 U+00E3o com essa obra tU+00E3o fraca e desnecessU+00E1ria (peU+00E7o desculpas pela pobreza desse texto, mas redigir sobre essa obra U+00E9 realmente um verdadeiro desafio). <br /> Acredito seriamente que se alguU+00E9m tivesse dado o "fica a dica" para Kiera Cass de que nU+00E3o se faz sucesso escrevendo a mesma coisa duas vezes, todo esse sofrimento teria sido evitado e eu com certeza teria passado o domingo fazendo alguma coisa mais produtiva com o meu tempo livre. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span></span>  <a data-text-id="2837275125830948728" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1679771469">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1679771469" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1679771469&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1679771469'><a id="like_count_review_1679771469" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1679771469?resource_type=Review"><span class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1671745793" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1671745793" />    <a title="~Alyssa~ " class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/56485897-alyssa"><img alt="~Alyssa~ " src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479693806p2/56485897.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1671745793?book_show_action=false">Aug 03, 2016</a>      <a title="~Alyssa~ " class="user" name="~Alyssa~ " href="/user/show/56485897-alyssa">~Alyssa~ </a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/56485897-alyssa?shelf=2016-releases">2016-releases</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/56485897-alyssa?shelf=book-boyfriends">book-boyfriends</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/56485897-alyssa?shelf=annoying-female-protagonists">annoying-female-protagonists</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/56485897-alyssa?shelf=too-rushed">too-rushed</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/56485897-alyssa?shelf=disappointing">disappointing</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/56485897-alyssa?shelf=kings-queens-princes-and-princesses">kings-queens-princes-and-princesses</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/56485897-alyssa?shelf=terrible-conclusion-to-series">terrible-conclusion-to-series</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1671745793" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12130647537092577136"><b>Changed my 1 star to a 2 star rating b/c of reasons ^.^</b> <br /><br />I honestly don't know what I just read. Am I disappointed? Yes. I can give you a list of all the reasons why this is my <b>LEAST FAVORITE</b> book in the series. Here we go:<br /><br />-So we all know that The Crown is the sequel to The Heir. Did I like The Heir? Nope, I didn't really enjoy it as much as I thought that I would. And honestly, I thought that The Crown would do much better than The Heir. But I was wrong. Even though in The Heir, Eadlyn was such</span>  <span id="freeText12130647537092577136" style="display:none"><b>Changed my 1 star to a 2 star rating b/c of reasons ^.^</b> <br /><br />I honestly don't know what I just read. Am I disappointed? Yes. I can give you a list of all the reasons why this is my <b>LEAST FAVORITE</b> book in the series. Here we go:<br /><br />-So we all know that The Crown is the sequel to The Heir. Did I like The Heir? Nope, I didn't really enjoy it as much as I thought that I would. And honestly, I thought that The Crown would do much better than The Heir. But I was wrong. Even though in The Heir, Eadlyn was such a brat and a know-it-all, I would choose The Heir any day over The Crown. The Heir was <b>MUCH BETTER</b> that The Crown.<br /><br />-Eadlyn... Where do I start with this one? Um, I <b>HATE</b> Eadlyn. Ok, hate is such a strong word. Maybe the word 'dislike' would be better. I already didn't like her in the first book but after completing this book, it gave me more reason to dislike her character. I feel as though Eadlyn only thinks of herself. You may disagree with me but I honestly think she only cares for her and no one else. Eadlyn is also a brat and an idiot. She doesn't seem to give a care in the world about her country. Eadlyn, in my opinion, <b>DOESN'T</b> make a good queen. Ok, before you yell at me, I know that she made that big change in the end about <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[changing the country to a constitutional democracy <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> but did she think of that on her own? Nope. She needed her own people of her country to persuade her to make such a decision. During that meeting with the country's citizens coming to talk to her, it was their idea. I guess in a way, she did follow through on their requests but isn't it pretty obvious that countries nowadays aren't successful under a king and queen? Well, I could go on and on about how stupid her character is. I'll just stop here then. <br /><br />-The characters in general... Besides Eadlyn, the other characters in The Crown, especially the Selected, seem to be dead. When I was reading, it felt as though that had no emotion and was empty inside. There really was no solid ground for any of the characters, preferably the Selected. They just seemed dead inside and out to me. Anyone feel the same way? <br /><br />-The plot line... This was a major problem for me. It seemed as though the plot had no structure at all. Things were flying all over the place and nothing mentioned in the book seemed to fit into the story. Basically, it was super windy and the plot line was flying all over the place, going in all sorts of different directions. Anyhow, I felt as though Cass could've done <b>MUCH</b> better with the conclusion to The Selection series. :( <br /><br />-Lastly, the winner... <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[<b>WHAT THE F**K?!</b> I honestly didn't expect Erik to win over Eadlyn's heart. I mean, the guy wasn't even a part of her Selection in the first place. He was just a translator, for goodness sakes! I was rooting for Kile Woodwork and I'm just super disappointed with how the ending turned out. I really thought that Kile might've had a chance. I guessed wrong. I don't need to say anymore. I wanted Kile and that didn't happen. Erik wasn't even a main character! Of all the guys she could've chosen, she chooses Erik 'Not-Part-Of-The-Selection-Just-A-Translator-Guy' Koskinen. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br /><b>This is honestly a VERY bad conclusion to such a good series.</b> The author could've done so much better. Then I wouldn't have given The Crown only 2 stars. </span>  <a data-text-id="12130647537092577136" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1614326487?book_show_action=false">May 07, 2016</a>      <a title="Elle Fae" class="user" name="Elle Fae" href="/user/show/7731612-elle-fae">Elle Fae</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">Anyone who hated America's series.</span></div>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7731612-elle-fae?shelf=ya-fiction">ya-fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7731612-elle-fae?shelf=feel-good-book">feel-good-book</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite"  <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7731612-elle-fae?shelf=do-not-regret-reading-this">do-not-regret-reading-this</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7731612-elle-fae?shelf=left-me-all-emotional">left-me-all-emotional</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7731612-elle-fae?shelf=adorable-family">adorable-family</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7731612-elle-fae?shelf=female-characters-who-don-t-hate-ea">female-characters-who-don-t-hate-ea</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7731612-elle-fae?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1614326487" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7289932827475619456"><i>I had power and no idea how to use it. I was a ruler who didn't know how to lead. I was twin who was on her own. I was a daughter with missing parents. I had half a dozen siutors and wasn't sure how to be in love.</i><br><br><b>4.75 stars!</b><br>Kiera Cass, you've come a long way since your first novel! I never in a million years thought I'd say this, especially reading the terrible trilogy that was America Singer's series.<br><br>At first I was like,<br><br><a href="http://s800.photobucket.com/user/ElleFaye/media/jessica_zpsiksub3pu.gif.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow"> <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1462665956i/19028153.gif" alt="jessica rolls her eyes photo jessica_zpsiksub3pu.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>But then by the end of it I felt a sense of peace at Eadlyn's ending. <br><br><a href="http://s800.photobucket.com/user/ElleFaye/media/kanye smiling_zpsu36psgax.gif.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow"> <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1462665956ra/19028154.gif" alt=" photo kanye smiling_zpsu36psgax.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br>Yes</span>  <span id="freeText7289932827475619456" style="display:none"><i>I had power and no idea how to use it. I was a ruler who didn't know how to lead. I was twin who was on her own. I was a daughter with missing parents. I had half a dozen siutors and wasn't sure how to be in love.</i><br><br><b>4.75 stars!</b><br>Kiera Cass, you've come a long way since your first novel! I never in a million years thought I'd say this, especially reading the terrible trilogy that was America Singer's series.<br><br>At first I was like,<br><br><a href="http://s800.photobucket.com/user/ElleFaye/media/jessica_zpsiksub3pu.gif.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1462665956i/19028153.gif" alt="jessica rolls her eyes photo jessica_zpsiksub3pu.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>But then by the end of it I felt a sense of peace at Eadlyn's ending. <br><br><a href="http://s800.photobucket.com/user/ElleFaye/media/kanye smiling_zpsu36psgax.gif.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1462665956ra/19028154.gif" alt=" photo kanye smiling_zpsu36psgax.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br>Yes guys, that's a <b>smiling</b> Kanye West. Enjoy it, they're rare.<br><br>This book hooked me in right from it's depressing start, and I feel like I've watched Eadlyn grow from spoiled brat to magnificent Queen the time the book ends. <b>I loved every minute of it. The good moments, the bad, the funny bits:</b><br><br><i>...'No-one will take you seriously!...' <br><br>'Fine,' I responded calmly. 'You're fired.'<br><br>Coddly laughed, looking at the other gentlemen at the table. 'You can't fire me, Your Highness.'<br><br>I tilted my head, staring at him. 'I assure you, I can. There's no-one here who outranks me at the moment, and you are easily replaceable.' </i><br><br>I felt so bad for her at times, there's was just way too much pressure put on her for someone her age. She tried to even change herself for the sake of her people's approval.<br><br><i>'Yes, it's all about their perception of me. They think I'm too cold. The most absolute way to refute that would be to get married. They think that I'm too masculine. The most absolute way to refute that is to be a bride.'</i><br><br><b>Surprisingly enough, the Selection bit wasn't important in this book - in fact, majority of the plot centered on Eadlyn and her slow, painful process of being a 'good' Queen in the people's eyes. She attends conferences. She listens as her people tell her their problems, and is disrespected again and again, by those who think she's too young, too 'bratty' and too inexperienced.<br><br>I won't spoil anymore! You have to read the book to find out what happens.<br></b></span>  <a data-text-id="7289932827475619456" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1640318870" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1640318870" />    <a title="Drew (DrewU+2019s Cup of Tea)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/22104588-drew-drew-s-cup-of-tea"><img alt="Drew (DrewU+2019s Cup of Tea)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1470087549p2/22104588.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1640318870?book_show_action=false">Oct 15, 2016</a>      <a title="Drew (DrewU+2019s Cup of Tea)" class="user" name="Drew (DrewU+2019s Cup of Tea)" href="/user/show/22104588-drew-drew-s-cup-of-tea">Drew (DrewU+2019s Cup of Tea)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22104588-drew-drew-s-cup-of-tea?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22104588-drew-drew-s-cup-of-tea?shelf=dystopian">dystopian</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1640318870" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2109898527139448446"><i> <blockquote>U+201CYour life is yours, singular and sacred, and you should be with the person who makes it feel that way every blessed second you live it.U+201D</blockquote> </i><br /><b>Whew, I'm glad I gave this a shot.</b><br /><br />I hate to say itU+2026 but I was wrong. In my review of <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/23019291.The_Heir__The_Selection___4_" title="The Heir (The Selection, #4) by Kiera Cass">The Heir</a> last year I hated on Eadlyn, calling her a spoiled brat. I still stand by that opinion, but I can't deny that <b>in this book she matured so much.</b><br /><br />Imagine my surprise when I actually started liking her. Rather than being loud and obnoxious, she was independent. Instead o</span>  <span id="freeText2109898527139448446" style="display:none"><i>  <blockquote>U+201CYour life is yours, singular and sacred, and you should be with the person who makes it feel that way every blessed second you live it.U+201D</blockquote></i><br /><b>Whew, I'm glad I gave this a shot.</b><br /><br />I hate to say itU+2026 but I was wrong. In my review of <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/23019291.The_Heir__The_Selection___4_" title="The Heir (The Selection, #4) by Kiera Cass">The Heir</a> last year I hated on Eadlyn, calling her a spoiled brat. I still stand by that opinion, but I can't deny that <b>in this book she matured so much.</b><br /><br />Imagine my surprise when I actually started liking her. Rather than being loud and obnoxious, she was independent. Instead of being whiny, she was a strong leader who soldiered on even when it got tough.<br /><br />The romance was also pretty cute. The Selected boys' characters - now narrowed down to six - were developed so much more and I got to know each of them. They weren't the cardboard cutouts they were in <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/23019291.The_Heir__The_Selection___4_" title="The Heir (The Selection, #4) by Kiera Cass">The Heir</a>, and I was rooting for the boy Eadlyn ended up with.<br /><br /><i>  <blockquote>U+201CIt was a delicious feeling, falling in love. IU+2019d had so many luxuries in my life, and I thought IU+2019d had a taste of this before, but I realized now it was merely a cheap imitation of something not meant to be imitated in the first place.U+201D</blockquote></i><br />I understand why people hate this series. I mean, the writing is kind of terrible. Every time I pick up one of these books I feel like I'm reading fanfiction. But along with the unrealistic dialogue, ridiculous scenarios, and silly behavior comes an <b>unputdownable quality.</b><br /><br />I won't argue that this is amazingly written literature - in fact that couldn't be further from the truth. While I enjoy detailed, complex books, I liked <i>The Crown</i> in a different way. The characters weren't intricate and the plot wasn't a masterpiece - <b>but it was so darn fun to read.</b><br /><br />I think I can say about this series: "It's so bad it's good." I'm just glad I finished this cute, chick lit book feeling satisfied and with fond memories.</span>  <a data-text-id="2109898527139448446" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1640318870">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1640318870" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=28&rating[page]=2&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1640318870&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1032569886" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1032569886" />    <a title="Sophie" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/8563233-sophie"><img alt="Sophie" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1445707102p2/8563233.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1032569886?book_show_action=false">May 20, 2016</a>      <a title="Sophie" class="user" name="Sophie" href="/user/show/8563233-sophie">Sophie</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780062458865" href="/book/show/26198897-the-crown">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/8563233-sophie?shelf=2016-releases">2016-releases</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/8563233-sophie?shelf=own-read">own-read</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/8563233-sophie?shelf=4-stars">4-stars</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/8563233-sophie?shelf=arcs-read">arcs-read</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/8563233-sophie?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1032569886" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8547084739780603812">I received an Advance Reader Copy from the publisher via NetGalley. This in no way impacted on my view. <br /><br />After reading book 4, The Heir, I was a bit apprehensive about reading this book. To me, the main character, Eadlyn, was annoying, even more so than her mother had been, and I didn't know if I could cope with another book from her PoV. However, I was pleasantly surprised with her character growth this time around.<br /><br />After the shock ending of The Heir, Eadlyn has cut her suitors down to 6, and is</span>  <span id="freeText8547084739780603812" style="display:none">I received an Advance Reader Copy from the publisher via NetGalley. This in no way impacted on my view. <br /><br />After reading book 4, The Heir, I was a bit apprehensive about reading this book. To me, the main character, Eadlyn, was annoying, even more so than her mother had been, and I didn't know if I could cope with another book from her PoV. However, I was pleasantly surprised with her character growth this time around.<br /><br />After the shock ending of The Heir, Eadlyn has cut her suitors down to 6, and is currently regent of Illea whilst her father is at her mother's bedside. She knows that the people aren't really fans of hers, and needs to endear herself to the population, or she'll never be safe. She starts off struggling with her new found responsibility, but soon comes into her own as regent, and feels like she will be a Queen that the people deserve.<br /><br />Out of the final 6, the front runners have always been, for me, Kile, Hale, or Henri. Erik, Henri's translator, was also a favourite, but he didn't exactly count, because he wasn't a member of the Selected. I felt like Eadlyn's choices throughout the process of the Selection were sound, and even though there was one bit, about 75% of the way through, that I thought it all was going to hell, I was happy with how she eventually decided on who her Prince Consort would be.<br /><br />Eadlyn has really grown as a person in the book, and even though she was annoying in the first book, this time she was interesting to read. For the final book in a five book series, I felt like The Crown was slightly too short, but, at the same time, everything was resolved, and I couldn't have asked for a more rounded and well constructed ending. I'd say that even if you weren't too keen on The Heir, give this a try, as you might be pleasantly surprised, like I was.</span>  <a data-text-id="8547084739780603812" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1032569886">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1032569886" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1032569886&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1032569886'><a id="like_count_review_1032569886" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1032569886?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">29 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1032569886" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1032569886" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=29&rating[page]=2&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1032569886&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1032569886" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1032569886, true, &#39;&#39;); $copy.find('script').remove();          $j('#rating_details_tip').prepend($copy);      }  //]]>  </script></div><div id="bookReviews">    <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section firstReview">      <div id="review_1277737991" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1277737991" />    <a title="lauren kellie" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/34240268-lauren-kellie"><img alt="lauren kellie" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1464845703p2/34240268.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1277737991?book_show_action=false">Jul 05, 2016</a>      <a title="lauren kellie" class="user" name="lauren kellie" href="/user/show/34240268-lauren-kellie">lauren kellie</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34240268-lauren-kellie?shelf=releases-2016">releases-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34240268-lauren-kellie?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34240268-lauren-kellie?shelf=dystopian">dystopian</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34240268-lauren-kellie?shelf=own">own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34240268-lauren-kellie?shelf=royalty">royalty</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34240268-lauren-kellie?shelf=sequel-series">sequel-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34240268-lauren-kellie?shelf=fiction">fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34240268-lauren-kellie?shelf=2016">2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34240268-lauren-kellie?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1277737991" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15772513784981537014"><blockquote> <i>"I'm telling you, Eady, wars and treaties and even countries will all come and go. But your life is yours, singular and sacred, and you should be with the person who makes it feel that way every blessed second you live it."</i> </blockquote><br />First, I would like to thank every person who has liked or commented on this review in the past year or so. This much of a response is unheard of for me. Almost every day, a few more people like it, or someone else actively advocates for Kile or Erik and sends up a prayer in</span>  <span id="freeText15772513784981537014" style="display:none"><blockquote>  <i>"I'm telling you, Eady, wars and treaties and even countries will all come and go. But your life is yours, singular and sacred, and you should be with the person who makes it feel that way every blessed second you live it."</i></blockquote><br />First, I would like to thank every person who has liked or commented on this review in the past year or so. This much of a response is unheard of for me. Almost every day, a few more people like it, or someone else actively advocates for Kile or Erik and sends up a prayer in the hopes America doesn't die. I've loved hearing everyone's predictions and hopes and dreams over the course of a year in waiting for what may or may not be the last of the Selection books, given the track record.<br /><br />Second, I wish it didn't have to end this way.<br /><br />I really enjoyed the original three Selection books. Sure, America could be annoying, but as long as you didn't take them too seriously, they were quick, fun reads.<br />But <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/22918050.The_Heir__The_Selection___4_" title="The Heir (The Selection, #4) by Kiera Cass">The Heir</a> was not a good read for me, for reasons I have already stated in <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1034643060">my review</a>.<br /><br />So let's return to the points of improvement I listed here, the day I finished <i>The Heir</i>, in optimism for its sequel.<br /><br /><b>U+2022 Eadlyn to stop being spoiled and do something unselfish for her people.</b><br />By the end of the book, Eadlyn <i>says</i> she's learned her lesson, and that she's more aware of how privileged she is. But let's take a look.<br /><blockquote>  <i>I stepped into the bath, noting there was no lavendar, no bubbles, no anything to sweeten the water. Eloise was quiet and fast, but she was no Neena. I sighed.</i></blockquote><br />So miss Princess--excuse me--<i>Queen</i> Eadlyn just can't enjoy her little bath without all its fluff, and she can't be bothered to just go and get it herself. That sounds like entitlement to me.<br />And does Eadlyn actually "do something unselfish for her people"?<br />Not really. She spends the entire book worrying about what they think of her rather than actually trying to help them. The two instances where she does try to reach out weren't even her idea. The first, the town hall meeting, was Marid's idea, and, as he points out, he was the one who had to save it in the end. The other instance, which never played out in the book, was Kile's idea for a throne room where the people could regularly come and talk to Eadlyn about their problems to get them fixed. This was what inspired Eadlyn <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[in the constitutional monarchy aspect, <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> which was a nice touch, but, again, not really her idea.<br />An additional idea, proposed by again Kile, was the housing project. But instead of actively taking a hand in it herself, <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Eadlyn banishes Kile from the palace and makes him do it on his own. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br /><b>U+2022 Eadlyn to actually interact with her people on any level.</b><br />See above.<br /><br /><b>U+2022 A good old-fashioned, knee-slappin, heck of a time ball.</b><br />Does the coronation ball count? I guess.<br /><br /><b>U+2022 Henri to find a cute maid to love.</b><br />I guess <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[it was really too much of a close call for Henri to have time "to find a maid to love." Maybe in book six. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br /><b>U+2022 Ahren to come back and have character development.</b><br />Oh, Ahren came back. But did he have character development?<br />I say not really. And I attribute it to the fact that Ahren and Eadlyn's relationship was never really solidified in <i>The Heir</i>. Eadlyn spent a good portion of this book lamenting over Ahren's departure, but it all felt very fake to me. Eadlyn in <i>The Crown</i> claimed she needed Ahren, that she relied on Ahren, but Eadlyn in <i>The Heir</i> hardly every interacted with him. She only every really mentioned Ahren in regard to his relationship with Camille. Therefore, it was hard to take their sudden closeness seriously.<br /><br /><b>U+2022 Either Erik or Kile winning the selection.</b><br />I think we all saw that one coming.<br /><br /><b>U+2022 Kile builds something cute to help Eadlyn.</b><br />Kile builds houses for those living in poverty, which is way better than building something for Eadlyn.<br /><br /><b>U+2022 Josie to get seriously told off by Eadlyn.</b><br />This one, in fact, has changed for me, and it's due to something someone commented on here a while back.<br />This person pointed out that it was always Eadlyn being unfair to Josie, not the other way around, and after thinking about it, I agree. It especially became apparent to me in some things Eadlyn said to Josie early on. While Josie was immature and annoying, she still never deserved to be treated so harshly by Eadlyn, because all she ever wanted was to be just like her.<br />So I was very pleased with the way things turned out between them. This was one point I was worried Kiera would drop the ball on, but she pulled through for me.<br /><br /><b>U+2022 Something exciting with Ean.</b><br />Something exciting most certainly did happen with Ean, but it was definitely not what I originally had in mind.<br />Ean's character quite honestly was disappointing for me. When Epic Reads was marketing <i>The Heir</i> they uploaded a bunch of videos that were mock interviews with some of the more important boys in the Selection. Ean was one of them, and his video, which portrayed him as a pompous little snake, got me really excited for some drama being thrown down.<br />But with the exception of Eadlyn's first meeting with him, he doesn't do anything at all in either books. He's always in the background. He might as well have been one of the boys Eadlyn sent home for all he's actually mentioned. I'm not even sure Eadlyn ever went on a date with him, and yet somehow he managed to <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[make it to the Elite. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> Kiera really dropped the ball on this one.<br /><br /><b>U+2022 America not to die.</b><br />Honestly, after thinking about it, I knew <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[there was a zero percent chance America was going to die. No way in heck was Kiera going to kill off a character so precious to her. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />In conclusion, as much regard as I have for Kiera as a person, and as much as I did like the original three books, these last two installments have caused everything to go to pieces. I'm not even sure there ever was a plot in these; most of it has been Eadlyn continually complaining about how "hard" her life is. What little drama exists feels fake and underdeveloped, and the world-building has gone so far under that we didn't even make it out of the palace in this book.<br />I mentioned the other day to a friend that reading this book has felt like reading fanfiction. It has all the plot holes, cheesiness, and enough of the original characters being married and having kids to give it that feel.<br />But, above all, Maxon Shreave will always and forever be life.<br /><br />------------------------------------------------<br /><br /><u>  <b>PREREADING</b></u><br /><br />5/11/15<br />things i would like in this book:<br />- eadlyn to stop being spoiled & do something unselfish for her people<br />- eadlyn to actually interact with her people on any level<br />- a good old-fashioned, knee-slappin, heck-of-a-time ball<br />- henri to find a cute maid to love<br />- ahren come back & have character development<br />- either erik or kile winning the selection<br />- kile builds something cute to help eadlyn<br />- josie to get seriously told off by eadlyn<br />- something exciting with ean<br />- aMERICA NOT TO DIE ???</span>  <a data-text-id="15772513784981537014" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1277737991">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1277737991" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1277737991&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1277737991'><a id="like_count_review_1277737991" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1277737991?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">837 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1277737991" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1277737991" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=837&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1277737991&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1277737991" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1277737991, true, &#39;&#39;);        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1118328857" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8967353758724495502"><b>EDIT: 13/01/2016 </b><br><br>I hate how gorgeous the covers for this series are. I want to smush them to my face and declare my eternal love for them.<br><br><br><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1381194694ra/4496905.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1118328857">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1118328857" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1118328857&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1118328857'><a id="like_count_review_1118328857" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1118328857?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">409 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1118328857" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1118328857" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=409&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1118328857&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1118328857" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1118328857, true, &#39;&#39;); </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1445600928" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1445600928" />    <a title="Clau R." class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/13061577-clau-r"><img alt="Clau R." src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1472281305p2/13061577.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1445600928?book_show_action=false">Jul 04, 2016</a>      <a title="Clau R." class="user" name="Clau R." href="/user/show/13061577-clau-r">Clau R.</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/13061577-clau-r?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1445600928" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7226786666473685289">THIS WILL BE A RANT.<br /><br />It's a 2.5. The thing is... I enjoyed the book, but OMG, I'm just not buying anything that happened at the end! REALLY? So now Eadlyn gets to make whatever change she wants in the kingdom, she doesn't have to get it approved or even discussed with the council, nope, she just gives the surprise announcement and that's it! WHAT! That's not how a country works! Maybe IllU+00E9a has to respect everything she decides, but there will obviously be revolts! It was too simple! She was like</span>  <span id="freeText7226786666473685289" style="display:none">THIS WILL BE A RANT.<br /><br />It's a 2.5. The thing is... I enjoyed the book, but OMG, I'm just not buying anything that happened at the end! REALLY? So now Eadlyn gets to make whatever change she wants in the kingdom, she doesn't have to get it approved or even discussed with the council, nope, she just gives the surprise announcement and that's it! WHAT! That's not how a country works! Maybe IllU+00E9a has to respect everything she decides, but there will obviously be revolts! It was too simple! She was like: YEAH I'M GONNA CHANGE THE WAY WE'VE BEEN RULING SINCE FOREVER, AND IT WILL BE AWESOME AND EVERYONE WILL BE HAPPY. NOPE.<br /><br />Also, I couldn't believe Maxon's decision! WHAT EVEN. I love Maxon but in this book he was just plain weak! I mean, I understand where he's coming from, but he can't just do what he did! OH WAIT, he can and HE DID. My God.<br /><br />What else? OHHH... let me talk about the person she chooses in the end: clichU+00E9 clichU+00E9 clichU+00E9! It was so obvious, and not because the romance was well-developed (because it was not) but because it was simply OBVIOUS. I mean, I like the boy, he was one of my favorites and one of my top choices, I just don't feel like the romance was believable. Suddenly they both were just like: OMG I LOVE YOU SO MUCH. It felt forced. Maxon's and America's story was BEAUTIFUL, so well-developed and believable and just perfect... but what we got in this book? Nope, not buying it.<br /><br />I have a lot of issues with this last installment, I think the series would've been fine with the first three books, I really loved them! But these last two? They were unnecesary. <br /><br />The things I liked? Hm... Henri, he was a cinnamon roll. I also liked Ean and Hale. Kile and Erik were also okay. The Elite boys won my heart at the end. And I also liked Eadlyn's choice, but I still feel it needed more romantic development.</span>  <a data-text-id="7226786666473685289" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1445600928">  <td id="reviewTextContainer1028551087" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12929546646691194351">I don't understand, I thought it was just a trilogy... Why are there suddenly two more books added. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1394014947ra/8796598.gif" width="240" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Update : I have read The Heir and I must admit that I actually quite enjoyed it, so looking forward to this one.<br><br>Update #2 : :)</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1028551087">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1028551087" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1028551087&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1028551087'><a id="like_count_review_1028551087" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1028551087?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">269 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1028551087" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1028551087" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=269&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1028551087&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1028551087" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1028551087, true, &#39;&#39;); class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1412936059" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1412936059" />    <a title="Mikee Andrea (ReadWithMikee)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/44137919-mikee-andrea-readwithmikee"><img alt="Mikee Andrea (ReadWithMikee)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1475805558p2/44137919.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1412936059?book_show_action=false">May 09, 2016</a>      <a title="Mikee Andrea (ReadWithMikee)" class="user" name="Mikee Andrea (ReadWithMikee)" href="/user/show/44137919-mikee-andrea-readwithmikee">Mikee Andrea (ReadWithMikee)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/44137919-mikee-andrea-readwithmikee?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/44137919-mikee-andrea-readwithmikee?shelf=favorite-covers">favorite-covers</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/44137919-mikee-andrea-readwithmikee?shelf=favorite-series">favorite-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/44137919-mikee-andrea-readwithmikee?shelf=anticipated-releases-of-2016">anticipated-releases-of-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1412936059" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15989609304232379052"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1462848728i/19051261._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><blockquote> <b> <i>Finding a prince might mean kissing a lot of frogs. Or kicking a lot of frogs out of your house. Falling might mean running headfirst into something you always wanted. Or dipping your toe into something you've been scared your whole life. Happily ever after could be waiting in a field a mile wide.</i> </b> </blockquote><br>Rating: {  }<br><br>This was an okay ending to Eadlyn's part of the story in The Selection series. I was never really a fan of The Heir or Eadlyn like I was with The Selection and America. The only reason I</span>  <span id="freeText15989609304232379052" style="display:none"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1462848728i/19051261._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><blockquote>  <b>    <i>U+275DFinding a prince might mean kissing a lot of frogs. Or kicking a lot of frogs out of your house. Falling might mean running headfirst into something you always wanted. Or dipping your toe into something you've been scared your whole life. Happily ever after could be waiting in a field a mile wide.U+275E</i>  </b></blockquote><br>Rating: {U+2605 U+2605 U+2605}<br><br>This was an okay ending to Eadlyn's part of the story in The Selection series. I was never really a fan of The Heir or Eadlyn like I was with The Selection and America. The only reason I kept up with series after The One was because like many others, I was curious as to how everyone from the original trilogy grew up to be.<br><br>In all honesty, I should've just stopped after the third book. I don't want to say that The Heir and The Crown ruined The Selection for me but in a way it did. Instead of believing that everybody lived happily ever after once Maxon and America became king and queen and the caste system was eliminated, The Heir just sort of wipes that all away like happily ever after never even happened.<br><br>The One was such a bittersweet ending to a fun trilogy and The Crown with its 278 pages wasn't going to top it at all. Not by a long shot.<br><br>Nothing really happened in The Crown. To be honest, I thought this book was such a waste because nothing worthy or significant occurred. Sure, Eadlyn was less of a brat in this book but I'm still not very fond of her. On top of that, I thought it was absolutely preposterous that Maxon stepped down and gave up his title for Eadlyn to rule. That was by far the most unrealistic thing I've ever heard. No king is going to give up his duties because he was stressing about his queen's recovery or because he wants a normal life with his wife. Tough shit. That's like saying you're giving up being a parent because you're stressed out about having kids. Putting the fate of your whole country on Eadlyn? Good luck with that.<br><br>I also felt that the ending was really rushed. Too many things were resolved too quickly and too easily that added to the unrealism that I was struggling with.<br><br>On a positive note, I did enjoy the fact that Eadlyn's choice broke away from tradition. Was her choice a surprise? No, not really. From the very beginning, I knew it would come down to one specific person but I was curious as to how Kiera Cass was going to make it happen.<br><br>The Selection was one of the first series that got me into reading Young Adult. Though it is far from the best series out there, I will always have an attachment to the first three books of The Selection. The Heir and The Crown may not be up to par with Maxon and America's story, but I still found it bittersweet that The Selection is finally over for good.</span>  <a data-text-id="15989609304232379052" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview"
