comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1412936059?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1412936059' style='display: onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1412936059, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1029162694" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1029162694" />    <a title="Andreea Pop" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4858513-andreea-pop"><img alt="Andreea Pop" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1462374723p2/4858513.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1029162694?book_show_action=false">May 04, 2016</a>      <a title="Andreea Pop" class="user" name="Andreea Pop" href="/user/show/4858513-andreea-pop">Andreea Pop</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4858513-andreea-pop?shelf=in-curand-in-romania">in-curand-in-romania</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4858513-andreea-pop?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4858513-andreea-pop?shelf=non-fantasy">non-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4858513-andreea-pop?shelf=swoon-worthy-characters">swoon-worthy-characters</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4858513-andreea-pop?shelf=awesome-romance">awesome-romance</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4858513-andreea-pop?shelf=light-read">light-read</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4858513-andreea-pop?shelf=funny">funny</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4858513-andreea-pop?shelf=amazing-feelings">amazing-feelings</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4858513-andreea-pop?shelf=great-parents">great-parents</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4858513-andreea-pop?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4858513-andreea-pop?shelf=huge-character-development">huge-character-development</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4858513-andreea-pop?shelf=editura-leda">editura-leda</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4858513-andreea-pop?shelf=royalty">royalty</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4858513-andreea-pop?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1029162694" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17798868575696494005">I'm gonna put it bluntly out there -- I did not like <i>The Heir</i>. I consider it one of my greatest literary disappointments, even if it has a relatively high rating (2.5 stars). So my expectations of <i>The Crown</i> were along the lines of <i> <b>'please be decent, please end quick and please be the last</b> </i>'. Most fortunately though, <i>The Crown</i> brought back the love I felt for Kiera Cass's novels made of syrupy romance and dreamy sighs. Taking this into consideration, this review will resemble half an omen to thi</span>  <span id="freeText17798868575696494005" style="display:none">I'm gonna put it bluntly out there -- I did not like <i>The Heir</i>. I consider it one of my greatest literary disappointments, even if it has a relatively high rating (2.5 stars). So my expectations of <i>The Crown</i> were along the lines of <i>  <b>'please be decent, please end quick and please be the last</b></i>'. Most fortunately though, <i>The Crown</i> brought back the love I felt for Kiera Cass's novels made of syrupy romance and dreamy sighs. Taking this into consideration, this review will resemble half an omen to this fifth installment and half a regret for what it did not come to fruition in its prequel, but only to highlight that this book exceeded my expectations and made me fall in love again with its world. <br /><br /><b>Unlike in The Heir</b>, I loved Eadlyn. She let go of her petty, egotistical, self-centered and vain antics in order to graciously transform into a more than capable young woman, leader and Queen. Yeah yeah, her character-development was speeded up to supersonic mode, but for once I didn't mind. She showed her thoughtfulness, her ambition, her intelligence and her strong personality. I admired the fact that she wants to do good by everyone around her and that she tries to mend her flaws. Regardless, she took a colossal departure from the stoic, stuck-up and artificial princess and became an oddly organic person, beautifully encapsulated through the integrity to her own heart and moral code. <br /><br /><b>Unlike in The Heir</b>, I didn't check the page count every two minutes to dreadfully discover there was still a long way to go until the finish. I was hooked and I read it easily, eager to see what's in store next. Tremendously enjoyable.<br /><br /><b>Unlike in The Heir</b>, I could connect to this bunch of boys. Instead of 35, there were only 6 left in the picture. Each of them (and here I'm talking about the ever-wonderful Hale, Kile, Ean, Henri and Erik) became amazing in their own way and right. <br /><br /><b>Unlike in The Heir</b>, I was actually surprised by some revelations. Marid and Brice, especially. And Maxon shocked me with his introspective tales. <br /><br /><b>Unlike in The Heir</b>, there were sweet relationships truly taking root. Deep, heartfelt friendships and dynamics that somehow evolved or appeared out of the blue only to fit the bill perfectly. Hale & Eady. Hale & Ean. Kile & Eady. Erik & Henri. Henri & Eady. Josie & Eady. Erik & Eady. Brice & Eady. Aspen & Eady. <br /><br /><b>Unlike in The Heir</b>, I did not curse the decision to expand the series from the original trilogy. This closure, this grand second finale somehow tied up the loose ends of <i>The One</i> by making sure certain matters were addressed, political ones, LGBT ones, feminism ones and discriminatory ones. I finally understood that we couldn't leave things at how they were with the initial 'last book'. <br /><br /><b>Unlike in The Heir</b>, there was so much more of the young Maxon and America we all know. Seriously, all the glimpses into their fairy tale of a love story made my heart burst free. Maxon fretting over Mer and going borderline insane about her health was just too cute to handle. I'm glad they're happy and don't paint me foolish just because they're works of fiction, but in my mind they exist vividly and that's of the utmost importance. <br /><br /><b>Unlike in The Heir</b>, I wasn't constantly exhausted about the sad and ill-fated attempts at romance. This time, it all flourished naturally, because the focus was on the worthy and so a cute and amazing and awesome and lovely couple became canon. And speaking about that particular pairing, <b>I SHIP IT</b>. <br /><br /><b>Like The Heir</b>, don't expect this book to suddenly be a complex piece of literature, because surely it is not. It fits the style of the series, so it's one for the heart. It's 100% drama and teen romance. It's light. It's quick. It's totally YA. It's a great read for a spring afternoon. It's the kind of book that has you smiling, daydreaming and relaxing. <b>Unlike The Heir</b>. <br /><br /><b>Unlike the Heir</b>, <i>The Crown</i> was so much better. Infinitely better. I urge you to read it and see for yourself but I have faith that you'll love it bunches.<br /><br />Bye, Illea. For real now. <br /><br /><b>ENJOY! <3 </b></span>  <a data-text-id="17798868575696494005" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1029162694">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1029162694" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1029162694&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1029162694'><a id="like_count_review_1029162694" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1029162694?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">202 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1029162694" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1029162694" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=202&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1029162694&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1029162694" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1029162694, true, &#39;&#39;); class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Jul 18, 2016 09:49AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1029162694' style='display: class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1247998940" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1247998940" />    <a title="Beatrice MasaluU+00F1ga" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4590441-beatrice-masalu-ga"><img alt="Beatrice MasaluU+00F1ga" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1457256540p2/4590441.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1247998940?book_show_action=false">May 07, 2016</a>      <a title="Beatrice MasaluU+00F1ga" class="user" name="Beatrice MasaluU+00F1ga" href="/user/show/4590441-beatrice-masalu-ga">Beatrice MasaluU+00F1ga</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4590441-beatrice-masalu-ga?shelf=owned">owned</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4590441-beatrice-masalu-ga?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1247998940" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12159267017596046844"><b>Warning: My review contains spoilers. [ I added spoiler tags as many as I can... but you might guess what happens in the end based on my rating]</b><br /><br /><i>The Crown </i> continues as Eadlyn Schreave temporarily takes over Illea after the stressful things happened on the previous book. Taking the opportunity and experience is part of her lesson to fully become the next Queen. It's challenging on her part especially when The Selection is on going. Finding the right guy for her isn't easy. Whatever choice she mak</span>  <span id="freeText12159267017596046844" style="display:none"><b>Warning: My review contains spoilers. [ I added spoiler tags as many as I can... but you might guess what happens in the end based on my rating]</b><br /><br /><i>The Crown </i> continues as Eadlyn Schreave temporarily takes over Illea after the stressful things happened on the previous book. Taking the opportunity and experience is part of her lesson to fully become the next Queen. It's challenging on her part especially when The Selection is on going. Finding the right guy for her isn't easy. Whatever choice she makes, she must follow what her heart speaks and unexpectedly changes everything.<br /><br />For me, the conclusion to this series is <b>bittersweet</b>. I'm going to be honest, I do like Kiera Cass but I have to say I'm disappointed with its ending. Like, really frustrated that I almost throw the book across the room because I'm holding to my thoughts and it ended not the way I expected or wanted. At the same time, I don't want to be selfish and one sided with the situation. I hope you'll understand my feeling of <i>when-your-ship-didn't-sail</i>. I'm still on denial stage and I'll get over this soon. I actually see it coming but I keep fighting the bad feeling, you know? Still, I am glad to see Eadlyn Schreave's character developed into a fine lady. She handled the situations maturely and earned my respect. <br /><br />Here I am, seeing the other perspective and tried to understand why it ended up like... <b>THAT</b>. I know some of you rooted for <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Erik/Eikko  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> to win and I respect that. I think he won because <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[it's a rule breaker to the tradition, it's not a Maxon-America repeat, and somehow, his character shows that he's a genuine, humble, thoughtful and simple man. His character stood out in some way despite of being behind the spotlight. <br /><br />I'm sorry guys but I'm not convinced with this whole Erik - Eadlyn ship. I didn't feel the spark between them and it was sort of an insta-love. Unlike what Eadlyn shared with Kile, these two tried to like each other.. THEY'RE SLOWLY FALLING and the chemistry between them is so evident. I don't give a damn if it's predictable.. these two have the chemistry.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> I have to vent out all of these. Apparently, this becomes my least favorite in the series. What can I do? Eadlyn's decision prevails and I should respect her choice. <br /><br /><b>Why my bet and others didn't win:</b><br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Kile - My bet. I am loyal to you no matter what. Among the other competitors, he knows Eadlyn the best. They've known each other for years. Majority, including myself are rooting for him. I guess it didn't sail because it's a Maxon-America repeat, predictable and boring. Well, I don't care. I want an alternate ending where Eadlyn and Kile ship SAIL. SADLY, THERE IS NO ALTERNATE ENDING. SHIP DOOMED FOREVER.<br /><br />Henri - obviously, communication barrier. a couple won't work out if there is a lack of communication.<br /><br />Hale - his charm fascinated me. He is like my back up bet. It seems he has a different type. ;)  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />Now, it's time to say goodbye to this series and I'm definitely going to miss it. I'm still looking forward to Kiera Cass's books in the future. Her writing style is really great and it effectively draws me into the story. Sadly, this book isn't for me.</span>  <a data-text-id="12159267017596046844" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1247998940">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1247998940" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1247998940&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1247998940'><a id="like_count_review_1247998940" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1247998940?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">154 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1247998940" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1247998940" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=154&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1247998940&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1247998940" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1247998940, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">82 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1247998940?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1247998940' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1247998940/comments?reverse=true">View all 82 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_154998714" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Emily Cordeiro" href="/user/show/48472927-emily-cordeiro"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1469688787p1/48472927.jpg" alt="48472927" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/48472927-emily-cordeiro">Emily Cordeiro</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer3100619535896795538">I can't agree more with your review. I was about to throw this books out of the plane that I was currently on. I really expected her to end up with</span>  <span id="freeText3100619535896795538" style="display:none">I can't agree more with your review. I was about to throw this books out of the plane that I was currently on. I really expected her to end up with Kile, because they had a development. I really expected Maxon to stay as King for a good time, even though I was happy for him and America, for finally being able to live their lives without thinking about the rest of IllU+00E8a. I also knew that Marid was a total fake, which was only boring and not surprising, as it should be. I mean, this book was a mess. Im so sad, because I really loved the first three books of the series. America was annoying and all, but at least her story with Maxon made sense, at least we could see they falling in love and slowly realising it. About Eikko, I really liked him, but his relationship with Eadlyn was always so platonic. I mean, not even platonic, they were friends, just very good friends. He was there for her, and she was grateful for it, period. It was a total mess in my point of view. Kiera should've developed Eikko and Eadlyn, instead of doing this hell of a mess with this series. I'll be eternally sad because she didn't end up with Kile, the one we saw her falling for. The one that went from hating her, to loving her, to sacrificing everything for her. I'm just not buying any part of Eadlyn's story. I don't dislike her as I did for a very brief period with America, but I'm really really far from loving her, as I learned to love America. Im just disappointed. Never thought I would give two stars to a book of the selection series. Never thought I would give two stars to any book I've chosen to read. This is just sad, tbh</span>  <a data-text-id="3100619535896795538" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Aug id="reviewTextContainer599834177" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13400429064481020005">This is going to go one of two ways.<br /><br />Way #1: I will love this book. I will gush about this book. I will want to have its children (not really) and pledge my soul to this book (a possibility). <br /><br />Way #2: I will hate this book so much that I see red. Gouging my eyes out after reading is a possibility (gouging occuring during reading in an [most likely successful] attempt to avoid continuing reading this book is also a possibility, BUT it will only happen if the book is <i>really</i> bad), but I may settle fo</span>  <span id="freeText13400429064481020005" style="display:none">This is going to go one of two ways.<br /><br />Way #1: I will love this book. I will gush about this book. I will want to have its children (not really) and pledge my soul to this book (a possibility). <br /><br />Way #2: I will hate this book so much that I see red. Gouging my eyes out after reading is a possibility (gouging occuring during reading in an [most likely successful] attempt to avoid continuing reading this book is also a possibility, BUT it will only happen if the book is <i>really</i> bad), but I may settle for minor hair tearing out and extreme ranting.<br /><br />We shall see.</span>  <a data-text-id="13400429064481020005" href="#" href="/review/list/21937982-hailey-hailsheartsnyc?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1438463511" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10046249474192656">SPOILER FREE REVIEW: <a target="_blank" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HORz_PjtpXQ" rel="nofollow">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HORz_...</a><br /><br />This one was a good improvement on The Heir. Eadlyn was a huge brat in the previous book, but she comes to some self realization in this book that makes her change her ways. I liked that with The Heir and The Crown you truly never really know who Eadlyn is going to end up with. With first three books of The Selection Series, you always kind of know who Maxon is going to choose, but these 2 books kept me guessing. However, these 2 books</span>  <span id="freeText10046249474192656" style="display:none">SPOILER FREE REVIEW: <a target="_blank" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HORz_PjtpXQ" rel="nofollow">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HORz_...</a><br /><br />This one was a good improvement on The Heir. Eadlyn was a huge brat in the previous book, but she comes to some self realization in this book that makes her change her ways. I liked that with The Heir and The Crown you truly never really know who Eadlyn is going to end up with. With first three books of The Selection Series, you always kind of know who Maxon is going to choose, but these 2 books kept me guessing. However, these 2 books put the romance on the side, which is annoying because that's 95% of why I love these books so much. But overall, I did really enjoy it, but I think it was time for the series to be over. </span>  <a data-text-id="10046249474192656" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1438463511">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1438463511" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1438463511&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1438463511'><a id="like_count_review_1438463511" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1438463511?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">129 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1438463511" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1438463511" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=129&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1438463511&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1438463511" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1438463511, true, &#39;&#39;); <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Jun 22, 2016 02:17AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1438463511' class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1413865226" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1413865226" />    <a title="Mariah of the Night Court" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/29456303-mariah-of-the-night-court"><img alt="Mariah of the Night Court" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1475361360p2/29456303.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1413865226?book_show_action=false">May 25, 2016</a>      <a title="Mariah of the Night Court" class="user" name="Mariah of the Night Court" href="/user/show/29456303-mariah-of-the-night-court">Mariah of the Night Court</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1413865226" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer604345810907388463"><b>SO DISAPPOINTED</b><br><br><b>***Contains Spoilers***</b><br><br>Kiera Cass seriously did not put that much effort in her last installment in the Selection series. The other books were great, especially the first three, but kind of lost their touch when Eadlyn was introduced. The Crown was so dry. It was like this...<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1464142791ra/19202137.gif" width="250" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Perfect comparison.<br><br>I really do not like Eadlyn as a character at all because she has no personality! All I hear out of her mouth is awkward, out of place dialogue that leaves me cringing. Everyone was telling</span>  <span id="freeText604345810907388463" style="display:none"><b>SO DISAPPOINTED</b><br><br><b>***Contains Spoilers***</b><br><br>Kiera Cass seriously did not put that much effort in her last installment in the Selection series. The other books were great, especially the first three, but kind of lost their touch when Eadlyn was introduced. The Crown was so dry. It was like this...<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1464142791ra/19202137.gif" width="250" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Perfect comparison.<br><br>I really do not like Eadlyn as a character at all because she has no personality! All I hear out of her mouth is awkward, out of place dialogue that leaves me cringing. Everyone was telling her how great of a queen she'd be and I was there thinking, "Why would you guys happily trade Eadlyn in place of America and Maxon???". <b>SHE IS SUCH A FLAT CHARACTER.</b><br><br>There is seriously no character depth in this book. We don't get to dive into any of the suitors' backgrounds, and really, we don't get to hear that much from the suitors at all! No personalities, just smiling faces who constantly said things to Eadlyn like "I understand you completely", "I'm so sorry about your mom", and "You'll make a great queen". Okay, I realize that those are nice things to say about a girl, but when it comes to reading, that is so boring! Especially when <b>EVERY SINGLE GUY SAYS IT LIKE TEN TIMES.</b><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1464142489ra/19202119.gif" width="400" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Alright, let me just get it out. I hate it when characters are overly nice all the time and have no kind of dark side to them. Character flaws. Yeah, that's it. And backstories, which this book had none of. <b>CHARACTERS WHO ARE OVERLY NICE AND CHEERY ALL THE TIME ARE JUST SO BORING.</b> <br><br>Some conversations went sorta like this:<br><br>"Hello Eadlyn," said suitor.<br>"Hello," said Eadlyn.<br>"You look lovely today," said suitor.<br>"Oh wow thank you so much!" said Eadlyn.<br>"I'm sorry about your mom," said suitor.<br>"Aw thank you...she's starting to get better," said Eadlyn.<br>"That's good," said suitor.<br>"Yeah," said Eadlyn.<br>"Nice seeing you, bye," said suitor.<br>"Bye," said Eadlyn.<br><br><b>WASN'T THAT EXCITING OR WHAT.</b><br><br>Alright, I'm gonna spice up this scene for the fun of it, keeping the suitors lines, but changing Eadlyn's.<br><br>"Hello Eadlyn," said suitor.<br>"Hey ya fuck tard," said Eadlyn.<br>"You look lovely today," said suitor.<br>"Yeah I just took a shit on the crapper and thought of you" said Eadlyn.<br>"I'm sorry about your mom," said suitor.<br>"If I fucking hear that one more time I will stick my tiara up yo ass," said Eadlyn.<br>"That's good," said suitor.<br>"Bitch what the fuck did I just say," said Eadlyn.<br>"Nice seeing you, bye," said suitor.<br>"Stfu," said Eadlyn.<br><br><b>NOW THAT IS GOLD.</b><br><br>Alright, moving on. So apparently Hale and Ean are gay for each other. Before I go on, let me just say, I am not against homosexuality. But, when we found this out, I was so mad because of how random and out of place it was. Okay Kiera, so to make this faster to write, you're going to just have two of the elite fall for each other and get away with it so easily? When Hale told Eadlyn that he was in love with Ean I literally said "What the fuck?" while reading. Whatever, on to Erik.<br><br>I knew that Erik was going to be with Eadlyn in the end, like how obvious could it be? And it happened so fast. He's probably the least flat character out of all the characters (but he's still flat). Eadlyn literally chose to be with him in like the last five pages. <br><br>What really bothered me though, was how everyone was just fine and dandy with it. When Henri found out, he's like "Ok, I see the love. Be together. I love you guys, you're s'cute. Henri out."........okay Henri. And when Eadlyn announced to the millions of viewers watching the broadcast that she was going to choose Erik (a guy no one even knew existed and was obviously not in the selection), everyone was just cheering and clapping. I don't know about you but if I were watching the Bachelorette and Jojo picked a guy that wasn't even one of her choices and wasn't on the show I'd be like "Who dis bitch". And the media would also go ballistic. But no, everyone was okay with it and didn't think twice.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1464142489ra/19202120.gif" width="400" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>And then, it was just like "The end, that's it, that's the book". <br><br>And I just sat there like "Wat".<br><br>Yeah, pretty much. I was hoping this book was going to be a good conclusion to the series, but overall, it wrecked it for me. It was so boring. The writing was bad. The characters were flat. The plot was dull. Nothing really happened. <br><br><b>Goodbye forever, Selection series.</b><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1464142489ra/19202121.gif" width="400" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></span>  <a data-text-id="604345810907388463" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1413865226">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1413865226" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1413865226&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1413865226'><a id="like_count_review_1413865226" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1413865226?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">118 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1413865226" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1413865226" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=118&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1413865226&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1413865226" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1413865226, true, &#39;&#39;); I'll just buy the first three instead. Then I can</span>  <span id="freeText8167600881648895377" style="display:none">After reading the book I've come to the conclusion that I'll just ignore the last two books. I'll just buy the first three instead. Then I can blissfully ignore this disaster. Maybe if this storyline was stretched out over three books then it wouldn't be such a mess.</span>  <a data-text-id="8167600881648895377" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Sep 18, 2016 10:04AM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_158135245" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="ArdourD" href="/user/show/55108877-ardourd"><img src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/f_25x33-d79c46f9428d2aea1444d67c091766a6.png" alt="F 25x33" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/55108877-ardourd">ArdourD</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer263351016502495799">It's been over a year since I liked this comment. class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1672201142" />    <a title="May" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/20416955-may"><img alt="May" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1461082995p2/20416955.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1672201142?book_show_action=false">Jun 20, 2016</a>      <a title="May" class="user" name="May" href="/user/show/20416955-may">May</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9788416498147" href="/book/show/27557581-la-corona">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20416955-may?shelf=estanterU+00EDa">estanterU+00EDa</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1672201142" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6235589219720507765"><b> OMG OMG OMGGGGGGG TIENES QUE LEER ESTE LIBRO Y TODA LA SAGA YA </b><br /><br />La Corona, cuarta y U+00FAltima parte de la saga La SelecciU+00F3n o segunda parte de la bilogU+00EDa secuela de la trilogU+00EDa la SelecciU+00F3n. Sea como sea, novela que concluye el ciclo que abriU+00F3 la SelecciU+00F3n y que se ha hecho con el pedacito que quedaba disponible de mi corazU+00F3n. La Corona es una novela totalmente a la altura del resto de la saga, con unos giros totalmente inesperados y que, sin duda, gustarU+00E1 a todxs lxs seguidorxs de La SelecciU+00F3n.<br />Lo</span>  <span id="freeText6235589219720507765" style="display:none"><b> OMG OMG OMGGGGGGG TIENES QUE LEER ESTE LIBRO Y TODA LA SAGA YA </b><br /><br />La Corona, cuarta y U+00FAltima parte de la saga La SelecciU+00F3n o segunda parte de la bilogU+00EDa secuela de la trilogU+00EDa la SelecciU+00F3n. Sea como sea, novela que concluye el ciclo que abriU+00F3 la SelecciU+00F3n y que se ha hecho con el pedacito que quedaba disponible de mi corazU+00F3n. La Corona es una novela totalmente a la altura del resto de la saga, con unos giros totalmente inesperados y que, sin duda, gustarU+00E1 a todxs lxs seguidorxs de La SelecciU+00F3n.<br />Lo cierto es que La heredera no fue del todo lo que esperaba y encontrU+00E9 bastantes fallos que me dejaron con un sabor agridulce. Sin embargo, La Corona corrige casi todos esos errores que vi en La Heredera y sube de nuevo el listU+00F3n colocU+00E1ndose a la altura de la trilogU+00EDa. Para mU+00ED es tan buena como La Elegida y creo que incluso acaba la secuela mejor de lo que La Elegida acabU+00F3 su trilogU+00EDa.<br />Los personajes de La Corona mejoran respecto a la anterior novela. La verdad es que entre tantos pretendientes en La Heredera me perdU+00EDa por completo y muchas veces confundU+00EDa unos con otros. Sin embargo, Cass define claramente quiU+00E9nes son los personajes de La Corona y les da cierta profundidad que hace que no te pierdas en la lectura y que seas agente directo de la elecciU+00F3n de Eadlyn ya que sacas tu propio favorito porque los conoces lo suficiente como para hacerlo.<br />Eadlyn como personaje. Pf. Creo que ha evolucionado muchU+00EDsimo en esta novela y que ha mejorado como personaje respecto a La Heredera. De hecho creo que Cass restifica y reconduce a la protagonista en La Corona y me ha gustado muchU+00EDsimo cU+00F3mo ha marcado la diferencia entre ella y AmU+00E9rica porque, a pesar de las claras similitudes, son totalmente diferentes y polos opuestos. Si ya bien en la novela anterior se nos presentaba a Eadlyn como un sujeto muy diferente a su madre, aquU+00ED la distancia entre ambas se hacen aU+00FAn mayor y se remarca muchU+00EDsimo su personalidad. Me encanta y me encanta porque su evoluciU+00F3n en tan solo una novela es alucinante y brillante.<br />El ritmo. TU+00EDpico de Kiera Cass. Siempre dejU+00E1ndote con ganas de devorar el siguiente capU+00EDtulo y no dejU+00E1ndote descansar por las noches. Disfruto mucho de su ritmo desenfrenado y de cU+00F3mo consigue atraparte entre sus historias.<br />Otra cosa de la que he disfrutado muchU+00EDsimo y que me parece bastante nuevo dentro de la saga ha sido de los giros inesperados. U+00A1QuU+00E9 de giros! U+00A1Por no hablar del giro final respecto a quiU+00E9n ama Eadlyn! Creo que si algo le faltaba a la saga eran giros mU+00E1s profundos e inesperados y que con esta novela Cass borda eso en lo que solU+00EDa flojear.7<br />La secuela de La Heredera y La Corona me ha gustado muchU+00EDsimo porque aporta una perspectiva distinta a la de La SelecciU+00F3n y se ven las cosas desde dentro mU+00E1s que desde fuera. <br />En resumen, La Corona es una novela fascinante, repleta de giros, sorpresas, con un ritmo increU+00EDble, una evoluciU+00F3n de personajes brillante y un final totalmente a la altura de lo esperado. <br />Tienes que leer esta saga YA.<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="6235589219720507765" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Virginia" href="/user/show/51330665-virginia"><img src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/f_25x33-d79c46f9428d2aea1444d67c091766a6.png" alt="F 25x33" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/51330665-virginia">Virginia</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer2678111160733207665">Tengo que decir que el ritmo de lectura como siempre es increible, y que me gusto el desarrollo que tuvo el persona de Eadlyn, Ademas de el giro</span>  <span id="freeText2678111160733207665" style="display:none">Tengo que decir que el ritmo de lectura como siempre es increible, y que me gusto el desarrollo que tuvo el persona de Eadlyn, Ademas de el giro inesperado de Henri y Ean que me sacU+00F3 una sonrisa. Pero me parece que al final le encontrU+00E9 mU+00E1s cosas negativas que positivas. No me malinterpreten, me gustan las chicas de caracter fuerte como Eadlyn, de hecho me gusta mU+00E1s que America, y este libro habU+00EDa sido mi favorito de la serie cuando comence a leerlo hasta que llegue al capitulo donde ella recibe el flechazo que cambia el curso de la historia en un dos por tres. Porque no, no pude sentir ese amor que tanto se profesan, de donde salio, como surgio, ni idea...en fin. Y para finalizar tenemos un personaje "malo" que asi como aparece para hacer de las suyas, se vU+00E1 y ya, y en eso queda. Le falto accion y nuestras docis de romance que si tuvimos en la historia de america.</span>  <a data-text-id="2678111160733207665" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      Sep 01, 2016 07:29PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div><div id="comment_156307971" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Ylenia" href="/user/show/51431631-ylenia"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1452595443p1/51431631.jpg" alt="51431631" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/51431631-ylenia">Ylenia</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer4500739732159502093"><i>Virginia wrote: "Que pena yo senti tal decepcion al acabarlo, me parecio que en este libro kiera se centro demasiado en lo politico y muy poquito en l</i></span>  <span id="freeText4500739732159502093" style="display:none"><i>Virginia wrote: "Que pena yo senti tal decepcion al acabarlo, me parecio que en este libro kiera se centro demasiado en lo politico y muy poquito en la seleccion en si. </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_931692759" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/931692759" />    <a title="Carol [Goodreads Addict]" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/10717098-carol-goodreads-addict"><img alt="Carol [Goodreads Addict]" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1449163093p2/10717098.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/931692759?book_show_action=false">May 26, 2016</a>      <a title="Carol [Goodreads Addict]" class="user" name="Carol [Goodreads Addict]" href="/user/show/10717098-carol-goodreads-addict">Carol [Goodreads Addict]</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10717098-carol-goodreads-addict?shelf=paranormal-fantasy">paranormal-fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10717098-carol-goodreads-addict?shelf=dystopian">dystopian</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/10717098-carol-goodreads-addict?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer931692759" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9941419015332013956">The Crown is book five in The Selection series by Kiera Cass. This series has captivated me from the beginning. For me, itU+2019s one of the most visual series IU+2019ve ever read. Is it the girly girl in me that loves the gowns, the jewels, the pomp and circumstance? No matter the reason, IU+2019m a fan, and I love the way Kiera Cass wrapped it all up. <br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1464200451i/19211977.jpg" alt="The Crown by Kiera Cass: " class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Eadlyn has grown up. This book holds a very different Eadlyn than you met in the beginning. This young woman holds the weight of her country on her shoulders.</span>  <span id="freeText9941419015332013956" style="display:none">The Crown is book five in The Selection series by Kiera Cass. This series has captivated me from the beginning. For me, itU+2019s one of the most visual series IU+2019ve ever read. Is it the girly girl in me that loves the gowns, the jewels, the pomp and circumstance? No matter the reason, IU+2019m a fan, and I love the way Kiera Cass wrapped it all up. <br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1464200451i/19211977.jpg" alt="The Crown by Kiera Cass: " class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Eadlyn has grown up. This book holds a very different Eadlyn than you met in the beginning. This young woman holds the weight of her country on her shoulders. Her mother lies in the hospital with her husband by her side. Eadlyn has always known the love her parents shared but watching her father at her motherU+2019s side shows her a depth she hadnU+2019t realized. Could she ever have that with one of these men from the Selection? She never even wanted to be a part of this but now finds herself longing for what her parents have. <br><br><b>  <i>U+201CI had power and no idea how to use it. I was a ruler who didnU+2019t know how to lead. I was a twin who was on her own. I was a daughter with missing parents. I had a half dozen suitors and wasnU+2019t sure how to be in love.U+201D</i></b><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1464200451i/19211978._SY540_.jpg" alt="queen: " class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Eadlyn is acting as Regent in her fatherU+2019s absence. She has trained since birth to someday take over the kingdom but she wasnU+2019t prepared for the full responsibility just yet. At the same time, she is somehow trying to find time to get to know the remaining men. She is developing feelings for some of these men but could it be love? <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1464200451ra/19211979.gif" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Of course, with power, come those that want to take it from you. Someone posing as a friend tries to manipulate Eadlyn and the public to put himself into a place to assume power. With public opinion of Eadlyn less than what she would want it to be, this puts her in a very precarious position. <br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1464200451i/19211980._SY540_.jpg" alt="The Crown Kiera Cass: " class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Of course, love canU+2019t be predicted. And for Eadlyn, it came as both a surprise and a shock. But what should have been the most beautiful moment of her life will force her to make a decision that will possible be the biggest sacrifice she will ever make for her kingdom.<br><br><b>  <i>U+201CIn an instant, everything in the room came alive. Like the sunshine had a melody and the sounds of footsteps had a texture I could feel in my fingertips each time anyone moved. The world woke up when I looked at him.U+201D</i></b><br><br>Could these feelings just be her own? Or does he feel the same way as well? Does she even dare to voice her feelings or should she keep them locked up inside?<br><br>As I said above, I love this series. I feel like the ending was perfect. Since itU+2019s been awhile since the last book, I donU+2019t remember it being so poetic. KieraU+2019s way with words in this one was just beautiful. With all the responsibility Eadlyn was forced to take on, I wished she had more time with her gentlemen but in the end, I donU+2019t know if that would have mattered. <br><br>As of late, IU+2019ve gotten away from young adult. But there was no way I couldnU+2019t follow this through to see how it ended. So if you havenU+2019t started this series and are on the fence about it, let me give you a not so gentle nudge and get started. Now there will be no waits between books for you to see what happens next. And if you think of it, let me know how you like it. I hope you enjoy it as much as I have. Thank you to Kiera Cass for such a wonderful, beautiful series.<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1464200451i/19211981.jpg" alt="Happily Ever After: " class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1425952445ra/13954015.gif" alt="signature" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br></span>  <a data-text-id="9941419015332013956" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review931692759">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link931692759" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=931692759&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_931692759'><a id="like_count_review_931692759" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/931692759?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">99 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_931692759" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_931692759" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=99&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=931692759&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_931692759" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 931692759, true, &#39;&#39;); class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1565099524" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1565099524" />    <a title="Maggie" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/51318038-maggie"><img alt="Maggie" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479934114p2/51318038.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1565099524?book_show_action=false">Jul 28, 2016</a>      <a title="Maggie" class="user" name="Maggie" href="/user/show/51318038-maggie">Maggie</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/51318038-maggie?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/51318038-maggie?shelf=dystopian">dystopian</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/51318038-maggie?shelf=2-stars">2-stars</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/51318038-maggie?shelf=2016-reads">2016-reads</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1565099524" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16315060720751436745"><blockquote> <i>U+201CMaybe it's not the first kisses that are supposed to be special. Maybe it's the last ones.U+201D</i> </blockquote><br /><br />The Selection : <br />The Elite : <br /><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1565629419">The One</a> : <br /><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1643404150">The Heir</a> : <br />The Crown : <br /><br />Don't mind taking your time with this one. It won't be a review of me ranting about Eadlyn and how stubborn and foolish and rude and spoiled she is. Or was I guess...<br /><br />I'd like to start off by saying I <b>hated</b> The Heir. I'm sorry, but if you've read my review, you'll know why. If you've read The Heir and were disappointed with it, then you'll know</span>  <span id="freeText16315060720751436745" style="display:none"><blockquote>  <i>U+201CMaybe it's not the first kisses that are supposed to be special. Maybe it's the last ones.U+201D</i></blockquote><br /><br />The Selection : U+2605 U+2605 U+2605 U+00BD<br />The Elite : U+2605 U+2605 U+2605 U+2605<br /><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1565629419">The One</a> : U+2605 U+2605 U+2605 U+2605 U+2605<br /><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1643404150">The Heir</a> : U+2605<br />The Crown : U+2605 U+2605<br /><br />Don't mind taking your time with this one. It won't be a review of me ranting about Eadlyn and how stubborn and foolish and rude and spoiled she is. Or was I guess...<br /><br />I'd like to start off by saying I <b>hated</b> The Heir. I'm sorry, but if you've read my review, you'll know why. If you've read The Heir and were disappointed with it, then you'll know why as well. In The Heir, Eadlyn is just rude, stubborn, foolish and spoiled. She has a bitchy attitude and wondered why everyone hated her or had some dislikes of her. But in The Crown, there are some changes.<br /><br />I knew that after reading and finishing The One, the series should've stopped there. It should've stayed as a trilogy. I mean, the main focus was on America and Maxon. Writing 2 stories about their daughter wasn't really worth it. Instead of keeping the happiness flowing everywhere, everything sort of faded because of these 2 other books. Instead of wishing more moments with America and Maxon, we get moments with their daughter and her own selection, even though she didn't want it. Instead of romance, we get boring dates, awkward ones as well, a boring plot, boring main characters and nothing in comparison to <i>The Selection, The Elite and The One.</i><br /><br />I will admit, this story did have its improvements like the other ones did. I mean, in The Heir, a lot of us see Eadlyn as a spoiled brat. I'm sorry, but spoiled explains her a lot in that book. But in The Crown, we notice she makes improvements in her life. She isn't stuck up and spoiled all the time, she doesn't treat everyone like shit, she tries to follow the same moves her father did when he was just a prince, and she shows some care and sympathy for the Selected boys.<br /><br />Nothing really happened in The Crown. There weren't any shocking moments or decisions that were about to leave my jaw hanging open. Honestly, I knew it was all coming. Eadlyn's choice didn't leave me disappointed. I was disappointed since my <i>ship sank and didn't keep floating on the ocean</i> but I didn't completely blame her. Her choice felt right and even though there is no other book coming up, I feel like in the minds of fans of this book can imagine the happy life they'll be living.<br /><br />As to the things that did upset me, even though it's really just one, I think making Eadlyn queen at a young age when both her parents are alive was stupid and ridiculous. Just because your parents are carrying stress on their shoulders and your mom is in a poor condition of recovering, that doesn't mean you give your royal title to your daughter who still doesn't even have a <i>soulmate</i> and doesn't even have a clue on how she would rule the country. Maxon literally gave up on his life to take care of America but then they didn't even know how Eadlyn would handle it. That's just stupid!<br /><br />Other than saying negative things about this book, I was glad Grandma Singer was back, new characters were mentioned and met, and new truths were discovered. I was glad Kiera brought some people back and made some changes in the ones we met in the previous book. I was glad there were character developments although they weren't the best. I don't consider Kiera Cass one of my favorite authors simply because I really only loved The One. I will continue to love that one but only that one. Admittedly, reading her novels are like reading fan fictions. The writing is too cute and written in a quirky way for teenage girls looking for romance that is discovered in a way that is not discovered here. <br /><br />I guess The Selection really is over now. I can't really emphasize the disappointment I was left with this book. I was expecting so much more even though at the same time, I wasn't. The series should've ended with The One. Period. I really hope that if Kiera Cass decides to work on something new, its different. Even if the main genre is romance, I just hope the writing improves and it doesn't just focus on one thing. If she is planning on working on something new for us, I just hope it's worth it and I hope my doubts for it stay high. I'm just hoping. <br /><br />Goodbye IllU+00E9a. For real now, and maybe for the best.</span>  <a data-text-id="16315060720751436745" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1565099524">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1565099524" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1565099524&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1565099524'><a id="like_count_review_1565099524" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1565099524?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">91 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1565099524" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1565099524" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=91&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1565099524&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1565099524" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1565099524, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">22 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1565099524?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1565099524' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1565099524/comments?reverse=true">View all 22 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_152467249" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Maggie" href="/user/show/51318038-maggie"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478924580p1/51318038.jpg" alt="51318038" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/51318038-maggie">Maggie</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer4383724630489895160"><i>Isra wrote: "I'm glad to see that I'm not the only one who seemed completely and utterly baffled that Maxon and America just handed over the crown to</i></span>  <span id="freeText4383724630489895160" style="display:none"><i>Isra wrote: "I'm glad to see that I'm not the only one who seemed completely and utterly baffled that Maxon and America just handed over the crown to her without even thinking about it. There should've been a y..."</i><br /><br />Thank you! class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1059615534" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1059615534" />    <a title="Pamela" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/3645538-pamela"><img alt="Pamela" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1451734871p2/3645538.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1059615534?book_show_action=false">May 07, 2016</a>      <a title="Pamela" class="user" name="Pamela" href="/user/show/3645538-pamela">Pamela</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780062458865" href="/book/show/26198897-the-crown">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1059615534" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6935534566203320354"><b>**53 people liked this post because of this initial review**</b><br /><br />OMFG!! YAY <3<br /><br />lol so much raging in the review section of Goodreads. If you don't like the series why dafaq u stil following it bro? get out & stay out yayy thank you <br /><br />----------------------------------------<br /><b>**Review of Novel**</b><br /><br />As I recall, IU+2019ve described Kiera Cass as an author who takes the difficult path and makes it work somehow. She never takes the easy path and this allows her to write interesting storylines and events. IU+2019ve a</span>  <span id="freeText6935534566203320354" style="display:none"><b>**53 people liked this post because of this initial review**</b><br /><br />OMFG!! YAY <3<br /><br />lol so much raging in the review section of Goodreads. If you don't like the series why dafaq u stil following it bro? get out & stay out yayy thank you <br /><br />----------------------------------------<br /><b>**Review of Novel**</b><br /><br />As I recall, IU+2019ve described Kiera Cass as an author who takes the difficult path and makes it work somehow. She never takes the easy path and this allows her to write interesting storylines and events. IU+2019ve always been pleasantly surprised by her stories and avidly engaged by her characters. I can describe The Crown using varied words, but good is not one of them.<br /><br />As I began reading this book, I felt that there was something missing. I want to stress that even this early on, I wasnU+2019t planning on rating this book with 5 stars, which is odd for me because IU+2019m an devoted fan of this series. ItU+2019s true that the fourth book in the series was a bother to read because of Eadlyn, but I still admired her character. She had a different type of personality, one that a lot of people would not appreciate, but her thoughts and actions made sense when they were strung together. Her personality wasnU+2019t an issue in this book, though. It was evident from the beginning that there were a lot of missing information and that most of the scenes were rushed. There were some scenes where she was suddenly in a date with someone without even an introduction that she was going to one. And said date would end abruptly and nothing interesting actually happens. I understand if this is a tactic to undermine the date, but as readers of EadlynU+2019s selection, it also undermines her emotions over her suitors. This, I think, should not have been done because she repeats every now and then that she cares deeply for them U+2013 even going so far as to say that she loves all of them. The lack of focus on the dates make these claims easily refutable.<br /><br />There was also a huge deficiency in character development. There were certain things in the book that were revealed rather abruptly. If you think about it, the clipped dates should have given way to more space for the development of other aspects of the story, but it didnU+2019t. These revelations caused so much turmoil in me that I was unable to continue right away. I was so pissed! I never curse in reviews, but that development was COMPLETE BULLSHIT. IU+2019m not really picky when it comes to characters, as long as thereU+2019s evidence of how so and so could have happened, IU+2019m okay with it. And yes, there were scenes that could have lead up to that kind of development, but EADLYN WASNU+2019T IN THAT STATE OF EMOTION. AT ALL.<br /><br />I canU+2019tU+2026 this book is a MAJOR DISAPPOINTMET.<br /><br />I love the America & Maxon moments, but if Kiera Cass really needed more space for character development, then they should have just cut out these scenes from the book. HELL, I would have preferred another book if that would let me avoid this mess of a rushed book. IU+2019m thoroughly disappointed. I tried to see how what happened had happened (avoiding spoilers is hard, whew!) but I just couldnU+2019t. I even tried to accept it, like U+2013 okay, you canU+2019t do anything anymore, this is the flow of the story. But I was at such at an emotional disconnect by that point that I couldnU+2019t enjoy the story anymore.<br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[The Marid plotline was so obvious that I canU+2019t believe Eadlyn missed it. And she only started to take notice of it when she was drunk! Also, IU+2019m not sure what constitutional monarchy entails, but by voting for a prime minister, it would appear that with MaridU+2019s popularity, he could still get the position if he so wanted. This book, I tell you, is complete BULLSHIT. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> Kiera, if youU+2019re reading this or if this somehow gets to you, please understand that IU+2019m not against your decisions. However, I AM mad that things were too abrupt, had no buildups, and seemed to have little to no thought put into it. It obvious; this book didnU+2019t even reach 300 pages. Everything was sloppy, even the writing style. IU+2019ve read better self-published novels than this.<br /><br />This is a very, VERY harsh review, I know, but I loved the Selection series because of how emotional everything was and because I was able to sympathize with the characters. I didnU+2019t love this series because of sloppiness or laziness from the authorU+2019s part. I know that Eadlyn isnU+2019t supposed to be a very emotional person, but everyone U+2013 and I do mean EVERYONE, no matter how cold and stoic they appear in everyday life U+2013 does not stay that way when presented with emotional situations. Especially people who are self-centered, which Eadlyn proclaims to be. Self-centered people are concerned with everything about them including their feelings, ESPECIALLY THEIR FEELINGS, no matter how calculating they may seem. But no, Eadlyn was portrayed as someone who wanted to be the best monarch for her people and was despised despite her efforts. This is not being self-centered. This is attempting to make your character do things that your fans would want her to do. This is making your character make choices that she isnU+2019t prepared to do yet in that part of the book. This is BASTARDIZING your story by forcing it to end by page 278.<br /><br />I wonU+2019t even end this review with a proper conclusion. We didnU+2019t get one, why should this?</span>  <a data-text-id="6935534566203320354" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1059615534">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1059615534" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1059615534&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1059615534'><a id="like_count_review_1059615534" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1059615534?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">82 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1059615534" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1059615534" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=82&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1059615534&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1059615534" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1059615534, true, &#39;&#39;); The ending of this review was 100 times better than the ending of this series."</i><br /><br />Thank you! :-)</span>    <br/>    <span class="xhrCommentFooter greyText">      May 15, 2016 10:18PM    </span>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1059615534' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1059615534, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_662326856" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/662326856" />    <a title="J.C. Morrows" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/21347189-j-c-morrows"><img alt="J.C. Morrows" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1459282438p2/21347189.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/662326856?book_show_action=false">Sep 02, 2015</a>      <a title="J.C. Morrows" class="user" name="J.C. Morrows" href="/user/show/21347189-j-c-morrows">J.C. Morrows</a>          marked it as to-read            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer662326856" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17955125297549856289">I will never understand why people feel the need to bash something they haven't even read. <br /><br />Irony... God willing, I will be in the same place a year or so from now. I am sure there will be plenty of people who detest my book. LOL!<br /><br />EDIT - 9/2/15<br /><br />The words above were strangely prophetic... I AM preparing to release my first novel and praying my skin is thick enough to deal with the inevitable bad reviews. Wish me the best...</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review662326856">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link662326856" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=662326856&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_662326856'><a id="like_count_review_662326856" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/662326856?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">83 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_662326856" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_662326856" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=83&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=662326856&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_662326856" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 662326856, true, &#39;&#39;);         <span id="freeTextContainer8177682730837807297">Minor spoilers<br /><br />Major rant<br /><br />So I read through this in one sitting but I did not like it. I found it boring and the romance was so rushed and came out of the blue. By halfway through the author still had me guessing on who Eadlyn, our stupid useless heroine, would choose. She had guys coming from far and wide just for her to "pick". Load of bull. I just taught Eadlyn's story was pointless. I found it boring and the romance was so rushed and came out of the blue. By halfway through the author still had me guessing on who Eadlyn, our stupid useless heroine, would choose. She had guys coming from far and wide just for her to "pick". Load of bull. I just taught Eadlyn's story was pointless. I am sure these two books would have been so much better if Maxon and America's story had continued from book 3 on where they left off. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[And it was so ridiculous in the end how she proposed to Henri but a minute before the wedding she changed her mind and after he had worked so hard for her to pick him, and he was not the least bit bothered. <br />How convenient. How fitting. What an understanding guy!!!
