</div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1568020439" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1568020439" />    <a title="Cait U+2022 A Page with a View" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/47412532-cait-a-page-with-a-view"><img alt="Cait U+2022 A Page with a View" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478204082p2/47412532.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1568020439?book_show_action=false">Jun 08, 2016</a>      <a title="Cait U+2022 A Page with a View" class="user" name="Cait U+2022 A Page with a View" href="/user/show/47412532-cait-a-page-with-a-view">Cait U+2022 A Page with a View</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/47412532-cait-a-page-with-a-view?shelf=ya-fantasy">ya-fantasy</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1568020439" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer18034697547399646712">So... this book was a great reminder of how weak the story & characters got at the end of The Selection series and HOW MUCH BEAUTIFUL COVERS CAN DISAPPOINT ME.<br /><br />I genuinely liked the first part of Eadlyn's story in The Heir, but there really was no plot arc in this sequel. It just plowed straight through in a bland line to the end. Everyone's character was reduced to some empty shell with dialogue... I can't even properly rage about how infuriatingly DULL this whole thing was because I'm still</span>  <span id="freeText18034697547399646712" style="display:none">So... this book was a great reminder of how weak the story & characters got at the end of The Selection series and HOW MUCH BEAUTIFUL COVERS CAN DISAPPOINT ME.<br /><br />I genuinely liked the first part of Eadlyn's story in The Heir, but there really was no plot arc in this sequel. It just plowed straight through in a bland line to the end. Everyone's character was reduced to some empty shell with dialogue... I can't even properly rage about how infuriatingly DULL this whole thing was because I'm still so bored.<br /><br />There was a partial focus on her mother's health issues, half of a focus on Eadyln coming to terms with ruling the country, and then sometimes she'd randomly remember that whole Selection thing. Everything felt like a side show, especially the typical background chatter of political unrest that this series fails so well at. These books are fun fluffy reads, but the embarrassing attempts at political analysis completely destroy them. <br /><br />My biggest issue with all of the books I've read by Kiera Cass is that events seem to happen because the author <i>just wants them to</i>. The whole book read like watching a middle school play... like all of the characters are forced to say these lines without actually feeling anything or having any realistic reactions and then they rush haphazardly onto the next scene. One second Eadlyn's barely talking to a guy and the next second they're crying about how they're soulmates and getting married?? I do not care. I feel nothing except regret for the past 2 hours I spent reading this mess.<br /><br /><u>Nice things I have to say: </u>middle schoolers would probably really enjoy this book (even the adults in it acted like tweens at times). And <i>that is the most gorgeous cover ever</i>. Why.<br /><br /><a href="http://apagewithaview.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">My blog</a> | <a href="http://apagewithaview.tumblr.com" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Tumblr</a> | <a href="https://twitter.com/pagewithaview" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Twitter</a> | <a href="https://www.instagram.com/pagewithaview/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Instagram</a></span>  <a de una Merodeadora)" href="/user/show/20954985-isa-cantos-cr-nicas-de-una-merodeadora">Isa Cantos (CrU+00F3nicas de una Merodeadora)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9788416498147" href="/book/show/27557581-la-corona">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1686158913" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15229217193051779720">Cada que leo un libro de Kiera Cass mi corazU+00F3n muere un poquito. La cantidad de sentimientos que logra producirme esta mujer con sus palabras, sus personajes y las situaciones que ellos viven es increU+00EDble y me deja deseando vivir en el palacio de IllU+00E9a junto con Maxon, America, Eadlyn y sus seleccionados.<br><br>Si bien entiendo las razones por las que muchas personas odian un poco <i>La Heredera</i> y <i>La Corona</i>, para mU+00ED fueron libros preciosos (no tanto como los tres primeros, pero, oye, llegar a ese nivel es</span>  <span id="freeText15229217193051779720" style="display:none">Cada que leo un libro de Kiera Cass mi corazU+00F3n muere un poquito. La cantidad de sentimientos que logra producirme esta mujer con sus palabras, sus personajes y las situaciones que ellos viven es increU+00EDble y me deja deseando vivir en el palacio de IllU+00E9a junto con Maxon, America, Eadlyn y sus seleccionados.<br><br>Si bien entiendo las razones por las que muchas personas odian un poco <i>La Heredera</i> y <i>La Corona</i>, para mU+00ED fueron libros preciosos (no tanto como los tres primeros, pero, oye, llegar a ese nivel es difU+00EDcil, jajaja). En <i>La Corona</i> vemos a una Eadlyn muchU+00EDsimo mU+00E1s madura y consciente de lo que se estU+00E1 jugando con la SelecciU+00F3n; una Eadlyn que entiende mU+00E1s a fondo que debe velar por los intereses de su familia y de su pueblo, sin olvidarse de ella misma. <br><br>Casi puedo decir que me leU+00ED <i>La Corona</i> de un tirU+00F3n, pues necesitaba saber cU+00F3mo iba a sortear Eadlyn a la opiniU+00F3n pU+00FAblica, las trampas de Marid IllU+00E9a y los entresijos de su propio corazU+00F3n. Cada pU+00E1gina que pasaba, sentU+00EDa yo misma las dudas que Eadly tenU+00EDa, sus miedos y la angustia por su madre y su futuro. VeU+00EDa cU+00F3mo ese sentimiento oculto que habU+00EDa intentado reprimir iba saliendo cada vez mU+00E1s y mU+00E1s a la superficie. U+00A1Ahhhhh! Y es que aunque yo no estuviera muy de acuerdo con ese sentimiento, la intensidad con que se narraban todos los momentos me fue absorbiendo hasta que terminU+00E9 <i>fangirleando</i> con cada palabra que cruzaban (#IsaHablandoEnClaveParaNoDarSpoilers). <br><br>Lo U+00FAnico que me resta decir antes de entrar a la secciU+00F3n de <i>spoilers</i> es que estoy muy satisfecha con el final que se le ha dado a la historia de Eadlyn y su SelecciU+00F3n. Es un final poco predecible, muy emotivo y que te dejarU+00E1 satisfecho, pero, paradU+00F3jicamente, con ganas de mU+00E1s (querida Kiera, otro libro de relatos cortos, por favor, love you). Y no digo que te deje con ganas de mU+00E1s porque quede incompleto, sino que sencillamente vas a querer saber cU+00F3mo sigue la vida de Maxon, America, Eadlyn y su futuro esposo.<br><br>Ahora... Los <i>SPOILERS</i><br><br>U+00A1EstU+00E1s avisado!<br><br>No leas mU+00E1s si no quieres saber detalles puntuales. <br><br>Te lo estoy advirtiendo. <br><br>Sigue leyendo bajo tu propio riesgo. <br><br>U+00BFEres masoquista o ya leU+00EDste el libro?<br><br>Venga, va, U+00FAltimo aviso. <br><br><i>Spoilers</i> en 3...<br><br>2...<br><br>1...<br><br>U+00A1Empezamos!<br><br>U+00B0 Tuve un serio dilema con este par de libros. Desde un primer momento, me encantaba Kile como opciU+00F3n para Eadlyn. De hecho, los <i>shippeaba</i> muchU+00EDsimo. TenU+00EDan una quU+00EDmica increU+00EDble, se conocU+00EDan y lo pasaban fenomenal. Sin embargo, creo que mi corazU+00F3n sabU+00EDa, en el fondo, que Eadlyn no podU+00EDa escogerlo a U+00E9l... a pesar de que ese fue su plan en un momento. Cuando llegU+00F3 la hora de pedirle que se casara con ella, sabU+00EDa que Eadlyn no serU+00EDa capaz de mantener a Kile atado al palacio sabiendo que lo que mU+00E1s deseaba U+00E9l era salir a conocer el mundo y construir cosas. ESA escena me destruyU+00F3 por dentro porque fue terriblemente desgarradora, pero a la vez mostrU+00F3 la faceta mU+00E1s desinteresada de Eadlyn y, bueno, morU+00ED con eso. <br><br>U+00B0 Hablemos del asunto de Hale e Ean. U+00A1Ay, dioses! Yo me esperaba que Hale fuera gay, a decir verdad, pero lo de Ean se me escapaba, asU+00ED que fue una gran sorpresa leer el momento en el que todo sale a la luz. La verdad es que fue precioso y adorU+00E9 la reacciU+00F3n de Eadlyn que, aunque en un principio fue en plan <i>"U+00BFquU+00E9 va a pensar la gente de mU+00ED cuando se enteren de que dos Seleccionados se enamoraron entre ellos y no de mU+00ED?"</i>, luego se tornU+00F3 en algo muy tierno. El asegurarse de que los dos tuvieran un futuro lejos del miedo, la recriminaciU+00F3n y el quU+00E9 dirU+00E1n... eso derritiU+00F3 mi corazU+00F3n. <br><br>U+00B0 Momentazo U+00E9pico aquel en el que Eadlyn le pide a Hale que diseU+00F1e su vestido de boda. HELL YEAH!<br><br>U+00B0 A pesar de todo el drama, nunca creU+00ED que America fuera a morir. A decir verdad, como que no estaba muy apegada emocionalmente a America y Maxon en su versiU+00F3n de <i>La Heredera</i> y <i>La Corona</i>. SU+00E9 que son los mismos, sU+00F3lo que con 20 aU+00F1os mU+00E1s, pero no lo sentU+00EDa asU+00ED. <br><br>U+00B0 Peeeeeeeeeeero, hablando de Maxon, lo que sU+00ED me pareciU+00F3 buenU+00EDsimo fue cuando Eadlyn, minutos antes del <i>Report</i> en vivo en el que anunciarU+00E1 al ganador de la SelecciU+00F3n, va a donde su padre a pedirle consejo y U+00E9l le dice <i>"sU+00E1ltate esa estU+00FApida norma, Eadlyn. CU+00E1sate con el chico del que estU+00E9s enamorada. Si crees que serU+00E1 un marido perfecto, te apoyarU+00E9 hasta el final. Y si la gente no lo aprueba, pues serU+00E1 problema suyo"</i>.<br><br>U+00B0 Me mataba de ternura ver a Henri intentando aprender inglU+00E9s para poder comunicarse mejor con Eadlyn, aunque creo que en el fondo U+00E9l sabU+00EDa desde hacU+00EDa mucho tiempo de los sentimientos de Erik y Eadlyn. <br><br>U+00B0 PODEMOS HABLAR POR FAVOR DEL PRIMER BESO DE EADLYN CON EIKKO. AY, MADRE. <br><br><i>"U+00BFSientes algo por mU+00ED? Si has sentido aunque sea una milU+00E9sima parte de lo que yo siento por ti necesito saberlo porque me estoy volviendo loca"</i>.<br><br>Y LUEGO SE BESAN... Y LUEGO SE DAN CUENTA DE QUE NUNCA VAN A PODER ESTAR JUNTOS. <br><br><i>"Esta serU+00E1 la primera vez en mi vida que no consigo lo que de verdad quiero. Y eres tU+00FA. La vida es cruel"</i>.<br><br>Y MI CORAZU+00D3N SE ROMPIU+00D3. Y quiero que sepan que yo no querU+00EDa que ellos dos terminaran juntos, yo era muy #TeamKile... pero la intensidad de las situaciones y la lU+00F3gica de no-puedo-ser-egoU+00EDsta-con-Kile terminU+00F3 haciendo que yo amara irreversiblemente a Eikko y Eadlyn como pareja. Creo que el que fuera algo prohibido y aparentemente inalcanzable me llevU+00F3 a adorarlos incluso mU+00E1s. <br><br>U+00B0 QuizU+00E1 uno de los momentos que me hizo llorar de <i>asdfghjkl</i> fue cuando Eadlyn le pide a Henri que se case con ella. La felicidad de ese hombre me partiU+00F3 el corazU+00F3n por las circunstancias. Sin embargo, justo antes del <i>Report</i> en vivo, Henri lleva a Eadlyn de la mano hasta donde estU+00E1 Eikko y les da su bendiciU+00F3n y es como OH. MY. GOD. YOU'RE. THE. FREAKING. BEST. HENRI. <br><br><i>"-Soy lento con este-, dijo Henri, seU+00F1alU+00E1ndose la boca-. Pero no con este- aU+00F1adiU+00F3, y se seU+00F1alU+00F3 los ojos. <br>-Ustedes son enamorados-prosiguiU+00F3. <br>Eikko negU+00F3 con la cabeza. Henri soltU+00F3 un suspiro y, con cierta desesperaciU+00F3n, lo obligU+00F3 a mostrar la mano derecha, donde destacaba el anillo de sello que yo le habU+00EDa regalado. Y despuU+00E9s me cogiU+00F3 la mano y seU+00F1alU+00F3 el anillo de Eikko"</i>.<br><br>U+00B0 En resumen, el libro me produjo DEMASIADOS FEELS de los buenos y que me hacen querer releer un libro en el mismo instante en que lo termino. <br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1467505690i/19600178._SY540_.jpg" width="384" height="576" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></span>  <a data-text-id="15229217193051779720" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1686158913">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1686158913" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1686158913&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1686158913'><a id="like_count_review_1686158913" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1686158913?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">76 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1686158913" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1686158913" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=76&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1686158913&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1686158913" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1686158913, true, &#39;&#39;); </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1434747586" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1434747586" />    <a title="Dana Kenedy (Dana and the Books)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/372001-dana-kenedy-dana-and-the-books"><img alt="Dana Kenedy (Dana and the Books)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1464902542p2/372001.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1434747586?book_show_action=false">Sep 07, 2016</a>      <a title="Dana Kenedy (Dana and the Books)" class="user" name="Dana Kenedy (Dana and the Books)" href="/user/show/372001-dana-kenedy-dana-and-the-books">Dana Kenedy (Dana and the Books)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/372001-dana-kenedy-dana-and-the-books?shelf=romance">romance</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/372001-dana-kenedy-dana-and-the-books?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/372001-dana-kenedy-dana-and-the-books?shelf=arc">arc</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/372001-dana-kenedy-dana-and-the-books?shelf=netgalley">netgalley</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/372001-dana-kenedy-dana-and-the-books?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/372001-dana-kenedy-dana-and-the-books?shelf=2016-release">2016-release</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1434747586" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7688036756868077835">This review can also be found <a href="http://danaandthebooks.com/2016/07/12/review-the-crown/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">on my blog, Dana and the Books</a>.<br /><br />The Selection series is my guilty pleasure.<br /><br />If you've never read the series, it's essentiallyThe Bachelor/The Bachelorette set in a dystopian future and with royalty. I also suggest you stop reading this review if you haven't read the seriesas there are spoilers for the first fourbooks here.<br /><br /><em>The Heir</em>(Book #4) takes place twentyyears after the first three books and we find ourselves thrust into another selection. Except this time the girl</span>  <span id="freeText7688036756868077835" style="display:none">This review can also be found <a href="http://danaandthebooks.com/2016/07/12/review-the-crown/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">on my blog, Dana and the Books</a>.<br /><br />The Selection series is my guilty pleasure.<br /><br />If you've never read the series, it's essentially The Bachelor/The Bachelorette set in a dystopian future and with royalty.  I also suggest you stop reading this review if you haven't read the series as there are spoilers for the first four books here.<br /><br /><em>The Heir </em>(Book #4) takes place twenty years after the first three books and we find ourselves thrust into another selection.  Except this time the girl chooses from a group of boys.  The girl, Eadlyn, is of course the daughter of America and MaxonU+2014the subjects of the first three books.<br /><br /><em>The Crown </em>(Book #5) picks up where <em>The Heir</em> ends: right after we find out America has had a shocking heart attack and then follows Eadlyn to the end of The Selection.<br /><br />Yes, the whole premise of this series is totally corny and there isn't anything spectacular about the actual writing itself, but it's so adorable and addictive. It's kind of like watching bad reality TV, you know it's bad, but you keep looking for more because you enjoy it on some strange level.<br /><br />Overall, I did find it a great conclusion to the series. It was definitely predictable, but I think if Kiera Cass ended it any other way it wouldn't have worked, and I would have walked away feeling like all the time I put into reading this series was a waste.<br /><br />All of the books in the series are quick reads, but I found I got through <em>The Crown</em> much faster than the others.  It was <em>very</em> short: 278 pages. To put that into perspective, the four other books are all more than 300 pages.  Since this was the last book <em>and</em> it was so short, it felt rushed.<br /><br />I like who she ends up with but I wish we had more build up and a longer look at the relationships between all of the guys who were left in <em>The Crown</em>.  Again, I feel this final book was far too short for a series closer. I wanted more side plots, more tension, more of a conclusion.<br /><br />Yes, these five books have been drawn out when it really could have been just three, but I don't care. I want more.<br /><br />I want to experience another Selection.<br /><br />Thanks so much to HarperCollins UK Children's for approving me for a copy on Netgalley!<br /><br />Pick up your own copy (<a href="http://amzn.to/2a59gxl" rel="nofollow">Amazon US</a> / <a href="http://www.amazon.ca/gp/product/0062458868/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8&camp=15121&creative=390961&creativeASIN=0062458868&linkCode=as2&tag=danandthebo07-20" rel="nofollow">Amazon CA</a> / <a href="http://www.anrdoezrs.net/links/7919222/type/dlg/https://www.chapters.indigo.ca/en-ca/books/the-crown/9780062458865-item.html?ikwid=the+crown&ikwsec=Home&ikwidx=0" rel="nofollow">Indigo</a> /<a href="http://www.bookdepository.com/The-Crown-Kier-Cass/9780007580248/?a_aid=DanaAndTheBooks" rel="nofollow"> Book Depository</a>)!</span>  <a data-text-id="7688036756868077835" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1434747586">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1434747586" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1434747586&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1434747586'><a id="like_count_review_1434747586" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1434747586?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">120 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1434747586" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1434747586" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=120&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1434747586&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1434747586" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1434747586, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">8 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1434747586?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=1">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1434747586' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1434747586/comments?reverse=true">View all 8 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div><div id="comment_154123185" class="brown_comment">  <div class="xhr_comment_photo">    t<a alt="Olivia" href="/user/show/1320825-olivia"><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1415287964p1/1320825.jpg" alt="1320825" /></a>  </div>  <div class="xhr_comment_body">    <a style="font-weight:bold" href="/user/show/1320825-olivia">Olivia</a>      <span id="freeTextContainer1416463784929547575">It was too short. class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1257490285" />    <a title="NiCoLeTa E." class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/37314676-nicoleta-e"><img alt="NiCoLeTa E." src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1463222962p2/37314676.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1257490285?book_show_action=false">May 08, 2016</a>      <a title="NiCoLeTa E." class="user" name="NiCoLeTa E." href="/user/show/37314676-nicoleta-e">NiCoLeTa E.</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/26150713-the-crown">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/37314676-nicoleta-e?shelf=romance-young-adult-etc">romance-young-adult-etc</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/37314676-nicoleta-e?shelf=fairytales">fairytales</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1257490285" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16079781487769995959"><b> <i>***4 "<u>Happily Ever After</u>" stars***</i> </b><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1462625235ra/19022516.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b> <i>U+201CTrust your gut. Trust your heart.U+201D<br>U+201CIU+2019m terrified of my heart.U+201D I didnU+2019t mean to say those words out loud, but there was something about him that made this room, and this moment, the only place I could ever admit to the truth.<br>He leaned down by my ear and whispered, U+201CThereU+2019s nothing there to fear.U+201D </i> </b><br><br>I'm a sucker for fairy tales...<br>And i was almost obsessed with the first three parts of the series...<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1462625235ra/19022517.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>America and Maxon were amazing and i will never forget their st</span>  <span id="freeText16079781487769995959" style="display:none"><b>  <i>***4 "<u>Happily Ever After</u>" stars***</i></b><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1462625235ra/19022516.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>  <i>U+201CTrust your gut. Trust your heart.U+201D<br>U+201CIU+2019m terrified of my heart.U+201D I didnU+2019t mean to say those words out loud, but there was something about him that made this room, and this moment, the only place I could ever admit to the truth.<br>He leaned down by my ear and whispered, U+201CThereU+2019s nothing there to fear.U+201D </i></b><br><br>I'm a sucker for fairy tales...<br>And i was almost obsessed with the first three parts of the series...<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1462625235ra/19022517.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>America and Maxon were amazing and i will never forget their story...<br><i>And then came Eadlyn and everything changed...</i><br><br><b>  <i>"Seriously, even if I did find someone, could it ever compare to them?"</i></b><br><br>The fourth book wasn't my favorite... Eadlyn was America and Maxon's only daughter and she had nothing from the brightness of her parents...<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1387604492ra/7628266.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>She was spoiled, she had a great opinion of herself and she was sooooo annoying...<br><i>But damn, i needed to find out with whom she will end up...</i><br><br><b>  <i>"I was surrounded by examples of how love, real love, could make you less bothered by your circumstances, whether it was facing the greatest disappointment of your life or shouldering the weight of a country. And suddenly, for the life of me, I couldnU+2019t remember why IU+2019d been so afraid of it.<br>I mentally thumbed through my list of suitors. KileU+2019s sweetness, FoxU+2019s enthusiasm, HenriU+2019s joy U+2026 these were all things that drew me in. But, beyond that, was there something beautiful and lasting?<br>I still didnU+2019t know. But finding out no longer looked so frightening."</i></b><br><br>In my heart, i wanted her to end up with one of two candidates....<br>And to be honest while i started this book, i diminished them to one....<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1443469132ra/16363612.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>And yep, i'm so happy because my wish came true after all!!!<br><i>Nope, sorry guys, i can't tell you who he was!!!</i><br><br><b>  <i>"No, this whole process made no sense, but I could see how it happened, how your heart could get swept up in the endeavor. And that was my hope now: that somehow duty and love would overlap, and IU+2019d find myself happy in the middle of it all."</i></b><br><br>The blissful thing in this story is that Eadlyn had changed... a lot!!!<br>She wasn't annoying anymore and you could say that she was more approachable... and i liked this change... <br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1462625235ra/19022518.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>The snob and selfish girl had vanished and in her place were a lovely, full of grace girl...<br><i>Thank God!!!</i><br><br><b>  <i>"I had power and no idea how to use it. I was a ruler who didnU+2019t know how to lead. I was a twin who was on her own. I was a daughter with missing parents. I had a half dozen suitors and wasnU+2019t sure how to be in love."</i></b><br><br>U+0391fter the flight of her twin and her mother's unexpected illness, Eadlyn had to grow up...<br>She stepped into her father's shoes temporary and she had lots to deal... and mostly her people's disbelief in her face...<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1462625235ra/19022519.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>And except all the above, she had to continue with the Selection and the six remaining men, the Elite...<br><i>But what will happen when the cold hearted girl will start to fall in love with someone that she can't have????</i><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1462625235ra/19022520.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b>  <i>U+201CThis will be the first time in my life I havenU+2019t been able to have something I truly wanted. ItU+2019s so cruel that it happens to be you.U+201D</i></b><br><br><i>No, i can't tell you more!!!</i><br>The only thing that i will say is that as a very sensitive person, my heart was breaking with the torment of Eadlyn's heart near to the end... <br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1462625236ra/19022521.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>Seriously, i couldn't stop the tears and i am so embarrassed for that!!!<br>But i have to say that i enjoyed this book, especially the last half...<br><br><b>  <i>"I had felt it growing, this feeling that had been hiding beneath the surface for some time now. IU+2019d seen him, this person who never intended to be seen, and my faulty, silly, useless heart kept whispering his name. I clutched my chest, feeling my heart racing. U+201CYou treacherous, treacherous thing. What have you done?U+201D<br>IU+2019d wondered how it was possible to magically find a soul mate in a random group of boys.<br>But now I couldnU+2019t question it."</i></b><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1462556024ra/19013912.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br></span>  <a data-text-id="16079781487769995959" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1257490285"> class="section">      <div id="review_1273756206" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1273756206" />    <a title="Andie (_HalfBl00dPrincess)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/30510075-andie-halfbl00dprincess"><img alt="Andie (_HalfBl00dPrincess)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477111902p2/30510075.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1273756206?book_show_action=false">May 11, 2016</a>      <a title="Andie (_HalfBl00dPrincess)" class="user" name="Andie (_HalfBl00dPrincess)" href="/user/show/30510075-andie-halfbl00dprincess">Andie (_HalfBl00dPrincess)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30510075-andie-halfbl00dprincess?shelf=dystopian">dystopian</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30510075-andie-halfbl00dprincess?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1273756206" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16407985282640220467"><b> Spoilers have been tagged but if you've read my review of THE HEIR, the outcome of THE CROWN will be spoiled nonetheless. </b> <br /><br />2.5 stars<br /><br />Disappointed is an understatement. Where's the romance?! <br /><br />As a huge fan of The Selection trilogy, I was ecstatic when Kiera gave us 'The Heir' as a spinoff story. I was really disappointed with Eadlyn's characterization but she showed room for growth and I prayed she would get it together in 'The Crown'. While she did surprise me and do an almost complete 180, it ju</span>  <span id="freeText16407985282640220467" style="display:none"><b> Spoilers have been tagged but if you've read my review of THE HEIR, the outcome of THE CROWN will be spoiled nonetheless. </b> <br /><br />2.5 stars<br /><br />Disappointed is an understatement. Where's the romance?! <br /><br />As a huge fan of The Selection trilogy, I was ecstatic when Kiera gave us 'The Heir' as a spinoff story. I was really disappointed with Eadlyn's characterization but she showed room for growth and I prayed she would get it together in 'The Crown'. While she did surprise me and do an almost complete 180, it just wasn't enough for me. And here's why - my SHIP completely sunk! <br /><br />I, like many others, was rooting for <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Kile  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> from the very beginning. Eadlyn's choice makes ZERO sense to me. It was never clear if she felt something for this guy or not and then after one specific conversation she decides SOULMATES! He doesn't really become a competitor until about the last 1/4 of the book. It was completely out of the blue and I didn't much care for it. <br /><br />The obvious choice was <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Kile  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> in my opinion. They had more chemistry than any of the other boys. In fact, I felt a complete disconnect from all but two of the boys (her choice is not included in the two). <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ There's something about childhood friends turning lovers that's just so appealing  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> maybe it's predictable but it's the fairytale story that I was hoping to see unfold - watching them go from not caring much for the other to falling in love. Because isn't that what The Selection was originally about? I feel cheated! <br /><br />Besides the lack of romance, the entirety of the book felt rushed, even more so at the end. Can the epilogue even be called an epilogue? Ugh I'm just so disappointed that after a year of waiting for the series conclusion this book ended up feeling like an after thought. <br /><br />What I DID like:<br /><br />-Eadlyn goes from being a snotty brat in The Heir to a strong, caring, down to earth girl. <br />-Maxon and America. Thank god they were here to remind us what true love is. <br /><br />I can't think of anything else I really enjoyed. Such a shame because I love Kiera Cass as an author. </span>  <a data-text-id="16407985282640220467" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1273756206">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1273756206" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1273756206&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1273756206'><a id="like_count_review_1273756206" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1273756206?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">78 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1273756206" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1273756206" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=78&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1273756206&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1273756206" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1273756206, true, &#39;&#39;); itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1088291019?book_show_action=false">May 03, 2016</a>      <a title="Sarah" class="user" name="Sarah" href="/user/show/7591340-sarah">Sarah</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/27829330-the-crown">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7591340-sarah?shelf=r2r-read">r2r-read</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7591340-sarah?shelf=series-read-along-challenge">series-read-along-challenge</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7591340-sarah?shelf=netgalley-edelweiss">netgalley-edelweiss</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7591340-sarah?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7591340-sarah?shelf=romance">romance</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7591340-sarah?shelf=dystopian">dystopian</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7591340-sarah?shelf=love-triangle">love-triangle</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7591340-sarah?shelf=read-with-abbie">read-with-abbie</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7591340-sarah?shelf=2016-resolutions">2016-resolutions</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7591340-sarah?shelf=read-2016">read-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1088291019" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16295979294558462042">(Source: I received a digital copy of this book for free on a read-to-review basis. Thanks to HarperCollins UK Children's, and NetGalley.)<br><br><blockquote> <b> <i>U+201CThere were things I was always sure of, and almost all of that has fallen apart in the last few weeks.U+201D</i> </b> </blockquote><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1460913639i/18804219.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>This was a good end to the series, and Eadlyn really played her role well.<br><br>Eadlyn continued to be a strong character in this book; she really stepped up, she put others first, and she really cared about what was good for everyone else rather than just for</span>  <span id="freeText16295979294558462042" style="display:none">(Source: I received a digital copy of this book for free on a read-to-review basis. Thanks to HarperCollins UK Children's, and NetGalley.)<br><br><blockquote>  <b>    <i>U+201CThere were things I was always sure of, and almost all of that has fallen apart in the last few weeks.U+201D</i>  </b></blockquote><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1460913639i/18804219.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>This was a good end to the series, and Eadlyn really played her role well.<br><br>Eadlyn continued to be a strong character in this book; she really stepped up, she put others first, and she really cared about what was good for everyone else rather than just for her, which was quite an improvement.<br><br><blockquote>  <b>    <i>U+201CI know itU+2019s abrupt, but given my motherU+2019s precarious condition, my father has asked me to take on more responsibilities.U+201D</i>  </b></blockquote><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1460913639i/18804220._SX540_.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>The storyline in this was about Eadlyn stepping up following her motherU+2019s illness, and taking on a role that she was young for, but capable of it seemed. We also had the culmination of the Selection, but there wasnU+2019t quite as much of the storyline devoted to this as I expected, and the book felt more about Eadlyn stepping up than about the romance.<br><br><blockquote>  <b>    <i>U+201CI feel the only way to manage that is to scale down this competition.U+201D</i>  </b></blockquote><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1460913639i/18804221._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>With regards to the romance, it really did seem to be missing from the majority of this book, and then Eadlyn made some very strange decisions, and I really didnU+2019t get what she was doing! The person who I expected her to be with by the end just didnU+2019t happen, and I wasnU+2019t 100% sure about the person she eventually chose.<br><br><blockquote>  <b>    <i>U+201CI canU+2019t just kiss you like itU+2019s nothing, because it turns out that youU+2019re not nothing.U+201D</i>  </b></blockquote><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1460913639i/18804222.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>The ending to this wrapped things up nicely, and we did get a happily ever after, it just wasnU+2019t quite what I expected.<br><br><blockquote>  <b>    <i>U+201CThe truth is, love is as much fate as it is planning, as much beauty as it is disaster.U+201D</i>  </b></blockquote><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1460913639i/18804223.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>8 out of 10</span>  <a data-text-id="16295979294558462042" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1088291019">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1088291019" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1088291019&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1088291019'><a id="like_count_review_1088291019" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1088291019?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">119 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1088291019" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1088291019" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=119&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1088291019&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1088291019" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1088291019, true, &#39;&#39;); </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1040530129" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1040530129" />    <a title="Howdy YAL " class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4026143-howdy-yal"><img alt="Howdy YAL " src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1445310493p2/4026143.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1040530129?book_show_action=false">Nov 29, 2014</a>      <a title="Howdy YAL " class="user" name="Howdy YAL " href="/user/show/4026143-howdy-yal">Howdy YAL </a>          marked it as ca-ching            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1040530129" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15545603269123136394">Bad author behavior aside, I probably won't read this because I think Cass's world building sucks and from the summary it seems as this is another romance loosely packaged as a dystopia. I could be wrong though. And honestly, I don't like the way Cass has written romance. Grant it, I only have read The Selection and will only read The Elite if I get it for free or from the library, but the romance in that book was ridiculous with man-cessories and forbidden romance. And that summary...well, cue</span>  <span id="freeText15545603269123136394" style="display:none">Bad author behavior aside, I probably won't read this because I think Cass's world building sucks and from the summary it seems as this is another romance loosely packaged as a dystopia. I could be wrong though. And honestly, I don't like the way Cass has written romance. Grant it, I only have read The Selection and will only read The Elite if I get it for free or from the library, but the romance in that book was ridiculous with man-cessories and forbidden romance. And that summary...well, cue the ominous music.<br /><br />Merged review:<br /><br />Which of the following is likely<br /><br />A) America decides that Maxon isn't good in bed and wants Aspen.<br /><br />B) Maxon ends up being the illegitimate heir to the throne and he and America end up being a negative in this makes no sense cast system that they're slowly eliminating. <br /><br />C) An actual plot<br /><br />D) Cass pulls a Princess Diaries 2 and just has the book full of pretty dresses, hijinks full of palace life, and mattress surfing.<br /><br /><br />Yeah, probably D.<br /><br />I can't deal, guys. I don't even know how she managed to sell this one. There's just NO plot there.<br /><br />Edit: Before you say anything, I'm well aware that the series is a continuation of America's daughter. Which should be a spinoff NOT a continuation of series, fyi. When I originally wrote this review there was no synopsis. Therefore, I have no intention of changing it.</span>  <a data-text-id="15545603269123136394" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1040530129">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1040530129" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1040530129&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1040530129'><a id="like_count_review_1040530129" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1040530129?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">52 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1040530129" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1040530129" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=52&rating[page]=1&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1040530129&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1040530129" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1040530129, true, &#39;&#39;); class="section firstReview">      <div id="review_1417017689" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1417017689" />    <a title="Kai" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/41788524-kai"><img alt="Kai" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1433887331p2/41788524.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1417017689?book_show_action=false">Nov 08, 2016</a>      <a title="Kai" class="user" name="Kai" href="/user/show/41788524-kai">Kai</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/41788524-kai?shelf=owned">owned</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/41788524-kai?shelf=finished-series">finished-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/41788524-kai?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1417017689" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16390985698176050474"><i>U+201CMaybe it's not the first kisses that are supposed to be special. Maybe it's the last ones.U+201D</i><br /><br />I have finally finished <i>The Selection</i> series. It was about time.<br />A few years ago when I read the first book I loved the story. Then came the second book and it went downhill. After <i>The One</i> I passionately hated America. And then I found out that this still wasn't enough and I had to read about her daughter! Who would only be more spoiled and vain and self-centered. If that was even possible.<br />So why did I kee</span>  <span id="freeText16390985698176050474" style="display:none"><i>U+201CMaybe it's not the first kisses that are supposed to be special. Maybe it's the last ones.U+201D</i><br /><br />I have finally finished <i>The Selection</i> series. It was about time.<br />A few years ago when I read the first book I loved the story. Then came the second book and it went downhill. After <i>The One</i> I passionately hated America. And then I found out that this still wasn't enough and I had to read about her daughter! Who would only be more spoiled and vain and self-centered. If that was even possible.<br />So why did I keep reading? Two reasons.<br />1. I hate leaving a series unfished.<br />2. <i>The Selection</i> is exactly like the Bachelor. It's crap, but highly entertaining crap.<br /><br /><i>The Crown</i> was no exception. This novel could've been named "The wonderful and great character traits of Eadlyn Schreave". The plot is basically Eadlyn doubting herself, followed by someone telling her how strong she is. Then she doubts herself and someone tells her how strong she is. And, take a guess, then she doubts herself and, yes!, someone tells her how strong she is. I'm not kidding.<br />Apart from that this book had a high level of cheesiness. Which was no big deal, since that's what I was used to from the other books in the series.<br /><br />I'm glad I can take those books from my to-read list and never bother myself with them again.</span>  <a data-text-id="16390985698176050474" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons"> itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1028437316" />    <a title="Nikita" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/23919282-nikita"><img alt="Nikita" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478623357p2/23919282.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1028437316?book_show_action=false">May 08, 2016</a>      <a title="Nikita" class="user" name="Nikita" href="/user/show/23919282-nikita">Nikita</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/23919282-nikita?shelf=really-liked">really-liked</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/23919282-nikita?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1028437316" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer364715858749231629">Updated May 8, 2016:<br>The Crown is exciting, dramatic, and amazing. Twenty years have passed ever since EadlynU+2019s parents fell in love and now itU+2019s her turn to host a Selection of her own. Eadlyn never thought she would find true love among the thirty-five suitors of the Selection, but the heart has a way of surprising everyone, even her. Events at the palace has forced Eadlyn to step into the spotlight and the further she goes, the more being alone no longer appeals to her. Now she must make the m</span>  <span id="freeText364715858749231629" style="display:none">Updated May 8, 2016:<br>The Crown is exciting, dramatic, and amazing. Twenty years have passed ever since EadlynU+2019s parents fell in love and now itU+2019s her turn to host a Selection of her own. Eadlyn never thought she would find true love among the thirty-five suitors of the Selection, but the heart has a way of surprising everyone, even her. Events at the palace has forced Eadlyn to step into the spotlight and the further she goes, the more being alone no longer appeals to her. Now she must make the most difficult and important choice she will ever make or expected in her life. The Crown is full of drama, surprises, twists and a perfect ending to an enchanting series.<br><br>After AmericaU+2019s heart attack, Maxon has appointed Eadlyn to be regent and has narrowed down her suitors to her elite leaving her more stressed than normal. As she continues to send time with the boys, Eadlyn continues to struggle of who she would choose to be her prince. She is surprised by how each of the elite such as Kile, Henri and Hale are close to her heart. Eadlyn continues to find ways to increase her popularity with the people of Illea and ease the growing riots with the help of Marid, the son of August Illea. Now the selection becomes even more important as she finds that being alone no longer appeals to her but also finds herself that her heart may belong to someone that she never thought it would. <br><br>EadlynU+2019s life turns upside down again when <*spoiler> Maxon passes the crown on to her <*/spoiler> and she takes on more roles than she thought possible. Not long after, Marid reveals his true motives that not only threaten EadlynU+2019s image to the people and the selection but the throne as well. In order to stop MaridU+2019s plans, Eadlyn is forced to narrow down her suitors sooner than expected and must choose a husband. However, every decision she makes becomes harder and harder as EadlynU+2019s selection comes to an end when her heart have other desires. As her selection comes to its end, Eadlyn surprises herself and everyone when she makes her the most important decision of her life.<br><br>Eadlyn has changed a bit since before. SheU+2019s still completely aware of her role but also aware of what others think of her and tries to adjust while maintaining who she is. Kile is still cool. I really like Henri. HeU+2019s so sweet but the language barrier would be too much for me to handle. I love Erik. A big surprise was Josie who finally gets a dose of reality and understands EadlynU+2019s life and the life of a royal. She is likable towards the end. Marid Illea, while at first I thought he was likable until his true colors were revealed and I quickly grew to hate him. Maxon, America, Marlee, Aspen and a few others were great. Lady Brice, I really, really like her. <br><br>Overall, The Crown was amazing. I really liked it. ItU+2019s a great ending to the series. Not one I expected but a good one none the less. I love how EadlynU+2019s character changes to a very likable person. Her choice for her prince was a surprise but in a way I accept it. We learn a few secrets in The Crown such as who put KileU+2019s name in the selection and some secrets that we didnU+2019t know from the first selection series. The Selection series has been an amazing and enchanting journey to read.<br><br>Updated November 5, 2015:<br>It has a cover!!! So beautiful.<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/books/1446757620l/22924389.jpg" width="200" height="300" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Updated October 8, 2015:<br>It has a title! The Crown. Coming May 3, 2016<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1412602033ra/11394923.gif" width="300" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Updated May 13, 2015:<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1391627667ra/8422259.gif" width="300" height="200" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></span>  <a data-text-id="364715858749231629" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1637213585" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1637213585" />    <a title="Carrie" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/36817401-carrie"><img alt="Carrie" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1415677371p2/36817401.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1637213585?book_show_action=false">May 14, 2016</a>      <a title="Carrie" class="user" name="Carrie" href="/user/show/36817401-carrie">Carrie</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/26150713-the-crown">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1637213585" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3962466850283415583">The Crown is the fifth and final book in the Selection series by Kiera Cass. In the first three books we were introduced to America Singer and followed her journey through the selection process where 35 women were chosen to meet Prince Maxon and compete to become his bride. <br /><br />In the fourth book of the series time jumps ahead to where America and Maxon had become king and queen and now have children of their own. Eadlyn is their oldest daughter and now in line to take the crown herself and with unr</span>  <span id="freeText3962466850283415583" style="display:none">The Crown is the fifth and final book in the Selection series by Kiera Cass. In the first three books we were introduced to America Singer and followed her journey through the selection process where 35 women were chosen to meet Prince Maxon and compete to become his bride. <br /><br />In the fourth book of the series time jumps ahead to where America and Maxon had become king and queen and now have children of their own. Eadlyn is their oldest daughter and now in line to take the crown herself and with unrest in the country it's decided for Eadlyn to have her own selection in order to find herself a husband to become prince. Now in The Crown Eadlyn has narrowed her choices down to the final six and must figure out where her heart lies along with learning to lead a nation. <br /><br />I started off this series on shaky footing only just finding it interesting despite the lack of world building and seeming that the series takes heavily from a couple of other popular things. First it reminded me heavily of The Bachelor television show and then the world in which it was taking place seemed an awfully lot like the Hunger Games world. <br /><br />But after reading the first book I found myself curious as to how and where the story would head and by the end of the first three I really found myself enjoying the story. When picking up the Heir I was by then a bit worried after reading a lot of negative reviews but I found that the new MC Eadlyn seemed to be written just the way I imagined she should be from the way she had been raised and I really enjoyed getting to know her and finding what had happened in the twenty years from the end of the first three books. <br /><br />Now that we are finishing up this series I had hopes of how it would turn out and who Eadlyn would end up with and to my surprise the series ended much the way I hoped but also worked out quite wonderfully some of the ongoing issues throughout. I found this a wonderful finish to what started off as a so-so series for me but quickly peaked my interest. <br /><br />Overall, this whole series has it's flaws throughout but turned into a fun read that I really enjoyed and glad that I gave a chance. <br /><br />For more reviews please visit <a target="_blank" href="https://carriesbookreviews.wordpress.com/" rel="nofollow">https://carriesbookreviews.wordpress....</a></span>  <a data-text-id="3962466850283415583" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> embrulhando o estU+00F4mago.<br /><br />Eu nU+00E3o espero nada dos livros Kiera Cass, mas eu sempre vejo tantas pessoas que eu gosto e acho inteligentes se divertindo com os livros que eu sempre acabo dando uma segunda chance pra autora. <br /><br />Mas lendo The Crown eu cheguei a uma conclusU+00E3o: eu jamais entenderei o apelo desses livros, tudo (TUDO) nessa histU+00F3ria U+00E9 extremamente ofensivo pra mim a um ponto que eu nU+00E3o consigo nem achar graU+00E7a. U+00C9 uma constant</span>  <span id="freeText5848680301588282068" style="display:none">Sendo bem sincera: eu desisti nos 80% porque todo esse livro estava me embrulhando o estU+00F4mago.<br /><br />Eu nU+00E3o espero nada dos livros Kiera Cass, mas eu sempre vejo tantas pessoas que eu gosto e acho inteligentes se divertindo com os livros que eu sempre acabo dando uma segunda chance pra autora. <br /><br />Mas lendo The Crown eu cheguei a uma conclusU+00E3o: eu jamais entenderei o apelo desses livros, tudo (TUDO) nessa histU+00F3ria U+00E9 extremamente ofensivo pra mim a um ponto que eu nU+00E3o consigo nem achar graU+00E7a. U+00C9 uma constante romantizaU+00E7 U+00E3o da sociedade machista e patriarcal sem fazer absolutamente NENHUMA CRU+00CDTICA que eu nU+00E3o consigo suportar, desculpa.<br /><br />JU+00E1 nU+00E3o bastasse o texto recheado de diU+00E1logos ridU+00EDculos a histU+00F3ria tambU+00E9m nU+00E3o ajuda em nada.<br /><br />Maxon, sempre inU+00FAtil, abdica o reinado porque quer ter mais tempo pra esposa.<br /><br />Gente? Que que isso?<br /><br />"Oi galera, sou o rei de vocU+00EAs, vivo uma meritocracia, tenho tudo do bom e do melhor, mas sabe como U+00E9 nU+00E9? Cansei! Vou curtir minha esposa e no meu lugar vou colocar minha filha sem nenhuma experiU+00EAncia pra governar esse paU+00EDs".<br /><br />QUE QUE ISSO?<br /><br />Como as pessoas nU+00E3o se revoltam?<br /><br />A famU+00EDlia real inteira U+00E9 ridU+00EDcula e eu sei que o Madrid (que merda de nome U+00E9 esse?) U+00E9 pra ser o malvadU+00E3o da histU+00F3ria, mas sinceramente ele e a U+00FAnica pessoa que parece ter um pingo de juU+00EDzo.<br /><br />E ainda tem aquela cena que encorajam a Eadlyn a colocar o povo "no lugar deles", que ela U+00E9 a autoridade da parada.<br /><br />?????????<br /><br />O QUU+00C3O IRRESPONSU+00C1VEL SOCIALMENTE U+00C9 KIERA CASS PRA ESCREVER UMA MERDA DESSAS?<br /><br />Eu nU+00E3o vou nem falar dos interesses amorosos da Eadlyn porque nU+00E3o faz sentido. O menino que ela se apaixona U+00E9 tU+00E3o aleatU+00F3rio e irrelevante pra histU+00F3ria que pra vocU+00EAs terem uma noU+00E7 U+00E3o eu nem sei o nome dele.<br /><br />E eu nU+00E3o vou nem falar do bosta do irmU+00E3o gU+00EAmeo da Eadlyn porque:<br /><br />1. Eu nU+00E3o lembro o nome dele.<br /><br />2. Eu nU+00E3o sei porque todo mundo estava se desculpando pra ele sendo que foi esse infeliz que fugiu de casa pra se casar com uma princesa aleatU+00F3ria o que causou a mU+00E3e do menino a ter LITERALMENTE um ataque do coraU+00E7 U+00E3o.<br /><br />Em uma nota final: queria que America tivesse morrido, pois: muito chata, ninguU+00E9m aguenta.</span>  <a data-text-id="5848680301588282068" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; Like clothes, I had guessed it was something that fit no two people exactly the same way. I was still unsure what the word looked like for me, but I sensed that, sooner rather than later, it would be fully defined. All that remained to be seen was if I could be satisfied with the definition.</b><br /><br />When I first picked up <i>The Selection</i> a couple years ago, I absolutely loved it. I really liked America as a MC and I liked the premise of the story. And after <i>The One</i>, I was happy with how her</span>  <span id="freeText1868612851790023687" style="display:none">4 Stars! <br /><br /><b>Love. Like clothes, I had guessed it was something that fit no two people exactly the same way. I was still unsure what the word looked like for me, but I sensed that, sooner rather than later, it would be fully defined. All that remained to be seen was if I could be satisfied with the definition.</b><br /><br />When I first picked up <i>The Selection</i> a couple years ago, I absolutely loved it. I really liked America as a MC and I liked the premise of the story. And after <i>The One</i>, I was happy with how her story ended...or so I thought.<br /><br />Then <i>The Heir</i> came to be. I was nervous about Cass continuing this series...especially focused on America and Maxon's child as the MC twenty years later and at first I thought Eadlyn was just a spoiled brat. But she grew on me and by the end of that book, I liked her almost as much as her mom.<br /><br />Now I've come to the end of this series (this time I think it's real) and I really enjoyed it. I'm glad that the story got continued. Eadlyn grew a lot within a short amount of time and I was so happy with her decisions at the end and how she handled herself. I did feel that there wasn't really as much drama or conflict in this one compared to the others, but it was still a quick and entertaining read.<br />And it's worth mentioning that every single book in this series has had such a beautiful cover <3</span>  <a data-text-id="1868612851790023687" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> class="section">      <div id="review_1033313924" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1033313924" />    <a title="Rachel  (APCB Reviews)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/12502667-rachel-apcb-reviews"><img alt="Rachel  (APCB Reviews)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1468898958p2/12502667.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1033313924?book_show_action=false">May 28, 2016</a>      <a title="Rachel  (APCB Reviews)" class="user" name="Rachel  (APCB Reviews)" href="/user/show/12502667-rachel-apcb-reviews">Rachel  (APCB Reviews)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12502667-rachel-apcb-reviews?shelf=can-t-wait-for">can-t-wait-for</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/12502667-rachel-apcb-reviews?shelf=2016-releases">2016-releases</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1033313924" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1777111505932552854">Where is the negative rating stars? Because that is what I firmly believe this book and this series deserves. I feel like this entire series, particularly the additional two books, were just a cheap scam to make more money off of readers. I totally understand that publishers publish books for profit, but I wish Kiera Cass had decided to write an original, new series, not a tired, worn-out, cheap double of the original "Selection" trilogy.<br /><br />And now I shall talk about everything that was wrong in th</span>  <span id="freeText1777111505932552854" style="display:none">Where is the negative rating stars? Because that is what I firmly believe this book and this series deserves. I feel like this entire series, particularly the additional two books, were just a cheap scam to make more money off of readers. I totally understand that publishers publish books for profit, but I wish Kiera Cass had decided to write an original, new series, not a tired, worn-out, cheap double of the original "Selection" trilogy.<br /><br />And now I shall talk about everything that was wrong in this book, and anything good. Spoiler Alert: there is no good. <br /><br />I think my main problems with this book are the consistencies and the lucky quick solutions to all the problems. At this point I am too angry and annoyed to write a detailed review, so here's an outline of my grievances.<br /><br />-180-character change in Special Snowflake Eadlyn<br />-so abrupt<br />-twists you can guess<br />-tries to make romance a surprise but it's not<br />-dumb character names like Eikko and Fox??<br />-Henri's speech is offensive (especially in regards to people whose English isn't good)<br />-need more Maxon and America time!<br />-Marid joins cast of characters just to cause problems<br />-no solution to caste/social unrest<br />-no romance, total insta-love<br />-boring characters<br />-short, pointless story</span>  <a data-text-id="1777111505932552854" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="section">      <div id="review_1211893836" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1211893836" />    <a title="Karmen (readingoncloud9)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/40213000-karmen-readingoncloud9"><img alt="Karmen (readingoncloud9)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1462152436p2/40213000.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1211893836?book_show_action=false">May 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Karmen (readingoncloud9)" class="user" name="Karmen (readingoncloud9)" href="/user/show/40213000-karmen-readingoncloud9">Karmen (readingoncloud9)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40213000-karmen-readingoncloud9?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/40213000-karmen-readingoncloud9?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1211893836" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2830869901662795069">Why was this book so short? I thought it could've been 300+ pages like the other books in the series. Probably because I just want more. I really loved seeing how much Eadlyn had grown since the Heir. She was rushed to choose her hubby, so the story felt a bit rushed like it was in a hurry to be finished. There wasn't much romance in this book, but I was happy when Maxon + America moments were mentioned because they're my otp. All the boys from the selected were so cute. I was team Kile from the</span>  <span id="freeText2830869901662795069" style="display:none">Why was this book so short? I thought it could've been 300+ pages like the other books in the series. Probably because I just want more. I really loved seeing how much Eadlyn had grown since the Heir. She was rushed to choose her hubby, so the story felt a bit rushed like it was in a hurry to be finished. There wasn't much romance in this book, but I was happy when Maxon + America moments were mentioned because they're my otp. All the boys from the selected were so cute. I was team Kile from the start! This book was pretty predictable, but I really liked it. The Selection series was like a tv drama. Haha, they're really easy and fast reads. I'm sad that the Selection series has ended! Can't wait for Kiera's future books!<br /><br />By the way, the Target edition of the Crown has really pretty fan art!</span>  <a data-text-id="2830869901662795069" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1635066904" />    <a title="Katrin" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/44311998-katrin"><img alt="Katrin"
