itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1635066904?book_show_action=false">May 18, 2016</a>      <a title="Katrin" class="user" name="Katrin" href="/user/show/44311998-katrin">Katrin</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780007580248" href="/book/show/30060836-the-crown">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/44311998-katrin?shelf=completed-series">completed-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/44311998-katrin?shelf=most-anticipated-releases-2016">most-anticipated-releases-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/44311998-katrin?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/44311998-katrin?shelf=book-boyfriends">book-boyfriends</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1635066904" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6739139130682237334">I finished this book a few days ago, but I was so overwhelmed by it that I was not able to write a review until now :D<br />I cannot believe that this series is really over now... I do not want it to be over!<br />Before starting this series I never would have thought that I will end up loving it so much. <br />I liked Eadlyn's story more than America's, not just because I liked Eadlyn as a person more than America, but also because of the politics and everything else around it. I liked that you never know who Ea</span>  <span id="freeText6739139130682237334" style="display:none">I finished this book a few days ago, but I was so overwhelmed by it that I was not able to write a review until now :D<br />I cannot believe that this series is really over now... I do not want it to be over!<br />Before starting this series I never would have thought that I will end up loving it so much. <br />I liked Eadlyn's story more than America's, not just because I liked Eadlyn as a person more than America, but also because of the politics and everything else around it. I liked that you never know who Eadlyn will end up with, whereas you always kind of know who Maxon will choose in the first three books.<br />I loved how Eadlyn changed so much from the spoiled, selfish girl she was in <i>The Heir</i> to the girl who cares about her country and her people at the end of <i>The Crown</i>.<br />I really like Eadlyn's final choice, but I think that the ending could have been longer. It seemed a bit rushed with Eadlyn changing her mind about who she is going to choose so often in the last 50 pages.<br />All in all, <i>The Crown</i> was a good series finale, but I liked <i>The Heir</i> a bit more, which is why I am giving 4.5 stars to this last book of The Selection Series.</span>  <a data-text-id="6739139130682237334" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1635066904">  <td id="reviewTextContainer1685498150" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12728515865215571868">DNF about 70 pages in.<br /><br />I just can't stop wondering, why couldn't this have been one book?? Really, this spinoff could have been one book just like the original trilogy could have been a duet. I liked the first book in this, but honestly cannot find the motivation to finish this one.<br /><br />Others may still love it, but I don't have time for this. </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1685498150">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1685498150" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1685498150&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1685498150'><a id="like_count_review_1685498150" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1685498150?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">23 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1685498150" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1685498150" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=23&rating[page]=3&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1685498150&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1685498150" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1685498150, true, &#39;&#39;); class="section">      <div id="review_1275650240" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1275650240" />    <a title="Olivia (The Candid Cover)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/14451126-olivia-the-candid-cover"><img alt="Olivia (The Candid Cover)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1439078236p2/14451126.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1275650240?book_show_action=false">Jul 08, 2016</a>      <a title="Olivia (The Candid Cover)" class="user" name="Olivia (The Candid Cover)" href="/user/show/14451126-olivia-the-candid-cover">Olivia (The Candid Cover)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/14451126-olivia-the-candid-cover?shelf=2016-releases">2016-releases</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1275650240" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13142069061057443405">As a big fan of The Selection series since the very beginning, I was so excited to see the books continue after America and MaxonU+2019s story. Even though The Heir could have been better, The Crown definitely made up for it. The characters are so much more developed and Eadlyn really changes from her old, snobby self. The bigger theme of family was so sweet and made me enjoy the book even more.<br /><br />I honestly enjoyed The Crown so much more than The Heir. The story seems to calm down a little bit more as</span>  <span id="freeText13142069061057443405" style="display:none">As a big fan of The Selection series since the very beginning, I was so excited to see the books continue after America and MaxonU+2019s story. Even though The Heir could have been better, The Crown definitely made up for it. The characters are so much more developed and Eadlyn really changes from her old, snobby self. The bigger theme of family was so sweet and made me enjoy the book even more.<br /><br />I honestly enjoyed The Crown so much more than The Heir. The story seems to calm down a little bit more as only six of EadlynU+2019s suitors are left in the competition. The remaining characters are developed even more and are each shown to have their own little quirks. Since this series became so mainstream, I have noticed a lot of people enjoying it less. Though it is pretty cheesy and dramatic, that is exactly what I would expect from a cute and quick read like this one. This book really ties up all the loose ends from The Heir extremely well in 279 pages.<br /><br />Eadlyn is so different from her appearance in The Heir. In her first story, Eadlyn is shown to be quite snobby, which definitely turned some people off. However, in The Crown, she starts to realize what people think of her and becomes a better person. I was very glad to see EadlynU+2019s transformation, as IU+2019m not sure I would have enjoyed the book as much if she remained so stuck-up.<br /><br />I love the theme of family in this series. I feel like it becomes even more emphasized in The Crown after America has a heart attack and EadlynU+2019s brother gets married and moves to France. The royal family has even more reason to be together and support each other. The fact that they prioritized each other was really sweet and I found myself smiling at their closeness.<br /><br />The Crown is a much more enjoyable book than The Heir since Eadlyn transforms from her original snobby personality and there is a big theme of family. This series is actually among one of my favourites. I have been waiting to read this book for a long time and I am so satisfied with the way that the series ended.<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="13142069061057443405" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview"      <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1442209562" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1442209562&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1442209562'><a class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1636635248" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1636635248" />    <a title="Tracy (Cornerfolds)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/5871712-tracy-cornerfolds"><img alt="Tracy (Cornerfolds)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479242949p2/5871712.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1636635248?book_show_action=false">Jul 31, 2016</a>      <a title="Tracy (Cornerfolds)" class="user" name="Tracy (Cornerfolds)" href="/user/show/5871712-tracy-cornerfolds">Tracy (Cornerfolds)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5871712-tracy-cornerfolds?shelf=romance">romance</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5871712-tracy-cornerfolds?shelf=dystopia">dystopia</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5871712-tracy-cornerfolds?shelf=dnf">dnf</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5871712-tracy-cornerfolds?shelf=ya">ya</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/5871712-tracy-cornerfolds?shelf=read-2016">read-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1636635248" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3776205820520328716">Read more of my reviews at <a href="http://www.cornerfolds.com" rel="nofollow">Cornerfolds.com</a>!<br><br>DNF @ 50% <br><br><b>Initial reaction:</b><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1463196746ra/19091906.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Before I begin this review I want to say I was totally in love with the original Selection trilogy. Sure, it was mostly romantic fluff, but it was really enjoyable fluff. I was excited when Cass released The Heir. I bought it as soon as it was released and took it on a Caribbean cruise as reading material, but was totally and completely let down by it. I hated Eadlyn and I didn't understand the need for her story in the first</span>  <span id="freeText3776205820520328716" style="display:none">Read more of my reviews at <a href="http://www.cornerfolds.com" rel="nofollow">Cornerfolds.com</a>!<br><br>DNF @ 50% <br><br><b>Initial reaction:</b><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1463196746ra/19091906.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Before I begin this review I want to say I was totally in love with the original Selection trilogy. Sure, it was mostly romantic fluff, but it was really enjoyable fluff. I was excited when Cass released The Heir. I bought it as soon as it was released and took it on a Caribbean cruise as reading material, but was totally and completely let down by it. I hated Eadlyn and I didn't understand the need for her story in the first place. Maybe you're wondering why I even bothered to review this book if I hated book four so much. In the past I have even discussed why I hate when people review books they don't expect to enjoy. But here's the thing: I wanted this final book to redeem the previous one. I wanted Kiera Cass to change my mind about Eadlyn and blow me away with the last bit of her story, but that did not happen here. In fact, I finally gave up at 50% of the way through.<br><br>The Crown picks up immediately after The Heir left off, with America in the hospital and Eadlyn trying to hold everything else together (for some reason). She has let go of several of the boys, directly mirroring the original trilogy, and is insistent upon choosing one of the remaining boys to marry. I will go ahead and tell you there is nothing about this book that I found redeeming (which is obviously why I decided not to continue reading it) so I'm not going to try to sugar coat this review. I actually had a long list of quotes and notes, but I accidentally deleted it, so whoops. I'm just going to wing it!<br><br>As with The Heir, there is absolutely no world building to speak of in this book. None. All of the characters remained within the castle walls at all times and honestly I didn't even feel like I could picture any of the rooms in the castle, which is really saying something. I should be able to picture every single nook and cranny of that castle if it's the only location I've seen for two books. Even worse than the lack of a proper world, though, is that these two books are really completely uneccessary. They are literally just The Selection series but with some details tweaked - right down to Eadlyn choosing an Elite to speed things along.<br><br>But my absolute biggest issue with these two books remains Eadlyn herself. I couldn't stand her. After The Heir, a lot of people wanted to talk about how Eadlyn had changed, had grown up, become selfless. I don't know what book they were reading, but I must have gotten a defective copy. My Eadlyn was a selfish bitch, at least through the 50% of the book that I made it through. And the thing about it is, I'm not the only one that hates Eadlyn - her entire country hates her too. She cannot figure out why everyone hates her. Part of the problem is that every single person surrounding her is constantly telling her how perfect and amazing and gorgeous and powerful she is. Maybe if someone would knock her down off her high horse, she might actually get a clue.<br><br>Other random things that irritated me about The Crown:<br><br>- Why is the cover model's dress so big? She's swimming in it. Could they not afford a tailor? In a series that is known for its gorgeous covers, I was really surprised by this. <br><br>- Am I to believe that the QUEEN cannot recover from a heart attack (which she had at age 30-something, by the way) in her own rooms? They couldn't roll all their equipment down the hall so she could be comfortable? So the KING could be comfortable instead of sleeping in a chair? <br><br>- Similarly, the princess/regent doesn't have a nighttime maid who could go get her some coffee? The regent of a country has to go down to the kitchen and make her own coffee?? And I mean, I get it if she wanted to get her own coffee, but she specifically says there's no one who can get it for her because it's nighttime. Give me a freaking break. <br><br>- Am I the only one who thought Kiera Cass made Henri seem like a total moron? I get it. The kid is from another country and doesn't speak English. (Honestly, it's a little unbelievable that someone who was entering this kind of competition wouldn't speak English to begin with, but whatever.) I pictured him as an idiot because that's how he was written. Not speaking a foreign language doesn't make a person dumb. :/ <br><br>- Since when can a king just decide to stop being king and hand things over to his kid because he's tired of the job? Isn't Queen Elizabeth like, 90 or something now? Why doesn't she just retire and hand things over to Prince Charles? <br><br>- The ending. Yes, I asked my friend to spoil it for me and just... what? This seems like a decision that was made solely for shock value. Did Kiera Cass decide this person would win while she was writing this book? Because nothing in The Heir pointed to this. <br><br>In case there was still any doubt in your mind, I hated this book. I hoped for redemption from the final book in this never ending series, but I didn't get it. I don't know what happened to Kiera Cass after The One was written. A friend suggested that perhaps she had been kidnapped and someone was writing in her name. That's the only thing that makes sense, really. Do I still recommend The Selection series? Yes, but stop at book three. </span>  <a data-text-id="3776205820520328716" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1486076106?book_show_action=false">May 15, 2016</a>      <a title="Jennifer" class="user" name="Jennifer" href="/user/show/2473504-jennifer">Jennifer</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2473504-jennifer?shelf=young-adult-genre">young-adult-genre</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2473504-jennifer?shelf=dystopia">dystopia</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2473504-jennifer?shelf=listened-to-audiobook">listened-to-audiobook</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/2473504-jennifer?shelf=read-2016">read-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1486076106" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4619904771610343338"><br><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/26074181.The_Crown__The_Selection___5_" title="The Crown (The Selection, #5) by Kiera Cass">The Crown</a> is the fifth installment in <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/2987125.Kiera_Cass" title="Kiera Cass">Kiera Cass</a>'s young-adult dystopian series titled: <u>The Selection</u>. This series has been interesting for me in terms of not loving it but still getting excited to read each and every installment that is released...yes, even when the "trilogy" was supposedly completed. I enjoyed America's story and I surprisingly enjoyed her daughter Eadlyn's story a tad more. But IllU+00E9a is at a good point now and doesn't seem to meet the technical description of a dystopian soci</span>  <span id="freeText4619904771610343338" style="display:none">U+2605 U+2605 U+2605 U+00BD<br><a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/26074181.The_Crown__The_Selection___5_" title="The Crown (The Selection, #5) by Kiera Cass">The Crown</a> is the fifth installment in <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/2987125.Kiera_Cass" title="Kiera Cass">Kiera Cass</a>'s young-adult dystopian series titled: <u>The Selection</u>. This series has been interesting for me in terms of not loving it but still getting excited to read each and every installment that is released...yes, even when the "trilogy" was supposedly completed. I enjoyed America's story and I surprisingly enjoyed her daughter Eadlyn's story a tad more. But IllU+00E9a is at a good point now and doesn't seem to meet the technical description of a dystopian society soooo.... maybe it's over? Who knows. If not, I guess I'll keep on reading :)<br><br><b>My favorite quote:</b><br><i>U+201CYou can read the stories and watch the movies, and you can think you know how itU+2019s all supposed to unfold. But the truth is, love is as much fate as it is planning, as much a beauty as it is a disaster. Finding a prince might mean kissing a lot of frogs. Or kicking a lot of frogs out of your house. Falling might mean running headfirst into something you always wanted. Or dipping your toe into something youU+2019ve been scared of your whole life. Happily ever after could be waiting in a field a mile wide. Or a window as narrow as seven minutes.U+201D</i><br><br><u>The Selection</u> series includes the following installments as of May 2016. The rating are my opinion only.<br>#0.4-<a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/22054340.The_Queen__The_Selection___0_4_" title="The Queen (The Selection, #0.4) by Kiera Cass">The Queen</a> by Kiera Cass">The Epilogue</a> U+2605 U+2605 U+2606 U+2606 U+2606<br><b>#4</b>-<a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/22918050.The_Heir__The_Selection___4_" title="The Heir (The Selection, #4) by Kiera Cass">The Heir</a> U+2605 U+2605 U+2605 U+00BD U+2606<br><b>#5</b>-<a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/26074181.The_Crown__The_Selection___5_" title="The Crown (The Selection, #5) by U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1486076106" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1486076106" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1635268976" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1635268976" />    <a title="Sophie" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/18451976-sophie"><img alt="Sophie" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1424022406p2/18451976.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1635268976?book_show_action=false">May 12, 2016</a>      <a title="Sophie" class="user" name="Sophie" href="/user/show/18451976-sophie">Sophie</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1635268976" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12099084426211313942">3,5 stars.<br /><br />Sorry, but this was not a winner for me.<br /><br />The "could be better" or "left me waiting for something more":<br /><br />-the character portraying of the boys. We barely get to know them. It was too superficial for me to really know them as all happens in Eadlyn's head and she does not spend many time with them. No real competition or undermining or...between them to keep us on our toes either;<br /><br />-the plot was pretty linear. Just a little surprise here and there but as everything happen in the palace, I was</span>  <span id="freeText12099084426211313942" style="display:none">3,5 stars.<br /><br />Sorry, but this was not a winner for me.<br /><br />The "could be better" or "left me waiting for something more":<br /><br />-the character portraying of the boys. We barely get to know them. It was too superficial for me to really know them as all happens in Eadlyn's head and she does not spend many time with them. No real competition or undermining or...between them to keep us on our toes either;<br /><br />-the plot was pretty linear. Just a little surprise here and there but as everything happen in the palace, I was not as involved as I was with The Selection when America sided with rebels, etc.;<br /><br />The good:<br /><br />-Eadlyn was less bratty and self centered in this sequel. I liked her development. She went from "I'm the best thing that's ever happened on humanity" to "Am I doing it right? " and "My people come first". At last!!! She matured and it was so much better;<br /><br />-he relationship with her family. We got to see the dynamic with her parents, her brothers, her counselor. Much more than interactions with the boys though it should have been the focal point of the story but... maybe I'm picky.<br /><br />So, because I had great expectations, especially after the author wrote a best selling series I loved very much, I'm feeling let down. It seems rehashed. She took the first excellent and new idea and exploited it in a slightly different way but without really developping its full potential.<br /><br />Now, I seem to be the "odd one" as it gets many good reviews so don't let my review deter you and make your own opinion.<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="12099084426211313942" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1635268976">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1635268976" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1635268976&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1635268976'><a id="like_count_review_1635268976" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1635268976?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">22 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1635268976" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1635268976" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=22&rating[page]=3&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1635268976&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1635268976" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1635268976, true, &#39;&#39;); elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1535409389" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1535409389" />    <a title="Aditi" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/16069171-aditi"><img alt="Aditi" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477558729p2/16069171.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1535409389?book_show_action=false">May 19, 2016</a>      <a title="Aditi" class="user" name="Aditi" href="/user/show/16069171-aditi">Aditi</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16069171-aditi?shelf=my-reviews">my-reviews</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16069171-aditi?shelf=ya">ya</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16069171-aditi?shelf=contemporary-romance">contemporary-romance</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16069171-aditi?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16069171-aditi?shelf=family">family</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16069171-aditi?shelf=friends">friends</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1535409389" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6736058531257152629"> <i>U+201CPerhaps I cannot make my people good, she told herself, but I should at least try to make them a little less bad.U+201D </i><br /><br /> ----George R.R. Martin<br /><br /><br />Kiera Cass, the best-selling author of <i>The Selection </i>series, pens her (possibly and I badly hope so!) the final and fifth book in this enchanting dystopian series. <i>The Crown</i> traces the journey of America's daughter, Eadlyn, stepping up to be the queen followed by America's illness. And as <i>The Selection </i> has been eliminated from their kingdom, Eadlyn still so</span>  <span id="freeText6736058531257152629" style="display:none"> <i>U+201CPerhaps I cannot make my people good, she told herself, but I should at least try to make them a little less bad.U+201D </i><br /><br /> ----George R.R. Martin<br /><br /><br />Kiera Cass, the best-selling author of <i>The Selection </i>series, pens her (possibly and I badly hope so!) the final and fifth book in this enchanting dystopian series. <i>The Crown</i> traces the journey of America's daughter, Eadlyn, stepping up to be the queen followed by America's illness. And as <i>The Selection </i> has been eliminated from their kingdom, Eadlyn still somehow has to choose a suitor for her marriage. <br /><br /><br /><b>Synopsis: </b><br /><br /><i>When Eadlyn became the first princess of IllU+00E9a to hold her own Selection, she didnU+2019t think she would fall in love with any of her thirty-five suitors. She spent the first few weeks of the competition counting down the days until she could send them all home. But as events at the palace force Eadlyn even further into the spotlight, she realizes that she might not be content remaining alone.<br /><br />Eadlyn still isnU+2019t sure sheU+2019ll find the fairy tale ending her parents did twenty years ago. But sometimes the heart has a way of surprising youU+2026and soon Eadlyn must make a choice that feels more impossibleU+2014and more importantU+2014than she ever imagined.</i><br /><br /><br />Prince Maxon steps down as the king of IllU+00E9a due to his wife, America's illness and as he needs to take care of his loving wife, he cannot burden himself with the kingdom duties. And it is time for the youngest lady of IllU+00E9a to be the queen, yes, you heard it right, Eadlyn soon transforms herself from an arrogant little girl to someone responsible and mature within a fortnight and this is where the readers are going to fall for her. But she also has to choose a suitor from 35 male candidates and among them only 6 remained and whom she actually fancied. Who will win Eadlyn's heart among the six suitors?<br /><br /><b>BORING ALERT!</b><br /><br />Well I remember rating the previous book with 4 stars only because of the author's writing style, and other techniques and I clearly remember how much Eadlyn sucked all through out the book! In this book, I was looking and hoping for a bit of Eadlyn's evolving characterization, yes Cass did involve a lot of changes in Eadlyn's portrayal, instead all those happened rather abruptly, without any reason or within an eventual build up! After reading this book, I believe, I shouldn't have given 4 stars to the previous book...<br /><br />There is literally no romance at all in this book, so if you're looking for some cheesy, moving drama, then look elsewhere, as Eadlyn displayed zero feelings or interest towards any of the 6 suitors, not even with the guy whom she ended up with. Yes, there are quite a lot of romantic scenes involving our very own America and Maxon, and those are depicted with a lot of feels and evocative emotions. Even the guy whom Eadlyn ended up is terribly wrong as it does not sync with the demeanor and the qualities reflected by the other suitors. <br /><br />The writing style is not at all articulate, things have not been formed with a proper flow, as the events and the twists unraveled rather hastily, without any proper explanation. The prose is not good, the pacing is way too fast, and felt like riding a super fast train and missing out most of the scenery from its window. The narrative is tad boring and has nothing to hold on to. The whole story building has shortcomings and it will be real difficult for the readers who have lost touch with the previous stories. The vividity and depth is missing from the prose, thus making it quite uninteresting and I found myself hurriedly skimming through the pages of this book.<br /><br />The newly introduced characters lacked depth and development hence it becomes difficult for the readers top connect with them. The characters of Maxon and America needed no development, although their presence made the story a bit uplifting enough to keep reading. On the other hand, their precious daughter, Eadlyn, sucked from the heart to the mind and especially she sucked heavily when she went to those boring dates with each of her suitors. Even the supporting characters are not that well-developed. <br /><br />Yet again, the book' cover left me awe-struck and kept me arrested for a while with all those litters and the grace captured possibly by Eadlyn is something amazing. Overall, I would recommend that it will be best if you can skip this book, as there is not much mention of America or Maxon, mostly the story revolves around Eadlyn.<br /><br /><b>Verdict: </b> <i>Not that much of a promising end! </i><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="6736058531257152629" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1535409389">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1535409389" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1535409389&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1535409389'><a id="like_count_review_1535409389" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1535409389?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">19 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1535409389" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1535409389" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=19&rating[page]=3&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1535409389&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1535409389" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1535409389, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">9 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1535409389?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=3">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1535409389' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1535409389/comments?reverse=true">View all 9 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1535409389' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1535409389, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div></div><div class="uitext" style="float: right; class="section firstReview">      <div id="review_1677166748" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1677166748" />    <a title="Jacqueline&#39;s Reads" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4197769-jacqueline-s-reads"><img alt="Jacqueline&#39;s Reads" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1380942477p2/4197769.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1677166748?book_show_action=false">Jun 23, 2016</a>      <a title="Jacqueline&#39;s Reads" class="user" name="Jacqueline&#39;s Reads" href="/user/show/4197769-jacqueline-s-reads">Jacqueline&#39;s Reads</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4197769-jacqueline-s-reads?shelf=audio">audio</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4197769-jacqueline-s-reads?shelf=ya">ya</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1677166748" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17149712373694371081"><b>The first 50% 3 Stars, The last 50% 4 Stars, OVERALL 3.5 Stars</b><br /><br />The Crown begins where The Heir left off. <br /><br />I donU+2019t even know where to begin with my review. I think if I wasnU+2019t pregnant, I would have made myself a glass of wine before attempting to write about my thoughts, but here it goes.<br /><br />I was not a fan of The Heir. As much as I loved the previous three books about EadlynU+2019s parents, there was something lacking in EadlynU+2019s story. Romance was what was lacking. However, I needed to know who Edalyn pi</span>  <span id="freeText17149712373694371081" style="display:none"><b>The first 50% 3 Stars, The last 50% 4 Stars, OVERALL 3.5 Stars</b><br /><br />The Crown begins where The Heir left off. <br /><br />I donU+2019t even know where to begin with my review. I think if I wasnU+2019t pregnant, I would have made myself a glass of wine before attempting to write about my thoughts, but here it goes.<br /><br />I was not a fan of The Heir. As much as I loved the previous three books about EadlynU+2019s parents, there was something lacking in EadlynU+2019s story. Romance was what was lacking. However, I needed to know who Edalyn picked (or if she even picks someone).<br /><br />The first 50% of The Crown was boring. Although Eadlyn stopped whining and seems to take on more responsibility, I found myself getting tired of her inner monologue and side stories. I wanted more interaction between Eadyln and the guys in the selection.<br /><br />What I got? Eadlyn being concerned about making the people happy, her concerned about her mother, her concerned about her brother, just basically Eadlyn concerned about everything, except finding a man to marry and love. Okay, maybe she was stressed about finding a man, but she didnU+2019t seem to make any more connections that what she made in The Heir.<br /><br /><b>Give me romance PLEASE!</b><br /><br />The second 50% I got a little bit of what I asked for. I saw Eadlyn developing and changing. She was becoming more mature, more focused and I felt like she was connecting more with the men. There are a lot of guys and I had a feeling it would go down to three of them.<br /><br /><b>Would she go with Kile, her long time best friend, who lives in the palace? Who would always make her laugh and be a familiar face?<br /><br />Would she go with Erik, HenriU+2019s translator, who gives Eadyln special sweet moments?<br /><br />Would she go with Henri, the adorable man, who canU+2019t speak English but worships the ground Eadyln walks on.</b><br /><br />As stated in my previous review in The Heir I loved Erik. I found him the best of both worlds. HeU+2019s the underdog, heU+2019s completely sweet and I love how heU+2019s not part of the selection. I also love that he will put honor and duty before selfish actions.<br /><br />My second favorite is a tie between Kile and Henri. I found Kile the front runner in the beginning in The Heir, but as EadlynU+2019s relationship with him progressed, it seemed they were forcing a relationship between them because it was the best option. It feel seem neither organic nor natural.<br /><br />I loved Henri because his only flaw was that he couldnU+2019t speak English. HeU+2019s funny and over the top sweet. He probably would have been my favorite except for his one flaw.<br /><br />Who will she choose? Who knows? And does she even choose anyone to begin with? Well thatU+2019s a question I had throughout the book.<br /><br />The Crown keeps you on your toes and you NEVER know whatU+2019s going to happen. I did the audio version of the book because I enjoyed the narrator so much from The Heir. The girl can cry, convey emotions like no oneU+2019s business. I am a complete fan. <br /><br />Overall, I found EadlynU+2019s story mild and kind of meh. I think if the author made this more romance base it would have been a winner for me. <br /></span>  <a data-text-id="17149712373694371081" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1677166748">  <td it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15"  <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30813900-amber-robertson?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite"        <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30813900-amber-robertson?shelf=romance">romance</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30813900-amber-robertson?shelf=contemporary">contemporary</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30813900-amber-robertson?shelf=science-fiction">science-fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30813900-amber-robertson?shelf=wishlist">wishlist</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1542572801" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4455237043068957063"><i> There was a loud knock of a staff on the floor, and the people around me shouted, U+201CGod save the queen.U+201D<br />And I felt a thrill in my chest to know those words were meant for me </i><br /><br />This finale was spectacular! I adored each moment of the book as I read. I wished maybe it was longer and not so fast paced. It did work though and I am satisfied with the ending. I'm very satisfied with everything that happened and I found myself smiling giddily at so many parts, despite being a cynical person. <br /><br /><i> U+201CWeU+2019ve been</i></span>  <span id="freeText4455237043068957063" style="display:none"><i> There was a loud knock of a staff on the floor, and the people around me shouted, U+201CGod save the queen.U+201D<br />And I felt a thrill in my chest to know those words were meant for me </i><br /><br />This finale was spectacular! I adored each moment of the book as I read. I wished maybe it was longer and not so fast paced. It did work though and I am satisfied with the ending. I'm very satisfied with everything that happened and I found myself smiling giddily at so many parts, despite being a cynical person. <br /><br /><i> U+201CWeU+2019ve been very good,U+201D he promised.<br />Mom smiled. U+201CWell, stop that immediately.U+201D </i><br /><br />The Crown picks up where The Heir finished. There is no time gap. There is no "oh wait, we've fast forward a month?" I liked that. I felt it was appropriate in this instance with the book. It let us seen how America was holding up after a heart attack and how Maxon had reacted. That made me incredibly happy since I adored the pairing. <br /><br />Also, can I just say how glad I am my OTP for this series happened! It could have gone so many other ways, each boy seemed to have a chance and that I was slightly anxious as to who would end up the prince consort. Thankfully it was <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Erik! I honestly didn't think it would end up being him and I was so pumped when it happened. U+201CVain koska pyysit, hauska nainen" (just because you asked, funny woman) was so very amusing to me! I hope the translation was correct if not fuck Google translate  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>. It did happen very quickly though at the end, within 7 minutes to be exact. I wish it had maybe been a bit elongated, hence why I only rated this novel four stars instead of five. <br /><br />I would compare this book to The Princess Diaries 2, personally. Which only made me fall further in love with what was happening and the characters presented to me. There were so many similar personalities to those of the movie and certain scenes had me shocked. <br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ When Madrid betrayed Eadlyn I was so shocked! I don't know why he was super shady but I was hoping he'd be a good friend to her. The fact he went for the cliche villain line of U+201CIf you think this will be the last youU+2019ve heard from meU+2014 U+201D was incredibly laughable to me. Just showed what a dickhead he was! I also loved how Josie changed in this novel and became a lot better in her personality when she realised being a princess wasn't just tea parties and pretty dresses.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />Just a spectacular finale from Kiera Cass, though I would have liked a bit more of an epilogue! Also, the dress envy she gave me was immense and if anyone wants to make me the dresses mentioned I would never complain!</span>  <a data-text-id="4455237043068957063" href="#" elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1087700439" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1087700439" />    <a title="Taylor Knight" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/12627819-taylor-knight"><img alt="Taylor Knight" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1458860014p2/12627819.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1087700439?book_show_action=false">May 16, 2016</a>      <a title="Taylor Knight" class="user" name="Taylor Knight" href="/user/show/12627819-taylor-knight">Taylor Knight</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1087700439" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5502398794859484701"><b>Spoiler free</b><br><i>3.5 stars</i><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1455403830ra/18098504.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>DID I ACTUALLY LIKE THIS BOOK? I THINK SO.<br><br>I read The Selection a really long time ago, when it first came out. Like, it was probably the first book I ever pre-ordered. I loved it and the next two books. They were so much fun and I couldn't get enough. If I had read them now, I don't think I would like them as much but I'm sure I would still enjoy them. I read The Heir as soon as it was released and I hated it. I didn't even finish it. <br>I hated Eadlyn so much. She was awful an</span>  <span id="freeText5502398794859484701" style="display:none"><b>Spoiler free</b><br><i>3.5 stars</i><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1455403830ra/18098504.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>DID I ACTUALLY LIKE THIS BOOK? I THINK SO.<br><br>I read The Selection a really long time ago, when it first came out. Like, it was probably the first book I ever pre-ordered. I loved it and the next two books. They were so much fun and I couldn't get enough. If I had read them now, I don't think I would like them as much but I'm sure I would still enjoy them. I read The Heir as soon as it was released and I hated it. I didn't even finish it. <br>I hated Eadlyn so much. She was awful and I hated her so so much. My best friend practically begged me to reread it and give it a second chance. I did and I somehow manged to read the whole thing. I still hated it. But I bought The Crown anyway. To be honest, 99% of the reason I bought it was because I wanted to own the complete series. I didn't really plan on reading The Crown but I picked it up one night and, by some miracle, I read it in one sitting. <br>I was still bitter from The Heir when I started The Crown but I don't know if it's because I was in the right mood for reading this book or what but it slowly started to grow on me. Around 200 pages in, I tentatively acknowledged that I kind of didn't hate this book. <br><br>Overall, I'm surprised that I didn't hate this book. The Crown is, in my opinion, a massive improvement from The Heir. I still don't like it as much as the original Selection but I enjoyed The Crown. I wasn't really expecting how it ended but I liked how it ended. And I think the series ended on a pretty good note. If you hate The Heir with a burning passion like I do, I wouldn't necessarily recommend The Crown but I don't think it's a complete waste of time.</span>  <a data-text-id="5502398794859484701" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" Yes!<br /><br />Achei que podia ter sido melhor, voltei a achar a escrita fraquinha mas uma coisa posso dizer, em termos de personagens gostei mais destas.<br />NU+00E3o gostei de com quem ficou porque nU+00E3o senti empatia com essa personagem. Gostei da grande decisU+00E3o do livro e depois como a Eadlyn a alterou no fim. <br /><br />Este livro nU+00E3o me captou tanto a atenU+00E7 U+00E3o como o 4U+00BA o que U+00E9 estranho porque estava mesmo ansiosa por lU+00EA-lo mas senti-me aborrecida diversas vezes. Contudo, nU+00E3o quer dizer que nU+00E3o tenha gostado pois gostei dos vU+00E1rios acontecimentos do livro, acho que foi o livro onde houve mais acU+00E7 U+00E3o e a Eadlyn cresceu imenso como personagem! Ela que foi sempre muito opinativa mas U+00E0s vezes era mais garganta que sei lU+00E1 o quU+00EA, viu-se numa encruzilhada sem saber bem o que fazer mas lU+00E1 tomou consciU+00EAncia do que era nU+00E3o sU+00F3 melhor para si mas como para o seu povo. Mais uma vez repito mas eu gostei muito mais da Eadlyn em dois livros do que a America em trU+00EAs...<br /><br />(...)<br /><a target="_blank" </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1075689778" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1075689778" />    <a title="~ Odette Knappers" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/35775020-odette-knappers"><img alt="~ Odette Knappers" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1467807562p2/35775020.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1075689778?book_show_action=false">May 09, 2016</a>      <a title="~ Odette Knappers" class="user" name="~ Odette Knappers" href="/user/show/35775020-odette-knappers">~ Odette Knappers</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/35775020-odette-knappers?shelf=2016-fictie">2016-fictie</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1075689778" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12244443015276486234">I really likes this ending. This is the last we will read from The Selection, but Kiera made it so that I have peace with it. Lovely, unexpected something.<br /><br />I've enjoyed the read, but I was not suprised by her choice of husband. It was my far-fetched theory from book 4, and as it turned out, it was not that far-fetched. I like to be suprised in books like this, like in <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/18635016.The_One__The_Selection___3_" title="The One (The Selection, #3) by Kiera Cass">The One</a>, but somehow this was not that good to me. But I did enjoy it a lot! Oh, and I love the character development! </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1316735884" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1316735884" />    <a title="Audrey" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/31022980-audrey"><img alt="Audrey" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1477521659p2/31022980.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1316735884?book_show_action=false">May 06, 2016</a>      <a title="Audrey" class="user" name="Audrey" href="/user/show/31022980-audrey">Audrey</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/31022980-audrey?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1316735884" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5366976556473106820">Wow. My favorite series.<br /><br />It's over.<br /><br />No more headstrong America.<br /><br />No more romantic Maxon.<br /><br />No more spunky Eadlyn.<br /><br />No more sweet Marlee, or perfect Ahren, or gentle Lucy, or intelligent Kaden, or caring Aspen, or mischievous Osten.<br /><br />This is so weird.<br /><br />And I gotta say, I'm not a fan of this feeling I have right now that's leaving me somewhere between cheering because of how much I loved this book and crying because I'm so upset it's over.<br /><br />Full review to come.<br /><br />Miss you already, Schreave family (and friends). </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1316735884">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1316735884" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1316735884&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1316735884'><a id="like_count_review_1316735884" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1316735884?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">19 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1316735884" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1316735884" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=19&rating[page]=4&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1316735884&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1316735884" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1316735884, true, &#39;&#39;); itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1303737726?book_show_action=false">Jun 06, 2016</a>      <a title="India Jade" class="user" name="India Jade" href="/user/show/38467984-india-jade">India Jade</a>          added it                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite"      <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38467984-india-jade?shelf=beautiful-conclusions">beautiful-conclusions</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38467984-india-jade?shelf=quick-reads">quick-reads</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38467984-india-jade?shelf=best-book-boyfriends">best-book-boyfriends</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38467984-india-jade?shelf=narrator-drove-me-crazy">narrator-drove-me-crazy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38467984-india-jade?shelf=i-wish-i-knew-these-people">i-wish-i-knew-these-people</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38467984-india-jade?shelf=i-wish-i-lived-in-this-book">i-wish-i-lived-in-this-book</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38467984-india-jade?shelf=read-in-less-than-24-hours">read-in-less-than-24-hours</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38467984-india-jade?shelf=i-am-very-satisfied">i-am-very-satisfied</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38467984-india-jade?shelf=wish-it-went-on-forever">wish-it-went-on-forever</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38467984-india-jade?shelf=i-ship-the-wrong-people">i-ship-the-wrong-people</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38467984-india-jade?shelf=i-ship-them-like-fedex">i-ship-them-like-fedex</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38467984-india-jade?shelf=i-totally-saw-that-coming">i-totally-saw-that-coming</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38467984-india-jade?shelf=love-dodecagon">love-dodecagon</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38467984-india-jade?shelf=by-a-favorite-author">by-a-favorite-author</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38467984-india-jade?shelf=best-book-siblings">best-book-siblings</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38467984-india-jade?shelf=heartwarming">heartwarming</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38467984-india-jade?shelf=holding-book-to-my-heart">holding-book-to-my-heart</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38467984-india-jade?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1303737726" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3998054119955071852">Seeing as this book comes out in a month or so, I figured I would do my <i>what I want in this book</i>.<br /><br />Here we go.<br /><br />- For Eadlyn to stop being such a brat<br /><br />- For America to . . . well, not die.<br /><br />- More Maxon and Eadlyn moments<br /><br />- For Ahren to apologize or something, I mean, I don't like her either, buddy, but Eadlyn's your sister!<br /><br />- More moments with the Bros<br /><br />- ERIK<br /><br />- KILE<br /><br />- HENRI<br /><br />- For one of the above to win (unless someone else pops up)<br /><br />- Actually, not for Henri to win, ya know, cause he can't speak English.<br />But</span>  <span id="freeText3998054119955071852" style="display:none">Seeing as this book comes out in a month or so, I figured I would do my <i>what I want in this book</i>.<br /><br />Here we go.<br /><br />- For Eadlyn to stop being such a brat<br /><br />- For America to . . . well, not die.<br /><br />- More Maxon and Eadlyn moments<br /><br />- For Ahren to apologize or something, I mean, I don't like her either, buddy, but Eadlyn's your sister!<br /><br />- More moments with the Bros<br /><br />- ERIK<br /><br />- KILE<br /><br />- HENRI<br /><br />- For one of the above to win (unless someone else pops up)<br /><br />- Actually, not for Henri to win, ya know, cause he can't speak English.<br />But you know who can? Both Erik and Kile . . .<br /><br />- For Eadlyn to actually appreciate all that she has<br /><br />- Some more stories from when the kids were growing up (what kind of parents were Maxmerica?)<br /><br />- For Aspen and Lucy to have a baby. I don't care how old they are.<br /><br />- For Kile to get really passionate about his architecture stuff again<br /><br />- For Eadlyn to realize what a jerk she is to Josie (that's her name, right? It's been a while . . .)<br /><br />- For Kiera to step up her game and give us some more tension *wiggles eyebrows*<br /><br />- For Eadlyn not to take advantage of Kile's willingness to kiss her (Not that kind of tension, guys!)<br /><br />- Actually, yeah, that tension. Just not like that.<br /><br />- So much more that, no matter how awesome Kiera is, even she can't fit into a book. And more importantly, that I don't want to type.<br /><br /><br />So there you have it, folks. Enjoy.<br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><b>MAY 29 UPDATE:</b><br />And it has been read, my peoples. I REPEAT:<br />IT.<br />HAS.<br />BEEN.<br />READ.<br /><br />AND I FREAKING KNEW IT!<br /><br />What did you know, India?<br /><br />Well . . . You'll just have to see when I actually get the chance to write this review after I finish suffering from all these feelings.<br /><br />More to come. . . .<br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><b>JUNE 6 UPDATE:</b><br /><br />I'm sorry, guys. I just got back from vacation late Saturday night, and obviously I wasn't going to spend my time in Mexico writing a review for <i>The Crown </i>, so I typed it up late last night and now I'm putting it here for all y'all's viewin' pleaaaasssuuuure.<br /><br />Here we go.<br /><br /><b>Rating:</b><br /><br />I'll give you 4 stars this time, Kiera. Eadlyn wasn't as terrible this time around. I applaud you.<br /><br /><blockquote>"You are always just Eadlyn. And you are always the queen. You are everything to everyone. And infinitely more to me."</blockquote><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><b> Plot:</b><br /><br />Eadlyn Schreave is still making her way through her Selection.<br /><br />With the recent tragedies of her brother's flee and her mother's health, Eadlyn is forced to cut the group down to the Elite.<br /><br />Only Gunner, Hale, Ean, Fox, Kile, and Henri remain. Along with Henri, Erik is still in the castle.<br /><br />As the Selection continues and threats fall upon the princess, Eadlyn must make choices that will effect the fairytale she never knew she would seek out. The Elite are hanging by wires, and they are being eliminated very quickly. Eadlyn can feel herself falling for someone, but they may not be who she should be falling for.<br /><br />Further threats cause Eadlyn to have to rush her decision.<br /><br />Who will she choose to rule beside her? What kind of queen will she be? Who can she trust? Who does she love? And are they the right person?<br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><b>Characters:</b><br /><br /><i>Eadlyn Schreave:</i><br />Don't get me wrong, I still hate her. I really do. I think she's selfish and a brat and too big for her britches.<br />That being said, by the end of this book, I was glad she got her happy ending.<br />I think some of the events that happened in this boom especially really humbled her and made her realize that no, she in fact is not the only person in the world. Her family is there, too. Her friends. Her loves.<br />In <i>The Crown</i>, Kiera really pushed Eadlyn to be a better person and also to pursue true love. Through this, Eadlyn came to the conclusion that it is acceptable to need someone. It's okay to let other people take care of you sometimes. It's okay to be in love - even if it's with someone you don't want to love.<br /><blockquote>Love. Like clothes, I had guessed it was something that fit no two people exactly the same way. I was still unsure what the word looked like for me, but I sensed that, sooner rather than later, it would be fully defined. All that remained to be seen was if I could be satisfied with the definition.</blockquote><br /><i>Kile Woodwork:</i><br />You guys know I love him. I love that he knows that there is a life outside of the castle, outside of IllU+00E9a. I love that he loves architecture and life and Eadlyn and his sister and his parents and everyone he grew up with. I love that he wants to leave the castle but also is willing to give that up for Eadlyn. I love that he is friends with the other Selected and that he wears ties that prevent world peace. I love that he will do anything for the people he loves even if it means sacrificing his own dreams. I love that he tells Eadlyn what he thinks and that Eadlyn sees that and admires him for it. I love that his parents love him so much and that he loves them back.<br />I love Kile Woodwork.<br /><blockquote>"Maybe it's not the first kisses that are supposed to be special. Maybe it's the last ones."</blockquote><br /><i>Gunner:</i><br />I honestly know nothing about this guy. I'm sorry. I just . . . He had a funny poem, he kissed Eadlyn. That's really the extent of my knowledge on Gunner. I mean, I don't even know his last name.<br />*mic drop*<br /><br /><i>Fox Wesley:</i><br />I really liked him for a bit in <i>The Heir</i>, but he wasn't one of the top runners in this last book. He was kind and apparently good looking and I'm sure he's sweet as all get out, but buh-bye.<br /><br /><i>Hale Garner:</i><br />I FREAKING KNEW IT. I KNEW IT THE WHOLE TIME.<br /><br /><i>Ean:</i><br />He was quiet.<br />I freaking didn't know it. I didn't know it the whole time.<br /><br /><i>Henri Jakoppi:</i><br />You're sweet, man. You really are. And I loved your poem for Eadlyn, but you can't speak English. I just don't know how we're gonna work this out.<br /><br /><i>Erik Koskinen:</i><br />I WAS ROOTING FOR YOU THE WHOLE TIME. WITH YOUR BEAUTIFUL EYES AND YOUR BEAUTIFUL FACE AND YOUR BEAUTIFUL BODY, YOU BEAUTIFUL PERSON.<br />Why must you make love impossible, Kiera?<br /><blockquote>Even Erik had gotten me a flower. I smirked a bit as I took it.<br />"This is a dandelion," I told him.<br />He shrugged. "I know. Some see a weed; some see a flower. Perspective."</blockquote><br /><i>Ahren Schreave:</i><br />Yeah, you better be sorry.<br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><b>Overall:</b><br /><br />I just wish this series would go on forever. I want to know about Eadlyn's babies and her wedding and her life with you-know-who (no, not Voldemort) and her reign as queen. I want to know about her kids' lives and their kids' lives and every kids' lives.<br /><br />The struggles of reading.<br /><br />*sigh*<br /><br />Please write another book, Kiera. I'll buy you a bow for your hair. I promise.</span>  <a data-text-id="3998054119955071852" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1303737726">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1292184947" />    <a title="Angel Erin" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/5880366-angel-erin"><img alt="Angel Erin" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479927814p2/5880366.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1292184947?book_show_action=false">Jun 09, 2016</a>      <a title="Angel Erin" class="user" name="Angel Erin" href="/user/show/5880366-angel-erin">Angel Erin</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1292184947" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer191817979128238390"><a target="_blank" href="http://angelerin.blogspot.com/2016/06/the-crown-selection-5-by-kiera-cass.html" rel="nofollow">http://angelerin.blogspot.com/2016/06...</a><br /><br />Honestly guys, I HAD to make this one a mini review because there really isn't much to say about it. The Crown is SUPER short and not that great. I felt meh about it most of the time while I was reading it. I wasn't even enraged over it, I just didn't care. <br />#WTFIsThisShizzzz<br /><br />I loved the first three Selection books and The Heir was okay, but I don't know... this one... it sucked. Here's a list of top 5 reasons why The Crown was a FAIL for me: <br /><br />1. The "twists"</span>  <span id="freeText191817979128238390" style="display:none"><a target="_blank" href="http://angelerin.blogspot.com/2016/06/the-crown-selection-5-by-kiera-cass.html" rel="nofollow">http://angelerin.blogspot.com/2016/06...</a><br /><br />Honestly guys, I HAD to make this one a mini review because there really isn't much to say about it. The Crown is SUPER short and not that great. I felt meh about it most of the time while I was reading it. I wasn't even enraged over it, I just didn't care. <br />#WTFIsThisShizzzz<br /><br />I loved the first three Selection books and The Heir was okay, but I don't know... this one... it sucked. Here's a list of top 5 reasons why The Crown was a FAIL for me: <br /><br />1. The "twists" were obvious.<br />2. Everything was rushed and still feels unfinished. <br />3. The ending felt VERY thrown together.<br />4. This one was flat and lackluster.<br />5. There was no real solution to any of the political and caste issues. <br /><br />Overall I hate to say it, but this feels like a book that was written for the love of money instead of for love of the story. It comes across as if the author herself is just OVER this damn series already. The Heir and The Crown should have never been published. Eadlyn's story is pointless and there is no resolution to anything! <br />#ForTheLoveOfMoney #MyPublisherMadeMeDoIt<br /><br />I recommend only reading the first three Selection books. Those are great if you want some fluffy and fun books. If you've already read The Heir and are curious about this one, then I say go ahead and give this one a go. Might as well because it's extremely short. I read it in one sitting, that's how short it is. Definitely borrow the book from the library or a friend though.<br />#AtLeastItsAShortFailure<br /><br /><br /><br /><br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="191817979128238390" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview"      </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1218276067" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14426939486181712507"><a href="http://www.mostlyyalit.com/2016/05/may-2016-mini-reviews-the-crown-hamilton-saga.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Review originally posted on Mostly YA Lit:</a><br /><br /><br />2.5 stars. Hoo boy. This was easily the fastest read of the whole Selection series, and similar book crack that I couldn't put down. That said...I wish there had been more development of characters in this book, and more of a synopsis of who was who at the beginning. Honestly, it was hard to remember all of the boys, Eadlyn's friends and allies, and more. In the first trilogy, we got a whole book seeing America and the other girls getting prepared for th</span>  <span id="freeText14426939486181712507" style="display:none"><a href="http://www.mostlyyalit.com/2016/05/may-2016-mini-reviews-the-crown-hamilton-saga.html" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Review originally posted on Mostly YA Lit:</a><br /><br /><br />2.5 stars. Hoo boy. This was easily the fastest read of the whole Selection series, and similar book crack that I couldn't put down. That said...I wish there had been more development of characters in this book, and more of a synopsis of who was who at the beginning. Honestly, it was hard to remember all of the boys, Eadlyn's friends and allies, and more. In the first trilogy, we got a whole book seeing America and the other girls getting prepared for the throne. I wish we'd seen similar challenges that the boys in Eadlyn's Selection had to face, because it felt downright easy for them. <br /><br />I appreciated Cass not going the traditional route in quite a few instances, especially since Eadlyn's circumstances are so different from America and Maxon's. That said, this whole last book felt rushed, from the feelings to the political developments. I really could have used more time to see the characters interact. <br /><br />Overall, a fun, fast read that really deserves a second epilogue. But maybe that will come? </span>  <a data-text-id="14426939486181712507" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div id="freeTextContainer767513495196072900">Ich hab das Buch quasi an einem Tag verschlungen und weiU+00DF ehrlich gesagt noch gar nicht ganz, was ich dazu sagen soll :D<br />Ich bin so traurig, dass die Alles in allem war der 5.
