</td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1574802224" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1574802224" />    <a title="Ellie" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/50105236-ellie"><img alt="Ellie" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1466919890p2/50105236.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1574802224?book_show_action=false">Jul 16, 2016</a>      <a title="Ellie" class="user" name="Ellie" href="/user/show/50105236-ellie">Ellie</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50105236-ellie?shelf=queer-and-here">queer-and-here</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50105236-ellie?shelf=2016-book-release">2016-book-release</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/50105236-ellie?shelf=not-worth-the-hype">not-worth-the-hype</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1574802224" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12054025198771699211">In this book, Eadlyn realizes she is a raging bisexual and marries a girl and they live happily ever after.<br><br>Well. I wish that was what had happened. Because that would be unexpected, crazy, and Kiera Cass would receive praise beyond words and the representation would be so good. Instead, trying to be unexpected, she chose the exact person who everyone knew she would choose. Are you fucking kidding me. It was so typical. Jesus Christ. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1449291127ra/17263409.gif" width="300" height="170" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[<br>Typically when characters end up with other peop</span></span>  <span id="freeText12054025198771699211" style="display:none">In this book, Eadlyn realizes she is a raging bisexual and marries a girl and they live happily ever after.<br><br>Well. I wish that was what had happened. Because that would be unexpected, crazy, and Kiera Cass would receive praise beyond words and the representation would be so good. Instead, trying to be unexpected, she chose the exact person who everyone knew she would choose. Are you fucking kidding me. It was so typical. Jesus Christ. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1449291127ra/17263409.gif" width="300" height="170" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[<br>Typically when characters end up with other people than my choice, I grudgingly accept it. I respect their decisions and I can see where the author is coming from. But <i>Erik</i>? But I couldn't get on board. He just didn't convince me that he felt soooooo in love with her. I just. Erik? REALLY? That's the best you could do? Like, wow! NO ONE SAW THAT COMING. I'm so emotional right now because omg that was sooooooo unexpected and I was sooo shocked!!!!!!!!!!!!!<br><br>Marid was so typical douchebag. And then you have the typical female character who is bitchy and annoying just to be pitted against our leading lady who ends up turning good in the end. As for the monarchy: why bother with the coronation and the whole importance of it all if she was just going to give the power back to the people anyway? I'm sorry, she literally just said stuff and everyone was like ok that's cool! Are you joking? If the crown really held that much power Maxon and America would not have suffered as much as they did to gain control. SMH.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>My eyes can't roll back enough to put up with this bullshit. The romance was so <b>forced</b>. Don't get me wrong, I loved the Selection series because Maxon was a precious dork. But he knew how to handle himself and his relationship with America. Eadlyn says she was in love with this man while she was running around staring at other guy's faces and holding their hands. She legit has more scenes with the others than the guy she ends up with. And then she has the nerve to say Fox couldn't love her because they didn't spend that much time together when it is legit the same for the guy she chose...<br><br>I felt like she was trying to tell us the romance was soo tragic because he wasn't chosen and honestly, the only thing tragic and relatable to Romeo and Juliet this situation is how they were acting. Like teenagers who somehow loved each other because of their attraction. Jfc. She asks him what his name is like three days before she proposes. Are you joking. Maxon and America had months of buildup, three books worthy of adventures and sneaking off and everything they did together. Let me remind you 80% of the time she was with ****, she was with *****, too. I can't. I can't. I'm sorry. <br><br>P.S. Kile deserves better. Every scene with him and Eadlyn did not feel like Kiera Cass was shouting at us how in love they were. They had chemistry, they had growing attraction, the awkward love...It was natural, familiar, content, comfortable. It was real. When there was silence - It was a lovely kind of silence, and it was its own kind of important.</["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span>  <a data-text-id="12054025198771699211" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1460189782" />    <a title="Reem Ghabbany" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/15236138-reem-ghabbany"><img alt="Reem Ghabbany" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1473599867p2/15236138.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1460189782?book_show_action=false">Sep 11, 2016</a>      <a title="Reem Ghabbany" class="user" name="Reem Ghabbany" href="/user/show/15236138-reem-ghabbany">Reem Ghabbany</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1460189782" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17438023460202616631">Well, even though I enjoyed this book so much I didn't want to put it down, I can't give it 5 stars. <br />It's just not that well put together you know? The language was not intriguing and so simple which some find that a good quality but I do not. If I was my younger self I'd give this five stars and fangirl about how this ended but no. <br />Nonetheless, I loved this book and I'm hoping for a 6th book. I want to see Eadyln as a wife and a mother. <br />Her character changed so much in this book! The transition</span>  <span id="freeText17438023460202616631" style="display:none">Well, even though I enjoyed this book so much I didn't want to put it down, I can't give it 5 stars. <br />It's just not that well put together you know? The language was not intriguing and so simple which some find that a good quality but I do not. If I was my younger self I'd give this five stars and fangirl about how this ended but no. <br />Nonetheless, I loved this book and I'm hoping for a 6th book. I want to see Eadyln as a wife and a mother. <br />Her character changed so much in this book! The transition was almost unbelievable in the course of 2 months! But I don't care! <br />I'v always enjoyed Kiera class's books. They're the kind of books you go through so fast and leave you so happy. </span>  <a data-text-id="17438023460202616631" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1460189782">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1460189782" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1460189782&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1460189782'><a id="like_count_review_1460189782" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1460189782?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">18 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1460189782" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1460189782" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=18&rating[page]=4&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1460189782&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1460189782" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1460189782, true, &#39;&#39;); class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1505899350" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1505899350" />    <a title="Fadwa (Word Wonders)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/42662881-fadwa-word-wonders"><img alt="Fadwa (Word Wonders)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1467335852p2/42662881.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1505899350?book_show_action=false">Aug 19, 2016</a>      <a title="Fadwa (Word Wonders)" class="user" name="Fadwa (Word Wonders)" href="/user/show/42662881-fadwa-word-wonders">Fadwa (Word Wonders)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/42662881-fadwa-word-wonders?shelf=dislikes">dislikes</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1505899350" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14191860224378482382">Full Colorful review on my blog : <i> <b><a href="https://wordwoonders.wordpress.com/2016/08/12/the-crown-i-tried-i-really-did-at-least-now-were-done/" rel="nofollow">Word Wonders</a> </b> </i><br /><br /><b>2.5 stars</b><br /><br />This ending to The Selection series wasnU+2019t a good one friends. IU+2019m one of those firm believers that they shouldU+2019ve left it alone after the end of that first trilogy, but nooo ! Go ahead and milk that cow. ItU+2019s not all bad obviously, I enjoyed some part so IU+2019m sorry if you like this book and IU+2019m offending you, I would suggest you donU+2019t read any further though, I donU+2019t have the strength to run away from pitchforks.<br /><br />SoU+2026 We all know that the w</span>  <span id="freeText14191860224378482382" style="display:none">Full Colorful review on my blog : <i>  <b><a href="https://wordwoonders.wordpress.com/2016/08/12/the-crown-i-tried-i-really-did-at-least-now-were-done/" rel="nofollow">Word Wonders</a> </b></i><br /><br /><b>2.5 stars</b><br /><br />This ending to The Selection series wasnU+2019t a good one friends. IU+2019m one of those firm believers that they shouldU+2019ve left it alone after the end of that first trilogy, but nooo ! Go ahead and milk that cow. ItU+2019s not all bad obviously, I enjoyed some part so IU+2019m sorry if you like this book and IU+2019m offending you, I would suggest you donU+2019t read any further though, I donU+2019t have the strength to run away from pitchforks.<br /><br />SoU+2026 We all know that the writing isnU+2019t spectacular in this, it is just meh but I was okay with it because to be honest I didnU+2019t go into The Crown expecting beautiful prose. But there is a minimum to be reached if you ask me, and while it was thankfully scraping it for the most part, sometimes I just facepalmed myself.<br /><br />Moving on. I went in wanting to rate this very loosely because I didnU+2019t expect it sweep me off my feet, I just wanted a cute fairytale ending -like in The One, and even that didnU+2019t happen. The ending felt sloppy and rushed and didnU+2019t answer all the questions EadlynU+2019s books raised. Romantically speaking, the ending was a good one, she ended up with the guy I was rooting for so I was happy with that. But politics wise, the One ended with everything being in order, first The Heir messes everything up, then this one starts fixing things -we admittedly see the light at the end of the tunnel- but it is just not enough. I wanted to see what the peopleU+2019s reaction will be to the announcements she made.<br /><br />I didnU+2019t review the Heir when I read it because I wasnU+2019t blogging yet but I mentioned it in my very first wrap-up and said that I didnU+2019t like Eadlyn, not one bit. I actually hated her. But now she changed. For the better that is. She stopped being whiny, selfish and arrogant, sheU+2019s now strong and responsible willing to do anything for her family and country, and I really appreciated that change but the one thing that I wanted to slap her for is how trusting she became. She went from 0 to 100 reaaal quick and I was sure it was going to come back and bite her in the ass. Which eventually happened.<br /><br />As for the guys, I felt like the characters fell flat and were very one dimensional aside from Kile, Erik and maybe Hale who were okay. I understand that with 30 guys it is impossible to develop all of them, but with the final 5, I wouldU+2019ve like a little more depth even they ultimately werenU+2019t going to stick around, it wouldU+2019ve made her choice less obvious. I must admit that in the original trilogy, the girls were better thought out than the boys in these two final books.<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="14191860224378482382" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1683865578" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1683865578" />    <a title="Carlos." class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/34048559-carlos"><img alt="Carlos." src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1469912518p2/34048559.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1683865578?book_show_action=false">Jun 30, 2016</a>      <a title="Carlos." class="user" name="Carlos." href="/user/show/34048559-carlos">Carlos.</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/34048559-carlos?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1683865578" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14114590407075893760">A ver, me ha gustado, pero tampoco nada para echar cohetes. La verdad es que no sU+00E9 muy bien cU+00F3mo explicarme, pero lo voy a intentar.<br /><br />Este libro y el anterior me parece alargar innecesariamente la historia, pero aU+00FAn asU+00ED son libros de los que disfruto. Te mantienen pegado leyendo hasta que llegas hasta la U+00FAltima pU+00E1gina, y luego te quedas con ganas de mU+00E1s.<br /><br />AdemU+00E1s, Kiera Cass crea unos personajes que son terriblemente entraU+00F1ables y de los que te encariU+00F1as casi sin querer. A pesar de que Eadlyn me pare</span>  <span id="freeText14114590407075893760" style="display:none">A ver, me ha gustado, pero tampoco nada para echar cohetes. La verdad es que no sU+00E9 muy bien cU+00F3mo explicarme, pero lo voy a intentar.<br /><br />Este libro y el anterior me parece alargar innecesariamente la historia, pero aU+00FAn asU+00ED son libros de los que disfruto. Te mantienen pegado leyendo hasta que llegas hasta la U+00FAltima pU+00E1gina, y luego te quedas con ganas de mU+00E1s.<br /><br />AdemU+00E1s, Kiera Cass crea unos personajes que son terriblemente entraU+00F1ables y de los que te encariU+00F1as casi sin querer. A pesar de que Eadlyn me pareciese insoportable en <i>The Heir</i>, en este me ha encantado. Me ha parecido un personaje que ha madurado mucho, y que sufre mU+00E1s de lo que se ve en el otro libro. Me ha gustado ver "el lado oscuro de la fama", y para quU+00E9 os voy a engaU+00F1ar: me he encariU+00F1ado un poquejo con ella.<br /><br />No voy a decir que la trama de la historia haya sido santo de mi devociU+00F3n, pero me ha mantenido intrigado pU+00E1gina tras pU+00E1gina. Ha habido muchos plot twists que no me esperaba (aunque viniendo de Kiera Cass, deberU+00EDa haberlos esperado), que hacU+00EDan el libro mU+00E1s y mU+00E1s interesante.<br /><br />A pesar de que es el libro mU+00E1s corto de la saga, no he echado en falta mU+00E1s pU+00E1ginas. Me ha parecido una conclusiU+00F3n muy sencilla y bonita para la historia. No me ha sorprendido, pero sU+00ED me ha gustado. No sU+00E9. TambiU+00E9n me encanta el mensaje que estos libros transmiten, de luchar por tu amor verdadero y todas esas mierdas (a pesar de ser la persona mU+00E1s arromU+00E1ntica del mundo).<br /><br />En fin, que esta es una saga que a pesar de no ser ni de lejos la mejor del mundo, me gusta mucho. He sufrido y reU+00EDdo mucho con ella desde hace unos cuantos aU+00F1os ya, y la voy a echar de menos. AsU+00ED que: gracias, Kiera, por esta historia.</span>  <a data-text-id="14114590407075893760" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1435980515" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11226817171917125032">Bulgarian review: <a target="_blank" href="https://bookishipster.wordpress.com/2016/05/04/U+043A U+043E U+0440 U+043E U+043D U+0430 U+0442 U+0430-U+043E U+0442-U+043A U+0438 U+0439 U+0440 U+0430-U+043A U+0430 U+0441/" rel="nofollow">https://bookishipster.wordpress.com/2...</a><br /><br />Another one of my favourite series has come to an end. The Crown definitely did not disapoint me, i think that Kiera Cass gave us the best ending. I was so happy to see my favourite characters again and how their lives are going. Although the shortness of this book, i still loved it completely and i'm really happy with how the tables have turned, even though i expected from Eadlyn to choose other guy. The Crown was cute, really easy to re</span>  <span id="freeText11226817171917125032" style="display:none">Bulgarian review: <a target="_blank" href="https://bookishipster.wordpress.com/2016/05/04/U+043A U+043E U+0440 U+043E U+043D U+0430 U+0442 U+0430-U+043E U+0442-U+043A U+0438 U+0439 U+0440 U+0430-U+043A U+0430 U+0441/" rel="nofollow">https://bookishipster.wordpress.com/2...</a><br /><br />Another one of my favourite series has come to an end. The Crown definitely did not disapoint me, i think that Kiera Cass gave us the best ending. I was so happy to see my favourite characters again and how their lives are going. Although the shortness of this book, i still loved it completely and i'm really happy with how the tables have turned, even though i expected from Eadlyn to choose other guy. The Crown was cute, really easy to read (i mean, i basically read it in one sitting) and absolutely adorable. By the end of the book i was so close to crying from happiness, it was unreal. I'm sad that the Selection is over, but i'm curious about what are we going to see next from Kiera Cass and i'm waiting with anticipation! </span>  <a data-text-id="11226817171917125032" href="#" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20825315-jennifer?shelf=fantasy">fantasy</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20825315-jennifer?shelf=love-triangles">love-triangles</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20825315-jennifer?shelf=jens-fav-male-characters">jens-fav-male-characters</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20825315-jennifer?shelf=royalty">royalty</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20825315-jennifer?shelf=love-story">love-story</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20825315-jennifer?shelf=jen-s-2016-favorites">jen-s-2016-favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20825315-jennifer?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer937252356" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4280252830955138495">You know, this entire series has been interesting. I wanted to hate the series because of all the drama the author caused but I can't in fact... this is one of my favorites of 2016. <br /><br />I think the author FINALLY wrote a strong female lead and wrote a strong conclusion to this series. I love the power of choice and I think in a world where a lot of people do not have the right to choose it is important to see that everyone given the opportunity would choose love. <br /><br />I really enjoyed seeing the characte</span>  <span id="freeText4280252830955138495" style="display:none">You know, this entire series has been interesting. I wanted to hate the series because of all the drama the author caused but I can't in fact... this is one of my favorites of 2016. <br /><br />I think the author FINALLY wrote a strong female lead and wrote a strong conclusion to this series. I love the power of choice and I think in a world where a lot of people do not have the right to choose it is important to see that everyone given the opportunity would choose love. <br /><br />I really enjoyed seeing the characters developed & I knew about Hale. I did. Sorry but you had to see that coming ;) <br /><br />I loved this story & I thought Cass did a fantastic job writing a very good conclusion to a very popular series. I thought it was strong enough that I truly could not put this book down and that is why it has earned a right on my favorites shelf this year. </span>  <a data-text-id="4280252830955138495" href="#"   <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1674890752" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6609422233608951257">Se ha terminado esta saga que tanto me gusta y aU+00FAn no me lo puedo creer.<br />Ha sido un buen final, sin duda alguna. Me ha sorprendido mucho por donde decide tirar la autora la trama de La SelecciU+00F3n, sin embargo siento que a este libro le ha faltado algU+00FAn buen giro en el argumento a parte de ese, no sU+00E9, se me ha quedado flojo en ese sentido. Pero el resto de la historia ha sido maravillosa.<br />Sin duda, esta saga la he disfrutado muchU+00EDsimo, es una de mis favoritas y no me cansarU+00E9 de recomendarla. </span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1674890752">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1674890752" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1674890752&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1674890752'><a id="like_count_review_1674890752" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1674890752?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">14 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1674890752" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1674890752" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=14&rating[page]=4&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1674890752&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1674890752" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1674890752, true, &#39;&#39;); href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1417160076" />    <a title="Kristy Mauna" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/46855210-kristy-mauna"><img alt="Kristy Mauna" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479930841p2/46855210.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1417160076?book_show_action=false">May 10, 2016</a>      <a title="Kristy Mauna" class="user" name="Kristy Mauna" href="/user/show/46855210-kristy-mauna">Kristy Mauna</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/46855210-kristy-mauna?shelf=romantic">romantic</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/46855210-kristy-mauna?shelf=dystopian-post-apocalyptic">dystopian-post-apocalyptic</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/46855210-kristy-mauna?shelf=fairy-tale">fairy-tale</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/46855210-kristy-mauna?shelf=swoon-worthy-romances">swoon-worthy-romances</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1417160076" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6122805145152465283"><i>The Crown</i> was everything I hoped it would be, as we finally say goodbye to Illea and this grand royal family. It's full of humor, drama, and sweet romantic moments that Kiera Cass always delivers so wonderfully in her books!<br /><br />This review <b>will</b> contain spoilers, but read my <b> <a href="http://bookstacked.com/reviews/book-review/book-review-crown-kiera-cass-selection-series/" rel="nofollow">spoiler-free review here!</a> </b><br /><br /><b> <i>"And that was my hope now: that somehow duty and love would overlap, and I'd find myself happy in the middle of it all."</i> </b><br /><br />I loved this book. It was everything <i>The Heir</i> wasn't and more. I'm just a huge f</span>  <span id="freeText6122805145152465283" style="display:none"><i>The Crown</i> was everything I hoped it would be, as we finally say goodbye to Illea and this grand royal family. It's full of humor, drama, and sweet romantic moments that Kiera Cass always delivers so wonderfully in her books!<br /><br />This review <b>will</b> contain spoilers, but read my <b>  <a href="http://bookstacked.com/reviews/book-review/book-review-crown-kiera-cass-selection-series/" rel="nofollow">spoiler-free review here!</a></b><br /><br /><b>  <i>"And that was my hope now: that somehow duty and love would overlap, and I'd find myself happy in the middle of it all."</i></b><br /><br />I loved this book. It was everything <i>The Heir</i> wasn't and more. I'm just a huge fan of this series and I've always gone into these books with no expectations because they are pure entertainment for me. The ending to this series did not disappoint me though.<br /><br />Eadlyn has completely grown up and matured since America's health scare. Was anyone else happy that America got through that nasty heart attack? I was so nervous after <i>The Heir</i>'s ending! I almost wished Kiera Cass had stopped writing these books if she just planned to have something so horrible happen to America. . but I'm glad nothing did.<br /><br />Now that Eadlyn has been named regent while Maxon stays by America's side as she recovers (seriously so sweet !!), she's ready to take care of business. Her first task is to slim down her suitors to the Elite, and I was actually relieved that she did. I wanted to get to know the boys I actually liked a little better. I was happy to see she kept both Kile and Henri (only because Erik was his translator), and maybe a little happy she kept Hale also!<br /><br />As soon as that is taken care of, it was nice to see how Eadlyn managed to tackle her new job so great. I really enjoyed seeing more politics throughout the story. I'm glad we got more backstory on what happened when Maxon became king and how the caste system fell. It all blended together well.<br /><br /><b>  <i>"I was surrounded by examples of how love, real love, could make you less bothered by your circumstances, whether it was facing the greatest disappointment of your life or shouldering the weight of a country."</i></b><br /><br />All of Eadlyn's dates were adorable, when she did have time for them, and I enjoyed all the romance woven into the story. I was rooting for Kile since <i>The Heir</i>, but once I saw more of Eady and Erik.. Well, I couldn't help but fall in love with them. Erik was just so sweet and loved her for who she was. . . How could I not love that?<br /><br />Like I said, Eadlyn truly grows up in this book. At the end of the last book I actually saw her appreciating the things/people around her more, so her character development didn't surprise me at all. She was lovely even when she did make mistakes because she knew what she did wrong, and she wasn't afraid to admit that. Who she was in this book made me appreciate who she was in the last.<br /><br /><b>  <i>"I'm telling you, Eady, wars and treaties and even countries will all come and go. But your life is yours, singular and sacred, and you should be with the person who makes it feel that way every blessed second you live it."</i></b><br /><br />I was happy to see the growth of all of Eadlyn's relationships with everyone in her life, not just her family and the Elite, but her friendships with Neena and even Josie. I think her relationships helped us see how much she has always loved those around her, especially the people of Illea.<br /><br /><b><i>"I'm fine."</i> She rolled her eyes as they headed off the stage.<br /><i>"Are you sure? We could have dinner brought up to our room."<br />"So help me, if you do that, I will throw it at you."</i></b><br /><br />MAXON AND AMERICA! I love them, forever. I just loved how they were finally acting more like themselves in this book. There were definitely more family moments and I loved every minute of them! I was happy to see Ahren come home and apologize, although I wish we saw him apologize to America, but I was just happy to see him again. I loved all the moments between Eadlyn, Osten, and Kaden as well. I'm going to miss them! :(<br /><br /><b>  <i>"You are everything to everyone. And infinitely more to me."</i></b><br /><br />The ending was great! Cass's books are always fun, light reads and this one was just as wonderful as the first 3 books in this series. There were swoon-worthy moments, tear-filled moments, and happily ever afters. I'm really happy with who Eadlyn chose to be with and how the future looks bright for the people of Illea.<br /><br />Overall, I really enjoyed this book. I wish we got a little more at the end or even throughout the book. I'm happy it didn't drag out but I still could've used a little more detail. I want to know more about Aspen and Lucy's future, what happened to the Elite after they left the palace, and more about Neena's life now.. I would've loved to see the wedding too! Who doesn't love weddings?!<br /><br />If you're a fan of this series I think you'll be happy and ready to finally say goodbye to this wonderful world Kiera Cass created for us! Ok.. Actually just one more novella and I'll be ready to say goodbye for good. . . :)</span>  <a data-text-id="6122805145152465283" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1417160076">  <td colspan="2">    <div </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1029975304" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1029975304" />    <a title="Michelle" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/22195799-michelle"><img alt="Michelle" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1466449168p2/22195799.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1029975304?book_show_action=false">May 04, 2016</a>      <a title="Michelle" class="user" name="Michelle" href="/user/show/22195799-michelle">Michelle</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1029975304" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13570522207292452388">4.5 stars<br /><br />The Crown was an excellent ending to a really great series. I have so many things to say so I will just get right to it...<br /><br />For those who hated Eadlyn in The Heir, I would strongly recommend reading The Crown. Eadlyn really changes in this one. She grows up. She breaks down. She is more vulnerable, more compassionate and caring. She find herself having a newfound confidence without being a snob or a brat. I genuinely loved her in this book. I was really rooting for her. I am very happy fo</span>  <span id="freeText13570522207292452388" style="display:none">4.5 stars<br /><br />The Crown was an excellent ending to a really great series. I have so many things to say so I will just get right to it...<br /><br />For those who hated Eadlyn in The Heir, I would strongly recommend reading The Crown. Eadlyn really changes in this one. She grows up. She breaks down. She is more vulnerable, more compassionate and caring. She find herself having a newfound confidence without being a snob or a brat. I genuinely loved her in this book. I was really rooting for her. I am very happy for her and I am super proud of her growth. <br /><br />The one thing everyone wants to know is who she picked but I'm not going to say who it is. I will say I was very happy with her choice. However, I will say one thing that kind of bothered me a little. I only wish she and her chosen man would have had some more scenes together. I understand she has 7 of the Selected she has to get to know and a country to run but I didn't absolutely feel like their love was completely believable at first. They had fantastic moments but I did need some more time for them to be with each other before I was really caught up in their romance. I am totally satisfied with her choice, don't get me wrong, but it felt a tiny bit rushed at times. However, by the end I could see why they fell in love with each other and I could celebrate with her and her man. <br /><br />In the first book, as Eadlyn didn't really care about the Selection nor was taking it very seriously so we didn't really get to know her suitors. I'm really enjoyed getting to know them all so much more in this one. I can say that all of them are really great, like I seriously could have accepted whomever she chose in the end. <br /><br />The romance, although is the main part of this book, I actually enjoyed seeing Eadlyn with her family and friends. We see America and Maxon being the absolute cutest and most devoted couple ever. We see Aspen and Lucy being strong despite their tragic struggles. Then we have her brothers who love her so much. Lady Brice and Neena as so loyal and hardworking, I just adore them both. She wouldn't have been able to be a queen without these people. Even those in the Selection became her friends and supported her. It was just so wonderful to see her support system go to work. <br /><br />We have a new villain. I won't say who because I don't want to spoil the surprise but the said person can go to hell. Ew. Ugh. I do not like this person. I thought I did but nope. Its all gone now. The person is a serious problem but Eadlyn takes out the trash by the end. <br /><br />There is something that came as a huge surprise for me. I didn't see it coming. It has nothing to do with Eadlyn and everything to do with Maxon and his father. I was shocked and speechless with anger. I can't even think about it too much or I will freak out. Nonetheless I need to get it off my chest so I can move on. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ We all hate Clarkson, right? He was a cruel father and a questionable husband but the one thing, the one redeeming quality he had was that he cared so much for his wife. He was devoted to her. Or at least that's what I thought until Maxon told Eadlyn about his father's mistress. Yes. Mistress. I couldn't believe it at first but then I remembered that Clarkson was always a greedy, selfish and heartless bastard. HOW COULD HE DO THAT TO AMBERLY??!! She was the MOST devoted wife in the world. She worshipped the ground he walked on and he cheats on her. He did seem to be guilty as see in some of his actions towards to Amberly but then if he felt so guilty why didn't he stop seeing his mistress?! I was so pissed. Then I felt horribly sad for Amberly because if she knew, she would have died from heartbreak. She deserved SO MUCH BETTER. Then we find out Maxon has a half-sister. Thank god she is nothing like her parents and a completely wonderful human being. Rant done.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />On a happier note, I am impressed by Eadlyn's growth, I adore seeing old and new characters working together and I love the finale to the Selection series. The book moved so fast for me, especially at the end, not like rushed but so much was happening that I just had to finish it as soon as possible. I cried tears of sadness and tears of joy and I want to thank Kiera Cass for introducing these characters to her readers. Although I have had my moments of anger and frustration for some of the characters' actions (I'm looking at you America), I know I am perfectly happy to have these books on my shelf where I can return to them one day to look at the struggles of finding love but knowing it is all worth it in the end. <br /><br />Note: I really need another epilogue because I need to see more of these characters even for a little bit. </span>  <a data-text-id="13570522207292452388" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1175211953" />    <a title="Muse-ic" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/36574090-muse-ic"><img alt="Muse-ic" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1472485984p2/36574090.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1175211953?book_show_action=false">Jun 28, 2016</a>      <a title="Muse-ic" class="user" name="Muse-ic" href="/user/show/36574090-muse-ic">Muse-ic</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/36574090-muse-ic?shelf=not-released">not-released</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/36574090-muse-ic?shelf=dystopian">dystopian</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/36574090-muse-ic?shelf=royalty-and-or-celebrities">royalty-and-or-celebrities</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1175211953" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8954088940329373903">2.75<br>I'm disappointed.<br>I went in with really low expectations, but I'm still disappointed.<br><br>I'm not disappointed with the events that happened per se, but the way they were written.<br>The entire book was flat! I didn't get a rise or emotion out of anything. I was <i>bored</i>!<br><br>I liked Eadlyn much more in this book. She did a lot of maturing since the last book. She is no longer that I'm-better-than-you brat as much because she made an effort to understand and connect with others.<br><br>Jumping into the book was weird</span>  <span id="freeText8954088940329373903" style="display:none">2.75<br>I'm disappointed.<br>I went in with really low expectations, but I'm still disappointed.<br><br>I'm not disappointed with the events that happened per se, but the way they were written.<br>The entire book was flat! I didn't get a rise or emotion out of anything. I was <i>bored</i>!<br><br>I liked Eadlyn much more in this book. She did a lot of maturing since the last book. She is no longer that I'm-better-than-you brat as much because she made an effort to understand and connect with others.<br><br>Jumping into the book was weird. It just started. No prep, no easing into it. Just BOOM! Middle of the chapter.<br><br>Also I'm just going to put it out there that I was extremely disappointed with the cover. All the other covers were downright mesmerizing!<br>....Then there was <i>The Crown</i>....<br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1467129734i/19556099._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1467129734i/19556100._SX540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Why is she staring down the camera?<br>In all the other covers, the model's face was artfully hidden in a way that left a little bit to the imagination and made it a little mysterious. I'd definitely prefer it that way!<br>The model is not ugly in any way. She's actually very pretty, but this cover is rather unflattering and didn't do her justice. <br><br><br><b>Spoilers from here on out!</b><br><br><br>The Lady Brice thing was interesting. I really liked her. <br>I'm actually glad the Cass put that in because it seemed strange that we had never heard of or seen Clarkson in his mighty sh*tiness cheating on his wife.<br>And we <i>all</i> knew there was no way he'd be faithful to Amberly....poor Amberly!<br>Seriously <i>WHAT</i> did she see in Clarkson?<br>I swear she'll like a goddamned Disney Snow White: <i>Oh, he's sooo handsome and he's a royal! He's definitely my true looove!</i><br>No.<br>Just. No.<br><br><br>The romance was so <i>meh</i> and not swoon-worthy.<br>Kiera Cass usually knows how to make me swoon. Maxon is one of my absolute favorite book boyfriends and I <i>always</i> swoon over him!<br>Eikko (Erik) could have been totally swoon-worthy too, but he just wasn't!<br>He was extremely sweet and all, but there was barely enough interaction between him and Eadlyn to serve as a solid foundation for their "soulmates" status.<br>And Eadlyn was like <i>I love him, he's my soulmate</i> but there wasn't enough between them for it to even get to that point! And, like, zero chemistry!<br>Like they were mildly friends, then they skipped to soulmates!<br>You can't just have a hamburger with two buns!<br><b>Where's the meat, bruh?</b> And the lettuce and tomatoes and fromage and mayonnaise??<br>The only thing within this romantic sandwich was one measly slice of ham!<br>(This may or may not be an metaphor of my current state of hunger)<br><br>Hale and Ean? Really? Interesting twist, I guess.<br><br>I actually enjoyed Josie in this one! And Grandma Singer is the best!<br><br>The Marid issue was strange. It felt a tad forced because we didn't haven't any big conflicts, so the author needed to add something. Perhaps it was just a method to justify the extremely quick ending, how Eadlyn's deadline for picking a suitor went from two weeks to two days, thereby cutting off between 50 and 100 pages from the book in which the fixing of the government could have been and <i>should</i> have been explained.<br>As a dystopian book, <i>The Crown</i> definitely should have focused more on the world, not mainly the romance.<br><br>I honestly would have preferred the book(s) to be in Ahren's perspective because he seemed to have a deeper and more realistic romantic tale to tell. <br>Alas, 'tis not the case.<br></span>  <a data-text-id="8954088940329373903" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1175211953">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1175211953" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1175211953&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1175211953'><a id="like_count_review_1175211953" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1175211953?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">14 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1175211953" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1175211953" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=14&rating[page]=4&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1175211953&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1175211953" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1175211953, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">4 comments</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1175211953?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=4">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1175211953' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1175211953/comments?reverse=true">View all 4 comments</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1175211953' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1175211953, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div></div><div class="uitext" style="float: right; class="section firstReview">      <div id="review_1437319374" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1437319374" />    <a title="Jana" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/22625902-jana"><img alt="Jana" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1470403660p2/22625902.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1437319374?book_show_action=false">May 07, 2016</a>      <a title="Jana" class="user" name="Jana" href="/user/show/22625902-jana">Jana</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22625902-jana?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22625902-jana?shelf=need-to-read-soon">need-to-read-soon</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22625902-jana?shelf=anticipated-releases-of-2016">anticipated-releases-of-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/22625902-jana?shelf=favorites-read-in-2016">favorites-read-in-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1437319374" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13498484470481072861"><blockquote> <blockquote><i>U+201CI clutched my chest, feeling my heart racing. U+201CYou treacherous, treacherous thing. What have you done?U+201D</i></blockquote> The same question goes to this book - what have you done? I feel like a part of me died a little with the very last page I had read. It can't be the end, no. This series has become such a huge part of my life and now that there is definitely no more books about its world coming, I really don't know what to do, I'm getting really emotional. But I guess the end is not really a goodbye - we sti</blockquote></span>  <span id="freeText13498484470481072861" style="display:none"><blockquote><blockquote><i>U+201CI clutched my chest, feeling my heart racing. U+201CYou treacherous, treacherous thing. What have you done?U+201D</i></blockquote> The same question goes to this book - what have you done? I feel like a part of me died a little with the very last page I had read. It can't be the end, no. This series has become such a huge part of my life and now that there is definitely no more books about its world coming, I really don't know what to do, I'm getting really emotional. But I guess the end is not really a goodbye - we still have the books and the story lives within its pages and within us.<br><blockquote><i>U+201C...no matter if and when they parted, they would never be separated. Not really.U+201D</i></blockquote>This book can easily be described in two great words that I live for when reading a book -<b> character development</b>. In <i>The Heir</i>, we were introduce to a spoiled, selfish and pretentious princess, a daughter of our beloved Maxon and America. To be honest, it didn't bother me that much that she was the way that she was, but sure as hell she wasn't one of my favorite character either. And now that has changed - she is now definitely one of my favorite characters I read about. She has become a selfless, strong young woman, trying to make up for all the stupid mistakes she had made. <br>I loved that the book was concentrated on her pulling down the walls she had pulled up around herself, on her growing as a person.<blockquote> <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1462636735ra/19024467.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1462636735ra/19024468.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1462636736ra/19024469.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1462636736ra/19024470.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></blockquote><br>The Selection that she held happened to finish differently from how it was supposed to, and I guess that that was a family trait. When I first found out who was she going to pick, because I had spoiled it to myself obviously, I was not very happy about it. But as I got to know the story, I was happy how it turned out and I grew to love the character she chose. Who am I to be mad about my initial ship not being able to sail? <br><blockquote><i>U+201CMaybe it's not the first kisses that are supposed to be special. Maybe it's the last ones.U+201D</i><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1462637952i/19024653._SY540_.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></blockquote><br>Now I can't get out of my head song <a href="https://youtu.be/xLPGtQoRUbk" rel="nofollow">The One</a> by Kodaline, it just reminds me of this whole series and especially my newfound ship.<br>All in all, this was such a great conclusion to a series, everything wrapped up so nicely and everyone got their happily ever after, and that is why I love this series so much - it always makes me happy and it always in the end makes me smile. <blockquote><i>U+201CYou have to do whatever it takes to be with the person you love.U+201D </i></blockquote> <b>Thank you, Kiera Cass, for creating this amazing world and for writing amazing stories within it.<br><br><br><br><br><br><br><br></b></blockquote></span>  <a data-text-id="13498484470481072861" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1278194208" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1278194208" />    <a title="Denia Books and BaublesU+00AE" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/30036140-denia-books-and-baubles"><img alt="Denia Books and BaublesU+00AE" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1461167356p2/30036140.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1278194208?book_show_action=false">May 09, 2016</a>      <a title="Denia Books and BaublesU+00AE" class="user" name="Denia Books and BaublesU+00AE" href="/user/show/30036140-denia-books-and-baubles">Denia Books and BaublesU+00AE</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <div>    <span class="greyText">Recommended to Denia Books and BaublesU+00AE by: </span>      13 years old and up  </div>          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30036140-denia-books-and-baubles?shelf=books-to-go-crazy-about">books-to-go-crazy-about</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30036140-denia-books-and-baubles?shelf=teenage-romance">teenage-romance</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30036140-denia-books-and-baubles?shelf=i-like-them">i-like-them</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30036140-denia-books-and-baubles?shelf=books-i-have">books-i-have</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30036140-denia-books-and-baubles?shelf=need-to-own">need-to-own</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1278194208" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4495977397045789961">4/5 stars.<br /><br />Eadlyn Schreave continues her story on "The Crown" where the choices she has to make will not only dictate her future, but her present as well. Since her mother is under medical care, her father has chosen to stay by America's side through her process; now, is Eadlyn's duty as a princess and future Queen of Illea to take care of her family, the selection and of her country.<br /><br />I really enjoyed Kiera Cass' writing style, I think it was appropriate for the "time" that the book was written on</span>  <span id="freeText4495977397045789961" style="display:none">4/5 stars.<br /><br />Eadlyn Schreave continues her story on "The Crown" where the choices she has to make will not only dictate her future, but her present as well. Since her mother is under medical care, her father has chosen to stay by America's side through her process; now, is Eadlyn's duty as a princess and future Queen of Illea to take care of her family, the selection and of her country.<br /><br />I really enjoyed Kiera Cass' writing style, I think it was appropriate for the "time" that the book was written on. It was simple and easy, nothing to hard to understand. This book is more clean (romance wise) than her first three books, I would definitely recommend this book to teens from 13 years old and up. I did felt like she rushed us through her story though. The characters were well described in the context of the book; however, the book itself is very short and with a lot of space between chapters--I wish she could've prolonged the story and give us a little bit more of description regarding the characters.<br /><br /> I felt like Eadlyn's character in this book is more humble towards everyone, and I really appreciate her change of personality. In "The Heir" she was really harsh towards everyone in her court, even her family. But in this one we get to see a change of heart--sort of. I did enjoy seeing how she acted towards the members of the council, she doesn't take BS from anyone, and I think that is a good quality to have when you are becoming queen of a country. But, since everything that happen with her mom, her brother, and well now with the rest of the selection is good to see her more humble towards them, and I believe that her change of heart made her see who was the best choice for her on the selection.<br /><br />Now, her prince consort wasn't a surprise for me. I kind of saw that happening in "The Heir" I won't spoil it for you, but her choice is going to blow your mind.<br /><br />Overall, I gave this book a 4/5 stars just because I wish she could've describe better the relationship between the Eadlyn and her prince consort. I felt like she didn't give us enough insight on their relationship--bringing the book to an end way too soon. However, this book is short and simple, nothing overbearing and not too many issues to overcome. I would definitely recommend this series if you haven't read it, it will consume your body, soul and mind. <br /><br />If you guys want to see my video review of this book, I'm going to leave a link down below:<br /><a target="_blank" href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w05DNGEFjR0&feature=gp-n-y&google_comment_id=z13eu1i5ttqfw1sfk225wv1p4xrnzpzff" rel="nofollow">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w05DN...</a><br /><br />And my blog review is here: <a target="_blank" href="https://deniareads.wordpress.com/2016/05/08/non-spoiler-book-review-the-crown-by-kiera-cass/" rel="nofollow">https://deniareads.wordpress.com/2016...</a></span>  <a data-text-id="4495977397045789961" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1278194208">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1278194208" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1278194208&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1278194208'><a id="like_count_review_1278194208" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1278194208?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">18 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1278194208" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1278194208" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=18&rating[page]=5&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1278194208&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1278194208" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1278194208, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1278194208?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=5">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1278194208' style='display: none;'></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1278194208' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1278194208, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1358524238" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1358524238" />    <a title="Kiki" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4074594-kiki"><img alt="Kiki" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1434086735p2/4074594.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1358524238?book_show_action=false">Aug 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Kiki" class="user" name="Kiki" href="/user/show/4074594-kiki">Kiki</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer1358524238&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1358524238" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11345010158972575244">I bloody loved this, for the same reason I loved the original trilogy: it's so entertaining. I think it took me under 3 hours to get through it, and that's reading at a comfortable pace with many distractions. It's the sort of book that gives and gives and asks for nothing back.<br /><br />The only problem I had with it is that the ending was bullshit, because it was so rushed, and could the author not have just added maybe another 50 pages just to sand off the rough corners? Everybody gets about a sentence</span>  <span id="freeText11345010158972575244" style="display:none">I bloody loved this, for the same reason I loved the original trilogy: it's so entertaining. I think it took me under 3 hours to get through it, and that's reading at a comfortable pace with many distractions. It's the sort of book that gives and gives and asks for nothing back.<br /><br />The only problem I had with it is that the ending was bullshit, because it was so rushed, and could the author not have just added maybe another 50 pages just to sand off the rough corners? Everybody gets about a sentence to clip closed the end of their story, but that's not enough. Could we not have seen the wedding? Or at least had a "five years later" epilogue? I hate five years later epilogues, because they're cheesy as fuck and never pulled off properly, but it would have been better than, "I'm marrying Eikko, let's have a prime minister, END SCENE". Like, really? How incredibly base and undignified.<br /><br />With all said and done, though, the best part of this book was Eadlyn. She's a rude-ass beotch with a bug up her ass but she's realistic as hell. I've met people like her in real life. You know those heroines in YA who are just so fucking perfect and universally loved and really just big pieces of cardboard for the heroes to swoon over? That's not Eadlyn. She's an entitled fucking arsehole but she had a really, really strong voice. I loved this about her.<br /><br />I could blah blah blah about America and Maxon but they're my baes, so who cares. You already know that. I was so over everyone else (did you guys think that Marlee was a total fucking train wreck in this book? Like what the shit? Girlfriend needs to simmer the fuck down and stop greeting) but America and Maxon are my sweet summer children. I'm okay with that.<br /><br />It's not that I'm sad this is over, because I felt that the last two books were just add-ons anyway. They were super unnecessary but SHIT if I did not enjoy the crap out of them. What better praise is there to give?</span>  <a data-text-id="11345010158972575244" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1358524238">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1358524238" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1358524238&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1358524238'><a id="like_count_review_1358524238" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1358524238?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">81 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1358524238" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1358524238" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=81&rating[page]=5&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1358524238&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1358524238" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1358524238, true, &#39;&#39;); class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1308303599" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1308303599" />    <a title="Kezia Miller" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/27350731-kezia-miller"><img alt="Kezia Miller" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478502422p2/27350731.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1308303599?book_show_action=false">Jul 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Kezia Miller" class="user" name="Kezia Miller" href="/user/show/27350731-kezia-miller">Kezia Miller</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27350731-kezia-miller?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer1308303599&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1308303599" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11358843813304878064">Oh I'm a mess right now. I've loved the Selection Series so much and it will probably remain my favourite series for my whole life. Thank you, Kiera for creating such an incredible world that I love to escape to. I don't know what I'm supposed to do know because it's over and I'm not ready for it to be over. I cried and laughed and gasped all throughout this book but it was perfect and I wouldn't change it all. I wanted Eadlyn to choose Kile but by the end of it I was totally Team Erik/Eikko so</span>  <span id="freeText11358843813304878064" style="display:none">Oh I'm a mess right now. I've loved the Selection Series so much and it will probably remain my favourite series for my whole life. Thank you, Kiera for creating such an incredible world that I love to escape to. I don't know what I'm supposed to do know because it's over and I'm not ready for it to be over. I cried and laughed and gasped all throughout this book but it was perfect and I wouldn't change it all. I wanted Eadlyn to choose Kile but by the end of it I was totally Team Erik/Eikko so I was happy with the ending. I cried so hard when she said goodbye to Eikko and Kile because I never wanted her to marry Henri. I really want to read the epilogue for The Crown but it's only available in the Barnes & Noble edition and they don't have them in Canada :( I have no idea what to read after this because it was so spectacular and just beautiful. I give this a 5/5 stars and everybody needs to read it. Eadlyn's character development was done very well from the beginning of The Heir until the end of The Crown. That book trailer really made me think that America had died. Thank goodness that she didn't I wouldn't have ever survived if that did happen. I was not expecting what happened to Hale and Ean to happen. And that plot twist at the end, I can't believe Maxon has a stepsister and Eadlyn has an aunt from that side of the family. I loved Lady (Aunt) Brice and was thrilled about the ending. I also loved that Josie finally clued into that a princess' life isn't full of parties and ball gowns and a lot of actual work. I loved this series and this book and no one can change my mind about that. Just thank you Kiera! I can't wait to read what you write next but until then I will reread this again many more times.</span>  <a data-text-id="11358843813304878064" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1308303599">  <td To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer1553190504&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1553190504" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1738761544951880499">3.5/5 Stars<br /><br />I have to start by saying this is probably my least favorite in this series.<br /><br />Summary:<br />Eadlyn and kingdom are all recovering from her mother's unforeseen heart attack. She still has young suitors in the Selection vying for her attention. With her father constantly at her mother's side, someone has to help rule the kingdom. But can she do it while picking a husband as well? <br /><br />Dislikes:<br />This was far shorter than the other books and it felt rushed. I didn't get the emotional connection that I</span>  <span id="freeText1738761544951880499" style="display:none">3.5/5 Stars<br /><br />I have to start by saying this is probably my least favorite in this series.<br /><br />Summary:<br />Eadlyn and kingdom are all recovering from her mother's unforeseen heart attack. She still has young suitors in the Selection vying for her attention. With her father constantly at her mother's side, someone has to help rule the kingdom. But can she do it while picking a husband as well? <br /><br />Dislikes:<br />This was far shorter than the other books and it felt rushed. I didn't get the emotional connection that I had with the others. <br /><br />Likes:<br />Eric is great, I have been cheering for him since the beginning. I really loved how the guys all progressed and played more pivotal roles this time around. They had wonderful personalities and some small quirks that I didn't see coming. <br /><br />Overall:<br />I enjoyed the book and am glad I read this because I have a huge soft spot for this series. But... If I ever reread them it will most likely be just the first three books. Those had the best characters and world building. This book concludes the series to one of the best bachelor type books ever. </span>  <a data-text-id="1738761544951880499" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>
