class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1500765138" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1500765138" />    <a title="Olga" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/20291301-olga"><img alt="Olga" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1456141738p2/20291301.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1500765138?book_show_action=false">Jun 12, 2016</a>      <a title="Olga" class="user" name="Olga" href="/user/show/20291301-olga">Olga</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9788416498147" href="/book/show/27557581-la-corona">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1500765138" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14176566628864393041">Voy a ser muy critica con este libro, creo que las editoriales y los autores no saben cuando parar y solo saben hacer mas libros que destrozan los buenos recuerdos que tienes de una saga, como es el caso...<br /><br />Eadlyn no ha conseguido cautivarme, solo he visto una pobre niU+00F1a rica con demasiados complejos y poco cerebro... no madura, le viene muy grande el puesto de su padre y no le llega ni a la alltura de los zapatos a America...<br /><br />El libro en si es un desproposito, personajes que no tienen ni pies ni</span>  <span id="freeText14176566628864393041" style="display:none">Voy a ser muy critica con este libro, creo que las editoriales y los autores no saben cuando parar y solo saben hacer mas libros que destrozan los buenos recuerdos que tienes de una saga, como es el caso...<br /><br />Eadlyn no ha conseguido cautivarme, solo he visto una pobre niU+00F1a rica con demasiados complejos y poco cerebro... no madura, le viene muy grande el puesto de su padre y no le llega ni a la alltura de los zapatos a America...<br /><br />El libro en si es un desproposito, personajes que no tienen ni pies ni cabeza y que parecen clones masculinos de los libros originales y la historia de amor, donde esta?? en que momento me la he perdido???. No he visto ni rastro del amor que se procesan, solo mucho vestido para estar estupenda y resaltar mas mi belleza natural... "es como lo de no se que vestido ponerme"...<br /><br />Lo dicho una pena que la autora deje tan mal sabor de boca con una saga que fue todo un acierto por su originalidad como por la historia de amor entre America y Madoxx... y como siempre digo , para gustos, los colores!!!</span>  <a data-text-id="14176566628864393041" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>   <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1327978611?book_show_action=false">Jun 15, 2016</a>      <a title="Darren Hagan aka snazzlebooks" class="user" name="Darren Hagan aka snazzlebooks" href="/user/show/34101852-darren-hagan-aka-snazzlebooks">Darren Hagan aka snazzlebooks</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780062458865" href="/book/show/26198897-the-crown">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1327978611" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4921838651476960662">**No spoilers**<br /><br />I knew it! I noticed it from their first conversation! Do I care that it was obvious? Not in the slightest. I genuinely loved all the moments they shared together and was so happy with the end result.<br /><br />Eadlyn's character changed so much through these 2 books and the things she was willing to do for her country were definitely admirable. She's amazing. I love her haha. I really liked her relationships with the remaining guys and the bonds they all shared with each other too.<br /><br />There cou</span>  <span id="freeText4921838651476960662" style="display:none">**No spoilers**<br /><br />I knew it! I noticed it from their first conversation! Do I care that it was obvious? Not in the slightest. I genuinely loved all the moments they shared together and was so happy with the end result.<br /><br />Eadlyn's character changed so much through these 2 books and the things she was willing to do for her country were definitely admirable. She's amazing. I love her haha. I really liked her relationships with the remaining guys and the bonds they all shared with each other too.<br /><br />There could definitely have been more to this book however. A longer epilogue would have been appreciated, it was literally like half a page that didn't add all that much. I liked the "6 years later" bonus epilogue thing I read online but it still left some stuff unexplained. I would've liked some idea of how the changes she made at the end were received by the people of IllU+00E9a, and how the lives of the elite turned out. <br /><br />On the whole I really enjoyed it and I will definitely probably reread the series at some point in the future when I'm in the mood for something fun.</span>  <a data-text-id="4921838651476960662" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1327978611"> id="reviewTextContainer1637016566" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3133827944839557973"><b> 4.5 Stars </b><br /><br />I'm so happy that this series has finally come to an end, and a nice ending at that. Seeing Eadlyn mature as not just a character but a Queen as well was incredibly great to see, she wasn't that annoying Teen like she was in The Heir. She owned who she was and proved she was something Fierce. I'm so happy with who she ended up with, because even I would have chosen him. But that said, I wish there was more of America and Maxon. They hardly appeared in the book when it came to all the</span>  <span id="freeText3133827944839557973" style="display:none"><b> 4.5 Stars </b><br /><br />I'm so happy that this series has finally come to an end, and a nice ending at that. Seeing Eadlyn mature as not just a character but a Queen as well was incredibly great to see, she wasn't that annoying Teen like she was in The Heir. She owned who she was and proved she was something Fierce. I'm so happy with who she ended up with, because even I would have chosen him. But that said, I wish there was more of America and Maxon. They hardly appeared in the book when it came to all the important Selection parts, but overall it was a nice ending. <br /><br />Let's just hope that Kiera doesn't add another 2 books on to this series. </span>  <a data-text-id="3133827944839557973" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons"> U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1435401928" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1435401928" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1630432235" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1630432235" />    <a title="Esa Khairina" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/15871360-esa-khairina"><img alt="Esa Khairina" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1357457360p2/15871360.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1630432235?book_show_action=false">May 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Esa Khairina" class="user" name="Esa Khairina" href="/user/show/15871360-esa-khairina">Esa Khairina</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1630432235" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4914235557552643991">What I wanted before reading The Crown:<br />1. Eadlyn to stop being useless, self-centered prick.<br />2. Readers to be shown what exactly all the works Eadlyn and the royal family had been up to.<br />3. The whole plot to stop being so stupid.<br /><br />What I wanted after finishing The Crown:<br />1. My money and energy and time back.<br />2. An eyedrop to cool my burning eyes.<br /><br />I didn't know why I kept continuing this book. I didn't know why I kept reassuring myself, "It will get better," and continuing reading despite the previous p</span>  <span id="freeText4914235557552643991" style="display:none">What I wanted before reading The Crown:<br />1. Eadlyn to stop being useless, self-centered prick.<br />2. Readers to be shown what exactly all the works Eadlyn and the royal family had been up to.<br />3. The whole plot to stop being so stupid.<br /><br />What I wanted after finishing The Crown:<br />1. My money and energy and time back.<br />2. An eyedrop to cool my burning eyes.<br /><br />I didn't know why I kept continuing this book. I didn't know why I kept reassuring myself, "It will get better," and continuing reading despite the previous pages had proven the opposite. Perhaps so I could write this review.<br /><br />Okay. Where should I begin.<br /><br />As a college student majoring International Relations, I am so ashamed and outraged that every characters in this book clearly don't know how to run a country. Doesn't mean I know how, but every single things they do are beyond common sense.<br /><br />For instance, take a look at what Eadlyn does to Sir Coddly. NOT ONLY HIS NAME IS STUPID AND COMPLETE RUBBISH, I DON'T EVEN REMEMBER SHE MENTIONS WHAT POSITION HE HOLDS. She mentions that, "He does something with pens and papers." UM EXCUSE ME? Anyway, Sir Coddly is her adviser of some sort, and he advises Eadlyn to rage war on France for Ahren's betrayal. She inclines to do so, stating that, "This is not treason. This is love."<br /><br />My ass.<br /><br />YOU JUST COULDN'T SAY THAT TO YOUR ADVISER, YOU WITCH! If you've watched The King's Speech, one of my most memorable line is, "We are not family. We are firm." Spoken by Colin Firth as Duke of York to his currently reigned king father. Your family is a firm if you're born into royalty. And to say that, "This is not treason. This is LOVE," to justify your brother's act of leaving a country behind is not a royal thing to say.<br /><br />And after that, Eadlyn fires Sir Coddly. BECAUSE SHE DISAGREES WITH HIS OPINION. That's. Not. How. You. Fucking. Run. A. Country. You. Dumbass. Imagine if all world-leaders constantly fire someone they don't like for personal reasons. What a more stupid, chaotic world we would live in.<br /><br />The idiocy goes on. Eadlyn offers to ascend because her mother's health is getting worse. Again, it seems like Kiera Cass doesn't know how monarchy works: you have to die before giving your heir your throne. First, the ruler of the country is MAXON, not America, and he's well and very much alive and still young. Second, I CAN'T FUCKING BELIEVE HE LET HIS UNSTABLE 18 YO RUN HIS COUNTRY AT A GREAT TIME OF CRISIS. Maxon, you clearly have no backbone. Gone was every respect I worshipped to you in the first three installments of the series.<br /><br />So, that is the worst. The final stupidity is that Eadlyn finally chooses Erik or Eikko, Henri's translator, and gives her speech and propose. Protests rise among the crowds, and Maxon replies, "Why are you yelling at me, you fools? She's your queen, for goodness's sake. Ask her."<br /><br />Omg.<br /><br />So, in a book where royalty is the subject, we will expect a great deal of politics to be played, right? I assure you, there is none. This is not a fiction about politics. This is a fiction about silly romance and stupid balls and who wears the gaudiest dress.<br /><br />From time to time, we are not shown how Eadlyn runs her country. She spends time battling her eyelashes to the suitors, joking with her brothers, coddling with her parents, complaining about her new maid, worrying what should she say in front of the camera, yadda yadda. I don't even have a fucking idea about what kind of test conducted to the suitors. Surely, if you're picking for a partner to run a country with, there must be some kind of fit and proper test, right? If I were Eadlyn, I would demand them to do some social projects and go on tour to see how the projects are going. BECAUSE THAT'S HOW YOU KNOW YOUR PARTNER IS GOOD FOR YOU TO RUN A COUNTRY WITH: by seeing how much he loves the society and how willing he is to rebuild it, not by seeing how good he is at making you laugh. You should rent a jester instead.<br /><br />My final thought: after spending a faor amount of quality time with Kestrel and Feyre, Eadlyn ruins my reading mood. This book is utter disappointment. Excuse me, I'd better rub my eyes with ice cubes right now.</span>  <a data-text-id="4914235557552643991" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1631342826" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1631342826" />    <a title="laurooou" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/19630779-laurooou"><img alt="laurooou" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1426653496p2/19630779.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1631342826?book_show_action=false">May 07, 2016</a>      <a title="laurooou" class="user" name="laurooou" href="/user/show/19630779-laurooou">laurooou</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19630779-laurooou?shelf=distopia">distopia</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19630779-laurooou?shelf=romance">romance</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/19630779-laurooou?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1631342826" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1918856505578819864">****1.5 stars****<br /><br />So... Overall I really disliked The Selection series.<br /><br />I just kept giving Kiera Cass another chance after reading each of the Selection novels. And when I read "the Heir", I was genuinely happy and I thought that Cass had finally understood how to write a decent story. But this book, the final one in the series, proved me wrong.<br /><br />I'm really sad about it, because I LOVE the world that Cass has created... The Selection had all of the elements I require to call it a a great series, exc</span>  <span id="freeText1918856505578819864" style="display:none">****1.5 stars****<br /><br />So... Overall I really disliked The Selection series.<br /><br />I just kept giving Kiera Cass another chance after reading each of the Selection novels. And when I read "the Heir", I was genuinely happy and I thought that Cass had finally understood how to write a decent story. But this book, the final one in the series, proved me wrong.<br /><br />I'm really sad about it, because I LOVE the world that Cass has created... The Selection had all of the elements I require to call it a a great series, except one. I just HATE Cass main female characters, they are so annoying and passed as clever when clearly, they are not !<br /><br />The Crown was SO bad ! Where to start ? It reminded me of everything I hated when I read the Selection. With America being a brat that kept changing her mind about who she wanted to end up with, without any valid reason given. Something happens, she misinterprets it. And her feelings do a 180. She's manipulated by everyone. Basically a puppet incapable of thinking and feeling for herself.<br /><br />I actually like Eadlyn in the first novel. I though that she was struggling to find who she was and what kind of ruler she wanted to be, she seemed clever and really invested in her relationship with Kyle. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[So when in a couple of pages, she ended up falling in love with Erik, I was BAFFLED ! <br /><br />There was no real building of the relationship and feelings on her part. I could definitely see where Erik's feelings came from, but Eadlyn's seemed fake. It happened way too fast. And the whole story felt like the author manipulating you into liking the main character. And the ending... so stupid ! I felt like reading H.R.H. by Danielle Steele all over again (which is probably the stupidest novel I've ever read in my entire life!). The idea of a "constitutional monarchy" (although VERY GOOD) came out of nowhere. I would have liked to read more (or anything really) about Eadlyn political aspirations and hopes for her country. The novel was quite short, so I felt there was many ways it could have been developed, especially since it's the last of the series.... <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />Anyway, this is the last book that I will read by Kiera Cass. I hate her style and her character building (which is inexistant). The reason why this book got those stars, is because even though I hate her portrayal of a woman's mind, I do like the world she's created for the Selection series.</span>  <a data-text-id="1918856505578819864" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1643357087" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1643357087" />    <a title="Maxine" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/16136847-maxine"><img alt="Maxine" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1446277427p2/16136847.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1643357087?book_show_action=false">May 20, 2016</a>      <a title="Maxine" class="user" name="Maxine" href="/user/show/16136847-maxine">Maxine</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780007580248" href="/book/show/30060836-the-crown">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1643357087" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8607045833937163696"><b>Actual rating: 3.5 stars</b><br><br>A satisfying conclusion to <i>The Selection</i> series but it still fell short on a few things for me. The writing style was not as magical as I remembered and some conversations felt awkward or forced. Most happenings were predictable except for the fact that <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Hale and Ean are in love with each other. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1446091067ra/16746913.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>YOU'RE A PSYCHIC IF YOU SAW THAT COMING. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Eadlyn and Eikko's romance <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> seemed rushed and so did the last few chapters. I w</span>  <span id="freeText8607045833937163696" style="display:none"><b>Actual rating: 3.5 stars</b><br><br>A satisfying conclusion to <i>The Selection</i> series but it still fell short on a few things for me. The writing style was not as magical as I remembered and some conversations felt awkward or forced. Most happenings were predictable except for the fact that <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Hale and Ean are in love with each other. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1446091067ra/16746913.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br>YOU'RE A PSYCHIC IF YOU SAW THAT COMING. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Eadlyn and Eikko's romance <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> seemed rushed and so did the last few chapters. I wish Kiera Cass wrote a few more chapters in this book or even in <i>The Heir</i> to build up the events and justify some outcomes of the story instead of pouring them down all at once. Although I still loved the ever-present humor, cutesy feel of Kiera Cass's stories and the easiness of the book. <i>The Crown</i> is a very light and quick read in my opinion. It's just a few <i>very</i> fast-paced pages after all. <br><br>I don't know if <i>The Selection</i> series has finally lost its charm or this one just didn't do it for me. I'd only recommend reading this for closure on what happens to America and Eadlyn. </["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span>  <a data-text-id="8607045833937163696" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview"      <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1276691984?book_show_action=false">May 06, 2016</a>      <a title="Marcia" class="user" name="Marcia" href="/user/show/11359908-marcia">Marcia</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11359908-marcia?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11359908-marcia?shelf=romance">romance</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/11359908-marcia?shelf=dystopia">dystopia</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1276691984" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9020583441326456281">Het lang verwachte einde van <i>The Selection </i>serie heeft me, zoals alle eerdere boeken in deze reeks, enorm van mijn werk gehouden. Ik kon niet stoppen met lezen en heb tranen met tuiten gehuild. Wat een heerlijk verhaal! <br /><br />Mijn complete recensie lees je op <a href="https://oogopdetoekomst.com/2016/05/06/the-crown-kiera-cass/" rel="nofollow">Oog op de Toekomst</a>.</span> class="section">      <div id="review_1635396709" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1635396709" />    <a title="Claudia GarcU+00EDa" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/25818379-claudia-garc-a"><img alt="Claudia GarcU+00EDa" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1452275451p2/25818379.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1635396709?book_show_action=false">May 13, 2016</a>      <a title="Claudia GarcU+00EDa" class="user" name="Claudia GarcU+00EDa" href="/user/show/25818379-claudia-garc-a">Claudia GarcU+00EDa</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1635396709" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12915343343984444606"><br><b>*Se prepara mentalmente para dar una opiniU+00F3n impopular*</b><br><br>Veamos... The Crown no ha estado mal, pero al terminarlo me he quedado con una sensaciU+00F3n de decepciU+00F3n bastante intensa. Para no hacer esto muy largo, voy a explicar lo que me ha gustado y lo que no - sin spoilers - y podrU+00E9is ver que la diferencia de tamaU+00F1o de ambas listas es bastante ilustrativa.<br><br><u>Lo que estU+00E1 GUAY</u><br>- The Crown es muy corto y avanza con un ritmo casi frenU+00E9tico, se puede acabar sin problema en una tarde, y por ello engancha.<br><br>- Eadl</span>  <span id="freeText12915343343984444606" style="display:none"><br><b>*Se prepara mentalmente para dar una opiniU+00F3n impopular*</b><br><br>Veamos... The Crown no ha estado mal, pero al terminarlo me he quedado con una sensaciU+00F3n de decepciU+00F3n bastante intensa. Para no hacer esto muy largo, voy a explicar lo que me ha gustado y lo que no - sin spoilers - y podrU+00E9is ver que la diferencia de tamaU+00F1o de ambas listas es bastante ilustrativa.<br><br><u>Lo que estU+00E1 GUAY</u><br>- The Crown es muy corto y avanza con un ritmo casi frenU+00E9tico, se puede acabar sin problema en una tarde, y por ello engancha.<br><br>- Eadlyn por fin evoluciona como personaje y hasta dan ganas de abrazarla, algo especialmente notable si como yo tenU+00EDas ganas de estrangularla en The Heir.<br><br>- Hay una relaciU+00F3n homosexual.<br><br>- Hay muchas, MUCHAS, referencias directas a Princesa por Sorpresa, lo cual no es muy original, pero enternecen mi corazU+00F3n de fan de Disney.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1463129206ra/19084340.gif" width="" height="" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><u>Lo que NO lo estU+00E1</u><br>- Para empezar, se nota y se nota muchU+00EDsimo que <i>The Heir y The Crown eran un U+00FAnico libro</i>, que por motivos comerciales ha acabado siendo dos, sin ni siquiera preocuparse en maquillar ese corte. Cuando lees la secuela de algo, ya sea por recuerdos, diU+00E1logo o la situaciU+00F3n, los protagonistas suelen hacer un poco de recap, pero aquU+00ED el libro continU+00FAa EXACTAMENTE dU+00F3nde lo dejU+00F3, y hacia delante. Teniendo poco mU+00E1s de 270 pU+00E1ginas, se ve claramente la escisiU+00F3n en el momento cliffhanger y no que se haya trabajado en este libro de forma separada a The Heir.<br><br>- El endgame del libro es... cuestionable. SU+00ED, sU+00E9 que habU+00EDa mucha gente en el team del afortunado chaval, pero la forma de llevar el romance en The Crown ha sido demasiado <i>instalove</i>, porque las seU+00F1ales que habU+00EDa en The Heir las habU+00EDa multiplicadas por cuatro con otros candidatos. En mi opiniU+00F3n, la idea original de Kiera Cass era otra, pero a riesgo de hacer la historia demasiado parecida a la trilogU+00EDa original o demasiado predecible, ha optado por sacrificar la quU+00EDmica de la protagonista con otros personajes y optar por el final "inesperado", lo cual deja a una bastante frU+00EDa.<br><br>- Las decisiones polU+00EDticas de este libro carecen de absoluta lU+00F3gica, salvo la final (good move!), y en casos como el de Maxon, estU+00E1n completamente <i>fuera de su personaje</i>.<br><br>- En el libro, en esencia, no pasa ABSOLUTAMENTE NADA, de hecho, hay mU+00E1s acciU+00F3n en The Heir que aquU+00ED.<br><br>- Hay personajes que solo son herramientas para la historia, y que se comportan o mueven de formas muy convenientes para el desarrollo de Eadlyn o de la """trama""".<br><br>- Las cosas que hacen Eadlyn y su elegido no son romU+00E1nticas, son ridU+00EDculas y con un extra de drama que me ataca los nervios.<br><br>- BONUS: Por U+00FAltimo y no por ello menos importante: la portada de The Crown me sigue pareciendo super siniestra y la peor de las cinco de La SelecciU+00F3n.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1463129206ra/19084341.gif" width="" height="" alt="" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Es triste, porque de verdad querU+00EDa que me gustase la historia de Eadlyn, y al final se ha quedado en meh. De todas formas, si buscas una lectura ligera y te gustU+00F3 La SelecciU+00F3n, siempre estU+00E1 bien para volver a su universo... pero espera a tener los dos libros y leerlos del tirU+00F3n, porque quiero creer que es la U+00FAnica forma en la que esta continuaciU+00F3n tiene sentido.<br></span>  <a data-text-id="12915343343984444606" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1635396709">  <td class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1302258995" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1302258995" />    <a title="Haley *City Girl Appearance~Country Girl Heart*" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/30268420-haley-city-girl-appearance-country-girl-heart"><img alt="Haley *City Girl Appearance~Country Girl Heart*" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1468872785p2/30268420.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1302258995?book_show_action=false">May 15, 2016</a>      <a title="Haley *City Girl Appearance~Country Girl Heart*" class="user" name="Haley *City Girl Appearance~Country Girl Heart*" href="/user/show/30268420-haley-city-girl-appearance-country-girl-heart">Haley *City Girl Appearance~Country Girl Heart*</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30268420-haley-city-girl-appearance-country-girl-heart?shelf=romance">romance</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30268420-haley-city-girl-appearance-country-girl-heart?shelf=dystopia">dystopia</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30268420-haley-city-girl-appearance-country-girl-heart?shelf=teen">teen</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1302258995" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3830935274260702598"><i>When Eadlyn became the first princess of IllU+00E9a to hold her own Selection, she didnU+2019t think she would fall in love with any of her thirty-five suitors. She spent the first few weeks of the competition counting down the days until she could send them all home. But as events at the palace force Eadlyn even further into the spotlight, she realizes that she might not be content remaining alone.<br />Eadlyn still isnU+2019t sure sheU+2019ll find the fairytale ending her parents did twenty years ago. But sometimes the</i></span>  <span id="freeText3830935274260702598" style="display:none"><i>When Eadlyn became the first princess of IllU+00E9a to hold her own Selection, she didnU+2019t think she would fall in love with any of her thirty-five suitors. She spent the first few weeks of the competition counting down the days until she could send them all home. But as events at the palace force Eadlyn even further into the spotlight, she realizes that she might not be content remaining alone.<br />Eadlyn still isnU+2019t sure sheU+2019ll find the fairytale ending her parents did twenty years ago. But sometimes the heart has a way of surprising youU+2026and soon Eadlyn must make a choice that feels more impossibleU+2014and more importantU+2014than she ever imagined. </i><br /><br />I am going to get straight to the point right now. I am quite disappointed in this last book of the Selection series. I mean, it was goodU+2014just not amazing. I fell in love with books one through four. This one was justU+2026.not as good, for a few reasons. <br />Eadlyn didnU+2019t choose who I wanted her to choose! Yeah, I know I am judging this book by the outcome of it. And I totally understand what she did. I was just rooting forU+2014him, not him. I liked both guys; I just liked one better.<br />I also did not like it that Kiera Cass added a gay U+2018couple.U+2019 It was an unneeded agenda that she added. <br />This is also not the best book of the series because it is the last. The Selection series is overU+2014no more stories about Eadlyn or America. (Personally, I liked AmericaU+2019s stories better.) But I am still sad to see them go. <br />I will just have to reread them! <br />Yeah, so those are the three reasons I didnU+2019t like this book as much as I liked the others. But, the cover was beautiful! <br />But, the ending was good. I mean, sure, Kiera Cass didnU+2019t have Eadlyn end up with who I wanted, but it did end happily ever after! For that, I am glad!<br />I am sad for this series to end!!! <br /><br />Title: The Crown<br />Author: Kiera Cass<br />AuthorU+2019s Website: <a target="_blank" href="http://www.kieracass.com/about/" rel="nofollow">http://www.kieracass.com/about/</a> <br /><br /><i>This review was written with my own opinions and words. </i><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="3830935274260702598" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1574255495" />    <a title="Catherine U+2661" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/48622339-catherine"><img alt="Catherine U+2661" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1574255495?book_show_action=false">Jun 13, 2016</a>      <a title="Catherine U+2661" class="user" name="Catherine U+2661" href="/user/show/48622339-catherine">Catherine U+2661</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1574255495" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15553087640383418889"><b>Actual Rating:</b> 3.75<br><br>This was definitely better than <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/22918050.The_Heir__The_Selection___4_" title="The Heir (The Selection, #4) by Kiera Cass">The Heir</a>! In that book, I felt like Eadlyn was bratty and unlikeable, but in this book she definitely started to grow as a character and become less annoying. There were definitely more scenes where Eadlyn was more assertive, selfless, and courageous - an immense improvement from her character in the previous novel<br><br>Although books 4 and 5 will never be as good as the original trio, I do feel like this was a comeback, and it does give me a better s</span>  <span id="freeText15553087640383418889" style="display:none"><b>Actual Rating:</b> 3.75<br><br>This was definitely better than <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/22918050.The_Heir__The_Selection___4_" title="The Heir (The Selection, #4) by Kiera Cass">The Heir</a>! In that book, I felt like Eadlyn was bratty and unlikeable, but in this book she definitely started to grow as a character and become less annoying. There were definitely more scenes where Eadlyn was more assertive, selfless, and courageous - an immense improvement from her character in the previous novel<br><br>Although books 4 and 5 will never be as good as the original trio, I do feel like this was a comeback, and it does give me a better sense of closure. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Even if I don't really like who Eadlyn chose in the end - but I do like the way she went about it, and it did show growth of character. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>And while I skimmed <i>The Heir</i>, I actually did read this book and enjoy it - especially some Selection moments and some scenes about Maxon and America:<br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1380222758ra/472473.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span>  <a data-text-id="15553087640383418889" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1574255495">  <td class="section">      <div id="review_1417041576" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1417041576" />    <a title="Afina" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/43326905-afina"><img alt="Afina" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1466477733p2/43326905.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1417041576?book_show_action=false">Apr 02, 2016</a>      <a title="Afina" class="user" name="Afina" href="/user/show/43326905-afina">Afina</a>          marked it as to-read                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/43326905-afina?shelf=books-that-have-ruined-me">books-that-have-ruined-me</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1417041576" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5019267266053534016">Woah. That cover. I was not expecting the down-fall of it. Seriously. I've been walking down The Selection series rides for as long as I can remember and so far not a single moment of my life had I ever been disappointed by the cover, until now. Well, the only thing that bothered me quite a lot is the full-face of the model, like, no, I don't want to see her face exposed fully. I'd like to keep it inside my head for me to picture it on my own, thank you. Although the colour and the background is</span>  <span id="freeText5019267266053534016" style="display:none">Woah. That cover. I was not expecting the down-fall of it. Seriously. I've been walking down The Selection series rides for as long as I can remember and so far not a single moment of my life had I ever been disappointed by the cover, until now. Well, the only thing that bothered me quite a lot is the full-face of the model, like, no, I don't want to see her face exposed fully. I'd like to keep it inside my head for me to picture it on my own, thank you. Although the colour and the background is gorgeous, i mean, it really is gorgeous but still....<br />Lastly, I really really really want Eadlyn to be ended up with Kile and for America to not be dead, or Maxon or any of those main characters. Please.</span>  <a data-text-id="5019267266053534016" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons"> elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1286659335" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1286659335" />    <a title="Lauren" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4617391-lauren"><img alt="Lauren" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479593418p2/4617391.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1286659335?book_show_action=false">May 27, 2016</a>      <a title="Lauren" class="user" name="Lauren" href="/user/show/4617391-lauren">Lauren</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4617391-lauren?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4617391-lauren?shelf=2016">2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4617391-lauren?shelf=gorgeous-covers">gorgeous-covers</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1286659335" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11027590347288870826">Was it perfect? No. Was it everything I had hoped it would be though? Yes. <br /><br />I get why some were disappointed, I really do. It felt a bit rushed at times and the whole "villain" thing felt a bit forced, which is why it won't get a 5 star rating from me. But, I do feel like Eadlyn is a strong, empowered character and I'm glad to have seen her grow and develop throughout her two books.<br /><br />I was very happy with the ending, even though I did find myself wanting more. All in all, I was satisfied to have th</span>  <span id="freeText11027590347288870826" style="display:none">Was it perfect? No. Was it everything I had hoped it would be though? Yes. <br /><br />I get why some were disappointed, I really do. It felt a bit rushed at times and the whole "villain" thing felt a bit forced, which is why it won't get a 5 star rating from me. But, I do feel like Eadlyn is a strong, empowered character and I'm glad to have seen her grow and develop throughout her two books.<br /><br />I was very happy with the ending, even though I did find myself wanting more. All in all, I was satisfied to have this series come to a close and I absolutely adored the characters. </span>  <a data-text-id="11027590347288870826" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1286659335">  <td class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1642662138" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1642662138" />    <a title="Alexa" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4988733-alexa"><img alt="Alexa" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1452299465p2/4988733.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1642662138?book_show_action=false">Jun 08, 2016</a>      <a title="Alexa" class="user" name="Alexa" href="/user/show/4988733-alexa">Alexa</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4988733-alexa?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1642662138" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7654159356290454184">I am so torn on how to express how I feel about this novel. On the one hand, it was total book crack and I couldn't stop reading it. I also just really liked the Elite that are present in this novel, as well as appearances of other familiar faces. On the other hand, this and The Heir could have been one book. And there were so many things that felt glossed over and underdeveloped, particularly because romance becomes such a heavy focus at one point. So I can't say I completely liked it BUT I</span>  <span id="freeText7654159356290454184" style="display:none">I am so torn on how to express how I feel about this novel. On the one hand, it was total book crack and I couldn't stop reading it. I also just really liked the Elite that are present in this novel, as well as appearances of other familiar faces. On the other hand, this and The Heir could have been one book. And there were so many things that felt glossed over and underdeveloped, particularly because romance becomes such a heavy focus at one point. So I can't say I completely liked it BUT I can't say I hated it either. What's a girl to do? </span>  <a data-text-id="7654159356290454184" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1642662138">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1642662138" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1642662138&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1642662138'><a id="like_count_review_1642662138" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1642662138?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">13 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1642662138" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1642662138" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=13&rating[page]=5&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1642662138&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1642662138" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1642662138, true, &#39;&#39;); Maybe itU+2019s the last ones.U+201D -Kile Woodwork<br />U+2022<br />Despite the fact that Eadlyn chose Erik, and that he was her soul mate and all, I honestly still think that Kile would've been a much better choice. I'm so glad that I'm finally done with this series, ugh. America's story wasn't as annoying and painful to read, in fact I loved Maxmerica! But this storyline, Eadlyn's story? Just. name="Allison Gardner" href="/user/show/41917425-allison-gardner">Allison Gardner</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar class="section">      <div id="review_1503066877" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1503066877" />    <a title="Kate Matson" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/37293133-kate-matson"><img alt="Kate Matson" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1474053243p2/37293133.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1503066877?book_show_action=false">Oct 27, 2016</a>      <a title="Kate Matson" class="user" name="Kate Matson" href="/user/show/37293133-kate-matson">Kate Matson</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/37293133-kate-matson?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/37293133-kate-matson?shelf=romance">romance</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/37293133-kate-matson?shelf=future">future</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/37293133-kate-matson?shelf=dystopia">dystopia</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/37293133-kate-matson?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/37293133-kate-matson?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/37293133-kate-matson?shelf=gorgeous-covers">gorgeous-covers</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1503066877" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2794931681735801687">Summary:<br />When Eadlyn became the first princess of IllU+00E9a to hold her own Selection, she didnU+2019t think she would fall in love with any of her thirty-five suitors. She spent the first few weeks of the competition counting down the days until she could send them all home. But as events at the palace force Eadlyn even further into the spotlight, she realizes that she might not be content remaining alone.<br />Eadlyn still isnU+2019t sure sheU+2019ll find the fairytale ending her parents did twenty years ago. But somet</span>  <span id="freeText2794931681735801687" style="display:none">Summary:<br />When Eadlyn became the first princess of IllU+00E9a to hold her own Selection, she didnU+2019t think she would fall in love with any of her thirty-five suitors. She spent the first few weeks of the competition counting down the days until she could send them all home. But as events at the palace force Eadlyn even further into the spotlight, she realizes that she might not be content remaining alone.<br />Eadlyn still isnU+2019t sure sheU+2019ll find the fairytale ending her parents did twenty years ago. But sometimes the heart has a way of surprising youU+2026and soon Eadlyn must make a choice that feels more impossibleU+2014and more importantU+2014than she ever imagined. <br />Plot:<br />Personally, I LOVED The Heir. However, The Crown fell a bit short on my standards. It felt forced, and the pacing was a bit dreadful, but that's because The Selection for Eadlyn was only 3 months. I was definitely surprised by the turn of events towards the end, and I was certainly not expecting it. I think I'll have a lot of followers on this point; that ending was unexpected, and I'm not very happy with it. It felt out of nowhere and incredibly rushed. Despite all of the complaints I just listed, this book was incredibly fun, and I still thoroughly enjoyed it. <br />Characters:<br />There as definitely a lot of rushed character development in this book. Don't get me wrong, I'm super happy about Eadlyn's turnout. It was a fresh relief to see The Selection from the princess' POV. It was far less intense than the original trilogy, because the suitors aren't fighting like cats and dogs over Eadlyn, and there weren't any intense relationship moments (Well not compared to the first three). <br />Let me just say, THAT ENDING. It was so out of the blue, and I was not hoping for her to end up with ****. One chapter she was in love with someone, and the next, she was in love with another. I DON'T GET IT! It was a bit sloppy on that part. <br />The one thing that bothered me was that Kiera Cass randomly threw in gay characters. Was that really necessary??? There was no need for gay characters, and it was annoying. I will say, however, it was unexpected, and I was unpleasantly surprised. <br />Overall & Recommendations:<br />This was a nice little wrap up to the selection series, but I had my problems with it. The plot was good, but definitely had some minor flaws. The characters had an unexpected turnout, and some I was not so happy with. Kiera Cass is such an amazing author, and I love this series SO MUCH. If you haven't read this series, go ahead and drop whatever you are doing, and pick this up RIGHT NOW. 12+ girls.</span>  <a data-text-id="2794931681735801687" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1503066877"> onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1503066877, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1421675203" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1421675203" />    <a title="Breanna" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/3396025-breanna"><img alt="Breanna" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1464551078p2/3396025.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1421675203?book_show_action=false">Sep 21, 2016</a>      <a title="Breanna" class="user" name="Breanna" href="/user/show/3396025-breanna">Breanna</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3396025-breanna?shelf=dnf">dnf</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1421675203" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3082946551228932850">DNF @ 58%<br /><br />Yikes. What a mess. I'm sorry, but I just couldn't finish this book knowing what I know and who she ends up choosing. <br /><br />I was already getting a little bored-the plot was very slow moving and the romance was practically non-existent-but I was sticking it out for the end because it seemed so obvious that my choice (and a majority of the fandom's as well) was going to be <i>the</i> choice and I was excited for them to finally reveal their feelings. When I started to sense a weird shift in the book</span>  <span id="freeText3082946551228932850" style="display:none">DNF @ 58%<br /><br />Yikes. What a mess. I'm sorry, but I just couldn't finish this book knowing what I know and who she ends up choosing. <br /><br />I was already getting a little bored-the plot was very slow moving and the romance was practically non-existent-but I was sticking it out for the end because it seemed so obvious that my choice (and a majority of the fandom's as well) was going to be <i>the</i> choice and I was excited for them to finally reveal their feelings. When I started to sense a weird shift in the book I spoiled myself the ending and after that the book just became unbearable to force myself through. I kept thinking "ugh, what's the point to even finish reading?". <br /><br />Honestly, I wouldn't have even been that mad about her choice except<i> it made absolutely no sense at all</i>. There was no chemistry whatsoever between her and the person she ends up choosing. It's very confusing and disappointing, especially considering the very obvious chemistry between her and the person myself, and half the fandom, was rooting for. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Besides, I don't understand how she can claim to love Erik and that he's her soulmate when they've literally had less than a handful of one on one conversations, and none of which were exactly deep and meaningful enough to evoke some sort of connection between them. <i>It makes zero sense</i>. I laughed when I saw that. And then she banishes Kile for what? <i>Caring</i> too much?! All the events of the previous book were pointing towards Kile and Eadlyn. I don't know what happened. Maybe Cass changed her mind because, why, they seemed too obvious? Too similar to Maxon/America (I don't understand how in that aspect though??) Regardless of predictability, they were the pairing most of us <i>wanted</i>! If she was going for an element of surprise it was horribly executed. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />Overall, a huge disappointment and a colossal waste of time. And by the looks of things I'm not in the minority with this.</span>  <a data-text-id="3082946551228932850" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1657245290" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1657245290" />    <a title="Yvonne (bookishpanda)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4023744-yvonne-bookishpanda"><img alt="Yvonne (bookishpanda)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1454500294p2/4023744.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1657245290?book_show_action=false">Aug 07, 2016</a>      <a title="Yvonne (bookishpanda)" class="user" name="Yvonne (bookishpanda)" href="/user/show/4023744-yvonne-bookishpanda">Yvonne (bookishpanda)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4023744-yvonne-bookishpanda?shelf=4-stars-books">4-stars-books</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4023744-yvonne-bookishpanda?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4023744-yvonne-bookishpanda?shelf=complete-series">complete-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4023744-yvonne-bookishpanda?shelf=long-series">long-series</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4023744-yvonne-bookishpanda?shelf=may-2016-release">may-2016-release</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1657245290" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11512878299905209281"><a href="http://aworldbetweenfoldedpages.blogspot.co.at/2016/07/review-crown-by-kiera-cass.html" rel="nofollow"> <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1452000576i/17631522.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>What is it with those <i>Selection </i>books that make me like them even though I don't<i> really </i>like them? This doesn't even make sense to my own ears. They're addictive and sometimes really bad and cringe-worthy but I still KIND OF enjoy reading them??? Either way,<b> I'm happy this is the last book of the series ...</b> and I really hope it stays this way. It should've ended after the third book but then again I ended up giving <i>The Heir</i> 5 stars anyway (don't even ask me HOW I could do that; I have no idea!!</span>  <span id="freeText11512878299905209281" style="display:none"><a href="http://aworldbetweenfoldedpages.blogspot.co.at/2016/07/review-crown-by-kiera-cass.html" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1452000576i/17631522.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a><br><br>What is it with those <i>Selection </i>books that make me like them even though I don't<i>  really </i>like them? This doesn't even make sense to my own ears. They're addictive and sometimes really bad and cringe-worthy but I still KIND OF enjoy reading them??? Either way,<b> I'm happy this is the last book of the series ...</b> and I really hope it stays this way. It should've ended after the third book but then again I ended up giving <i>The Heir</i> 5 stars anyway (don't even ask me HOW I could do that; I have no idea!! Need to change that ...) and this one didn't get a bad rating as well. Hmm.<br><br>I remember <b>I was rooting for my beloved Erik / Eikko</b> because he's just adorable and made the story somewhat more interesting, in my opinion. I just couldn't help but fall in love with him - HE'S SO SWEET AND I LOVE HIM! Kile was my second favorite but I never quite felt the chemistry between Eadlyn and him? Like, no? Okay, I admit, there also wasn't THAT much chemistry between Erik and Eadlyn at first but there were little hints to where this could lead ... it just felt better to me.<br><br>As of <b>Eadlyn </b>herself, I have to say that she was <i>okay </i>in this book. I absolutely couldn't stand her in the beginning of the first book but thank goodness she changed a bit (as well as in this book) - she's still selfish and mostly thinks about herself first but ... especially towards the end she realized how wrong she was all this time and actually starts to change her behavious and all that. I don't approve of all her decisions and I certainly don't think she's the best character ever but ... I don't know, maybe this book just mushed my brain and I can't think straight anymore.<br><br><b>The plot was almost non-existent, which is sad because this series had potential.</b> There were rebel groups and attacks and she could've definitely told us some more about these things, make this a whole lot more interesting ... but she didn't. Instead she focused on Eadlyn and her duty and finding a husband and many other "unimportant" things. Seeing it that way is actually <b>disappointing </b>and yet I still enjoyed it most of the times ... oh my, oh my. There was one big plot twist that I absolutely didn't see coming - it would've probably been a really good one but it came out of no where and therefore I was like "Ummm, okay? REALLY?! NOW?!", so yeah. Without sounding mean, Kiera definitely has potential but I don't think she quite knows how to use it properly? She could've done so much better.<br><br>So, am I happy with the ending I got? Let's just say <b>I'm glad Eadlyn chose the right person</b> but she could've done that within one (a bit longer) book as well and we wouldn't have needed to wait so long - it was quite obvious to me, haha. Also, it didn't feel like a conclusion - there are <b>unanswered questions</b> about the kingdom, the people, the rebel groups and all I wanted of Kiera was to give us a GOOD explanation. A good ending ... oh well. I still had lots of fun reading this series and thought the books weren <i>that</i> bad but ... don't write any new books to this series, Kiera.<br><br><a href="http://aworldbetweenfoldedpages.blogspot.com" rel="nofollow">www.aworldbetweenfoldedpages.blogspot.com</a><br>_______________________<br><i><u>June 8th:</u></i><br>I'm absolutely NOT sure about my rating and might even change that again but ... well, even though these books aren't <i>that</i> good and kinda cringe-worthy I still enjoy them a lot? They're addictive, a bit silly but easy and fun to read so whatever, haha.<br><br>Also, I just wanna say that I'm VERY pleased with who Eadlyn ended up with - I KNEW IT RIGHT FROM THE BEGINNING, HA! He was my favorite so everything's cool. :D</span>  <a data-text-id="11512878299905209281" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1297130087?book_show_action=false">Jul 08, 2016</a>      <a title="Aoife" class="user" name="Aoife" href="/user/show/16768476-aoife">Aoife</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780062458865" href="/book/show/26198897-the-crown">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16768476-aoife?shelf=disappointing">disappointing</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16768476-aoife?shelf=favourite-author">favourite-author</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16768476-aoife?shelf=romance">romance</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16768476-aoife?shelf=ya-dystopian">ya-dystopian</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16768476-aoife?shelf=ya">ya</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1297130087" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12938204684610446667">UGH NO.<br /><br /><br />Okay so overall I can't help but be disappointed with this book because my favourite guy from the very start didn't win. I thought the end result was so predictable - I had figured out that it would probably happen literally the moment he showed up in the book, I had just kept a small hope it wouldn't - and because of that I just feel so blah. I also agree with everyone who said the romance suddenly magnified when they 'declared' their love. It was like one look and suddenly Eadlyn went a</span>  <span id="freeText12938204684610446667" style="display:none">UGH NO.<br /><br /><br />Okay so overall I can't help but be disappointed with this book because my favourite guy from the very start didn't win. I thought the end result was so predictable - I had figured out that it would probably happen literally the moment he showed up in the book, I had just kept a small hope it wouldn't - and because of that I just feel so blah. I also agree with everyone who said the romance suddenly magnified when they 'declared' their love. It was like one look and suddenly Eadlyn went a bit crazy, it was very strange and felt all a bit rushed, especially as there hadn't been that much interaction, in my view, in The Heir. I also think some of the guys whose characters had been built up were let down in The Crown - <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Kile suddenly became way more romantic, I thought he lost a bit of himself suddenly when he started spouting off about building her things, Fox became a strong contender for me at the end of The Heir but suddenly he was a bit vapid and weird. And then Henry, my beloved Henri :( I loved him so much and he was, and is, a beautiful character. But it was like all of a sudden Eadlyn just kept pointing out so many things wrong with him rather than focusing on their connection which was obviously there. STUPID Eadlyn. I just really wanted Henri to win (I also think he should have been a bit more annoyed about Eadlyn duping him into an almost marriage and being 'in love' with Erik) I just can't buy Eadlyn and Erik, they just seemed so forced or something and I just can't. No.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />I felt like the end of this book was very rushed and it seemed to take a while to get to a point and then all of a sudden everything happened at once. Also, I don't remember his Marid guy ever being mentioned in The Heir? He showed up out of no-where. There was so much information we were still getting such as the breakdown of August and Maxon's friendship, and then Lady Brice and it just seemed to spill out and I felt like throwing my hands up in the air and saying 'whoa, whoa, what?' Also Maxon's 'reveal' to Eadlyn at the end was a bit unnecessary. <br /><br />I definitely came out of The Selection series a lot happier than I did with The Heir and The Crown. Long live the Queen, not.</span>  <a data-text-id="12938204684610446667" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1588880783" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1588880783" />    <a title="misskaelyn14" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/12044911-misskaelyn14"><img alt="misskaelyn14" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1444494510p2/12044911.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1588880783?book_show_action=false">Jun 10, 2016</a>      <a title="misskaelyn14" class="user" name="misskaelyn14" href="/user/show/12044911-misskaelyn14">misskaelyn14</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1588880783" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9926313318228619193">Going into this book I was excited over how this part of the series was going to wrap up. I found The Heir my favorite book out of the entire Selection series, and I couldnU+2019t wait to see where things were going in the final book. But once the details were released about The Crown it made me nervous. The book is only 278 pages long. 278 PAGES! Once I found that out I was nervous to see where things went and wrapped up since it was such a short book. <br />Some positive things to say about this book is</span>  <span id="freeText9926313318228619193" style="display:none">Going into this book I was excited over how this part of the series was going to wrap up. I found The Heir my favorite book out of the entire Selection series, and I couldnU+2019t wait to see where things were going in the final book. But once the details were released about The Crown it made me nervous. The book is only 278 pages long. 278 PAGES! Once I found that out I was nervous to see where things went and wrapped up since it was such a short book. <br />Some positive things to say about this book is that EadlynU+2019s attitude completely changes from an absolute brat into a person with feelings. I also loved Maxon in this installment because he had some pretty hilarious lines.<br />Some issues I had with this book included not enough pages to flesh everything out. About 130 pages into the story we find out that Maxon is going to step down so he can help America recover so that they can live their life together without all the responsibilities. Okay, what the actual hell. I personally thought Maxon was smarter than that. I donU+2019t think Eadlyn is ready to be a queen after all that has happened in The Heir. <br />Another big issue I had was how she chooses her man. One moment she was set on Kile and then the next moment she banishes him from the land. That to me is such a bitch move, and yet Kile was still fine with it. But what really pisses me off the most was how she was going to marry Henri even though they have no chemistry and that sheU+2019s in love with Erik, his translator. Why ban Kile when youU+2019re going to marry the guy you have nothing in common with. This whole situation left me annoyed and sour with how things went and turned out. Overall the ending was so rushed and the epilogue was stupid and pointless and they could have left that out.<br />Overall I thought this book was a complete let down. There were some positive things, but overall nothing really made sense and was completely rushed. I felt like the last 50 pages were thrown together just to wrap up the series quickly. It was as if Cass gave zero fucks and made the characters do that as well. I decided to rate this book 2/5 stars for those reasons.<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="9926313318228619193" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>
