class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1302713780" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1302713780" />    <a title="Maddy" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/39368406-maddy"><img alt="Maddy" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1455187509p2/39368406.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1302713780?book_show_action=false">May 24, 2016</a>      <a title="Maddy" class="user" name="Maddy" href="/user/show/39368406-maddy">Maddy</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was amazing</span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was amazing" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1302713780" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5768366382309543012">That happy happy feeling you get when your ship from the start sails omg. <br /><br />This is now one of my favourite quotes in existence:<br />U+201CIU+2019d wondered how it was possible to magically find a soul mate in a random group of boys.<br />But now I couldnU+2019t question it.U+201D<br /><br />Ok so i definitely rate this book 5/5 stars. It had me happy, sad, angry and just a flowing emotional overload. (Sorry if that didn't make sense I'm am just really emotional at the moment). Kiera Cass has done it again she has concluded the series that</span>  <span id="freeText5768366382309543012" style="display:none">That happy happy feeling you get when your ship from the start sails omg. <br /><br />This is now one of my favourite quotes in existence:<br />U+201CIU+2019d wondered how it was possible to magically find a soul mate in a random group of boys.<br />But now I couldnU+2019t question it.U+201D<br /><br />Ok so i definitely rate this book 5/5 stars. It had me happy, sad, angry and just a flowing emotional overload. (Sorry if that didn't make sense I'm am just really emotional at the moment). Kiera Cass has done it again she has concluded the series that so many love. I can't believe I just read the last book. I need more about Eadlyn. Her character development was unreal and she is now pretty close to the top of my list of favourite strong female characters.<br /><br />The story Maxon reveals to Eadlyn at the end came at a massive shock to me and I'm so happy Kiera Cass added that in to spice it up a little. <br /><br />I know some people hate this series and Eadlyn but for me I love this series. It is a fairytale, fantasy to let you escape from reality. It is perfect. Eadlyn for me was such a strong inspiring young female struggling with finding love and leading a country. She ends up becoming a role model and someone that would be the perfect candidate to run a country. <br /><br />Let me know what you thought of this book below (: </span>  <a data-text-id="5768366382309543012" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/990094450?book_show_action=false">Jun 08, 2016</a>      <a title="Amber Hetchler" class="user" name="Amber Hetchler" href="/user/show/32882104-amber-hetchler">Amber Hetchler</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/32882104-amber-hetchler?shelf=disappointing">disappointing</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/32882104-amber-hetchler?shelf=ugh">ugh</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer990094450" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12737345897023591781">It's over, right? Please tell me Cass has finally emptied the tiny box of her imagination. <br /><br />Truly it's my fault for reading this even though I knew I would hate it. <br />But how could I not read the last book and soak up every last Maxon and America moment I could get? They're literally the only reason this got two stars instead of one. <br />Seriously, what is this bullshit? I could not keep track of where this book was going even as it came to a close. Every decision was made in a split second and I found</span>  <span id="freeText12737345897023591781" style="display:none">It's over, right? Please tell me Cass has finally emptied the tiny box of her imagination. <br /><br />Truly it's my fault for reading this even though I knew I would hate it. <br />But how could I not read the last book and soak up every last Maxon and America moment I could get? They're literally the only reason this got two stars instead of one. <br />Seriously, what is this bullshit? I could not keep track of where this book was going even as it came to a close. Every decision was made in a split second and I found myself stumbling over the pages wondering how each monumental thing could happen in the span of three pages or less. Especially the last chapter. Eadlyn makes a decision, backtracks on that desicion and BAM<br />the book's done. <br />Like Cass got sick of writing about it and just rushed to finish the series.<br />Can't say I blame her. <br /><br />Look, I only have one piece of parting advice, just pretend like the Selection series was just a trilogy and skip the last two. It will save you a lot of grief. <br /><br />Good-bye forever Selection series. I'm sorry you had to end on such a bad note.</span>  <a data-text-id="12737345897023591781" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div         <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/27829330-the-crown">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4676630-steffi?shelf=leserunde">leserunde</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4676630-steffi?shelf=read-in-english">read-in-english</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4676630-steffi?shelf=kindle-books-2016">kindle-books-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/4676630-steffi?shelf=neu-2016">neu-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1627864144" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11025475114401099495">At the beginning I was really surprised how well everything was going with this book, I even kind of liked Eadlyn which couldn't have been a bigger surprise after The heir. <br /><br />In the first half I found myself quite entertained besides the usual flaws of this series but then it started to drag a lot. There were no twists, everything was predictable and just lame. The characters were interchangable with each other, especially the boys. Everyone was nice and all the sweet perfect boy. <br /><br />There was never</span>  <span id="freeText11025475114401099495" style="display:none">At the beginning I was really surprised how well everything was going with this book, I even kind of liked Eadlyn which couldn't have been a bigger surprise after The heir. <br /><br />In the first half I found myself quite entertained besides the usual flaws of this series but then it started to drag a lot. There were no twists, everything was predictable and just lame. The characters were interchangable with each other, especially the boys. Everyone was nice and all the sweet perfect boy. <br /><br />There was never lots of logic in this book and I was almost as far to being quite used to it but there were still many things which just bothered me and made me roll my eyes.<br /><br />I will remember the series as a shallow series with characters having the most stupid names ever. I really hope this series is over, and I still don't know why I kept on reading it, especially the books about Eadlyn. The first three books were still kind of entertaining in a trashy way.<br />PLEASE, no more books about Eadlyn's kids.</span>  <a data-text-id="11025475114401099495" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; AND IT'S PURPLE. FRICKIN' PURPLE!!!! <br>okay the girl on the cover does not look like Eadlyn at ALL but whatever. <br><br><br><b> Update</b> SYPNOSIS!! <i> "And now Eadlyn has to make a choice more difficult - and important - than she ever expected".</i> <br>Fuuuuuuuuuuuck.<br><br><b> Edit (again) </b> Let us compare this cover : <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/10507293.The_Selection__The_Selection___1_" title="The Selection (The Selection, #1) by Kiera Cass"> <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/books/1322103400s/10507293.jpg" alt="The Selection (The Selection, #1) by Kiera Cass" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a> to this one : <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/26074181.The_Crown__The_Selection___5_" title="The Crown (The Selection, #5) by Kiera Cass"> <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/books/1446759650s/26074181.jpg" alt="The Crown (The Selection, #5) by Kiera Cass" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a> I mean c'mon, I'm just realising now that the cover for The Crown is probably one of the ugliest &gt</span>  <span id="freeText11401699961488120641" style="display:none">Yay, another The Selection book where hopefully America doesnt die !!<br><br><br><b> Edit</b> WE HAVE A COVER FOLKS. AND IT'S PURPLE. FRICKIN' PURPLE!!!! <br>okay the girl on the cover does not look like Eadlyn at ALL but whatever. <br><br><br><b> Update</b> SYPNOSIS!! <i> "And now Eadlyn has to make a choice more difficult - and important - than she ever expected".</i> <br>Fuuuuuuuuuuuck.<br><br><b> Edit (again) </b> Let us compare this cover : <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/10507293.The_Selection__The_Selection___1_" title="The Selection (The Selection, #1) by Kiera Cass">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/books/1322103400s/10507293.jpg" alt="The Selection (The Selection, #1) by Kiera Cass" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a> to this one : <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/26074181.The_Crown__The_Selection___5_" title="The Crown (The Selection, #5) by Kiera Cass">  <img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/books/1446759650s/26074181.jpg" alt="The Crown (The Selection, #5) by Kiera Cass" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a> I mean c'mon, I'm just realising now that the cover for The Crown is probably one of the ugliest >:-( <br>That is NOT OKAY, OKAY?   <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1687096880" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14280006121660874211"><b>Un 3,5 en realidad</b><br /><br />Esperaba algo mU+00E1s del libro, sobre todo en lo referente al romance que me ha parecido todo un poco precipitado y me he quedado con ganas de conocer mU+00E1s al chico en cuestiU+00F3n. Pero vamos, recomiendo la saga porque son unos libros que enganchan una barbaridad y son muy entretenidos, aunque en lo referente al romance me gustU+00F3 mU+00E1s el de la trilogU+00EDa original.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1687096880">  <td src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1453634192p2/33012562.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1484519011?book_show_action=false">Jul 09, 2016</a>      <a title="Vivianne" class="user" name="Vivianne" href="/user/show/33012562-vivianne">Vivianne</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33012562-vivianne?shelf=finished-series">finished-series</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1484519011" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15334296735808559030"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1467754452i/19626632._SY540_.jpg" width="500" height="500" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b> NO ARE YOU KIDDING ME! IS THIS THE END we get to hear from ILLEA IT CANU+2019T BE, PLEASE SAY THIS IS NOT THE END!!! </b> <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1467754452ra/19626633.gif" width="500" height="300" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>The strange things about these books are that the endings have me so heartbroken, overly enjoyed happy that I forget all the predictable, bad things about the story and want to give this book 5 stars just like I gave <i> The Heir </i>. But I am not going to do that with this one, because off the many flaws in this story. <br><br>I loved that the book starts where it left of in <i> The Heir </i>. Eadlyn is</span>  <span id="freeText15334296735808559030" style="display:none"><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1467754452i/19626632._SY540_.jpg" width="500" height="500" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><b> NO ARE YOU KIDDING ME! IS THIS THE END we get to hear from ILLEA IT CANU+2019T BE, PLEASE SAY THIS IS NOT THE END!!! </b> <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1467754452ra/19626633.gif" width="500" height="300" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>The strange things about these books are that the endings have me so heartbroken, overly enjoyed happy that I forget all the predictable, bad things about the story and want to give this book 5 stars just like I gave <i> The Heir </i>. But I am not going to do that with this one, because off the many flaws in this story. <br><br>I loved that the book starts where it left of in <i> The Heir </i>. Eadlyn is going on with the Selection process and tries to find the most suitable husband. Only six remain and while the uproars in the country grows Eadlyn decides she needs to take over from her dad and become Queen. <br><br>Eadlyn improved in this book even more. She sees the things from her peopleU+2019s point of view and tries to better everything. She has grown much since the first book. But I do not understand her choices, like the suitor she chooses in the end. I feel for her that her brother left and that her mom is sick and I think she does an amazing job at taking over her dadU+2019s job for a while. Though I think it is a shame we do not see the political point of view. For example Eadlyn talks about being tired for the day because she has done so much, yet the only thing that is written about in the book is that she had a date and signed some contracts. The book felt a little rushed and I couldnU+2019t feel Eadlyn as much as the first book because off the weird time lapses and the holes in the story. Considering the little amount off pages the book has, there could have been so much added, that would make the book feel more real! I felt like the book is to short, the other selection was described in three books and that was hardly enough. And then this selection is only two books <b> and </b> the last book has way little pages then the others. I am not pleased that this is the end off a series I loved. <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1467754452ra/19626634.gif" width="500" height="300" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Okay back to the Selection process. Like I also mentioned in my other review I still liked seeing the process from the Selector point off view and that the candidates are boys. I do see a lot off differences between the selections. Like in the selection from America I remembered her doing a lot off assignments like hosting a party. I canU+2019t remember a thing that the boys in EadlynU+2019s needed to do. I thought they came off really easy, how can you know who is a suitable king? Another difference between the books is that this book is much girlier, I didnU+2019t particularly like that. Even the covers show that. I think that is also the difference between the main characters. <br><br>I hoped that because the boys where narrowed down to six in this book, that they would have a bigger role and had a little more dimension... But unfortunately that wasnU+2019t the case. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ I do not understand why Fox and Gunner where even mentioned in this book being boring as hell. I canU+2019t even remember a thing about them. Eadlyn doesnU+2019t like them but still kept them around for the show. Though I liked the story of Ean and Hale I thought the writer made herself came off easy, two more out off the running who is next..? Then Kile, I was surprised with Eadlyns choice there. I hoped she would choose him over Henry, at least she would be happy with him. But her last minute change was weird. And then Henry how can he become a king when he doesnU+2019t even speak the first language of the country and has no idea off all the traditions or laws!? I do not understand that Eadlyn almost made him king because he is sweet to her. I liked Eric BUT how can he and Eadlyn become so overly in love when they havenU+2019t talked more then three times. INSTA LOVE! Which IU+2019m not a fan off at all! That was also very unrealistic and weird.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1467754452ra/19626635.gif" width="500" height="300" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Another very unlikely thing was how Maxon resigns. Because he needs some more free time?! A real king wouldnU+2019t do that! That just canU+2019t happen! And also the way Eadlyn takes over from him first is so weird, I get Maxon wants to be with America but you canU+2019t leave your 18! Year old daughter in charge of your whole country while you are wining by her bed. Also, when Eadlyn is queen she needs an advisor and who would you turn toU+2026 Your predecessor and dad. RIGHT? So why the hell is she left alone in this mess and does she needs to do everything by herself. These things make this book so unbelievable. <br><br>What I missed was excitement and renovation! I think there was missing U+2018a villainU+2019, which where Clarkson, Celeste and the Rebels in the other books. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Here it is Marid which I actually didnU+2019t see coming (as one off the only things). But he was weak and when the reader finds out he is bad he actually gets put down immediately. In not a great way. It almost felt a little childish.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br><br>Lady Brice secret was one off the things that had a little hint about how good the first books where. It was predictable but that didnU+2019t mean I did not like it. I was upset to see that happen at the very last few pages but it happened. Come to think off it everything happened in the last few pages. <br>Eadlyn decides everything in the end in 10 minutes, just like I feel the writer did. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[ Eric is chosen which, like I said before, I didnU+2019t get. Then she announces that the country will be a constitutional monarchy which I thought was a very clever way to make the people in IllU+00E9a happy but not the Reader of these books. America and Maxon dedicated their whole life to get rid of the castes. Then Eadlyn just gives all the power off being Queen away. I donU+2019t know it didnU+2019t feel right.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> And then the epilogueU+2026 really disappointing. I WANT MORE! (Not a book please, maybe a mini epilogue, do they have children, how many!? Will the constitutional monarchy work? Okay we can go on with this family forever. Please let this rest). But I am still disappointed with the epilogue. <i> The One </i> was such a great ending to this series while this isU+2026 Just not satisfying! <br><br>Okay after these many many comments I would still like to say something positive (and explain why I gave it four stars). I loved the writing style and the many beautiful quotes I can get from them. I love all the old characters and I loved to see their families. I liked Eadlyn and the growth she makes. I still love the covers. I just love this world! goodbye Illea! (Hopefully for real now!) <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1467754452ra/19626636.gif" width="500" height="300" alt="description" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>I think it's a wise decision to take a break between the third and fourth book, BUT PEOPLE IF YOU LOVED THE FIRST THREE YOU ARE GOING TO LOVE THIS TO!! They are a bit less than the other books I thought, but still worth reading even if it is just to see the other characters all grown up.</["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></["br"]></span>  <a data-text-id="15334296735808559030" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1618835028" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1618835028" />    <a title="Isra Starr" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/1653392-isra-starr"><img alt="Isra Starr" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1331653817p2/1653392.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1618835028?book_show_action=false">May 26, 2016</a>      <a title="Isra Starr" class="user" name="Isra Starr" href="/user/show/1653392-isra-starr">Isra Starr</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1653392-isra-starr?shelf=gifted">gifted</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1653392-isra-starr?shelf=read-2016">read-2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/1653392-isra-starr?shelf=may-page-count-challenge">may-page-count-challenge</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1618835028" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16647947333774275490">I would give this book a solid 3 stars, which surprised me because I went into it expecting to drop 1.5-2 stars maximum. This is definitely <b>NOT</b> a spoiler-free review so you have been warned! You can find this review on my blog, <a href="http://iisraiis.blogspot.com" rel="nofollow">Israis</a>.<br /><br />First and foremost, Eadlyn had such a personality change from The Heir to The Crown that it gave me whiplash. This spoiled, selfish, brat of a girl all of a sudden becomes a kind of decent person, and while I always appreciate some character development, that was a</span>  <span id="freeText16647947333774275490" style="display:none">I would give this book a solid 3 stars, which surprised me because I went into it expecting to drop 1.5-2 stars maximum. This is definitely <b>NOT</b> a spoiler-free review so you have been warned! You can find this review on my blog, <a href="http://iisraiis.blogspot.com" rel="nofollow">Israis</a>.<br /><br />First and foremost, Eadlyn had such a personality change from The Heir to The Crown that it gave me whiplash. This spoiled, selfish, brat of a girl all of a sudden becomes a kind of decent person, and while I always appreciate some character development, that was a little too much of a change to happen all of a sudden. The Heir leaves off with her still having such an attitude, although she did change a little bit in the process of book four, but when I picked up The Crown, the first thing I noticed was that she was actually kind of decent? Why? What changed that suddenly made her so willing to be nice and generous and care about her country above all else? That left me frustrated during the beginning, but gradually throughout the book I started ignoring it and focusing on the plot which, trust me, had its fair share of plot holes but we'll get into that later.<br /><br />My main point of reading this book was for the boys, and let me tell you why. While we really don't get to experience much of them because 90% of the story is Eadlyn's internal monologue on what she's possibly going to do to maintain her position of princess without the people rioting (something that she constantly worries about but we <i>never</i> actually see in the book). They all had such potential to be unique and beautiful characters that I wanted to learn more. It's fair to note this first: <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Eadlyn drops the Selection down to a final six Elite in the beginning of the novel <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span>. Having said that, let's talk about the boys.<br /><br />Hale is so sweet and kind and he develops so much throughout the book that I would gladly read a spinoff about him and the other remaining Selection candidates. Honestly, he does the bravest thing in the book when he shows Eadlyn his dedication to her but expresses his true feelings, and for me that was great. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Also his relationship with Ean sounded so precious that I really, really wanted another novel just to learn about how they fell for each other. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> While Ean wasn't my favourite, I approved of him because he didn't have to say much for Eadlyn to know how he felt about her and the palace and the Selection process. Kile developed a lot in this book too. He went from being someone who really didn't care about Eadlyn and the castle and wanted to run away from it to actually wanting to do things to change the castle and better it. Finally, Henri is the cutest little human being in the world. I wanted to pull him from the pages of the book and tuck him in my pocket to protect him forever because he's too sweet for this world and deserves so much better than having to deal with Eadlyn in any context. He was the only one who seemed to do whatever he could to make sure that everything was so bright and cheery, and he tried so hard to learn English for Eadlyn!!! Little sweetheart!<br /><br />As for the others, they were all okay in their own ways.<br /><br />Here's where the nonstop spoilers come in. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[Eadlyn falling for Eikko (Erik) was so...not well written? I have to admit when they first talked in The Heir I knew she was going to pick him or Kile, but there was little to no interaction between them that deserved this whole big romantic storyline that she seemed to narrate in The Crown. Having said that, their little romance was cute. I loved the way they exchanged rings in their own way because it showed that they had feelings for each other, but I thought it was downright stupid that Eadlyn kept insisting it'd never be because she was required to pick a boy from the Selection when she insisted in The Heir that she had the ability to call off the Selection at any time when she agreed to it. Also let's once again talk about Henri, because the ending scene where he grabbed their hands and told them both that he loved them and that they had to be together was SO CUTE.<br /><br />Speaking of that ending scene, the most ridiculous thing in this entire book was King Maxon's declaration about him committing treason. When Eadlyn ran up to him begging to marry Eikko I was expecting some hesitation but then an okay from him because he had his same spiel with America, but no off he goes into this story about how his dad beat him up as a kid and there was a mistress and half-sister drama with Lady Brice and NO. Just no. That was so unnecessary and immediately diverted my attention from an actually semi-decent ending for this overall average series. That was not necessary Kiera Cass, not in the slightest, and it jarred me out of actually caring about the book. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />My overall feelings towards the book are basically summed up as cute, but will never read again. The Selection series was overall an average set of books that honestly should've stopped at book three, but that's fine. I didn't mind this book too much, the fourth I could've completely done without. Am I attached to Eadlyn? Absolutely not. I want to know more about the boys, though, but if anything else does come out attached to this series, I doubt I'll ever read it.</span>  <a data-text-id="16647947333774275490" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" imgcol" href="/user/show/31055027-happinesslife"><img alt="~U+2665~ happinesslife" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1399047566p2/31055027.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1768688807?book_show_action=false">Oct 07, 2016</a>      <a title="~U+2665~ happinesslife" class="user" name="~U+2665~ happinesslife" href="/user/show/31055027-happinesslife">~U+2665~ happinesslife</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9788416498147" href="/book/show/27557581-la-corona">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1768688807" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13592355759569333314"><a target="_blank" href="http://yourhappinesslife.blogspot.com.es/2016/10/resena-306-la-corona-kiera-cass.html" rel="nofollow">http://yourhappinesslife.blogspot.com...</a><br /><br />Un final digno de una reina. Eadly es una princesa que tiene que ganarse la aprobaciU+00F3n de su reino mientras se enfrenta a la ardua tarea de abrir su corazU+00F3n y elegir a la persona que compartirU+00E1 su vida, pero el corazU+00F3n no es siempre el que manda cuando tienes unas leyes que cumplir.<br /><br />Aunque la primera parte fuera un poco lenta y de relleno, he disfrutado mucho de la segunda y del final, y sobretodo de los grandes cambios que nos propone la autora.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1768688807">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1768688807" title="Flag this review as false;">comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1768688807?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=6">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1768688807' style='display: '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1647026180" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1647026180" />    <a title="Ladywolf." class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/30632295-ladywolf"><img alt="Ladywolf." src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476291447p2/30632295.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1647026180?book_show_action=false">May 24, 2016</a>      <a title="Ladywolf." class="user" name="Ladywolf." href="/user/show/30632295-ladywolf">Ladywolf.</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9788820060374" href="/book/show/29957460-the-crown">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer1647026180&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1647026180" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14071098873024002731">Non saprei come descrivere la sensazione che provo adesso, ma direi che U+00E8 molto simile al sollievo.<br />SU+00EC, perchU+00E9 finalmente questa serie U+00E8 finita! Alleluia!<br />CioU+00E8, devo ancora leggere la raccolta, ma rimedierU+00F2 (anche perchU+00E9 non puU+00F2 essere peggio di questo, no?). In ogni caso, sono felice di poter aver letto la conclusione di questa saga giU+00E0 di per sU+00E9 traballante.<br />Ora basta Cass, dedicati ad altro, per favore, che hai giU+00E0 fatto danni.<br />Se in The Heir non ero molto convinta, The Crown mi ha dimostrato che</span>  <span id="freeText14071098873024002731" style="display:none">Non saprei come descrivere la sensazione che provo adesso, ma direi che U+00E8 molto simile al sollievo.<br />SU+00EC, perchU+00E9 finalmente questa serie U+00E8 finita! Alleluia!<br />CioU+00E8, devo ancora leggere la raccolta, ma rimedierU+00F2 (anche perchU+00E9 non puU+00F2 essere peggio di questo, no?). In ogni caso, sono felice di poter aver letto la conclusione di questa saga giU+00E0 di per sU+00E9 traballante.<br />Ora basta Cass, dedicati ad altro, per favore, che hai giU+00E0 fatto danni.<br />Se in The Heir non ero molto convinta, The Crown mi ha dimostrato cheU+2026 beh, avevo ragione a dubitare di questa miniserie.<br />Per caritU+00E0, quando America era la protagonista ci sono stati alti e bassi, ma almeno la storia aveva un senso; qui, invece, sembra solo una telenovela mal riuscita. E la cosa peggiore, U+00E8 che in questU+2019ultimo romanzo non cU+2019 U+00E8 nemmeno un briciolo di azione o suspense. PerchU+00E9 scrivere un libro del genere se U+00E8 del tutto sconclusionato?<br />Eadlyn si fa pare per il cazzo, non muore nessuno, il U+201CcattivoU+201D di turno U+00E8 un coglione e Kile viene liquidato.<br />SU+00EC, ok. Tifavo per Kile, ma non U+00E8 comunque la ragione per cui questo libro non mi soddisfa. Anzi, alla luce dei fatti, ha fatto bene a prendere su armi e bagagli per andare a occuparsi di ciU+00F2 che gli stava piU+00F9 a cuore.<br />Voglio direU+2026 Erik U+00E8 una buona scelta, peccato che questo fantomatico amore sia sbucato fuori cosU+00EC dal nulla.<br />Inoltre, avevo affermato che Eadlyn mi era sembrata realistica nello scorso romanzo. EbbeneU+2026 Forse U+00E8 fin troppo realistica, al pari delle ragazzette cagacazzi e provate di oggi. Manco avesse 15 anniU+2026<br />Partiamo con ordine.<br />Fin dallU+2019inizio Eadlyn ammette di sapere chi ama. Ok, bueno. E allora perchU+00E9 Erik viene fuori dopo?<br />Continua a pensare che sposerU+00E0 Kile, per poi fare dietrofront su tutta la linea.<br />Si preoccupa immensamente per lU+2019opinione pubblica e si fa aiutare da Marid nonostante sappia fin dal principio che la sua famiglia U+00E8 sempre stata una cagacazzi.<br />Scopre che Hale e Ean sono gay, ma non fa nulla per migliorare la loro situazione, a parte farli andare via senza alcuna punizione.<br />Ok, spiegatemi questa cosa della coppia omosessuale che U+00E8 servita solo a eliminare due pretendenti della Selezione. Un conto U+00E8, che dopo la scoperta, Eadlyn avesse creato una legge per sostenere le coppie omo, ma qui se ne U+00E8 praticamente lavata le mani, dopo aver puntualizzato quanto gli atteggiamenti verso di loro fossero discriminati.<br />Poi, i tuoi genitori sono stanchi? Bene, fatti eleggere regina senza un minimo di esperienza e con Marid che puU+00F2 darti in pasto allU+2019opinione pubblica con uno schiocco delle dita. E non contenta, per impedire ciU+00F2, decidi di sposare subito Henri che manco riuscite a comunicare. <br />SU+00EC, ok, mi calmo. Ero abbastanza WTF???<br />Ecco perchU+00E9 ho sempre pensato che questa serie doveva fermarsi con The One.<br />Dopo uno inizia a fare casini.<br />Bah.<br />Morale della favola: Kile U+00E8 esiliato per un anno (eccetto tre giorni) dal palazzo, Marid viene fatto allontanare e Eadlyn si sposa Erik o Eikko.<br />Fine.<br />Sul serio: U+00E8 stata una lettura un poU+2019 deludente.<br />PerchU+00E9 a conti fatti si U+00E8 basata solo e solamente sulla percezione di Eadlyn. Nemmeno sui suoi sentimenti!<br />E allora che minkia decidi a fare di sposarti se quello che ti preme di piU+00F9 U+00E8 lU+2019opinione che il popolo ha di te?<br />Per non parlare della tragedia epica che tira su perchU+00E9 non puU+00F2 sposarsi con Erik.<br />Ti prego, Keira CassU+2026 Sul serio.<br />Non toccare piU+00F9 questa storia.<br /></span>  <a data-text-id="14071098873024002731" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1647026180">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1647026180" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1647026180&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1647026180'><a id="like_count_review_1647026180" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1647026180?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">9 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1647026180" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1647026180" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=9&rating[page]=6&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1647026180&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1647026180" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1647026180, true, &#39;&#39;);        </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1029148569" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13222810883859735298">5 stars <3<br /><br />La digne conclusion d'une sU+00E9rie envoutante.<br /><br />C'est refermant mon roman aprU+00E8s avoir lu la toute derniU+00E8re ligne que j'ai rU+00E9ellement pris conscience que je ne reverrais plus jamais America, Maxon et Eadlyn. MU+00EAme si je n'en ai pas envie, je dois leur dire aurevoir. Je suis partagU+00E9e prU+00E9sentement entre la joie et la tristesse. The Crown est la digne fin d'une sU+00E9rie qui m'aura fait rU+00EAvU+00E9 pendant 4 annU+00E9es merveilleuses.<br /><br />Dans ce dernier tome, Eadlyn doit faire un choix. Mais aprU+00E8s la fin inatten</span>  <span id="freeText13222810883859735298" style="display:none">5 stars <3<br /><br />La digne conclusion d'une sU+00E9rie envoutante.<br /><br />C'est refermant mon roman aprU+00E8s avoir lu la toute derniU+00E8re ligne que j'ai rU+00E9ellement pris conscience que je ne reverrais plus jamais America, Maxon et Eadlyn. MU+00EAme si je n'en ai pas envie, je dois leur dire aurevoir. Je suis partagU+00E9e prU+00E9sentement entre la joie et la tristesse. The Crown est la digne fin d'une sU+00E9rie qui m'aura fait rU+00EAvU+00E9 pendant 4 annU+00E9es merveilleuses.<br /><br />Dans ce dernier tome, Eadlyn doit faire un choix. Mais aprU+00E8s la fin inattendue du tome prU+00E9cU+00E9dent, elle n'a malheureusement pas le cU+0153ur U+00E0 enchainer les rendez-vous avec ses divers prU+00E9tendants. Le peuple d'IllU+00E9a est mU+00E9content et Eadlyn aura besoin de tous les alliU+00E9s possibles, mU+00EAme de ceux dont elle doute.<br /><br />Lorsque j'ai dU+00E9butU+00E9 ma lecture, j'U+00E9tais angoissU+00E9e de savoir ce qui allait advenir U+00E0 l'un de mes personnages favoris de la sU+00E9rie. J'avais envie de voir Eadlyn U+00E9voluer bien sU+00FBr, mais je n'avais pas le cU+0153ur lU+00E9ger. Ce n'est que vers la moitiU+00E9 du roman, lorsque j'ai enfin eu l'esprit en paix, que j'ai U+00E0 nouveau pris goU+00FBt au flirt et aux rendez-vous. Et pour en avoir, il y en a! Ce n'est peut-U+00EAtre pas ce U+00E0 quoi plusieurs s'attendaient, mais personnellement, je ne pourrais U+00EAtre plus ravie du choix final d'Eadlyn. En terminant ma lecture, j'avais le cU+0153ur tellement gros que j'ai bien cru que j'allais pleurer de joie. Et juste U+00E0 y repenser, j'ai le sourire aux lU+00E8vres.<br /><br />En seulement deux tomes, Eadlyn a U+00E9normU+00E9ment U+00E9voluU+00E9, devenant ainsi une femme U+00E0 la fois forte et sensible. Je n'aurais jamais cru que c'U+00E9tait possible U+00E9tant donnU+00E9 le mU+00E9pris que j'avais pour elle au tout dU+00E9but du 4e tome. Mais sa force de caractU+00E8re m'a totalement conquise, et j'avouerais mU+00EAme que je la prU+00E9fU+00E8re peut-U+00EAtre U+00E0 America. Elle a ce petit je ne sais quoi de plus.<br /><br />Quant U+00E0 l'aspect dystopie, il est lU+00E9gU+00E8rement plus dU+00E9veloppU+00E9 dans ce dernier tome. Kiera Cass ne peut faire autrement que de boucler la bloucle, et elle le fait vraiment de maniU+00E8re admirable. Eadlyn n'a jamais U+00E9tU+00E9 la prU+00E9fU+00E9rU+00E9e du public, mais on peut voir qu'elle a U+00E0 cU+0153ur le bonheur de chacun des habitants d'IllU+00E9a.<br /><br />Et bien voilU+00E0. C'est la fin. AprU+00E8s 4 annU+00E9es U+00E0 attendre impatiemment le prochain tome de La SU+00E9lection, il n'y en aura plus. Kiera Cass a fait un travail admirable. Elle m'a conquise dU+00E8s la premiU+00E8re page du premier tome, U+00E0 un tel point que U+00E7a me fait mal de me dire que je viens de lire la derniU+00E8re page du tout dernier tome de la sU+00E9rie. Mais je me rU+00E9jouis en me disant que ses personnages vivront U+00E0 jamais dans mon imagination. Et que si l'envie m'en prend, je pourrai toujours ouvrir U+00E0 nouveau mon livre et me replonger dans leur histoire.</span>  <a data-text-id="13222810883859735298" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="freeTextContainer444758600418774972">While this ending was a bit predictable, I absolutely loved it! it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1328734533" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer634626458114710809"><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1461520005i/18876829.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Doesn't do justice to Kiera Cass' other works.<br><br>The Crown didn't do it for me. I'm left with the feeling that I should have waited to read both books together, because The Crown on its own isn't as good as The Heir or any of Kiera Cass' previous books.<br><br>I didn't enjoy it nearly as much as the other Selection books (which I devoured). I liked to read her dates with the elite. Romance was put as a third storyline with politics and family being the priority. It was nice to read Eadlyn's growth.<br><br>I still</span>  <span id="freeText634626458114710809" style="display:none"><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1461520005i/18876829.png" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Doesn't do justice to Kiera Cass' other works.<br><br>The Crown didn't do it for me. I'm left with the feeling that I should have waited to read both books together, because The Crown on its own isn't as good as The Heir or any of Kiera Cass' previous books.<br><br>I didn't enjoy it nearly as much as the other Selection books (which I devoured). I liked to read her dates with the elite. Romance was put as a third storyline with politics and family being the priority. It was nice to read Eadlyn's growth.<br><br>I still gave it 3 stars because I was able to finish it even though I skipped a few pages here and there.<br><br><br><br><i>I received an eARC of this book in exchange for an honest review.</i><br><br><img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1461514072i/18876286.jpg" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><a href="https://www.facebook.com/readingromances" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1461512074i/18876058.jpg" width="60" height="60" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a> <a href="https://www.amazon.com/gp/profile/A1TE4KK3SEH0M1" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1461512074i/18876059.png" width="60" height="60" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a> <a href="https://twitter.com/readingromances" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img src="https://i.gr-assets.com/images/S/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1461511043i/18875876.jpg" width="70" height="70" class="gr-hostedUserImg"></a></span>  <a data-text-id="634626458114710809" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1328734533">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1328734533" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1328734533&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1328734533'><a id="like_count_review_1328734533" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1328734533?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">9 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1328734533" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1328734533" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=9&rating[page]=7&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1328734533&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1328734533" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1328734533, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1328734533?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=7">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1328734533' style='display: none;'></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1328734533' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1328734533, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1649773056" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1649773056" />    <a title="Danny " class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/8943230-danny"><img alt="Danny " src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1475182616p2/8943230.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1649773056?book_show_action=false">May 30, 2016</a>      <a title="Danny " class="user" name="Danny " href="/user/show/8943230-danny">Danny </a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1649773056" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9155824829000144380"><b> U+201CMaybe it's not the first kisses that are supposed to be special. Maybe it's the last ones.U+201D</b><br /><br />This book was way to short!! I do think Eadlyn as a character had a great growth from The Heir to The Crown, she was pretty terrible in the first book but I grew to like her more in this book. <br /><br />My issues with these last two books in particular is that I don't feel like they were necessary, and honestly they didn't add anything to the series or the world. Also another thing I didn't like which I had an iss</span>  <span id="freeText9155824829000144380" style="display:none"><b> U+201CMaybe it's not the first kisses that are supposed to be special. Maybe it's the last ones.U+201D</b><br /><br />This book was way to short!! I do think Eadlyn as a character had a great growth from The Heir to The Crown, she was pretty terrible in the first book but I grew to like her more in this book. <br /><br />My issues with these last two books in particular is that I don't feel like they were necessary, and honestly they didn't add anything to the series or the world. Also another thing I didn't like which I had an issue with in the main series is I feel like the stories just skim the surface of the world, we never get any depth of whats really going on outside the walls of the castle, and I never really felt any conflict while reading the book.<br /><br />As for the romance I did like who she ended up with but again with these two books being so short and not much happening I didn't really feel much romance blossoming between the two of the characters. Its definitely not on par with America and Maxon I just felt like it was too rushed and you never had the time to really see many special moments with Eadlyn and the selected guy.<br /><br /></span> class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1750465734?book_show_action=false">Sep 27, 2016</a>      <a title="Nina U+273F Looseleaf Reviews U+273F" class="user" name="Nina U+273F Looseleaf Reviews U+273F" href="/user/show/3456885-nina-looseleaf-reviews">Nina U+273F Looseleaf Reviews U+273F</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3456885-nina-looseleaf-reviews?shelf=dystopian">dystopian</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3456885-nina-looseleaf-reviews?shelf=romance">romance</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3456885-nina-looseleaf-reviews?shelf=teen">teen</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/3456885-nina-looseleaf-reviews?shelf=2016-new-release-challenge">2016-new-release-challenge</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1750465734" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4483443143244659371">This was almost my favorite book of The Selection series if it wasn't so damn SHORT! 279 pages? Why you gotta play us dirty, Miss Cass? I have absolutely fallen in love with Eadlyn and all of her boys, and don't get me wrong, I love the ending of this, but I felt like there was no buildup whatsoever. I want to love this couple so much, but while we get to fall in love with their characters individually, the buildup to the relationship is literally non-existent. It is very in keeping with</span>  <span id="freeText4483443143244659371" style="display:none">This was almost my favorite book of The Selection series if it wasn't so damn SHORT! 279 pages? Why you gotta play us dirty, Miss Cass? I have absolutely fallen in love with Eadlyn and all of her boys, and don't get me wrong, I love the ending of this, but I felt like there was no buildup whatsoever. I want to love this couple so much, but while we get to fall in love with their characters individually, the buildup to the relationship is literally non-existent. It is very in keeping with Eadlyn's character that she goes all in without even knowing if her decision is what *he* wants, but where's the fallout? Or even the lead up? So much was left unexplored I just have to wonder why this was published as is.</span>  <a data-text-id="4483443143244659371" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1293573979" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1293573979" />    <a title="Therese" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/33131884-therese"><img alt="Therese" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1476706501p2/33131884.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1293573979?book_show_action=false">Jul 18, 2016</a>      <a title="Therese" class="user" name="Therese" href="/user/show/33131884-therese">Therese</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33131884-therese?shelf=2016-release">2016-release</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33131884-therese?shelf=2016-reads">2016-reads</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1293573979" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10901180212631304470">The story was so rushed it felt like a disrespect to the characters and the readers who rooted for these characters. I love Kiera and I loved how the series started out. It's one of those things that you like not for any particular reason but the feeling of familiarity. <br /><br />I don't understand Eadlyn. One moment she likes this guy, then this guy, then she claims it couldn't be love, then she goes and says she's in love with this other guy then bam they're soulmates. I was choosing from two guys, and</span>  <span id="freeText10901180212631304470" style="display:none">The story was so rushed it felt like a disrespect to the characters and the readers who rooted for these characters. I love Kiera and I loved how the series started out. It's one of those things that you like not for any particular reason but the feeling of familiarity. <br /><br />I don't understand Eadlyn. One moment she likes this guy, then this guy, then she claims it couldn't be love, then she goes and says she's in love with this other guy then bam they're soulmates. I was choosing from two guys, and she did end up with one of them but I still hoped she wouldn't choose at all because she was young and brave and strong and she could face anything with her ladies. If she could choose someone who wasn't even in the selection, why couldn't she choose herself? Her country? I don't see how her being engaged solved any of the country's problems. I could've accepted it if she had any romantic connection with the guy, though. But there was none. It was all too sudden. I was going to give it 2 stars but I upped it by one star for emotional attachment. <br /><br />Update: I'm giving it 2 stars again. I was browsing through my books I rated 3 stars and it didn't seem fair.</span>  <a data-text-id="10901180212631304470" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1380004861?book_show_action=false">Jul 16, 2016</a>      <a edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1380004861" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3160604353204295509"><b>L'ho cominciato consapevole del fatto che l'avrei odiato e l'ho finito promettendomi di non leggere piU+00F9 nulla di Kiera Cass.</b><br><br>La trilogia di Maxon e America non mi era dispiaciuta, ma i libri di Eadlyn sono veramente orrendi.<br>La protagonista U+00E8 insopportabile (pure il popolo la odia, <i>non potete immaginarvi le risate che mi sono fatta quando le hanno lanciato il cibo</i>) ma allo stesso tempo tutti i personaggi secondari della storia la adorano e venerano la terra su cui cammina.<br>Le dicono che U+00E8 gentile,</span>  <span id="freeText3160604353204295509" style="display:none"><b>L'ho cominciato consapevole del fatto che l'avrei odiato e l'ho finito promettendomi di non leggere piU+00F9 nulla di Kiera Cass.</b><br><br>La trilogia di Maxon e America non mi era dispiaciuta, ma i libri di Eadlyn sono veramente orrendi.<br>La protagonista U+00E8 insopportabile (pure il popolo la odia, <i>non potete immaginarvi le risate che mi sono fatta quando le hanno lanciato il cibo</i>) ma allo stesso tempo tutti i personaggi secondari della storia la adorano e venerano la terra su cui cammina.<br>Le dicono che U+00E8 gentile, <b>ma U+00E8 una carogna</b>.<br>Le dicono che U+00E8 altruista, <b>ma U+00E8 l'esatto opposto</b>.<br>Le dicono che U+00E8 intelligente, <b>ma si fa fregare dal primo cretino che incontra</b>.<br><br>........... a mai piU+00F9 rivederci Kiera Cass.<br><br><br><br><a href="http://photobucket.com/images/i'm out of here" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">  <img       </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1387222011" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer12569895168195487772">Cover!!<br />The background is really nice. Shame that I don't like the dress or the girl.<br /><br />-----------------------------------------------------------------------<br /><br />Edit: Ohmygodohmygod I just saw a spoiler for this book. And not just any spoiler; a spoiler for the guy that Eadlyn ends up with. <br /><br />PEOPLE, PLEASE HIDE YOUR SPOILERS, OR AT LEAST PUT A WARNING AT THE TOP OF YOUR REVIEW.<br /><br />The worst thing about this isn't that I was spoiled, it's that Eadyln ends up with the guy I <b>don't</b> want her to end up with. Ugh</span>  <span id="freeText12569895168195487772" style="display:none">Cover!!<br />The background is really nice. Shame that I don't like the dress or the girl.<br /><br />-----------------------------------------------------------------------<br /><br />Edit: Ohmygodohmygod I just saw a spoiler for this book. And not just any spoiler; a spoiler for the guy that Eadlyn ends up with. <br /><br />PEOPLE, PLEASE HIDE YOUR SPOILERS, OR AT LEAST PUT A WARNING AT THE TOP OF YOUR REVIEW.<br /><br />The worst thing about this isn't that I was spoiled, it's that Eadyln ends up with the guy I <b>don't</b> want her to end up with. Ugh.<br /><br />And on second thoughts, since I've had almost a year to think about this, I don't think I liked The Heir as much as I thought I did (as you can see in my review for that book). So, because of that too, I might give this a skip. As much as it pains me not to finish a series (that really should have ended two books ago), I just don't think I can handle the disappoint. </span>  <a data-text-id="12569895168195487772" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; There was crying by the crying was because of how beautiful it was! <br /><br /><br />I just have to say many of the things I read in it I didn't see coming! <br />Like Hale and Ean! From the moment it happened in the book i thought it was adorable. But my favorite part in the entire book was the ending! It was a perfect way to end the series. I have to say I wish I had more of this place and these characters but I wouldn't change a thing that happened in this book! Erik and Eadlyn are perfect together and it<br />Just made me so happy! <br /><br />So overall I loved this book and I definitely gave it a 5/5 stars!      rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1435175203" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5227092993239018646">I'm so conflicted. I started the book so excited to have the series come to an satisfying end but I can't pinpoint why the book fell a little flat to me.<br /><br />Eadlyn changed for the better even though some of her decisions made me question her judgement. The story in general seemed rushed and left situations feeling unresolved. The guy Eadlyn chose ended up being quite predictable and everyone except Eadlyn and her choice, lost something as a result of her actions.<br /><br />Regardless of The Crown leaving me di</span>  <span id="freeText5227092993239018646" style="display:none">I'm so conflicted. I started the book so excited to have the series come to an satisfying end but I can't pinpoint why the book fell a little flat to me.<br /><br />Eadlyn changed for the better even though some of her decisions made me question her judgement. The story in general seemed rushed and left situations feeling unresolved. The guy Eadlyn chose ended up being quite predictable and everyone except Eadlyn and her choice, lost something as a result of her actions.<br /><br />Regardless of The Crown leaving me disappointed I still enjoy the series and recommend them to anyone needing a break from the heavier stories.</span>  <a data-text-id="5227092993239018646" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1124826410" />    <a title="Caleb" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/16381356-caleb"><img           </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1124826410" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11291289646749172832">More like a 3.5 stars<br /><br />Eadlyn is a ridiculous character and acts like a child sometimes. The plot felt rushed a lot and not as fluent as the other books in the series. America did have many flaws in the first three books but she did have a brain at some moments. I will be making a video review if this on my channel which I will share later.<br /><br />UPDATE: looking back I only liked the writing and decided it wasn't worth a 3 star </span>          </span> itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1573200805" />    <a title="DaniU+00EBlle (Light & Stripes)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6097882-dani-lle-light-stripes"><img alt="DaniU+00EBlle (Light & Stripes)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1474126396p2/6097882.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1573200805?book_show_action=false">Jun 16, 2016</a>      <a title="DaniU+00EBlle (Light & Stripes)" class="user" name="DaniU+00EBlle (Light & Stripes)" href="/user/show/6097882-dani-lle-light-stripes">DaniU+00EBlle (Light & Stripes)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9789000345205" href="/book/show/29740398-de-kroon">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6097882-dani-lle-light-stripes?shelf=dutch">dutch</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6097882-dani-lle-light-stripes?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1573200805" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4744104056011652558">Leuk boek! En zo blij met de keuze die Eadlyn uiteindelijk heeft gemaakt! Wel jammer dat de serie nu voorbij is. Een van de leukste series die ik gelezen heb! 3.5 sterren omdat het allemaal toch wel heel snel gebeurde in het boek.<br />Volledige recensie: <a target="_blank" href="http://lightandstripes.nl/kiera-cass-de-kroon" rel="nofollow">http://lightandstripes.nl/kiera-cass-...</a></span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1573200805">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1573200805" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1573200805&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1573200805'><a id="like_count_review_1573200805" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1573200805?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">9 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1573200805" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1573200805" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=9&rating[page]=7&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1573200805&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1573200805" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1573200805, true, &#39;&#39;);
