class="section">      <div id="review_1354884000" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1354884000" />    <a title="Imnothing" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/20505354-imnothing"><img alt="Imnothing" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1368989615p2/20505354.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1354884000?book_show_action=false">Jun 08, 2016</a>      <a title="Imnothing" class="user" name="Imnothing" href="/user/show/20505354-imnothing">Imnothing</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20505354-imnothing?shelf=sexy-covers">sexy-covers</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20505354-imnothing?shelf=decepciU+00F3n">decepciU+00F3n</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20505354-imnothing?shelf=bad-finals-incompleto-es-poco">bad-finals-incompleto-es-poco</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1354884000" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10881273056861898300">Portada y encima dice que es la conclusiU+00F3n. <br />Ataque.<br /><br />***<br />A V I SO en esta reseU+00F1a (o intento de reseU+00F1a) hay demasiados spoilers, lee bajo tu responsabilidad.<br /><br /><br />Lo mio con Kiera Cass se llama amor-odio a su escritura. Algo con lo que sin duda a veces se disfruta pero en otras ocasiones se detesta. Con The Crown lamentablemente me ha pasado con The Elite, un libro que me resultU+00F3 una carcasa salvo por dos sorpresas; y aquU+00ED con The Crown ha pasado lo mismo, he sentido rapidez e inconclusiU+00F3n. Algo con lo qu</span>  <span id="freeText10881273056861898300" style="display:none">Portada y encima dice que es la conclusiU+00F3n. <br />Ataque.<br /><br />***<br />A V I SO en esta reseU+00F1a (o intento de reseU+00F1a) hay demasiados spoilers, lee bajo tu responsabilidad.<br /><br /><br />Lo mio con Kiera Cass se llama amor-odio a su escritura. Algo con lo que sin duda a veces se disfruta pero en otras ocasiones se detesta. Con The Crown lamentablemente me ha pasado con The Elite, un libro que me resultU+00F3 una carcasa salvo por dos sorpresas; y aquU+00ED con The Crown ha pasado lo mismo, he sentido rapidez e inconclusiU+00F3n. Algo con lo que sin duda tras leer The Heir no esperaba encontrarme.<br /><br />Vale, lo admito, en la vida de niU+00F1a disfrutU+00E9 con las pelU+00EDculas Disney, unas que a lo mU+00E1ximo que aspiraban sus protagonistas en la vida era con soU+00F1ar con el dU+00EDa de su boda, con la perfecciU+00F3n de un hombre que no existe y con el deseo de encontrar un amor perfecto que nada tenU+00EDa que ver con la realidad. AsU+00ED pues U+00BFcomo nos vendieron La SelecciU+00F3n? Pues como eso mismo pero con el aU+00F1adido distU+00F3pico tan maravillado que vino acompaU+00F1ado tras el U+00E9xito de Los Juegos del Hambre. Con eso sobre la mesa naciU+00F3 lo que nadie en su momento esperaba: un U+00E9xito desmesurado con el que aU+00F1os mU+00E1s tarde se vendieron otras novelas, comparU+00E1ndolas a esta misma. Fijaros como nos vendieron The Red Queen (the Selection meets... blah blah blah).<br /><br />La trilogU+00EDa acabU+00F3, y vimos un cuento de hadas con tintes polU+00EDticos, que no distU+00F3pico, cuidado. AsU+00ED pues pienso que tras vender los derechos para pelU+00EDcula Kiera pensU+00F3 en hacer una continuaciU+00F3n que siguiera con el estigma de U+00E9xito que habU+00EDa tenido su principal trilogU+00EDa. Y asU+00ED empezU+00F3 The Heir, con una protagonista que nada tenU+00EDa que ver con su madre, y que sin duda disfrutU+00E9 porque si se apreciaban preocupaciones e inquietudes polU+00EDticas que sin duda habU+00EDan sido tapadas mU+00E1s de la cuenta para elevar el nivel de escenas amorosas.<br /><br />The Heir mostrU+00F3 un aumento de "originalidad" de Kiera y logrU+00F3 gustarme, cosa por la que no apostaba. U+00BFQue pasU+00F3 entonces? Pues que las expectativas para U+00E9ste libro fueron bastante elevadas. Bastante.<br /><br />Vale. Primero empiezo por lo positivo. Que es poco y luego os justifico mi descontento. Lo mejor de la novela son dos sorpresillas. Primero que Lady no se quU+00E9 resulta ser la tU+00EDa de Ead, cosa que supongo que algunos sabU+00EDais y otros desconocU+00EDamos. Resulta que la amante del padre de Maxon le soltU+00F3 tras llamarle zorra...<br /><blockquote>Ya le dirU+00E9 a tu hermana que le envU+00EDas saludos</blockquote><br /><br />Imaginaros con la cara con la que me quedU+00E9. U+00BFQue era su tU+00EDa? Pues eso, nuevo miembro para la familia real. Toma, ya. <br /><br />Y la segunda, pues la relaciU+00F3n homosexual de dos de los Seleccionados. Es un clichU+00E9 que decidas poner al que le gusta la moda como homosexual, U+00BFpero que le vamos ha hacer? La cosa es que el que le gustaba la moda se enamorU+00F3 de otro Seleccionado. Uno del que no sabemos mucho de el, salvo que es encantador, carismU+00E1tico.... Vamos que una cosa llevU+00F3 a la otra y ahU+00ED floreciU+00F3 el amor. Ead decide dejarles ir como enamorados que son y ella prosigue con su SelecciU+00F3n.<br /><br />A partir de aquU+00ED no hay mU+00E1s sorpresas. AsU+00ED que solo me queda lo negativo.<br /><br />Primero: U+00BFOs acordarais como Ead leU+00EDa la prensa informativa en The Heir, y bueno nos hacU+00EDa participes de los descontentos de los ProCastas? U+00BFSU+00ED? Pues vale. Olvidadaros de esas informaciones Kiera las tira por tierra, y si hace falta de hace un rebozado de croquetas con ello. AsU+00ED pues la buena de Ead, que era una chica aplicada por la polU+00EDtica de su paU+00EDs pasa de preocuparse de ese tipo de prensa a preocuparse y contentar a la prensa amarillista de U+00CDllea. SU+00ED seU+00F1oras y seU+00F1ores, todas las decisiones de Ead (la mayorU+00EDa de ellas) son en base a contentar a la prensa del cotilleo de su propio paU+00EDs. OlU+00E9 tu, Ead por tu involuciU+00F3n. OlU+00E9 tu.<br /><br />La segunda: U+00DAnica meta en doscientas y pico pU+00E1ginas: El matrimonio. No sU+00E9 cuantas veces he leU+00EDdo la palabra matrimonio. Si, ya lo sU+00E9, no os echU+00E9is encima, que ya se de que va la SelecciU+00F3n: de matrimonio. Pero os aseguro que sU+00ED me vendes esto como una distopU+00EDa, algo mU+00E1s que solo matrimonio tendrU+00E1 U+00BFno? Pues no, ya os lo digo yo. U+00BFOs acordU+00E1is de como he empezado la reseU+00F1a? U+00BFCon lo de Disney? Pues eso.<br /><br />La tercera: Eikko/Erik/Ahora me doy cuenta que suspiro por ti. Antes que nada, os aviso que yo apostaba por Erik como interU+00E9s romU+00E1ntico de Ead, solo que no asU+00ED de mal desarrollado. Vamos, que resulta que en el anterior libro, en la famosilla pelea de la cocina, te das cuenta que te gusta el susodicho y Kiera no decide contarnos que empieza a sentir algo desde ese momento. No que va. Nada de nada. Eso no lo intuimos hasta que se miran un par de veces, se intentan besar otro par de veces y poco mU+00E1s. El amor es de TOMA, PUM, ME GUSTA. Y nada, tenemos que conformarnos con creernos la historia, porque claro (aquU+00ED va otra expresiU+00F3n que se repite hasta la sociedad) su historia puede ser como la de sus padres: un cuento de hadas...<br /><br />La cuarta: La incongruencia. SU+00ED, sU+00ED, la incongruencia U+00BFque querU+00E9is que os diga? Hace unos instantes os he comentado que Ead nos dice que se enamorU+00F3 de Erik en la pelea de las cocinas. U+00BFOs acordU+00E1is? U+00BFSU+00ED? Pues vale. En un escenario un poco distinto uno de los pretendientes se declara a Ead (U+00A1que romU+00E1ntico es todo aquU+00ED eh!) Cosa que la deja pasmada y que no tarda en compartir con Neena, que la informa de que le parece raro que le dijera el hombrecillo que justo se habU+00EDa enamorado de ella en las cocinas, que todo eso le olU+00EDa a chamusquina...<br /><blockquote>Creo que lo que me hace dudar U+2014empecU+00E9 U+2014 es el hecho de que empezara a sentir algo especial por mU+00ED justo la noche de la pelea en las cocinas</blockquote><br /><br />Vamos, no me jodas. U+00BFQue la protagonista si puede enamorarse en una cocina y el hombrecillo de la SelecciU+00F3n, no? U+00BFPero que me estU+00E1is vendiendo?<br /><br />Vale, ya paro. Si os soy sincera pienso que Kiera apoderarU+00E1 los genes de Casandra Clare y nos darU+00E1 mil versiones de su mundoU+00BFPor quU+00E9? Por el hermano de Ead que dice que nunca se saltarU+00EDa las normas, pensando en Kiera, seguro que ya le tiene una historU+00EDa prohibida para el. Fijo.<br /><br />U+00BFQue ha supuesto para mi este U+00FAltimo libro? Poco, la verdad, la idea de casarte porque te hace femenina delante de la naciU+00F3n y no masculina no me gusta. Pienso que Ead tenU+00EDa mas capacidades para gustar a su gente, que no centrarse solo en eso. Pero bueno U+00BFque mU+00E1s da?<br /><br />Otra cosa que he echado a faltar: explicaciones. U+00BFQue ha pasado con los rebeldes de Cristina/Cristine? Aquellos de los de la cruz U+00BFos acordU+00E1is? Por quU+00E9 yo si. Como aquellos diarios de Gregor, que nadie ha echado a faltar. Me falta informaciU+00F3n U+00BFAU+00FAn existen rebeldes en U+00CDllea que repudian lo que suponen las clases sociales? <br />Bah mU+00E1s cosas, incongruntes. Os acodU+00E1is como les echan en cara a los del pueblo que deciden hablar con Ead, que Ead ha diferencia del pueblo no podU+00EDa elegir su profesiU+00F3n, que prU+00E1cticamente eran unos dioses por poder elegir. Vale con esto en la mano U+00BFque pasa con esa mujer que te U+00E9sta lavando el retrete? U+00BFTambiU+00E9n ha tenido elecciU+00F3n como el resto? O como Ead U+00BFno ha podido elegir, porquU+00E9 debU+00EDa atender a una familU+00EDa a una unidad de personas que necesitaban de una persona trabajando mU+00E1s que formando ?. Que se interpongan cosas asU+00ED sin sentido alguno me asquea. U+00BFPero que mU+00E1s da?<br /><br />Ya esta. Seguro que pocos coincidirU+00E9is conmigo. AU+00FAn asU+00ED quiero expresar que ha significado para mi: una perdida.<br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="10881273056861898300" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1354884000">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1354884000" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1354884000&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1354884000'><a id="like_action_review_1354884000" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1354884000" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=8&rating[page]=7&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1354884000&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1354884000" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1354884000, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1354884000?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=7">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1354884000' style='display: none;'></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1354884000' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1354884000, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_845263279" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/845263279" />    <a title="Rebekah" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/26614970-rebekah"><img alt="Rebekah" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1389676327p2/26614970.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/845263279?book_show_action=false">Jul 14, 2016</a>      <a title="Rebekah" class="user" name="Rebekah" href="/user/show/26614970-rebekah">Rebekah</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26614970-rebekah?shelf=love-the-cover">love-the-cover</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26614970-rebekah?shelf=buy-for-personal-library">buy-for-personal-library</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26614970-rebekah?shelf=2-star-peasants">2-star-peasants</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26614970-rebekah?shelf=love-triangles-and-squares">love-triangles-and-squares</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26614970-rebekah?shelf=series-hype">series-hype</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/26614970-rebekah?shelf=summer-2016-to-read">summer-2016-to-read</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer845263279" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15451707272031797404"><b> <u>Why only two stars?</u> </b> In a nutshell, I base my ratings on literary merit. There's nothing "special" about Cass's writing style. Her idea isn't too original. The world-building is almost non-existent. This book won't be winning prizes any time soon. However, I still really enjoyed it. <br /><br /><b>Hardcore breakdown: the series as a whole</b><br />I give the entire series a 3/5. It's not the best thing to ever happen to me, but it's also easy reading with lighthearted plot. It's basically contemporary-dystopian if that</span>  <span id="freeText15451707272031797404" style="display:none"><b>  <u>Why only two stars?</u></b> In a nutshell, I base my ratings on literary merit. There's nothing "special" about Cass's writing style. Her idea isn't too original. The world-building is almost non-existent. This book won't be winning prizes any time soon. However, I still really enjoyed it. <br /><br /><b>Hardcore breakdown: the series as a whole</b><br />I give the entire series a 3/5. It's not the best thing to ever happen to me, but it's also easy reading with lighthearted plot. It's basically contemporary-dystopian if that makes sense. There's not a lot of focus on actual world-building or conflict. The emphasis of this series is the characters and their thoughts, feelings, etc. It's 100% clean, so a great series to start off with for new/younger readers. I always finish a Kiera Cass book in record time because her books are like crack. Once you start you can't stop until you're done. <br /><br /><b>Softcore breakdown: my reflections on this book</b><br />I'll start with the things I liked. The Crown was a great book to pull me out of my reading slump. It's princess-y enough and contemporary enough to kind of numb my brain without being "fluffy." I enjoyed Cass's themes and her reiteration of "love takes work" kind of thing. Eadlyn has really grown as a character, and I've enjoyed getting to know her. <br /><br /><u>What I did not like: Part One, the impersonal</u><br />Here we go. I think it's fair to say that I liked The Heir a lot more than The Crown, and I liked The Selection best of all. Nothing can beat the original Selection in my heart because I read it when I was first getting involved in YA and Goodreads. That being said, there are undeniable issues with The Crown...<br /><br /><i>A is for Aspen </i><br />I don't know about anyone else, but I was a little uncomfortable with Aspen being "Eadlyn's other parent" in her words. Maxon, Aspen, and America are all very close--much closer than they appeared in the fourth book--and I found it weird. Would you want your wife's serious ex-boyfriend that close with your kids? I can understand keeping him around and promoting him, I can even understand the occasional family dinner. What I didn't like was him being "the third parent." <br /><br /><i>B is for Brice</i><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[At the very end of the book, Maxon reveals that King Clarkson had a mistress and that mistress got pregnant with Maxon's half-sister. <b>This also made me uncomfortable</b>All we hear about Clarkson is that he's a butthole with a major soft spot for his wife. He basically hated everyone but her. So WHAT'S WITH THE MISTRESS? Where did this even come from? Couldn't we have left Lady Brice alone? Did we really need another wrench in this plot line? It was too much at the very end. I mean, there were eight pages left and Maxon drops the "you have an aunt" bomb. I didn't like it.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br /><i>C is for Crown</i><br />Eadlyn's love story felt a bit forced to me. Like one moment she had zero feelings for her choice, and the next she was in love. Again, I get that this is more of a fuzzy love story than a hardcore dystopian romance, but it still felt awkward in the beginning stages. She didn't end up with who I thought she'd end up with, and at first I was really aggravated. As the story went on, I started to accept it, and it was fine. But, again, it all felt very rushed and forced seeing as how the first Selection took three books, and this one was over in two. <br /><br /><u>What I did not like: Part Two, the personal</u><br />Let me just break out my soap box and stand up for a moment. <b>I do not appreciate YA authors intertwining their personal political stances within their fictional stories</b> <br /><br />***It is not my intention to take a stance on any of the following issues within this review, only to point out what I see as a flaw***<br /><br />Over and over and over again, I have seen YA authors bring up present day politics in their books. This is problematic because not everyone loves Barak Obama, supports gay marriage, votes Republican or Democratic, believes in God as Christians know him, or believes in God at all. These opinions should be (A)brushed over or (B) left out of fictional stories because they are FICTIONAL worlds. They hardly concern the characters. You can have a gay character without taking a stance on gay marriage. You can have a muslim or a Christian or an atheist character without taking a stance on religion. I do profess to be a Christian, so I love seeing Christian influence in YA. For this part, I am mostly talking about political platforms. <br /><br />During The Crown, we have someone "come out of the closet." I felt that it cheapened the whole thing. It was more of a convenient way to get rid of two contestants than something that actually added to character and plot. That kind of thing demands planning, and time, and a deeply emotional moment. I understand that homosexual characters are more and more popular as the LBGT movement grows across the nation. But if you're going to do something, do it on purpose. Do it right. Don't just throw it in there. <br /><br /><b>Kiera Cass was not the worst example of this I've ever seen. Not at all. </b> This just happened to be the straw that broke the camels back, and I felt the need to address this in my review. If you disagree with me, so be it. If you think I'm being a heartless B, feel free to unfriend me. I would never want to force my opinion on someone else. <br /><br />At the end of the day, I don't know if I'm better off for reading the fourth and fifth book in this series, or if the original Selection was magical enough to stand on its own. If you're a diehard Selection fan, then I'd recommend you finish it out. But if you're not, you might just want to leave it as is. <br /><br />Happy reading! </span>  <a data-text-id="15451707272031797404" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1199398096" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1199398096" />    <a title="Wendy" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/27878270-wendy"><img alt="Wendy" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1472383101p2/27878270.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1199398096?book_show_action=false">Jul 09, 2016</a>      <a title="Wendy" class="user" name="Wendy" href="/user/show/27878270-wendy">Wendy</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27878270-wendy?shelf=my-bookshelf">my-bookshelf</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/27878270-wendy?shelf=2016-releases">2016-releases</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1199398096" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15472719509367189713">The Selection is one of my favorite series ever, so obviously I pre-ordered The Crown and started reading right away. I seriously thought this book would be better, because of the epic plottwist in The Heir but also because this is the last book in the series. But unfortunately, Kiera Cass kinda let me down and IU+2019ll tell you why.<br /><br />So first of, I was beginning the book and I really enjoyed it. The epic plottwist at the end of The Heir continued and I was satisfied with the outcome of that.. but aft</span>  <span id="freeText15472719509367189713" style="display:none">The Selection is one of my favorite series ever, so obviously I pre-ordered The Crown and started reading right away. I seriously thought this book would be better, because of the epic plottwist in The Heir but also because this is the last book in the series. But unfortunately, Kiera Cass kinda let me down and IU+2019ll tell you why.<br /><br />So first of, I was beginning the book and I really enjoyed it. The epic plottwist at the end of The Heir continued and I was satisfied with the outcome of that.. but after that it kinda went downhill. I know IU+2019m unreasonable but I just felt that way.<br /><br />First, Eadlyn had to choose a guy for her Selection; thatU+2019s what this book is about, right? So she did. But IU+2019m so disappointed in who she chose (I know this probably shouldnU+2019t be a problem because everyone has their taste..) and the events were just a little crazy in my opinion. Suddenly this whole romance thing between Eadlyn and her boy seemed very insta love like and I just didnU+2019t like that.. I just prefer another boy who she could have fallen in love with!<br /><br />Also, can we talk about the last 100 pages? Because they were chaotic as hell. I mean, everything that probably could have happen, happened and it went by so fast. Too fast, if you ask me. I couldnU+2019t maintain the pace and if this book was just 100 pages longer I think it would be so much better. This doesnU+2019t take away the epicness of the events: because that was a thing that Kiera did very well. Because of all the events, the story had to take a turn and that was one I didnU+2019t expect at all.<br /><br />But that Epilogue guys??? What was that? The only thought I had was: U+2018CanU+2019t we get more, is this it?U+2019 because I think that was the most crappy epilogue ever. DonU+2019t get me wrong, I loved the idea behind it (like, the refering to the beginning of The Heir) but shouldnU+2019t a Epilogue be all about the life AFTER the end? Like fine, Eadlyn chose her guy, but canU+2019t we at least get their happy ending?<br /><br />And this book isnU+2019t all bad guys, because there are a lot of things I was happy about. Example: Eadlyn. I loved her story and how she evolved throughout the series. First she was a bitch, but right now she is so sweet and understanding.. I loved that development and thatU+2019s absolutely a big plus!<br /><br />I know, IU+2019m awfully cruel by writing this review, especially because Kiera Cass once used to be my favorite author (well guys.. she probably still is), but I just felt that way when I read it and I wish it didnU+2019t give me the feeling that it had to be rushed, just for itU+2019s releasing date sake. I just feel like this book deserved more than this. So sorry Kiera, for slashing your book, but I give The Crown three stars.</span>  <a data-text-id="15472719509367189713" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1199398096">  <td colspan="2">    <div href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1199398096&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1199398096'><a id="like_count_review_1199398096" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1199398096?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">8 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1199398096" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1199398096" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=8&rating[page]=7&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1199398096&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1199398096" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1199398096, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1199398096?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=7">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1199398096' style='display: none;'></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1199398096' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1199398096, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1592219337" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1592219337" />    <a title="Saira" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/45873906-saira"><img alt="Saira" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478384740p2/45873906.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1592219337?book_show_action=false">May 06, 2016</a>      <a title="Saira" class="user" name="Saira" href="/user/show/45873906-saira">Saira</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/45873906-saira?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/45873906-saira?shelf=2016">2016</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/45873906-saira?shelf=romance">romance</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1592219337" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10132331085451109584">This book really rushed things; it is like Kiera did not put a lot of thought into this and really wanted to get it written and over with. There is not a whole lot of love shared between any of the characters, and there is hardly any romance, or connections made. The romance department is lacking in The Crown.<br /><br />What I did like, though, is how Eadlyn has changed. She puts others first, and isn't as distant around the selected as she used to be. I can see that she is trying her hardest around them,</span>  <span id="freeText10132331085451109584" style="display:none">This book really rushed things; it is like Kiera did not put a lot of thought into this and really wanted to get it written and over with. There is not a whole lot of love shared between any of the characters, and there is hardly any romance, or connections made. The romance department is lacking in The Crown.<br /><br />What I did like, though, is how Eadlyn has changed. She puts others first, and isn't as distant around the selected as she used to be. I can see that she is trying her hardest around them, but she is having a hard time because everything going on around her: Her mother is had a heart attack, her brother isn't around, and she is trying to rule a country while trying to find a husband. I don't balme her for being stressed. Even through all this, Eadlyn still continues to be a strong female character without being mean, and showing that she can love the same things as anyone else, without being a terrible person. Eadlyn evolved just as I wanted her to.<br /><br />But on the other hand, Kiera did not do a good job in explaining who Eadlyn loves. <a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[<b>One minute she is in love with Kile, the next she is in love Henri, and finally she decides to marry Erik. I'm not completely sure where Eadlyn falling in love Erik came from, since they hardly know anything about each other, but I can kind of see it. Kind of. I would have been perfectly happy with her ending up Kile, even though I wasn't that into him either and it would have been predictable.</b> <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span> Now normally, I feel a connection when two characters are meant to be together, and I'm sure any other avid readers out there do too, but I didn't feel any emotions when it came to Eadlyn and the boys. Nothing. I was just blindly reading it all. I feel like Kiera could have done so much more with these characters, and she didn't.<br /><br />But I do like the way America and Maxon haven't changed. Their personal life has really evolved, and I love seeing this side of them. The way they were depicted in The Heir... they didn't seem like themselves; just replicas. <br /><br />I waited a whole year for this book; I read The Heir as soon as it came out, just as I had The Crown. I am disappointed. I loved the original three books with all my heart, even though they all had moments where they could have been better. But... Eadlyn's Selection is a miss for me. I wonder if it would have been better if Kiera never written about Eadlyn at all.<br /><br />I love Kiera's writing, I love the Selection series, but I don't love this book. </span>  <a data-text-id="10132331085451109584" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1592219337">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1592219337" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1592219337&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1592219337'><a id="like_count_review_1592219337" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1592219337?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">8 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1592219337" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1592219337" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=8&rating[page]=7&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1592219337&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1592219337" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1592219337, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">1 comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1592219337?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=7">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1592219337' style='display: none;'><div class='brown_comment'><span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a class="loadingLink" data-remote="true" href="/review/1592219337/comments?reverse=true">View 1 comment</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></div></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_1592219337' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 1592219337, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div></div><div class="uitext" style="float: right; class="section firstReview">      <div id="review_1656830319" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1656830319" />    <a title="Aimee" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/17989838-aimee"><img alt="Aimee" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479261879p2/17989838.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1656830319?book_show_action=false">Aug 17, 2016</a>      <a title="Aimee" class="user" name="Aimee" href="/user/show/17989838-aimee">Aimee</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780007580248" href="/book/show/30060836-the-crown">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/17989838-aimee?shelf=books-i-own">books-i-own</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/17989838-aimee?shelf=sent-from-publishers">sent-from-publishers</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/17989838-aimee?shelf=read-in-2016">read-in-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1656830319" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2790578427049957079">I received a copy of The Crown from HarperCollins New Zealand to review. This is the last book in The Selection Series.<br /><br />I have loved every book in The Selection Series so far and The Crown didnU+2019t let me down. I loved it just as much as the others. I think IU+2019ve said this a few times now but IU+2019m just going to repeat myself. When I first picked up The Selection (three years ago I think) I wasnU+2019t sure if IU+2019d like it. IU+2019d heard it was going to be a TV show and I wanted to read the book first so I just</span>  <span id="freeText2790578427049957079" style="display:none">I received a copy of The Crown from HarperCollins New Zealand to review. This is the last book in The Selection Series.<br /><br />I have loved every book in The Selection Series so far and The Crown didnU+2019t let me down. I loved it just as much as the others. I think IU+2019ve said this a few times now but IU+2019m just going to repeat myself. When I first picked up The Selection (three years ago I think) I wasnU+2019t sure if IU+2019d like it. IU+2019d heard it was going to be a TV show and I wanted to read the book first so I just bought the first two books (the only ones out at the time) and I couldnU+2019t put them down. It reminded me of The Bachelor with a twist and I was hooked from the start. This series has been so addictive.<br /><br />I reviewed The Heir recently, you can read that here, which IU+2019d heard mixed reviews on. Especially about Eadlyn but I liked her. Not as much as America and she did annoy me a little at the start of The Heir but she did grow on me through the book and she really stepped up in The Crown. Eadlyn is the first woman in inherit the throne and that has put a lot of pressure on her as sheU+2019s grown up. SheU+2019s had to deal with the people of Illea doubting her ability to lead but instead of letting what people think of her get under her skin it makes her want to prove them wrong, that she is a capable leader and does have what it takes. And I think she definitely proved that in The Crown.<br /><br />I was really interested to find out how EadlynU+2019s Selection ended. IU+2019m not going to give anything away but I will say there were two guys that I could see her with and she ended up choosing one of them. I think she did the right thing with the other guy too and I also think she made the right decision.<br /><br />I loved seeing that America and MaxonU+2019s relationship hadnU+2019t changed at all from the first three books. And I loved to see them with their children. Because The Heir and The Crown were from EadlynU+2019s perspective there wasnU+2019t as much shown with Ahren, Kaden, Osten and their parents but there were some good scenes where it was obvious that America and Maxon were great parents. I loved Osten!<br /><br />I loved the ending of The Crown, everything was wrapped up nicely and Eadlyn had the last word with one very annoying person. I loved it.<br /><br />IU+2019m so glad that I gave The Selection a chance instead of dismissing it because it reminded me of The Bachelor, which IU+2019m not a fan of. This is one of my favourite series ever and if you havenU+2019t already read it I highly recommend you give it a chance. </span>  <a data-text-id="2790578427049957079" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1302171438" />    <a title="Merb" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/43771381-merb"><img alt="Merb" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1469260465p2/43771381.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1302171438?book_show_action=false">Aug 29, 2016</a>      <a title="Merb" class="user" name="Merb" href="/user/show/43771381-merb">Merb</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/43771381-merb?shelf=read-books-only">read-books-only</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1302171438" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11485532300718111123">The Crown is the final book in The Selection series, and ends Eadlyn's selection and story. <br /><br />As a huge fan of The Heir, I was going into this book with not high expectations, but just the expectation that it would at least be enjoyable. Unfortunately, I just did not click with this book the way I had with the other four books in this series. I think as this book heavily focused on Eadlyn's character development, it lacked that fun, simple and romantic element that draws me to these books. I enjoy</span>  <span id="freeText11485532300718111123" style="display:none">The Crown is the final book in The Selection series, and ends Eadlyn's selection and story. <br /><br />As a huge fan of The Heir, I was going into this book with not high expectations, but just the expectation that it would at least be enjoyable. Unfortunately, I just did not click with this book the way I had with the other four books in this series. I think as this book heavily focused on Eadlyn's character development, it lacked that fun, simple and romantic element that draws me to these books. I enjoyed the well needed depth that Eadlyn's character brought to The Heir, but I found it was too overpowering in this book to the extent that the story lacked the fun qualities that I loved so much in the past books. I don't think these books are written with enough sophistication, complexity nor depth to pull off a story like this. It just felt a little ridiculous. If you enjoyed the first three books in this series and are contemplating whether to read The Heir and The Crown, I wouldn't say to not read them as your experience may differ from my own. Based on The Heir I would say definitely give it a try, as I just really loved that book, but this one really is a disappointment. Maybe it's a personal thing, but I really felt this book was a let down.<br /><br />THE REST OF THIS REVIEW WILL CONTAIN SPOILERS. SO PLEASE STOP READING NOW IF YOU HAVE NOT READ THIS BOOK. <br /><br />What the heck was with who Eadlyn chose? I felt let down completely. That was such an odd and unexpected choice that really had no buildup nor investment. It was so sudden that I never really got a chance to like them together. I felt a little betrayed to be honest. I get why Kiera Cass made Eadlyn choose Erik, because he was not a part of the selection itself, so it really showed how she had learnt to equalise herself as a ruler and as a person. I get that, and I like that. But what the heck. Where was the lead up? All through The Heir I thought Erik was like a thirty year old, so I was utterly confused when they started hinting that she and him may become a romantic item. I either completely missed something there, or it was as sudden and rushed as I think. But anyway, what is done is done. I will fondly look back on The Selection, and try to not let the disappointment of this book overshadow the enjoyment I got from the other four books. </span>  <a data-text-id="11485532300718111123" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1611429069" />    <a title="Riley Powell" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/41380772-riley-powell"><img alt="Riley Powell" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1459476412p2/41380772.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1611429069?book_show_action=false">Jul 23, 2016</a>      <a title="Riley Powell" class="user" name="Riley Powell" href="/user/show/41380772-riley-powell">Riley Powell</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1611429069" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13437482761386455599">*4/5 stars*<br /><br />I borrowed The Crown from a friend and now I kind of really wish I bought my own copy. I really loved reading this. It may not be my absolute favorite book, but I immensely enjoyed the last book in the Selection series! <br /><br />First things first: did anyone else know that Kiera purposely wrote Eadlyn as spoiled? If I have my facts right, Kiera Cass wanted to have America and EadlynU+2019s personalities completely opposite from another. I found that cool and I honestly never had a problem with the</span>  <span id="freeText13437482761386455599" style="display:none">*4/5 stars*<br /><br />I borrowed The Crown from a friend and now I kind of really wish I bought my own copy. I really loved reading this. It may not be my absolute favorite book, but I immensely enjoyed the last book in the Selection series! <br /><br />First things first: did anyone else know that Kiera purposely wrote Eadlyn as spoiled? If I have my facts right, Kiera Cass wanted to have America and EadlynU+2019s personalities completely opposite from another. I found that cool and I honestly never had a problem with the attitude of EadlynU+2019s. And anyway, Eadlyn matures once The Crown starts up.<br /><br />ItU+2019s been over a year since I last read KieraU+2019s books and after finishing The Crown, I can definitely see the cheesiness everyone else sees. It was everywhere. The characters spoke in a manner that I just couldnU+2019t help but find cheesy. I had minor complications with that, but I feel like that was my only problem with the book. <br /><br />When reading The Crown, I had a feeling I knew who sheU+2019d pick. Eadlyn and other peopleU+2019s actions made it clear whom she favored more than the others. Actually, I like the man she picks. They make a cute couple. <br /><br />Much like the other book I just read, Me Before You, the romance part of The Crown took a back seat. The fifth book in the Selection series was more about politics, since Eadlyn took over for her father while he stayed with his wife. I took delight in the fact that Kiera wrote her last book like that since it was interesting to see the problems that IllU+00E9a faces and it wasnU+2019t at all boring. <br /><br />I loved The Crown. ItU+2019s a book with flaws, but thatU+2019s easily forgotten when you see the positives. The Crown was majestic and I devoured it. <br /></span>  <a data-text-id="13437482761386455599" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1650204069?book_show_action=false">Jun 02, 2016</a>      <a title="T (novelparadise)" class="user" name="T (novelparadise)" href="/user/show/19837653-t-novelparadise">T (novelparadise)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1650204069" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15948923526147799045"><b> Actual rating: 3 </b><br /><br />I was expecting to dislike this a hell of a lot more than I did. I did not enjoy The Heir. I found Eadlyn to be bratty, whiny, selfish and annoying. Thankfully, she <i>mostly</i> grew out of that in this book. <br /><br />I only had two main concerns with this. Firstly, someone's sexuality should never be used as a plot twist. I was so angry when reading that scene, and the fact that homosexuality is frowned upon, and downright dangerous in their society and all Eadlyn cared about was what the me</span>  <span id="freeText15948923526147799045" style="display:none"><b> Actual rating: 3 </b><br /><br />I was expecting to dislike this a hell of a lot more than I did. I did not enjoy The Heir. I found Eadlyn to be bratty, whiny, selfish and annoying. Thankfully, she <i>mostly</i> grew out of that in this book. <br /><br />I only had two main concerns with this. Firstly, someone's sexuality should never be used as a plot twist. I was so angry when reading that scene, and the fact that homosexuality is frowned upon, and downright dangerous in their society and all Eadlyn cared about was what the media would think because two of her suitors fell for each other over her? Get over yourself girl.<br /><br />I also felt like the ending of this book was waaaaay rushed. This book is short. It's like 278 pages or something like that. The ending just came by way too quickly and everything was resolved way too quickly. Also, that epilogue didn't even seem like it was something the characters were saying/doing/whatever, it seemed more like the author talking to us. Idk. <br /><br />I only really read this because I wanted to know what happened in the end of this, and also all the books look really pretty together. Overall I wasn't too disappointed with who she ended up with, however I did find that a bit insta-lovey, but anyway. I 100% understand her reasoning for letting go of the other person I was rooting for. 100% understand. So, I'm pretty happy she ended up with the person she loves, even if it felt like it came out of nowhere. </span>  <a data-text-id="15948923526147799045" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1650204069">  rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer1040532988&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1040532988" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer18295316694396368036">DNF 23%<br />No can do. Was looking forward to it not because of me liking the series, because I don't exactly. But it was fun trying to guess who she'd end up with and such. Yes I'm shallow like that. So it's been a guilty pleasure of sorts. But ultimately she did not end up with my fav Kile so good luck with that. If she doesn't end up with the guy I like and instead with a stupid boring guy then really, there's no point in reading about stupid Eadlyn anyway since I'm here only for Kile. <br />Bye book! H</span>  <span id="freeText18295316694396368036" style="display:none">DNF 23%<br />No can do. Was looking forward to it not because of me liking the series, because I don't exactly. But it was fun trying to guess who she'd end up with and such. Yes I'm shallow like that. So it's been a guilty pleasure of sorts. But ultimately she did not end up with my fav Kile so good luck with that. If she doesn't end up with the guy I like and instead with a stupid boring guy then really, there's no point in reading about stupid Eadlyn anyway since I'm here only for Kile. <br />Bye book! Hope fans all around are displeased by you. :)<br />By Super Angry Kile shipper <br /><br />Okay so I went back and read the final Kile part and really honey? Yes he has his dreams but huh you guys could've been together and fulfill his dream all at the same time. It's just all a sad excuse because she fell for THE OTHER STUPID GUY because it would show that TRUE LOVE CONQUERS ALL but it's just so cliche I can't even. Ugh I hate it when people make the MC end up with someone just because they want to send a seemingly "bigger" message but in the end really who cares? People would still want them to end up with the guy who has the most chemistry with the MC so get over the whole damn message shit. God I haven't been so angry at a book in a while. Such a fucking rip off. To think that my ship sunk for the sake of a fucking plot device is just cheap.</span>  <a data-text-id="18295316694396368036" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> class="section">      <div id="review_1088347632" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1088347632" />    <a title="Rose" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/27188391-rose"><img alt="Rose" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1391647475p2/27188391.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1088347632?book_show_action=false">Aug 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Rose" class="user" name="Rose" href="/user/show/27188391-rose">Rose</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9780062458865" href="/book/show/26198897-the-crown">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1088347632" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4476373602356501366"><b>3.5 Stars</b><br /><br />Well, The Crown certainly brought the series to an end. Following on from the events of The Heir, Eadlyn narrows down her Selection to The Elite, six men until a new Prince of Illea.<br /><br />I enjoyed The Crown, but I didn't love it. I have never really looked back on past reviews, so I am uncertain as to what I wrote about Eadlyn's character in my review of The heir, but my current and final opinion is that I can relate to her, but I feel as if she is too distant.<br /><br />Eadlyn's character develops hug</span>  <span id="freeText4476373602356501366" style="display:none"><b>3.5 Stars</b><br /><br />Well, The Crown certainly brought the series to an end. Following on from the events of The Heir, Eadlyn narrows down her Selection to The Elite, six men until a new Prince of Illea.<br /><br />I enjoyed The Crown, but I didn't love it. I have never really looked back on past reviews, so I am uncertain as to what I wrote about Eadlyn's character in my review of The heir, but my current and final opinion is that I can relate to her, but I feel as if she is too distant.<br /><br />Eadlyn's character develops hugely in the finale to the series, and she begins to understand what lies in the world outside her sheltered life. <br /><br />My major dislike of The Crown was how I predicted everything from a mile away. Sure, I turned the pages in the correct order (besides checking the ending I'd already predicted), but I felt as if Kiera Cass was whispering what was to happen in my ear. Untrustworthy characters, plot twists... All of that.<br /><br />Overall, The Crown was quite an interesting book. I found it easy to put down, but the story was there.<br /><br />"Maybe it's not the first kisses that are supposed to be special. Maybe it's the last ones." U+2014 Kile Woodwork to Eadlyn</span>  <a data-text-id="4476373602356501366" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div Por fin lo he terminado. Y en esta ocasiU+00F3n tengo mucho que decir. <br /><br /> 'La heredera' me pareciU+00F3 un libro innecesario, pero esa primera parte aU+00FAn me gustU+00F3. SoportU+00E9 el carU+00E1cter de Eadlyn y en tU+00E9rminos generales la historia me pareciU+00F3 entretenida y con una buena evoluciU+00F3n del personaje principal. Y no porque Eadlyn no terminara con quien me gustaba.          >            <span id="freeTextContainer13425795551355785088">You know that I always say that this series is my guilty pleasure and they're still the best words to describe my feelings but additional to that I have to say that I enjoyed the last book more than The Heir! <br /><br />I loved the change in character of Eadlyn and I enjoyed the ending a lot. Even though I always rooted for someone else. It was a perfect ending for the series and I loved seeing it unfold.<br /><br />Anyway this book is in no way a literature masterpiece. But if you're in in need of a solid romance series that has a high obsessions factor then read The Selection series. Tough the dialogues are cringe worthy and the plot is so easy and convenient I still think it is worth the read.<br /><br />It's just like watching the Bachelor - everybody loves silly things like that sometimes. <br />This book series is perfect if you want to pick up something relaxing where you don't have to focus very hard.<br /><br />Farewell Selection Series! You have been very good to me! </span>  <a data-text-id="13425795551355785088" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1619313213?book_show_action=false">May 18, 2016</a>      <a title="Mihail" class="user" name="Mihail" href="/user/show/14580317-mihail">Mihail</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9789542717362" href="/book/show/30069620">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer1619313213&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1619313213" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer14022900919657333567"> Here comes the finish to another series. RIP The Selection (2012-2016). So, lets start with the positive stuff. I really enjoyed this book, it was so easy to read - the chapters were short, and it's only 250 pages, you can finish it for a day or two. Overall, I liked the plot, even though I was rooting for another suitor (*cough*Kile*cough). And now from the negative side. This book was maybe too short and most importanly I felt like it was rushed. Was Mrs Cass in a hurry? The last chapters</span>  <span id="freeText14022900919657333567" style="display:none"> Here comes the finish to another series. RIP The Selection (2012-2016). So, lets start with the positive stuff. I really enjoyed this book, it was so easy to read - the chapters were short, and it's only 250 pages, you can finish it for a day or two. Overall, I liked the plot, even though I was rooting for another suitor (*cough*Kile*cough). And now from the negative side. This book was maybe too short and most importanly I felt like it was rushed. Was Mrs Cass in a hurry? The last chapters felt like she was going to miss the deadline for her book: "Oh, I have to hand this book to the publishers tomorrow. Let's just write eveything I have to say in 10 pages. I'm sure no one will notice". Not cool, Cass. Definetly not cool. You should've taken your time for that ending. <br /> That's that. I'm giving the book 3.5/5 stars because I'm feeling good and all positive today.</span>  <a data-text-id="14022900919657333567" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/26150713-the-crown">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1627637192" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13398942438460486884">I knew I was going to at least check Eadlyn's final choice but I've decided to read the whole book. So after finishing it, I'll say that I still don't get the hype of this series. I mean, it's probably like with The Bachelorette/The Bachelor- you know it's stupid but you want to see who wins. As for the last book, "The crown" had a really rushed ending.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1462266593ra/18973079.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[1. Honestly, I knew she was going to pick either Kile or Erik/Eikko (but choosing Kile was too easy). <br>2. I wasn't expecting for Ea</span></span>  <span id="freeText13398942438460486884" style="display:none">I knew I was going to at least check Eadlyn's final choice but I've decided to read the whole book. So after finishing it, I'll say that I still don't get the hype of this series. I mean, it's probably like with The Bachelorette/The Bachelor- you know it's stupid but you want to see who wins. As for the last book, "The crown" had a really rushed ending.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1462266593ra/18973079.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[1. Honestly, I knew she was going to pick either Kile or Erik/Eikko (but choosing Kile was too easy). <br>2. I wasn't expecting for Ean and Hale to like each other but good for them!<br>3. Eadlyn grew up and Josie (I think that's her name- Kile's sister) grew up too! <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1348217676" />    <a title="Ally (The Scribbling Sprite)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/36978618-ally-the-scribbling-sprite"><img alt="Ally (The Scribbling Sprite)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1438351851p2/36978618.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1348217676?book_show_action=false">Jun 07, 2016</a>      <a title="Ally (The Scribbling Sprite)" class="user" name="Ally (The Scribbling Sprite)" href="/user/show/36978618-ally-the-scribbling-sprite">Ally (The Scribbling Sprite)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/36978618-ally-the-scribbling-sprite?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/36978618-ally-the-scribbling-sprite?shelf=romance">romance</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1348217676" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13941758123030873407">Rating to be determined. I have to ponder this.<br /><br />It was cute, though. And I loved the ending <3.<br /><br />**Edit:<br /><br />I've settled on a solid three stars. One of those books where I enjoyed it as I was reading it; it was a quick read, and fun. But then I turned the last page and kind of wondered . . . what just happened? There just wasn't much substance, or conflict, or action. Conflict was mentioned, sure, but it never really played out. The romance was sweet (I love who she ended up with) but definitely und</span>  <span id="freeText13941758123030873407" style="display:none">Rating to be determined. I have to ponder this.<br /><br />It was cute, though. And I loved the ending <3.<br /><br />**Edit:<br /><br />I've settled on a solid three stars. One of those books where I enjoyed it as I was reading it; it was a quick read, and fun. But then I turned the last page and kind of wondered . . . what just happened? There just wasn't much substance, or conflict, or action. Conflict was mentioned, sure, but it never really played out. The romance was sweet (I love who she ended up with) but definitely underdeveloped. It was a cute story though, and I love the characters. Eadlyn just grows on you :)</span>  <a data-text-id="13941758123030873407" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1635174687" />    <a title="Giulia Alayne" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/32211345-giulia-alayne"><img alt="Giulia Alayne" it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1635174687" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8207281903102340614">This book was a waste of my time. Not that I'm saying my time is particularly precious, but I really want it back.<br />Okay, these books are low quality literature, but they're somehow addictive and fun, that's why I read them. Take away the fun, and they're not worth reading anymore, which is exactly what happened with this last volume for me. Annoying main character. Boring, dumb and predictable plot.<br />Do not recommend.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview"  <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1412695500?book_show_action=false">Oct 21, 2016</a>      <a title="Alee" class="user" name="Alee" href="/user/show/38148827-alee">Alee</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38148827-alee?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer1412695500&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1412695500" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer7228095317893997385">Acabo de fijarme que no puse nada sobre este libro...Bueno pues fue una completa decepciU+00F3n. La heredera fue un gran libro pero este...A Kiera le saliU+00F3 fatal. Sinceramente no me tuvo ningU+00FAn sentido que Eadlyn se enamorara de Eikko asi de repente, durante todo el primer libro su relaciU+00F3n con kyle fue creciendo hasta al principio de este libro y de repente al final ella tiene un Instalove con Eikko venga ya, Quien se cree eso? Le doy las dos estrellas por America y Maxon (y Kyle) pero sino nada</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border id="reviewTextContainer1435630718" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3711179091489976177">Let's be honest, this series definitely has its flaws but I love it nonetheless! Kiera Cass knows how to mess with your feelings and does so brilliantly. There aren't many books which really made me feel the love the characters had for each other like Kiera Cass's Selection series does.<br />Of course, her stories are light and fluffy but there's surely enough drama and intrigues to satisfy most of us.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="freeTextContainer3488002760321442755">The Selection series, although I got very annoyed with America and Eadlyn at times, ended up being one of those series that became a guilty pleasure.
