itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1435077180" />    <a title="Crystal" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/9456152-crystal"><img alt="Crystal" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1460135616p2/9456152.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1435077180?book_show_action=false">Jun 15, 2016</a>      <a title="Crystal" class="user" name="Crystal" href="/user/show/9456152-crystal">Crystal</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">                  <em>                    This review has been hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer1435077180&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1435077180" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1888258833228229632">OKAY! After alot of thinking and mourning over finishing this book im sticking to my rating of 3.8 stars. While im happy for Eadyln getting to be with Erik...im disappointed because they made it seem like her and Kile were going to get together i mean whats better than getting married to your childhood friend?? and they had such beautiful moments that were so sweet i swooned! but then they were LOL JK we aren't doing that..i felt bad for Henri because he had feelings for her and he was so</span>  <span id="freeText1888258833228229632" style="display:none">OKAY! After alot of thinking and mourning over finishing this book im sticking to my rating of 3.8 stars. While im happy for Eadyln getting to be with Erik...im disappointed because they made it seem like her and Kile were going to get together i mean whats better than getting married to your childhood friend?? and they had such beautiful moments that were so sweet i swooned! but then they were LOL JK we aren't doing that..i felt bad for Henri because he had feelings for her and he was so sweettt! i was like *sighs dreamily* if he was fluent in english i definitely wanted them together for sure but since he was having trouble i have felt sad that he wasn't gnna get picked..and the ending killed me because i was creying so much for Kile..i guess he wanted to have a career which is cool and awesome but i wanted them together *sobs* and i felt like she was breaking my heart when she was telling him to leave..le sigh. Finally knowing Hale's secret made me relieved but i was surprised and so happy for him that he got to be happy with Ean that was too cute and sweet. The best part of this book were the moments that involved Maxon and America and the memories they talked about which did make me crey alot but i loved that they were included in the book still. they will forever be favorite couple *sighs dreamily*</span>  <a data-text-id="1888258833228229632" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>         </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1441055356" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15076721534323973971">Sin duda ha mejorado con respecto a su primera parte, pero aU+00FAn asU+00ED no llega ni de lejos a la trilogU+00EDa original.<br />Primero empezarU+00E9 hablando de lo que me ha gustado y, eso ha sido volver a reencontrarme con el mundo de la selecciU+00F3n que tanto me gustU+00F3 desde el principio; tambiU+00E9n la agilidad con la que estU+00E1 escrito y a pesar de que no pasa nada demasiado interesante, se lee rU+00E1pido.<br />Con respecto a lo que menos me ha gustado o menos me ha convencido ha sido lo rU+00E1pido que ocurre todo con respecto a la his</span>  <span id="freeText15076721534323973971" style="display:none">Sin duda ha mejorado con respecto a su primera parte, pero aU+00FAn asU+00ED no llega ni de lejos a la trilogU+00EDa original.<br />Primero empezarU+00E9 hablando de lo que me ha gustado y, eso ha sido volver a reencontrarme con el mundo de la selecciU+00F3n que tanto me gustU+00F3 desde el principio; tambiU+00E9n la agilidad con la que estU+00E1 escrito y a pesar de que no pasa nada demasiado interesante, se lee rU+00E1pido.<br />Con respecto a lo que menos me ha gustado o menos me ha convencido ha sido lo rU+00E1pido que ocurre todo con respecto a la historia amorosa. SU+00ED es cierto que desde el primer libro me olU+00EDa algo y me ha gustado que haya sido asU+00ED, pero he echado en falta mU+00E1s complicidad entre ellos y mU+00E1s escenas, aunque ya habU+00EDa bastantes escenas mU+00E1s predecibles de mU+00E1s. El comportamiento de la protagonista cambia por completo y lo que debiera ser una evoluciU+00F3n se convierte en un cambio en un abrir y cerrar de ojos. La falta de acciU+00F3n y de sorpresa le quitan <br />desencanto y bueno, es que los sentimientos no llegan a ''calarte'' por asU+00ED decirlo, por lo que al final resulta una lectura para pasar el rato simplemente. </span>  <a data-text-id="15076721534323973971" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1441055356">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1441055356" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1441055356&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1441055356'><a id="like_count_review_1441055356" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1441055356?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">6 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1441055356" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1441055356" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=6&rating[page]=9&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1441055356&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1441055356" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1441055356, true, &#39;&#39;); I just wanted something that I could have fun reading. Even though the book started off slow, I did enjoy it for what it was. Nothing serious. Just fluff. I definitely liked Eadlyn a lot more in this book than the previous one because she has definitely matured. However... Some of the decisions that were made in this book had me in disbelief. The way the story wrapped up was SO RUSHED that I didn't have time to process. I found myself t</span>  <span id="freeText11527841382523940217" style="display:none">2.5<br /><br />Going into this, I definitely didn't expect to be wowed. I just wanted something that I could have fun reading. Even though the book started off slow, I did enjoy it for what it was. Nothing serious. Just fluff. I definitely liked Eadlyn a lot more in this book than the previous one because she has definitely matured. However... Some of the decisions that were made in this book had me in disbelief. The way the story wrapped up was SO RUSHED that I didn't have time to process. I found myself to be annoyed by the writing quite frequently. I had 2 people in mind that I would've been happy if Eadlyn ended up with one of them. While I am satisfied with Eadlyn's choice, I wish there was more development with her relationship. Once she declared her feelings for that person, their feelings were magnified so much to the point where I felt so irritated by it.</span>  <a data-text-id="11527841382523940217" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" href="/review/list/10194401-abbie?shelf=read-to-review">read-to-review</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1611153538" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8377717981334825808">(I received a copy from Netgalley, In exchange for an honest review.) <br /><br />I liked Eadlyn again in this installment. She grew as a character, and proved she could step up when she needed to. <br /><br />I enjoyed this, but at the same time, It was the weakest one in the series for me. For most of it, the romance side of the story lacked for me, which was a real shame. <br /><br />Overall, An enjoyable read, but also my least favourite in the series.</span>          </span>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1440304077" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15038492538248886109"><i> 5/5 stars </i><br /><br />The Selection series has been a guilty pleasure of mine for around three years now, and seeing it come to an end really saddens me. However, I am pleased with the outcome and know that no matter how many times I read the books, they will never grow old.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext         >            <span id="freeTextContainer7025423843612794813">Where do I even start? Giving this 3* was probably way too generous! This was just lacking in so many ways. Also when your ship doesn't sail in a story that revolves around it, kinda makes the whole thing suck! class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1776779377" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1776779377" />    <a title="Zainab Sheikh" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/39204432-zainab-sheikh"><img alt="Zainab Sheikh" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1441997740p2/39204432.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1776779377?book_show_action=false">Oct 14, 2016</a>      <a title="Zainab Sheikh" class="user" name="Zainab Sheikh" href="/user/show/39204432-zainab-sheikh">Zainab Sheikh</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Hardcover 9780062479280" href="/book/show/31798785-the-crown">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/39204432-zainab-sheikh?shelf=did-not-like-it">did-not-like-it</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/39204432-zainab-sheikh?shelf=owned-books">owned-books</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1776779377" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17314488054004424282">I have a lot to say about this book.<br /><br />The <b>character development is abrupt.</b> EadlynU+2019s attitude was all bratty in The Heir but in this book, sheU+2019s the kindest,patient and most sympathetic human being alive. ItU+2019s like she bought a new personality all of a sudden. SheU+2019s the Kylie Jenner of Selection series. ItU+2019s unreal. The developments are supposed to be slow and gradual. You donU+2019t change your personality overnight.<br />Anyway, IU+2019m happy that the crap that sheU+2019s Eadlyn Shreave and no one was as powerful as</span>  <span id="freeText17314488054004424282" style="display:none">I have a lot to say about this book.<br /><br />The <b>character development is abrupt.</b> EadlynU+2019s attitude was all bratty in The Heir but in this book, sheU+2019s the kindest,patient and most sympathetic human being alive. ItU+2019s like she bought a new personality all of a sudden. SheU+2019s the Kylie Jenner of Selection series. ItU+2019s unreal. The developments are supposed to be slow and gradual. You donU+2019t change your personality overnight.<br />Anyway, IU+2019m happy that the crap that sheU+2019s Eadlyn Shreave and no one was as powerful as her was only mentioned twice.<br /><br />About that twist, I totally saw it coming from a mile away and IU+2019m not even exaggerating it. I knew what was going to happen even when I was reading The Heir. Not even a teeny tiny bit of unpredictable. So, when it actually happened, I just shrugged. Whatever. <br /><br />The thing that annoys me was how simple the ending was. Everything worked so easily for her. Because well, sheU+2019s Eadlyn Shreave.<br /><br />Also, half of this book is filled with America and MasonU+2019s love story and how great it is and blah blah blah which also annoyed me. Like, okay I know theyU+2019re perfect for each other and have gone through a lot because I have read THREE books about them. Stop mentioning it in every single chapter.<br /><br />The good thing: the book is entertaining. ItU+2019s light and entertaining but thatU+2019s the only good part. You donU+2019t know anything that is happening in the outside world or outside her magnificent palace because basically, this book is about Eadlyn choosing for herself a husband and the story only revolves around it.<br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[I donU+2019t find any chemistry between Erik and Eadlyn. I mean, even Hale and Eadlyn had more chemistry. I wish it was Kile who won the Selection because they had a lot of good chemistry and I know their couple or story would have been cliched or predictable but it would have been better than Eadlyn and Erik though and it would also be a good story.<br />And AmericaU+2019s fate wasnU+2019t unpredictable either. I knew she wouldnU+2019t die. I also find it extremely hard to believe how quickly Henri changed his mind. He wasnU+2019t even a little bit of sad when he saw that Eadlyn wanted his translator not him. <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span></span>  <a data-text-id="17314488054004424282" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1776779377">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1776779377" '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1763461167" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1763461167" />    <a title="Barbi Faye (The Book Fae)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/16673801-barbi-faye-the-book-fae"><img alt="Barbi Faye (The Book Fae)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1471387124p2/16673801.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1763461167?book_show_action=false">Oct 12, 2016</a>      <a title="Barbi Faye (The Book Fae)" class="user" name="Barbi Faye (The Book Fae)" href="/user/show/16673801-barbi-faye-the-book-fae">Barbi Faye (The Book Fae)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <div><span class="uitext greyText">Recommends it for: </span>           <span class="uitext reviewText">Illeans</span></div>          <div>    <span class="greyText">Recommended to Barbi Faye (The Book Fae) by: </span>      Christine Riccio  </div>          <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16673801-barbi-faye-the-book-fae?shelf=favorites">favorites</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16673801-barbi-faye-the-book-fae?shelf=fantasy-fiction">fantasy-fiction</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16673801-barbi-faye-the-book-fae?shelf=dystopian-diatribes">dystopian-diatribes</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16673801-barbi-faye-the-book-fae?shelf=romantical-reads">romantical-reads</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16673801-barbi-faye-the-book-fae?shelf=zelda-s-challenge">zelda-s-challenge</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1763461167" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer5823210183168819454">Princess Eadlyn Schreave is responding to her mom's extreme heart attack by having a mass Elimination as she decides on her Elite top six: Sirs Hale, Henri, Ean, Gunner, Kile, and Fox. She takes over as Regent of Illea in the meantime, attending her first board meeting. Thankfully, her mother is finally awake, she weakly greets her family. <br /><br />Eadlyn spends time with Kile, and she lets him know that she likes him, being friends for so long. Marid Illea visits, and shares his condolences, then flower</span>  <span id="freeText5823210183168819454" style="display:none">Princess Eadlyn Schreave is responding to her mom's extreme heart attack by having a mass Elimination as she decides on her Elite top six: Sirs Hale, Henri, Ean, Gunner, Kile, and Fox. She takes over as Regent of Illea in the meantime, attending her first board meeting. Thankfully, her mother is finally awake, she weakly greets her family. <br /><br />Eadlyn spends time with Kile, and she lets him know that she likes him, being friends for so long. Marid Illea visits, and shares his condolences, then flowers; somehow it reaches the press and affects her public's opinion of her. Gunner, cute and sweet, approaches her and requests a true kiss, to see if they could be a true match. Once the surprise wore off, she agrees to the cute idea. They both then considered; "No, right?" He told the Princess that it was an honor, and made his quiet goodbye. Aw! Sniff!<br /><br />Hale assists with her gown for an episode of the Report; Henri happily attends a lunch date with her, needing his translator Erik, who is still friendly and sweet. Seeing how hard Henri works on his English, she suggests having Finnish lessons for all. She also continues to learn more about her remaining top five. She shows well on the Report showing levity and responsibility to her country.<br />Marid continues his pressures, by slanting her public opinion, lame linking, press leaks, and even ring shopping. Also at this time, in giving her mom and dad time together, she agrees to ascending the throne and being Queen. Yay, another Kick Ass Queen!)<br /><br />She has been talking with Hale, who reveals to her that he has fallen in love with someone else: Ean. Graciously, Eadlyn agrees to eliminate them with dignity. Learning more of herself soon she realizes that she has feelings for Erik, Henri's translator. They laugh and kiss, and she accepts his antique ring as a good luck token. They share a romantic time together. She gives him her signet ring, admitting to herself how much she loves him. She quickly eliminates Fox, as he is manipulating her, decides not to be with Kile, lets go of Ean and Hale, Henri happily wishes them to be together. <br /><br />On the final Report, she makes her Selection: she chooses Erik, and asks her to marry him. This also heads off anything Marid was up to as well. And we all know, in tales of fae, they lived happily ever after!! <br /><br />Happily inhaled the final Selection novel!! I am anxious to see what Kiera Cass will come up with next, as this was a very entertaining dystopian romance! A fun and fluffy novel...</span>  <a data-text-id="5823210183168819454" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1763461167">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1763461167" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=1763461167&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_1763461167'><a id="like_count_review_1763461167" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/1763461167?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">11 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1763461167" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1763461167" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=11&rating[page]=9&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=1763461167&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1763461167" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1763461167, true, &#39;&#39;);          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: $('box').getStyle('z-index')})});        } else {          $$('div.prototip').each(function(i){i.setStyle({zIndex: 6000})});        }      });      $('rating_details_tip').observe('prototip:hidden', function () {        $$('span.elementTwo').each(function (e) {          if (e.getStyle('display') !== 'none') {            var lessLink = e.next();            swapContent(lessLink);          }        });      });//]]></script>  <script type="text/javascript">  //<![CDATA[      var $ratingGraph = $j('#rating_graph');      var $copy;      if ($ratingGraph.length > 0) {          $copy = $ratingGraph.clone();          $j('#rating_details_tip_graph').remove();          $copy.attr('id', 'rating_details_tip_graph');          $copy.find('script').remove();          $j('#rating_details_tip').prepend($copy);      }  //]]>  </script></div><div id="bookReviews">    <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section firstReview">      <div id="review_1581961752" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1581961752" />    <a title="Ruzaika Deen" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/36220461-ruzaika-deen"><img alt="Ruzaika Deen" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1464176211p2/36220461.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1581961752?book_show_action=false">Jun 21, 2016</a>      <a title="Ruzaika Deen" class="user" name="Ruzaika Deen" href="/user/show/36220461-ruzaika-deen">Ruzaika Deen</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1581961752" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17310138079546936704">Another version of this review can be found <a href="http://reading-is-dreaming-with-open-eyes.blogspot.com/2016/05/kiera-cass-crown-selection-5.html" rel="nofollow">here</a><br><br><i>"Love is as much fate as it is planning, as much a beauty as it is a disaster."</i><br><br>As a huge fan of The Selection trilogy I was very excited for The Heir- only to be disappointed at the end. While I did like the basic idea of the story, Eadlyn pretty much spoilt everything for me. I didn't like her characterization at all, and by the time I finished the book I was fervently praying for her to have a lot of character growth in the next book at least. Wh</span>  <span id="freeText17310138079546936704" style="display:none">Another version of this review can be found <a href="http://reading-is-dreaming-with-open-eyes.blogspot.com/2016/05/kiera-cass-crown-selection-5.html" rel="nofollow">here</a><br><br><i>"Love is as much fate as it is planning, as much a beauty as it is a disaster."</i><br><br>As a huge fan of The Selection trilogy I was very excited for The Heir- only to be disappointed at the end. While I did like the basic idea of the story, Eadlyn pretty much spoilt everything for me. I didn't like her characterization at all, and by the time I finished the book I was fervently praying for her to have a lot of character growth in the next book at least. While that did happen in The Crown, I was nevertheless dissatisfied with the story.<br><br>Going into this book, I was, understandably, quite wary. I didn't dare hope for the magic that was America's and Maxon's love story, but my poor heart did expect Kiera Cass to be back in all her awesomeness in narrating a beautiful fairytale. That. Did. Not. Happen. Here's why:<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1466573135ra/19494118.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Also: <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1466573135ra/19494119.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Look, I'm all for finding your soulmate and well, la-di-dah, you can ride into your goddamned sunset and live happily ever after. But when it comes about with zero development, I say no. Please, no. I had this constant nagging feeling that things were happening just because the author wanted them to, and not because the characters did. Get what I mean? I thought America had much better chemistry with Kile. I was rooting for them from the very beginning- I love the idea of childhood friends turning lovers. Granted, it would have been predictable but it's the kind of ending I felt was fitting given their individual natures and their growth from being friends to more. Kile was very clear about his intentions and it made no sense to me when he just nodded along to what Eadlyn had to say. I'm sure something could have been worked out for his ambitions about seeing the world and all that.<br><br>Eadlyn's choice was completely flabbergasting. Apart from Kile, I only ever felt a connect with Henri, and that ended stupidly as well. Why does everyone just agree to what she has to say and not voice their own opinions? I can't believe Henri just stepped back and paved the way for Erik. Come on. He was sweet-natured, but no one is as sweet-natured as that. Eadlyn sure was much more bearable here than in the previous book and showed surprising growth of character, but her decisions truly baffle me. She goes around feeling nothing at all about Erik and suddenly after one genuinely bewildering conversation she's convinced that they are soulmates. She was reading too much into their past encounters, if you ask me. She doesn't even realize that he's her "soulmate" up until about 80% of the book and then she's all moon-eyed about him and scolding her "treacherous heart" for betraying her. Puh-lease. <br><br><i>U+201CYou are always just Eadlyn. And you are always the queen. You are everything to everyone. And infinitely more to me.U+201D</i> <br><br>If this were a better-written book, I would be all smiling when reading stuff such as this one, but here, I was just very frustrated. Why not give them more chance to grow together as a couple? Sure, they didn't have much time, and that brings me to my other concern: why was everything so rushed at the end? <br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1466573135ra/19494120.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>It's like the author, like us, just wanted to see an end to the series and tied up all the loose knots in a hurry. Talk about convenience! The boys each get eliminated so bloody conveniently that I was all, "Ha, should've seen that coming!" when things started happening. Pointless reveals at the end aside, this book could have been much, much better if the author had taken time to focus on everything, instead of just wrapping up everything haphazardly. And I would have loved this story much more if I had actually felt anything towards the characters. <br><br>Final thoughts: Kind of a pointless read if you're not looking for any sort of closure to Eadlyn's story.<br><br>The story idea: 3/5<br>The realization of the story: 2/5<br>The characters: 2/5 <br>The cover: 2/5<br>Enjoy factor: 2/5<br><br><b>Final Rating: 2/5</b><br></span>  <a data-text-id="17310138079546936704" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1581961752">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link1581961752" U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_1581961752" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_1581961752" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_1581961752" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 1581961752, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/1581961752?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=10">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_1581961752' style='display: elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1635933465" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1635933465" />    <a title="Peaches" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/38698518-peaches"><img alt="Peaches" src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/f_5f-6a03a5c12233c941481992b82eea8d23.png" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1635933465?book_show_action=false">May 12, 2016</a>      <a title="Peaches" class="user" name="Peaches" href="/user/show/38698518-peaches">Peaches</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38698518-peaches?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1635933465" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1658950440681094352">That moment when the creator of a franchise has finally sunk all the way down into writing poorly planned fan fiction.....<br />Let's be real, Eadlyn's story was a decent idea, but that's all it was (kind of like when those artists on fb draw what Disney princess children would look like). Are we interested? I guess? Would we want to watch two movies about it? No thanks. <br /><i>The Heir</i> was okay, but I wanted what I think all readers wanted: The same premise with a different cast. Hasn't Cass seen <i>The Bachel</i></span>  <span id="freeText1658950440681094352" style="display:none">That moment when the creator of a franchise has finally sunk all the way down into writing poorly planned fan fiction.....<br />Let's be real, Eadlyn's story was a decent idea, but that's all it was (kind of like when those artists on fb draw what Disney princess children would look like). Are we interested? I guess? Would we want to watch two movies about it? No thanks. <br /><i>The Heir</i> was okay, but I wanted what I think all readers wanted: The same premise with a different cast. Hasn't Cass seen <i>The Bachelor</i>? I assumed she had due to the parallels between the first trilogy and the show, but now I'm thinking not. When you make a formula that works and then extend the idea to a new generation, you know what your readers want: dates, scandal, actual villains, people who are actually interested in dating the protagonist? Cass should've viewed some cycles of <i>Degrassi</i> before this undertaking, especially to study how actually teenagers acted.<br />I thought America and Maxon (and the other contestants of the trilogy) were really believable with their idealistic and conflicting emotions, but Eadlyn never did it for me. Cass obviously tried to straddle the line between making her protagonist an actual bitch and making her a typical heroine who has some things to work through, but easily sheds her unappealing qualities by the end (how magical that can happen in less than a year!). In contrast, most of the men were pretty interesting. Kile and Hale had goals, Fox and Gunner had intrigue (though we hardly got to read about them), Henry was endearing, Erik had skills, and Ean was the best and didn't get enough airtime. Yet, they 1. aren't that interested in her at all and 2. leave willingly without Eadlyn having to deal with the consequences. All of these men happily see that they aren't the one for her or conveniently leave without confrontation, which is so unrealistic. In this situation, if you make it to the end, you'd at least have some emotions invested. Eadlyn has virtually no feelings for any of them and her forced "realization" of loving Erik after many of his obvious downcast glances when he was around her is both dramatic and silly. Suddenly, she can't live without him but prepares herself to be a martyr when no one explicitly tells her she has to. In fact, most of Eadlyn's issues come from her own high standards for herself rather than those of the people around her who accept and love her. Poor little rich girl, much?<br />The plot was tedious and took away too much from what this story should have been: A reality dating show. Instead, we get the odd insertion of Marid (yet another idiotic name) who really doesn't do much at all and has no point (couldn't they have at least killed him?), America and Maxon's PDA all over the palace (why didn't you just write a book about their marriage? I wouldn't have read it, but still...), America's heart defect (seriously? A totally forced choice to spare this book from being a trilogy too (which I am thankful for)), and Josie's redemption (I promise we didn't care). By the end, I was jubilant that it finished with two books instead of three, but I really didn't care about any of it. <br /><br />The only aspects I did like:<br />The mini homosexual love story (which there should've been more of)<br />Henri's character (although my heart broke for him and how he was used. Luckily, again, he was happy to bow out. How convenient, Cass. We couldn't have anyone being actually hurt and disliking the protagonist you sacrificed quality writing to make us like, could we?)</span>  <a data-text-id="1658950440681094352" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1437158045" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1437158045" />    <a title="U+2606StephanieU+2606" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/20199767-stephanie"><img alt="U+2606StephanieU+2606" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1473272170p2/20199767.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1437158045?book_show_action=false">Jun 13, 2016</a>      <a title="U+2606StephanieU+2606" class="user" name="U+2606StephanieU+2606" href="/user/show/20199767-stephanie">U+2606StephanieU+2606</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/20199767-stephanie?shelf=ya-dystopian">ya-dystopian</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1437158045" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16757796357132210752">All in all, pretty much what I expected from the <i>Selection</i> series. Unfortunately, I did feel the ending was a bit rushed, and that led me to believe that the story could have been eked out a little longer...but it seems Cass just wasn't as in love with her character Eadlyn as she was of America.<br />I can understand one reason the book felt more rushed than usual: I spent the majority of the time trying to remember who was who from <i>The Heir</i>, since it's been so long since I read it. I tried to remembe</span>  <span id="freeText16757796357132210752" style="display:none">All in all, pretty much what I expected from the <i>Selection</i> series. Unfortunately, I did feel the ending was a bit rushed, and that led me to believe that the story could have been eked out a little longer...but it seems Cass just wasn't as in love with her character Eadlyn as she was of America.<br />I can understand one reason the book felt more rushed than usual: I spent the majority of the time trying to remember who was who from <i>The Heir</i>, since it's been so long since I read it. I tried to remember who Kile was...who Erik was...who Ean was...I was totally lost until 1/3 of the way through. So maybe that added to the rushed feeling at the end. At least in the <i>Selection</i> series (the core books), the love between Maxton and America didn't feel like insta-love. This felt totally like insta-love, and I normally don't find that in most books. I know many people feel a lot of books have it, but this relationship between (leave character out to avoid spoilers) seemed to just come out of nowhere and didn't really develop until almost 75% of the way through. It truly seemed like it would be (insert other name here...you'll know who you'd think it was gonna be if you read the first book), but of course, that was all misdirection.<br />I don't know: it wasn't bad. It was cute. I expected more from Cass ever since I read <i>The Siren</i> and immediately loved it. Maybe <i>The Heir</i> and <i>The Crown</i> could've been just one big book? I mean, this book was only 278 pages...it could've handled being longer.<br />I did like the ending. I did like the growth of the originally spoiled and unlikable Eadlyn. (How the hell do you pronounce her name anyway? It is ee-dlyn or Aye-dlyn or Ah-dlyn? Or "a" (like in weigh) -dlyn?) That frustrated the heck out of me. But be that as it may...<br />I've never read the novellas in the series because I'm not really a novella reader. But I don't think that would've been relevant to this group of books. <br />Oh, and another thing: they add an adversary halfway through the book! Shouldn't he have been introduced much earlier on, with a little more backstory and foundation? It was just like: problem presented, problem solved. Didn't like that move.<br />Still I give the book U+2605 U+2605 U+2605 U+2605 U+2606. I know I sound like I'm bashing it, but I just didn't connect to the protagonist. Although I will admit that I was never a fan of America from the original <i>Selection</i> books. Kind of bitchy (then become noble) characters.<br />If you're going to read a Kiera Cass novel, I'd recommend <i>The Siren</i> because that story was beautiful and haunting. <br />I heard these books will be made into movies. I do enjoy Cass's writing style and flow. A quick read for all already familiar with the series.<br />I can't wait to see what she has in store for us next.</span>  <a data-text-id="16757796357132210752" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1640533678?book_show_action=false">Jul 03, 2016</a>      <a title="bookspixscoffeefix" class="user" name="bookspixscoffeefix" href="/user/show/29985634-bookspixscoffeefix">bookspixscoffeefix</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/29985634-bookspixscoffeefix?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1640533678" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11879355840994933007">My Review: I honestly never thought I would say this, but I didn't like it as much as I was expecting. It was still and wonderful, very enjoyable read, and I wanted more. I really May or Aunt May to come into the book, but she didn't. I also wanted Ahren to play a little bit of a bigger role but that is all. That is the major reason I was a little disappointed. I also wanted more romance in this book. Maxon and Americas story was great because they knew they were meant for each other, and Eadlyn</span>  <span id="freeText11879355840994933007" style="display:none">My Review: I honestly never thought I would say this, but I didn't like it as much as I was expecting. It was still and wonderful, very enjoyable read, and I wanted more. I really May or Aunt May to come into the book, but she didn't. I also wanted Ahren to play a little bit of a bigger role but that is all. That is the major reason I was a little disappointed. I also wanted more romance in this book. Maxon and Americas story was great because they knew they were meant for each other, and Eadlyn doesn't know until the final pages of the book, which means we really don't get to see much of how they are together. I was also disappointed with two of the boys in the book and thought it was un-needed to put that in the book, that alone kind of hurt my opinion for the book. Other than those 3 reasons, I loved the book! I had a ton of action, which led me to finish the book in one night. I know I've pointed out pretty much all the things I didn't enjoy about the book, but let me tell you don't let it stop you from reading it. I really did enjoy this book I was just expecting a little bit more. I loved seeing Americas mom come into play in this book. There were also so new family secrets revealed in this book that were very entertaining. I really truly did enjoy this book! book. Maxon and Americas story was great because they knew they were meant for each other, and Eadlyn doesn't know until the final pages of the book which means we really don't get to see much of how they are together. I was also disappointed with two of the boys in the book and thought it was un needed to put that in the book, that alone kind of hurt my opinion for the book. Other than those 3 reasons, I loved the book! I had a ton of action which led me to finish the book in one night. I know I've pointed out pretty much all the things I didn't enjoy about the book, but let me tell you don't let it stop you from reading it. I really did enjoy this book I was just expecting a little bit more. I loved seeing Americas mom come into play in this book. There were also so new family secrets revealed in this book that were very entertaining. Overall this book was okay, It was my favorite, but it could have been worse. Kiera Cass is still one of my favorite author and is one of the best people at writing books! This book just wasn't my favorite. <br /><br /><br /><br />* Side Note, I'm having a Giveaway for this book on my Instagram right now, check it out! To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer1627613055&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1627613055" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15635274827897987384">GOOD, GOOD? GOOD, GOOD.<br><br><img src="https://s3.amazonaws.com/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1453047007r/17776291.gif?148006986736901" class="gr-hostedUserImg hostedImg" data-src="https://s3.amazonaws.com/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1453047007r/17776291.gif" style=";display:none;" data-error="[image error]" onerror="$j(this).loadHostedImage();" onload="$j(this).loadHostedImage();"><img src="/assets/loading-trans.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg loadingImg"><br><br>I'm glad that I've managed to finish this book and overall the series. It may seem easy to just be finally done with this since it's short and it should be, but no, I didn't take this easy at all. I don't know why suddenly I became so emotional and affected like I'm the MC. It was hard for me especially when I've been spoiled because it made me hesitate to continue and still I continued for I wouldn't know how things would end.<br><br>I've read the last 5 chapters with a heavy hea</span>  <span id="freeText15635274827897987384" style="display:none">GOOD, GOOD? GOOD, GOOD.<br><br><img src="https://s3.amazonaws.com/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1453047007r/17776291.gif?148006986736901" class="gr-hostedUserImg hostedImg" data-src="https://s3.amazonaws.com/compressed.photo.goodreads.com/hostedimages/1453047007r/17776291.gif" style=";display:none;" data-error="[image error]" onerror="$j(this).loadHostedImage();" onload="$j(this).loadHostedImage();"><img src="/assets/loading-trans.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg loadingImg"><br><br>I'm glad that I've managed to finish this book and overall the series. It may seem easy to just be finally done with this since it's short and it should be, but no, I didn't take this easy at all. I don't know why suddenly I became so emotional and affected like I'm the MC. It was hard for me especially when I've been spoiled because it made me hesitate to continue and still I continued for I wouldn't know how things would end.<br><br>I've read the last 5 chapters with a heavy heart feeling like it's The One ending again. Yes, it's a bit rushed and there I was hoping again for something more. I guess that "more" would be the father-and-daughter conversation of Maxon and Eadlyn. For that, <b>I love Maxon FOR LIFE!</b> And don't you think that Aspen is so HOT with him being called General Leger? And seeing the old couples, aw, I really love them.<br><br><img src="https://images.gr-assets.com/hostedimages/1463138875ra/19085520.gif" class="gr-hostedUserImg"><br><br>Now with the romance part, there was a lot of emotions to be dealt with. I felt like I've been toyed, charged, rejected and such. It's confusing and a bit frustrating as hell because I don't know. I like Kile, Henri, Eikko and Hale (who turned out to be gay which is not that surprising and I still like him for it). <br><br>To be honest, I'm really rooting for Kile that's why I felt rejected when Eadlyn decided to settle down with him but end up banishing him instead from the palace. It makes me utterly sad. I've always known in the back of my mind that Erik would be the twist ever since he came up behind Henri. He's not that bad but I've only felt the love in the last 5 chapters. <br><br>So yeah, I'm happy for Eadlyn, for whom she has become with just a <i>U+201CIU+2019m Eadlyn Schreave, and no one in the world is as powerful as me,U+201D</i>and the othersU+2014Josie and Kaden (wow), Hale and Ean, Ahren and Camille, Kile and ME (yes), Marid and who knows (almost me ugh).<br><br><i>U+201CHappily ever after could be waiting in a field a mile wide. Or a window as narrow as seven minutes.U+201D</i><br><br>And mine's waiting to be read. <br><br>Goodbye now, IllU+00E9a!</span>  <a data-text-id="15635274827897987384" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1634896999?book_show_action=false">Jul 22, 2016</a>      <a title="Gaia" class="user" name="Gaia" href="/user/show/6502657-gaia">Gaia</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6502657-gaia?shelf=incazzata">incazzata</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6502657-gaia?shelf=insomma">insomma</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6502657-gaia?shelf=poteva-essere-meglio">poteva-essere-meglio</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1634896999" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8327690541334495766">Vi riporto una breve conversazione con madre:<br />"Mami, mi lamento sempre che i libri che leggo non mi sorprendono, poi trovo questo che lo fa, ma mi fa incazzare perchU+00E8 le cose non vanno come voglio io..."<br />"Gaia, scrivi un libro, cosU+00EC le cose andranno come vuoi tu"<br />A parte l'ovvietU+00E0 di madre che non si realizzerU+00E0 mai, concentriamoci sull'effetto sorpresa.<br />Da quando ho letto <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/22918050.The_Heir__The_Selection___4_" title="The Heir (The Selection, #4) by Kiera Cass">The Heir</a> U+00E8 passato un anno, quindi alcune cose mi erano piU+00F9 chiare di altre, ma di una cosa ero CONVINTISSIMA: che la tizia avreb</span>  <span id="freeText8327690541334495766" style="display:none">Vi riporto una breve conversazione con madre:<br />"Mami, mi lamento sempre che i libri che leggo non mi sorprendono, poi trovo questo che lo fa, ma mi fa incazzare perchU+00E8 le cose non vanno come voglio io..."<br />"Gaia, scrivi un libro, cosU+00EC le cose andranno come vuoi tu"<br />A parte l'ovvietU+00E0 di madre che non si realizzerU+00E0 mai, concentriamoci sull'effetto sorpresa.<br />Da quando ho letto <a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/22918050.The_Heir__The_Selection___4_" title="The Heir (The Selection, #4) by Kiera Cass">The Heir</a> U+00E8 passato un anno, quindi alcune cose mi erano piU+00F9 chiare di altre, ma di una cosa ero CONVINTISSIMA: che la tizia avrebbe scelto il suo vecchio amico di infanzia, con cui non andava d'accordo, ma grazie alla selezione ha scoperto un lato di lui che non conosceva.<br />Esterrefatta. Ecco com'ero quando la tizia se ne viene fuori che prova dei sentimenti per l'interprete finlandese.<br />Senza parole, cazzo. Ero tipo: "ma da dove viene fuori tu?"<br />Forse avrei dovuto rileggere il precedente, magari questa cosa non U+00E8 venuta fuori dal nulla come sembrava a me, ma comunque sono arrabbiata! Ero sicurissima dell'altro! Era cosU+00EC carino e dolce.<br />Adesso, quella stellina lU+00EC solitaria solitaria, non U+00E8 perchU+00E8 semplicemente le cose non sono andate come volevo io, il libro l'ho trovato in generale piatto, arrivata a 70 pagine non vedevo l'ora che finisse, mi stava annoiando, non U+00E8 successo niente di particolare che ha fatto muovere un po' la situazione.<br />I personaggi, a distanza di un anno non posso certo ricordarmi la faccia di tutti, no? <br />Certi autori con i seguiti cercano di buttare lU+00EC qualcosa di quello che era successo precedentemente, ti rifanno una breve descrizione del personaggio. Qui l'unica cosa che vengo a sapere U+00E8 che gli occhi del finlandese sono azzurri.<br />Non mi U+00E8 piaciuto per nulla.<br />Diversi libri che ho letto l'anno scorso e ripresi recentemente non mi sono molto piaciuti, forse ho sbattuto la testa nel corso di quest'anno (anche se me lo ricorderei se fosse successo), non lo so, preferisco dare la colpa a Hegel e a LU+00E9vinas suppongo.</span>  <a data-text-id="8327690541334495766" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1461495258" />    <a title="Carolyn" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/38626717-carolyn"><img alt="Carolyn" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1478458548p2/38626717.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1461495258?book_show_action=false">May 09, 2016</a>      <a title="Carolyn" class="user" name="Carolyn" href="/user/show/38626717-carolyn">Carolyn</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/38626717-carolyn?shelf=reviewed">reviewed</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1461495258" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer13706555227902867540">hmmmmmm idk if it had anything to do with selection haters getting in my head or if it was my growing understanding of what makes a book good, but I wasn't impressed by this.<br /><br />the selection was so addicting for me because it was so dramatic and unpredictable. there were characters who I adored (Maxon, Marlee, etc) and characters I would be happy to push off a cliff (America, Celeste, the king, etc). The Heir/The Crown didn't have these qualities.<br /><br />The drama in this is so incredibly "meh". There were</span>  <span id="freeText13706555227902867540" style="display:none">hmmmmmm idk if it had anything to do with selection haters getting in my head or if it was my growing understanding of what makes a book good, but I wasn't impressed by this.<br /><br />the selection was so addicting for me because it was so dramatic and unpredictable. there were characters who I adored (Maxon, Marlee, etc) and characters I would be happy to push off a cliff (America, Celeste, the king, etc). The Heir/The Crown didn't have these qualities.<br /><br />The drama in this is so incredibly "meh". There were only a few end of chapter cliffhangers and most of them sucked. I predicted almost every single twist. There was only one I didn't see coming, and I barely remembered the character's name so I didn't really care that much haha. <br /><br />America and Maxon seem too different (since they've obviously matured lol) for me to connect with them again, and the new characters just weren't lovable- or even memorable! The only character names I remembered going into this book were eadlyn and Henri. It was smart of Kiera to end the heir the way she did because bringing an old character into he spotlight motivated me to read this. But it felt like the question at the end of the heir was answered too quickly in the crown. had I not cared about finishing he series, I would have dnf'ed it from there.<br /><br />The boy Eadlyn chooses is predictable. She suddenly goes from liking 4ish boys ("my heart is confusedddddddddd") to having cute romancey thoughts about this specific boy. it's just so obvious. <br /><br />quickly want to add that the plot felt SO RUSHED ugh I guess part of the point was for the reader to fear that certain things wouldn't happen by the end but still RUSHED. too short. :(<br /><br />idk if you're a selection fan, it's worth finishing the series I guess... it's fast paced and interesting enough, but go in with low expectations.</span>  <a data-text-id="13706555227902867540" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1461495258"> class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1429316303" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1429316303" />    <a title="Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm"><img alt="Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1364999103p2/7436809.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1429316303?book_show_action=false">May 03, 2016</a>      <a title="Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)" class="user" name="Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)" href="/user/show/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm">Kirsty (Amethyst Bookwyrm)</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/26150713-the-crown">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm?shelf=netgalley-edelweiss">netgalley-edelweiss</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm?shelf=dystopia">dystopia</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7436809-kirsty-amethyst-bookwyrm?shelf=review">review</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1429316303" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer8938976072874158595">Thanks to HarperCollins ChildrenU+2019s UK for giving this book to review.<br /><br />Princess Eadlyn has never felt more alone, with her twin brother married and in France, her mother just having had a heart attack and her father never leaving her side. Eadlyn must cope with running the country and finding love with one of the remaining boys in the selection. With everything in turmoil and the people not trusting her ruling ability, Eadlyn must make some hard choices about what to do with her kingdom, as well a</span>  <span id="freeText8938976072874158595" style="display:none">Thanks to HarperCollins ChildrenU+2019s UK for giving this book to review.<br /><br />Princess Eadlyn has never felt more alone, with her twin brother married and in France, her mother just having had a heart attack and her father never leaving her side. Eadlyn must cope with running the country and finding love with one of the remaining boys in the selection. With everything in turmoil and the people not trusting her ruling ability, Eadlyn must make some hard choices about what to do with her kingdom, as well as her heart. <br /><br />The Crown is very enjoyable final book of The Selection series. It is very fast paced as I stayed up very late just to see how it finished, and had some minor twists I didnU+2019t see coming. There was not as much romance in this novel compared to the other books and while I was very happy about her choice and I felt it worked well in the story, I would have liked more. <br /><br />Eadlyn is strong and a responsible and capable ruler who cared for her people and while spoiled would sacrifice anything for her kingdomU+2019s happiness. Kile is intelligent, considerate and inventive, while Hale is confident and friendly. Henri is happy and innocent and Eric/Eikko is down to earth, shy and compassionate.<br /><br />The Ending wrapped everything up but was a bit rushed. I am looking forward to seeing what Kiera Cass writes next. I would recommend The Crown to people who have read and enjoyed The Selection series, especially The Heir. <br /><br />This and my other reviews can be found at <a href="http://amethystbookwyrm.blogspot.co.uk/" rel="nofollow">Amethyst Bookwyrm</a><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="8938976072874158595" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1429316303">  <td    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1187394693" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3600379556972038446"> <a href="http://shirleycuypers.blogspot.be/2016/07/the-crown-review.html" rel="nofollow">Original review</a><br /><br /><b>35 suitors entered the selection, who will win her heart?</b><br /><br /><i>The Crown</i> is the final book in the <i>Selection</i> series and continues the story of Eadlyn and her becoming queen and marrying someone. Because of certain events she needs to rush the selection, but will that turn out well? Will she marry the man she wants?<br /><br />In <i>The Crown</i>, you could really see how Eadlyn developed into the person she was at the end of the book. From a bratty kid, she became a real queen. She opened herself to other</span>  <span id="freeText3600379556972038446" style="display:none"> <a href="http://shirleycuypers.blogspot.be/2016/07/the-crown-review.html" rel="nofollow">Original review</a><br /><br /><b>35 suitors entered the selection, who will win her heart?</b><br /><br /><i>The Crown</i> is the final book in the <i>Selection</i> series and continues the story of Eadlyn and her becoming queen and marrying someone. Because of certain events she needs to rush the selection, but will that turn out well? Will she marry the man she wants?<br /><br />In <i>The Crown</i>, you could really see how Eadlyn developed into the person she was at the end of the book. From a bratty kid, she became a real queen. She opened herself to others and people saw that she changed. And that's one of the things I like so much about <i>The Crown</i>.<br /><br /><a class="jsShowSpoiler spoilerAction">(view spoiler)</a><span class="spoilerContainer" style="display: none">[While I was reading <i>The Heir</i>, I always wanted Kile, but I also liked Erik. But because Erik isn't a suitor, I forgot a little about him because I thought there was no chance for him being tongether with Eadlyn. But now, after finishing <i>The Crown</i>, I'm happy that Eadlyn is with Erik instead of Kile. I still love Kile, because he knew Eadlyn since they were kids and they know funny things about each other, but the relationship between them is so different if you compare it to the relationship between Eadlyn and Erik.  <a class="jsHideSpoiler spoilerAction">(hide spoiler)</a>]</span><br /><br />I'm really sad that this is the last book in the <i>Selection</i> series, I want to read more. I want to know how their wedding will be, how many kids they'll have. Maybe Kiera Cass should write some more books about Eadlyn and her family & friends. I'm not ready to say goodbye!</span>  <a data-text-id="3600379556972038446" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div       rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/43501578-shakira?shelf=2016">2016</a>,               <a        </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1629194609" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer10060865393801750158">Extremely disappointed with the outcome of this selection. It felt really rushed... maybe this should have been a trilogy.<br /><br />SPOILERS AHEAD<br />.<br />.<br />.<br />. <br />if you haven't read this book yet, you're about to be spoiled so continue at your own risk. <br /><br />I saw it coming from the beginning that she amd Erik would end up together. For a secomd there, however, she seemed very likely to choose Kile but I also remembered how he feels 'stuck' at the palace and just knew it would be Erik.<br /><br />I'm really glad that Henri approved</span>  <span id="freeText10060865393801750158" style="display:none">Extremely disappointed with the outcome of this selection. It felt really rushed... maybe this should have been a trilogy.<br /><br />SPOILERS AHEAD<br />.<br />.<br />.<br />. <br />if you haven't read this book yet, you're about to be spoiled so continue at your own risk. <br /><br />I saw it coming from the beginning that she amd Erik would end up together. For a secomd there, however, she seemed very likely to choose Kile but I also remembered how he feels 'stuck' at the palace and just knew it would be Erik.<br /><br />I'm really glad that Henri approved of this though or else this book would have gotten a 1 star because realistically, it's just not right to come in as someone's translater and then swoop in just as they've won to say that you were the winner all along and no one else stood a chance.<br /><br />I saw the Hale thing coming also but Ean I didn't guess. I'm glad that worked out though. I'm also glad that Kile got to do as he pleased and travel the country and help people. I do think that with this selection, being from the selectors POV, there was more closure for all of the characters we come to know. For further example, I love hoe Hale is going to design the wedding dress and Henri, bake the cake... I do love Henri.<br /><br />I'm really glad that we got to see a better side to Josie in this as well.<br /><br />The Lady Brice thing was so unexpected and actually a really good plot twist in my opinion.<br /><br />Overall, this book, for me, was the least enjoyable out of the 5 selection books and I was not satisfied with the ending so I gave this a 3/5 stars.</span>  <a itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/804740216" />    <a title="Ceres" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/4982613-ceres"><img alt="Ceres" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1390836033p2/4982613.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/804740216?book_show_action=false">May 20, 2016</a>      <a title="Ceres" class="user" name="Ceres" href="/user/show/4982613-ceres">Ceres</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9782221159255" href="/book/show/30126262-la-couronne">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer804740216" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer4750639943339735380">[Review in english]<br />This is the end! And I think it was about time. This last book was nice but really not so much. I never expected a lot from The Selection series and it was the same for The Crown. Kiera Cass offered a cute book, but not very developped. I can say it was even a little rushed. Easy. Maybe boring. There is no surprise, no action, no suspens in this book. This is a cute book where a cute girl find her cute lover. Eadlyn's selection was boring. I though it was just friends hanging</span>  <span id="freeText4750639943339735380" style="display:none">[Review in english]<br />This is the end! And I think it was about time. This last book was nice but really not so much. I never expected a lot from The Selection series and it was the same for The Crown. Kiera Cass offered a cute book, but not very developped. I can say it was even a little rushed. Easy. Maybe boring. There is no surprise, no action, no suspens in this book. This is a cute book where a cute girl find her cute lover. Eadlyn's selection was boring. I though it was just friends hanging out and not a competition. What a shame.... But, I must say I'm happy with the choice Eadlyn made in the end. She's the only character I loved who was developped enough. She grow up, she opened her heart, her evolution was interesting. As for the plot, it was superficial and inconsistant. Kiera Cass had good ideas but she never developped them. It's sad because I always though this series had so much potential for a good romance and a good political game. But The Selection is just a cute series with love and nothing more really. It was nice to read it.<br />[Chronique en franU+00E7ais]<br />Je n'ai jamais eu de grandes attentes pour cette saga que j'ai toujours trouvU+00E9e superficielle et peu dU+00E9veloppU+00E9e. Malheureusement ce tome ne dU+00E9roge pas U+00E0 la rU+00E8gle. C'est trop rapide, peu aprofondi et surtout trU+00E8s prU+00E9visible. Mais j'ai passU+00E9 un bon moment et Eadlyn m'a beaucoup plu, c'est la seule qui U+00E9volue de maniU+00E8re spectaculaire!</span>  <a data-text-id="4750639943339735380" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review804740216">  <td colspan="2">    <div class="updateActionLinks">        <a class="right flag" rel="nofollow" id="flag_link804740216" title="Flag this review as inappropriate." href="/flagged/new?resource_id=804740216&resource_type=Review&return_url=/book/show/26074181-the-crown">flag</a>      <span class='likeItContainer' id='like_container_review_804740216'><a id="like_count_review_804740216" rel="nofollow" href="/rating/voters/804740216?resource_type=Review"><span class="likesCount">6 likes</span></a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<span class="loadingLinkSpan"><a id="like_action_review_804740216" rel="nofollow" data-like-container-id="like_container_review_804740216" ref="like" class="jsLike like_it gr-button gr-button--small loadingLink" data-remote="true" data-method="post" href="/rating?count_on_right=false&format=json&lc=6&rating[page]=10&rating[rating]=1&rating[resource_id]=804740216&rating[resource_type]=Review">Like</a><span class="loadingAnimation"></span><span class="loadingError"></span></span></span>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a id="commentLink_804740216" href="#" onclick="comment_form_for(&#39;review&#39;, 804740216, true, &#39;&#39;); return false;">comment</a>U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0<a href="/review/show/804740216?book_show_action=false&from_review_page=10">see review</a>    </div>    <div id='comments_for_review_804740216' style='display: none;'></div><div class='brown_comment' id='comments_form_review_804740216' style='display: none'><textarea class='placeholder_text' onclick="expand_comment_form_for('review', 804740216, true, '')">Write a comment...</textarea></div>  </td></tr>      </div>  </div>  <div class="clear"></div></div>    </div>  </div>    <div class="elementListBrownSeparator"></div>  <div class="friendReviews elementListBrown" >    <div class="section">      <div id="review_1629660146" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1629660146" />    <a title="Bianca" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/55507967-bianca"><img alt="Bianca" src="https://s.gr-assets.com/assets/nophoto/user/u_5f-632230dc9882b4352d753eedf9396530.png" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1629660146?book_show_action=false">May 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Bianca" class="user" name="Bianca" href="/user/show/55507967-bianca">Bianca</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1629660146" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer18375431904840355018">Heartbreak. Disappointment. Confusion. <br /><br />Just a couple of words I think of when I look back at my time reading this book. *shudders*<br /><br />Firstly, I am fairly certain that I'm speaking for 50-60% of the fandom when I say I was very confused and disappointed with who Eadlyn's final choice was. It was brutal to even continue reading the damn book after the -ahem- 'goodbye' scene with a certain someone and rather abrupt stereotypical happily ever after ending with a completely out-of-nowhere prince charmin</span>  <span id="freeText18375431904840355018" style="display:none">Heartbreak. Disappointment. Confusion. <br /><br />Just a couple of words I think of when I look back at my time reading this book. *shudders*<br /><br />Firstly, I am fairly certain that I'm speaking for 50-60% of the fandom when I say I was very confused and disappointed with who Eadlyn's final choice was. It was brutal to even continue reading the damn book after the -ahem- 'goodbye' scene with a certain someone and rather abrupt stereotypical happily ever after ending with a completely out-of-nowhere prince charming. <br /><br />It honestly destroyed me because I felt as if 'The Heir' was definitely heading towards someone but then the second-half of 'The Crown' randomly shifted to someone else. I feel as if Kiera had originally planned for Eadlyn to choose who most people were rooting for but then changed her mind and opted to make the ending of Eadlyn's story less predictable than America's. <br /><br />Ofcourse America's story was predictable, especially in the last book but I don't think many people minded because more than half the fandom WANTED it to happen. I feel as if Kiera wanted to change this whole 'predictable' thing and decided to change it up. I hate that. <br /><br />In conclusion, I'm most likely never going to read it again and am so upset. </span>  <a data-text-id="18375431904840355018" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1629660146">  <td class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer16909771307702869993">here we are (once again) at the end of the selection series!<br /><br />i had a lot of issues with the heir and most of them were regarding our main character, eadlyn. however, in this book those problems were resolved in my eyes BUT NEW ONES ARRIVED.<br /><br />i did feel like eadlyn grew a lot more in
