NOTHING. AT. ALL. there was no conflict no big threat or enemy we had to worry about zero nada.<br /><br />and also.,..,,. shE ENDED UP WITH EIKKO ??!?!??!?!?!?!? i mean i thought it was so obvious that she was gonna pick kile but <b> I STILL REMEMBER SAYING THAT IF IT WASNT OBVIOUS THEN IT WOULD BE COOL TO SEE HER FALLING IN LOVE WITH EIKKO BECAUSE HES NOT TECHNICALLY IN THE SELECTION</b> but now i don't know how to feel about that because there was no build up to their relationship and honestly this book felt very rushed. but since its the last one it also felt very bittersweet. <br /><br />alright ill leave y'all with a quote that i think is something very important to remember<br /><br /><i>"Maybe it's not the first kisses that are supposed to be special. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer1631136512&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1631136512" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer3677451443224699783">I WAS SO EXCITED TO READ THIS BOOK. <br /><br />it was a major disappointment. I feel like after four fantastic books, Keira Cass decided that She was gonna be totally unpredictable. (I mean come on Tris has to be with Four and no matter how much some people prayed Bella would be with Jacob, even they deep down knew that Edward would be the ultimate winner) <br />So I guess Keira was going to break the cliche and write a totally unpredictable book. <br /><br />SPOILERS <br />don't get me wrong, I love Erik as a character. He's nic</span>  <span id="freeText3677451443224699783" style="display:none">I WAS SO EXCITED TO READ THIS BOOK. <br /><br />it was a major disappointment. I feel like after four fantastic books, Keira Cass decided that She was gonna be totally unpredictable. (I mean come on Tris has to be with Four and no matter how much some people prayed Bella would be with Jacob, even they deep down knew that Edward would be the ultimate winner) <br />So I guess Keira was going to break the cliche and write a totally unpredictable book. <br /><br />SPOILERS <br />don't get me wrong, I love Erik as a character. He's nice and a good friend to Eadlyn but I thought that's as far as they would go. They had NO chemistry. I know a lot of people wanted her to choose him, but seriously Eadlyn talks to him the way people talk to a random person at a bus stop. THERE WAS NOTHING THERE. But she chose him and there was no buildup and it came out of nowhere and I was upset.<br /><br />Maybe if she was going to choose him, make him more of an important character throughout? <br /><br />They had a good friendship going but seriously I don't understand why she chose to marry him. <br /><br />After so much waiting, I despised this book. <br /><br />The writing felt rushed. The pace was SLOW. I feel like Cass just kind of gave up and put no heart into her book. The rest of the series was so so good and this book upset me more than you can imagine. <br /><br /></span>  <a data-text-id="3677451443224699783" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1631136512">  <td uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1090779391?book_show_action=false">Jun 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Svetla Peicheva" class="user" was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/30706072-svetla-peicheva?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1090779391" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6066657526768036799">Bulgarian review: <a target="_blank" href="http://booksrbeter.blogspot.bg/" rel="nofollow">http://booksrbeter.blogspot.bg/</a><br /><br />From all the books in this series, I can't say I hated this the most but I certainly felt most indifferent for it. I read it really quickly but it was a rather dull read. <br />Personally I think that the books written for Eadly were weak. I didn't really like her in the first book about her and i don't really like her in this one. The only difference id that here, we see more of her. We have character developpement which I honestly appreciate. I liked</span>  <span id="freeText6066657526768036799" style="display:none">Bulgarian review: <a target="_blank" href="http://booksrbeter.blogspot.bg/" rel="nofollow">http://booksrbeter.blogspot.bg/</a><br /><br />From all the books in this series, I can't say I hated this the most but I certainly felt most indifferent for it. I read it really quickly but it was a rather dull read. <br />Personally I think that the books written for Eadly were weak. I didn't really like her in the first book about her and i don't really like her in this one. The only difference id that here, we see more of her. We have character developpement which I honestly appreciate. I liked seeing her trying to improve herself and her kingdom. I liked that she opened for her feelings and that she followed her heart. <br />What I don't like thought is all that rushing,all that planing.It felt like the author is already sick of the book and wants to finish it faster. I just hated all those thing she was doing 90% of the time, just so she has something to do. <br />Now,about the suitors...like almost everybody I shipped her with Kile. That whole "let's make her wanted,let's make some drama" shit really annoyed me thought. I must say that even if I may not like the person she ended up with or the unnecessary drama in the book, I understand and agree with her reasons.</span>  <a data-text-id="6066657526768036799" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1434735716" />    <a title="Miz" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/6907245-miz"><img alt="Miz" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1420153794p2/6907245.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1434735716?book_show_action=false">May 22, 2016</a>      <a title="Miz" class="user" name="Miz" href="/user/show/6907245-miz">Miz</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Kindle Edition " href="/book/show/26150713-the-crown">review of another edition</a>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6907245-miz?shelf=ebook-owned">ebook-owned</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6907245-miz?shelf=romance">romance</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6907245-miz?shelf=young-adult">young-adult</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/6907245-miz?shelf=to-be-released-2016">to-be-released-2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1434735716" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1263971675647946220">Fastest book I've read in a while!! And first book I've read on my phone. (Both facts are interlinked).<br />Enjoyable though I had forgotten the personalities - they soon came flooding back. I should have reread The Heir before tackling this one, but it was still good. I enjoyed the characterisations and plot but they changed the personalities significantly after the first book. Yes, it's meant to be a coming of age set of books so maybe that is the redemption for this seemingly overnight change. <br /><br />The</span>  <span id="freeText1263971675647946220" style="display:none">Fastest book I've read in a while!! And first book I've read on my phone. (Both facts are interlinked).<br />Enjoyable though I had forgotten the personalities - they soon came flooding back. I should have reread The Heir before tackling this one, but it was still good. I enjoyed the characterisations and plot but they changed the personalities significantly after the first book. Yes, it's meant to be a coming of age set of books so maybe that is the redemption for this seemingly overnight change. <br /><br />The ending also felt a bit rushed. I know for a fact that one of the two announcements - the political one - would not just be made like that! It might have been the right outcome but that would more than ruffle a few feathers. <br /><br />Now I need to find another 'good' and 'easy' to read series like this. I've read Tommorw When The War Began, The Darkest Minds, Divergence, Matched, .... any other suggestions gratefully received. </span>  <a data-text-id="1263971675647946220" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" hidden because it contains spoilers. To view it,                    <a href="#" onclick="Effect.toggle(&#39;reviewTextContainer1262548837&#39;); return false;">click here.</a>                  </em>              <span id="reviewTextContainer1262548837" class="readable"                    style="display:none"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer6286221388771397710">I'm currently sobbing so bare with me okay? <br />My favourite scene I think was when Maxon was talking to Eadlyn about him. He told her things that made me cry. EADLYN WHOA. So much character development. She started off bratty but now she is truly a Queen, even if she gave up that title. I love how she dealt with KILE because I love him to pieces. And Henri. He told her things that made me cry. EADLYN WHOA. So much character development. She started off bratty but now she is truly a Queen, even if she gave up that title. I love how she dealt with KILE because I love him to pieces. And Henri. He knew. <br />I did not see Hale and Ean coming but I ship it. <br />I'm glad it is a monarchy but I wonder what will happen to the palace and the royal family? I also freaking loved that epilogue. <br />I love Eikko. <br />I knew America would survive and I'm so so happy Maxon and America are going on strong. <br />I need to end this review cause I'm a mess. <br />I cannot believe it is the end of this series. Everytime I hear the word America, or strawberry tarts I will think of the selection. The books may have come to an end, but my love for this series hasn't. Farewell for now Illea. </span>  <a data-text-id="6286221388771397710" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/7081484-catherine-ford?shelf=other">other</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1645629140" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer2810445850564302987">This series really should have ended after The One. These 2 extra books have just ruined things. Okay, the story could have worked. But what happened to the detailed descriptions from the first 3 books? What happened to the intricate plot twists? What happened to the action? This was dull in all 3 of those areas. Yes Eadlyn has great character development, but that just isn't enough. The selection process for her was predictable, and her becoming Queen [sorry if that is a spoiler, but it is</span>  <span id="freeText2810445850564302987" style="display:none">This series really should have ended after The One. These 2 extra books have just ruined things. Okay, the story could have worked. But what happened to the detailed descriptions from the first 3 books? What happened to the intricate plot twists? What happened to the action? This was dull in all 3 of those areas. Yes Eadlyn has great character development, but that just isn't enough. The selection process for her was predictable, and her becoming Queen [sorry if that is a spoiler, but it is inevitable if you've read any of this series]. I said it in my review of the Heir and I will say it again, it is as if a different author wrote these last 2 books.<br />I'm disappointed. To anyone wanting to start the series, read the first 3 books, then stop, because the next 2 will just ruin the series for you. </span>  <a data-text-id="2810445850564302987" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" It was really cool, first I was a bit skeptical about the whole eady + eikko thingy (I mean I thought for sure that she would end up with kile, duh) but it grew on me and it turned out to be a great ending! (Also, go Finland woo !!) anyway I think this book was pretty good, the ending was really emotional and definitely brought tears to my eyes (correction: waterfalls. Not just tears, waterfalls down my cheeks. Like messy ugly crying in the dark.) so yeah the book was kind of short but sweet and a nice conclusion. Ps. I mean I kind of saw it coming with the whole eady + eikko thingy in the last book, I was kind of aware that it was a possibility but I didn't wanna accept it lol still now I'm glad it happened. src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1479531810p2/33450770.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1483981761?book_show_action=false">May 28, 2016</a>      <a title="Amanda Lim" class="user" name="Amanda Lim" href="/user/show/33450770-amanda-lim">Amanda Lim</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>                  <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/33450770-amanda-lim?shelf=owned-books">owned-books</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1483981761" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15542538661619176362">I finished this book in one day. To be honest, it was super entertaining and I don't care what everyone thinks...it was very entertaining for me which is why I gave it a 4 stars. And let me say, I knew even from the The Heir with who she was going to end up with. Well, I didn't know that they were going to end up together but I knew there was something between them. I was so proud when she admitted her feelings towards him. It really felt good to get back into the story since it has been a long</span>  <span id="freeText15542538661619176362" style="display:none">I finished this book in one day. To be honest, it was super entertaining and I don't care what everyone thinks...it was very entertaining for me which is why I gave it a 4 stars. And let me say, I knew even from the The Heir with who she was going to end up with. Well, I didn't know that they were going to end up together but I knew there was something between them. I was so proud when she admitted her feelings towards him. It really felt good to get back into the story since it has been a long time. <br /><br />Honestly, I think that America's and Maxon's story was better that Eadlyn. But I loved the glimpses of America and Maxon in the last two books. It was overwhelming to see how their love has grown even stronger for each other throughout the years. <br /><br />The only thing I didn't like is how it ended. It was really abrupt and sudden. I think that it could have ended in another better way.</span>  <a data-text-id="15542538661619176362" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span> When would these Schreave ladies finally wear their crowns or tiaras?<br /><br />==========================<br /><br />Some thoughts about this book:<br />* made me cry<br />* too rushed<br />* I`m not really satisfied with how everything happened in this book and how they unbelievable, except for the endgame person.</span>  <span id="freeText1305386168029081316" style="display:none">This is probably the worst cover in the series? When would these Schreave ladies finally wear their crowns or tiaras?<br /><br />==========================<br /><br />Some thoughts about this book:<br />* made me cry<br />* too rushed<br />* I`m not really satisfied with how everything happened in this book and how they unbelievable, except for the endgame person. (I`d expound on it but it would mean spoilers)<br />* I need more details about Ahren.<br />* I like Eadlyn in this book better though, because she had more authority and she knows what to do. What I don`t like about it is that it`s a sudden development. Felt like I was reading a different book that`s not the sequel to The Heir.</span>  <a data-text-id="1305386168029081316" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> id="freeTextContainer8345529839273256744"> Okay... Although I had problems with the plot of this book, I ultimately loved it. I don't think it's the best conclusion to a series but I was actually kind of pleased with how it ended. Maybe.<br /><br /> Now I'm not upset about how it ended because of the ending, I'm upset that this series is over :(. I honestly enjoyed this so much. When I picked up The Selection two weeks ago, I didn't expect to fall in love with the characters and the plot. But I did. I literally could not stop reading these books. T</span>  <span id="freeText8345529839273256744" style="display:none"> Okay... Although I had problems with the plot of this book, I ultimately loved it. I don't think it's the best conclusion to a series but I was actually kind of pleased with how it ended. Maybe.<br /><br /> Now I'm not upset about how it ended because of the ending, I'm upset that this series is over :(. I honestly enjoyed this so much. When I picked up The Selection two weeks ago, I didn't expect to fall in love with the characters and the plot. But I did. I literally could not stop reading these books. They were just so fantastic. <br /><br /> If you have read these books, feel free to message me so we can fangirl over them. If not, read them! They're fantastic! And perfect for getting you out of a reading slump!</span>  <a data-text-id="8345529839273256744" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a>          </span>        </div> kind of bleh about this book. class="section">      <div id="review_1629869581" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1629869581" />    <a title="India Hill" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/36376245-india-hill"><img alt="India Hill" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1454689733p2/36376245.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt right" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1629869581?book_show_action=false">Jul 14, 2016</a>      <a title="India Hill" class="user" name="India Hill" href="/user/show/36376245-india-hill">India Hill</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">liked it</span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1629869581" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer17334618214867490340">I enjoyed this book, I'm giving it 3 stars. This is interesting bc The Selection is one of my favorite series. I enjoyed it enough, but the main issue for me was this book missed that certain grit that the first three books/America had. The first three books were more than Princess novels, it talked about the castes and how people react to things based on their social standing. Things were calmer in this book, which isn't bad at all but not what I expected. I flew through this, however, and I am</span>  <span id="freeText17334618214867490340" style="display:none">I enjoyed this book, I'm giving it 3 stars. This is interesting bc The Selection is one of my favorite series. I enjoyed it enough, but the main issue for me was this book missed that certain grit that the first three books/America had. The first three books were more than Princess novels, it talked about the castes and how people react to things based on their social standing. Things were calmer in this book, which isn't bad at all but not what I expected. I flew through this, however, and I am happy with who she chose in the ending.</span>  <a data-text-id="17334618214867490340" href="#" onclick="swapContent($(this));; return false;">...more</a> alt="Alba" src="https://images.gr-assets.com/users/1455971501p2/42689888.jpg" /></a>  <div class="left bodycol">    <div class="reviewHeader uitext stacked">        <a class="reviewDate createdAt it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">it was ok</span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="it was ok" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>          <span class="greyText">U+00A0 U+00B7 U+00A0</span>          <a class="lightGreyText" title="Paperback 9788416498147" href="/book/show/27557581-la-corona">review of another edition</a>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1645471820" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer11592104152555695220">La corona ha sido un final de saga que me ha decepcionado bastante. La trama me ha parecido algo aburrida, no ocurre prU+00E1cticamente nada de interU+00E9s en gran parte de la novela. Aunque reconozco que la actitud de la protagonista ha mejorado un poco, no ha terminado de convencerme ni ella ni su historia de 'amor'. Pero aunque estas dos U+00FAltimas partes no me hayan terminado de convencer, la saga en general me ha gustado y la recomiendo.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1030225441?book_show_action=false">May 05, 2016</a>      <a title="Ana " class="user" name="Ana " href="/user/show/16321781-ana">Ana </a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">really liked it</span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10"></span><span title="really liked it" size="15x15" class="staticStar href="/review/list/16321781-ana?shelf=read-in-english">read-in-english</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/16321781-ana?shelf=2016">2016</a>          </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1030225441" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer15376446642590823121">I'm so happy right now! But seriously, that epilogue was bullshit, I want something longer.<br />Despite popular opinion I adore these books so much, and I know they are far away from being perfect and they have their flaws, but they are fast and cute and adorable and so fun to read and they make me so happy, I will miss very much this story and their characters and I hope to reread it (especially the first three) soon.</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext buttons">          <tr class="no_border feedFooterReview" id="update_comment_stuff_Review1030225441">  <td colspan="2"> class="section">      <div id="review_1628150629" class="review" itemprop="reviews" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">  <link itemprop="url" href="https://www.goodreads.com/review/show/1628150629" />    <a title="Jess Coleman" class="left imgcol" href="/user/show/29613808-jess-coleman"><img alt="Jess Coleman" itemprop="publishDate" href="/review/show/1628150629?book_show_action=false">May 03, 2016</a>      <a title="Jess Coleman" class="user" name="Jess Coleman" href="/user/show/29613808-jess-coleman">Jess Coleman</a>        rated it        <span class=" staticStars"><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p10">did not like it</span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span><span title="did not like it" size="15x15" class="staticStar p0"></span></span>            </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1628150629" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer1821600009802059056">Well, that was stupid. Like, really stupid.<br /><br />I get it, this isn't a masterpiece of literature, by any stretch of the imagination. But I felt blindsided.<br /><br />The plot was rushed. The relationships were rushed (oh my gosh---she picked HIM?!). The character development (what little potential this book had to begin with) was incredibly rushed.<br /><br />Way to go, Ms. Cass, you totally wasted my time with the last book of the series.</span> <div class="uitext greyText bookshelves">            Shelves:              <a class="actionLinkLite" href="/review/list/32879029-emma?shelf=owned">owned</a>,               <a class="actionLinkLite" </div>    </div>        <div class="reviewText stacked">              <span id="reviewTextContainer1627441438" class="readable"              >            <span id="freeTextContainer9225553228168199152">pros: easy to read, fun to read, i found myself slightly caring about a few of the characters by the end.<br /><br />cons: sometimes unbearably cheesy/clichU+00E9/even nonsensical, not a fan of the writing style (it's poorly written in my opinion, more so than cass's other books, but i have no intention of undermining the opinion of others), spent the large majority of the book not caring about the outcome or anyone involved in the story.<br /><br />& so: 2.6/5</span>          </span>        </div>      <div class="reviewFooter uitext
